review_body: Read on the home site that Aqua Bamboo were renovating so almost didn't book. They need to take that off their site because I didn't hear a sound! Wasn't feeling well the last day and had a late departure and Aqua Bamboo offered to let me check out at 6 pm for a small fee. I wanted to get some sun so I turned down their offer. About 2 hours later I came back because still not feeling well and they had already cleaned my room but STILL let me stay until my flight. Great location. Will definitely be back! A HUI Hou!

We booked three nights at this hotel and arrived to find a room with a bed so old that it was actually concave. The room itself is quite small with what appear to be very old and dingy decorations. I knew the bed was going to be bad, but was even more surprised to find that the walls were so thin you could hear the elevator every time it dinged on the floor as well as any time someone was speaking in the hallway or closing their door. The construction two blocks away began very early in the morning and continued until late at night adding more noise to an already impossible to sleep situation. The cherry on top were the drapes that were entirely too thin to block out the sunrise. We got about 2 hours of poor sleep and checked out in the morning. However, the hotel refused to refund us for the two nights we didn't even stay on the property. Worst hotel experience I have had in twenty years.

For the price this place was great. Wonderful staff, beautiful pool area and a great location. Short walk to everything. I found this hotel on-line and it turned out to be much more than I expected. I will be back for sure.

Booked this hotel 7 months in advance rooms facing courtyard. While the courtyard is lovely and features teak furniture and red cushions, the hot tub was hugely dissapointing as was rarely hot. The staff was unable to figure out how to turn it on. Out of seven days only two days was actually hot. bar does not serve alcohol, friendly staff there though and small menu tasty. The hotel is regrettably much more ghetto than I had expected in reading reviews. I thought would be a little tarnished but not prepared for the trashed hallways and elevator. HUGE disparity in rooms, so beware. renovations not nearly done. 7 th floors up are renovated. learned the hard way that you do not want courtyard views, massive construction going on around hotel and on upper floor, courtyard side you will be exposed to loud earthmovers, not a Hawaiin view. Also we were inconvenienced by having water turned off one day, and workers coming in rooms. No coffee cups to use the coffee machine, no cream etc. the thursday reception was a joke, not poolside and the lei making was limited to two persons allowed to do at a time. VEry disappointing and NOT festive.Also the lower floor courtyard sanctuary view rooms are not refurbished and in bad repair. opt for mountain view room if possible. Disappointed in the luxury suite on 9th floor, There is orange construction webbing and green rope holding tiki hut together, trash dump site at back entrance. Embarrased that this is where I brought my family for vacay.

Gets better every year beautiful upgrades around the Pool area and new restaurant with really good food.Staff is very friendly and helpful.I want to thank all the staff and manager Kimari for the wonderful time we had there.Also its about a three minute walk to the beach.Until next year we will be back.

Stayed 4 nights at Aqua Bamboo in Studio 508. Checked in on Christmas night. Thank you Lisa . Studio is very well equipped, clean, functional and comfortable but a little dated.Ate 2 breakfasts and one dinner at Ok Tiki Terrace. Excellent food and service from Mike, Chef Eddie, Sam, Amber and the team.

Hotel is a bit old but there were works going on when we were there that suggest renovations may be happening, not noisy at all though. Room was a nice size and clean , house keeping attended everyday. Staff were lovely always willing to help and very much assisted us with getting from A-B and booking tours. Lobby was nice and cosy. The pool was gorgeous and a lovely escape from the hustle and bustle. TV was a bit dated but came with a play station and free access to a dvd rental machine. Location was great very close to the main areas of Waikiki. Room was definitely great for the price and the face it had a kitchen was a bonus. Free wifi was also a great touch. Thank you for the great time Aqua Bamboo

I looked at the posted photos read most of the reviews and still thought I'd give this place a try. I should have realized this hotel was not up to par when, upon arriving at 11 pm, several locals were working on a car right out front. Then we enter the lobby and hear an employee asking the front desk man what the various room charges are! Huh?! This was probably once a very nice place to stay. Unfortunately, the lack of upkeep shows. The only reason I gave it two stars was because the employees were very nice. Pros: nice employees; centrally located; safe in closet; large room; lemon water in lobby; big fridge and stove in kitchen area of our room.Cons: very loud a/c; bathroom window slats couldn't close so it got very warm in there; no "continental" breakfast; coffee machine out of order with only black coffee being free (cream was $1.00); three other entry doors to our room with cheap push in door locks-did not feel safe and told desk clerk; flimsy sliding door locks; kitchen drain plug broken; pool tiles were slimy and I slipped twice upon entry. The entire place needs upgrading. SEE PHOTOS

We recently stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in Waikiki from Oct 5-13, 2019 in room 807.Family of 2 adults and 2 children (ages 4 and 13). The room was a one bedroom suite with a queen bed in the bedroom and a queen pullout in the living area. Perfect sleeping arrangements for me and my family. We had a kitchen and were able to take full advantage of this during our stay. Coming from Canada, the CDN dollar doesn't fair well in the USA so this was very welcomed to save us a little $$$ and we took full advantage of this amenity.The hotel staff were extremely accommodating to any and all of our requests.The swimming pool is an incredible little oasis right in the middle of busy Waikiki! You'd never know you were in the middle of a city. We enjoyed the pool daily as there was always nice shaded areas to give the kids a break from the sun. Once the pool-side bar construction is complete, this will only add to the value of this area of the hotel.Pleasant surprise amenities:- Espresso machine in the lobby. Free cafe americano which we had every day and only $1.00 for specialty coffees like latte and $1.00 hot chocolate.- Complimentary beach chairs, float devices, body boards available to guests to take down to the beach.- Complimentary beach towel service- Movie rental machine in lobby, free of charge and included video games as there was a PlayStation in the room. This came in handy on the one and only day we had rain pretty much all day. Movies were nice to have at night when our day had wrapped up.- Washer/Dryers located on floors 4, 8 and 12 (from memory).The biggest PLUS with this hotel is the location. 1.5 blocks to the beach!! we were there in about 4 mins every day and it is so central we weren't far from whatever amenities we needed. We had rented a car for the week to explore the island but aside from that there was no need for a car. Next time we will skip that expense now that we know the hotel is so close to all we need.We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, it suits all types of travelers.

Booked through Hotels.com. They moved us from our original booking to this room. It was terrible. Run down and needs lots of updating The one cup offered for us to use was dirty. Luckily we booked only one night before our cruise. I’m sure the hotel rooms are much nicer. I would book directly. The lobby and outside area are lovely and I’m sure their hotel rooms are much better than what we had. Front desk was very helpful in getting us to our cruise

This hotel is currently undergoing renovation works, so from water shut down's to construction workers all over the place. The hotel is ok but not very clean there was a weird smell in the lobby and the customer service is simply non-existent. I don't recall ever getting a hi or hello or any introduction to tourist activities or what's in the area or anyone who spoke English what a missed opportunity! Rooms were cleaned everyday but needs some maintenance. The pool was slippery and no promotion of Manager's reception etc. No drinking water either! On the plus side there are restaurants and the beach nearby and walking around and visiting other hotels we would return to Hawaii but definitely not to this hotel. This place is ok if you could deal with poor customer service and noise. Don't stay here if you are travelling with kids, there are better hotels. I won't return even if it was offered for free

I stayed at this hotel for sux nights and my room was large comfortable and had two balconies one over looking views of Waikiki beach the other the mountains.The first two days I was here there was no concierge, then on the Tuesday Heather appeared and assisted me with some activity bookings.Brandon on reception wss great everyday he would greet me with a hello, ask how everything was. There was some general maintenance and renovating going on in the hotel but it was all done as quietly and without disturbing you as much as possible. On day five of my stay I had "plumbing issues" in the bathroom with water still in the bath from the shower and the toilet doing it's own thing, I spoke to the girl on reception who called maintenance straight away when I returned to the hotel about an hour later I was told that they would be moving me into a suite due to the plumbing issue and apologized. I felt this was very good customer service and solved the issue of being in a room and uncomfortable. I moved my luggage to my new room which was on the opposite side so both balconies now looked at the mountains.The daily resort fee I feel is high especially if you do not use the dvd/games. Free WiFi is part of this along with towels and beach chairs. Although not of big importance a restaurant or bar on site would be very beneficial especially after a long day instead of needing to go out again.I would probably stay here again.

While the room was a little dated, the outdoor area more than made up for it. Sitting in the shade by the pool was wonderful and the new bar area that was under construction will be a great addition. The rooms certainly need a facelift but this is underway and the staff are all very helpful and friendly.

We recently stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 4 nights in suite 807. We loved the fact that there was a kitchen (eat in if you like) a beautiful pool and the location can't be beat. It is about 1 1/2 blocks from the beach, near Honolulu Zoo, the bus route and lots of great restaurants. The hotel also offers beach towels and chairs. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stayed for 8 days. The rooms were neat. Our first room was good size but opened up to the broncs neighbours. Moved up to high floor on opposite side of building which was smaller room but heaps better view and less racket. Rooms are quite when doors closed but the air conditioner was old and very noisy. Noisy with street traffic if doors open. Location was okay.

We booked this hotel through an Air BnB because the pictures of the pool were so inviting and the location to Waikiki Beach. Unfortunately the pool was closed for refurbishing when we went but we did sneak a peek and it is a beautiful setting. The rooms and the hotel interior is very dated, like many of the hotels in Waikiki. The rooms, elevator and lobby are small. Many of the rooms look out onto the busy street or an alley with a brick wall. Ask for a pool view. Location is fantastic for quick and easy access to the bus ( right outside the door) or the beach ( a very easy 5 minute walk). You are about a block and 1/2 from the international market which is pricey but a nice place to walk around. There is a car rental agency within a 3 minute walk of the hotel but no parking on site. We realized that parking for rental cars is almost more than the daily rental. Often 20 to 30 dollars for over night. close Restaurants are mostly local Hawaiian plate or asian food. Burger King and McDonalds are a few minutes walk away for those who want a quick cheap meal. This hotel is for the budget minded who want a nice pool retreat when not at the beach.

Priced well, great location. The parking filled up and we had to park next door. Not super inconvenient but a bit of a drag with luggage. Stayed for 4 nights and only had room cleaned once. They didnt give us fresh towels or replenish toiletries. Just made the bed and took out trash. No breakfast, the pool was under construction while I was there, not enough washers and dryers, also the washers and dryers are old and coin operated ones and I'm not sure how "clean" they really made my clothes. All in all it's a great spot for the price in the center of Waikiki/Honolulu. I was comfortable in my room and enjoyed my stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Keeping in mind this is by no means a 5 star hotel I would still recommend it as a place to stay if you want to be close to Waikiki beach. A few suggestions I have are updating the air conditioning to central air or something, the overall smell of the building was musty and they try off setting it with ALOT of what smells like off brand fabreez but that's just in the lobby area and elevators not I the actual rooms.

Place is nice, but the staff never smiled. Few times I got smile from younger boy. The man who took care of the yard was very nice and polite. Even if you did not need any cleaning in your room, they make sure that you pay anyway the cleaning.

We spent 7 days at Aqua Bamboo and found it to be a nice hotel at a perfect location. Everything was in walking distance, a two minute walk to the beach, plenty of great food options nearby and close to bus lines. The pool area was really nice too and we actually preferred it to the beach.The best part about Aqua Bamboo was the lovely front desk staff, specifically Moana who was such a friendly face but also went above and beyond when we had some property stolen at the beach and he personally took us to the station in his time off to help us. Meeting Moana and the kindness that he gave us was one of the highlights of our trip to Hawaii and he sets a great example of how it is the people who make the place special. Because of this experience we recommend Aqua Bamboo to all of our friends and family and look forward to coming back again soon in the future.

Location of this Hotel is quite good .... but sadly I cannot say the same about the staff behind the reception desk (Brandon being the only exception - he at least had a conversation with us!) Surely it is not too much to expect some sort of acknowledgement of customers in the hotel - especially as we were staying there for six nights! Long enough to recognise faces each day!!Hotel itself is badly in need of renovations, which I understand is going to happen .... and quite necessary!Wish we had chosen somewhere else to spend our last few days / nights .... could not recommend to anyone if you want friendly recognition and a reasonable standard of accommodation.

We really wanted to love this hotel. We actually did until they tried to kick us out because their reservation system was awry and we had to prove we actually reserved for the fourth night -- and the desk guy said, "OK, you can stay." Um, WHAT?Better stuff first. We're kama'aina and their discount was very generous. The location is superb for the price. The hotel has charm, there's a nice little concierge desk, and the amenities are just right for a moderate hotel. Most interactions with the front desk were pleasant (especially Moana -- really nice guy). The hotel is clean, and I liked the decor and comfortable vibe. The pool is nicest of all.So. The reservation system is seriously messed up, and the customer service unforgiveable. The first day we were there, we were settling in and I got a cancellation notice on my email. "Your reservation has been cancelled." Obvs we didn't do that, and a call to the front desk straightened that out. So onward to our third day, and we were relaxing in the room when housekeeping let themselves in. "Are you extending your stay?" she asked, surprised to see us. "Uh, yes," we said. Meaning, yes, we reserved for a fourth night. (When I originally reserved, we reserved for three, and I called to add an additional night. My emails reflect it, and my last res email plainly stated four nights. Perhaps this is what wonked out the system. Why, I've no idea.)A few minutes later, I'm on the phone with a ghost tour agency trying to book us something to do that evening, and my husband answers the room phone. He hangs up in dismay, I hang up with the tour guy, my husband says, "We have to leave." Apparently the front desk has told us we have to get out.We start madly packing and I'm like, wait, let me find the ressie on my email. My husband calls the front deks back and says we have the email stating we're on for a fourth night. Front desk says he needs to see the email. (Here the onus is on us to prove our "right" to stay." The entire exchange with this guy went this way.) Meanwhile, I call and guy says we won't be charged for the fourth night if we're out in about 30 minutes. Apparently the hotel is full, there's no alternative. Someone else has booked our room.Finally I'm incensed and I go down with my husband, and the front desk guy (this is Saturday 6/8 around 1:30 p.m.) has reviewed the email and just keeps saying, "My notes had nothing about your staying a fourth night." OK, well, I'm sorry you had inadequate "notes," but this is your excuse and how you rep your hotel in a major snafu? He kept repeating why he was correct in thinking we'd no right to stay. THIS is what upsets customers. You can make even a major mistake, and if you own the problem and try to straighten it out, the guests are less likely to be angry. We're down there with all our bags, finally, not WANTING to stay (and expecting a chain of emails like the very first one on our first day saying we had to get out) and the guy just once again said, "I said you could stay."Yeah, right. I demand he print out the details of our stay so he doesn't overcharge us, quiz him on who he is and who is his manager (oh, and over and over he stated no one in the entire Aqua chain in management works weekends, so there's no one else we can call at the time.) No attempt to rebook us in another of the large number of Aqua hotels, which is what I'd have done. It was a big weekend at Waikiki, Pan Pacific fest, and Waikiki was largely booked. It wouldn't have been easy to waltz into another hotel and get a room. Believe me, I'd have headed straight for the Surfrider.We go outside, hail a cab, go to the airport, get on the next flight to Big Island where we live, pay $200 extra for the switch, and are really, REALLY glad to be home. So here is our experience with the Aqua Bamboo. We'll never stay there again. It's a shame, because I really felt we had a kama'aina home.

Just right. Location is fabulous, We walked everywhere and jumped in the ocean. Waikiki at night is a delight. Aqua Bamboo is just right not posh but nice people nice location. nice rooms.I recommend this place because it is so local and easy to walk about from and quiet

We stayed in three hotels in Waikiki during our two week visit. All three were at the same price point. The other two were lovely. I booked Aqua Bamboo based on TripAdvisor reviews which was a disappointment as the hotel did not look like the pics. Yes the hotel is tired and being renovated but this is no excuse for providing beige, fraying, scratchy towels and thin, worn, stained sheets. The first night we were there it was too late to have the sheets changed after I discovered the stains and the state of the pillows. To avoid using the towels I wiped myself with a face washer. At least that was white. After a complaint to reception the linen and towels were changed but there was little improvement. I was asked how my stay was at checkout and mentioned the towels were disgusting. I was refunded one night’s resort fee. When I have mentioned the state of the room in other forums and facebook groups some have said there experience was ok. But why would you risk it? I should have read the one star reviews more closely and seen there was a theme of dirtiness before I booked. Lesson learned.

We stayed 8 nights at the above hotel with all our family .The hotel looks tired and need of an overhaul but the rooms were clean and neat.The beds were except-able but the pillars were a bit hard.The biggest problem with America now is the resort fees you have to pay per day per room and the amount of tips you have to pay which is a minimum of 18% and the meals are expensive already.The outdoor pool area was excellent as we used to meet there every afternoon for drinks and relax it was excellent.The hotel had a free shuttle to and from the Alana Mona shopping centre but i must say the trip was painful due to the driver never shutting up. I was glad to get off the shuttle.You got free towels for the beach and beach chairs as required.Great position in relation to the beach and to the shops like the Food Pantry also there are bus stips just across the road from the hotel.

How is it that we feel so at home at Aqua Bamboo? I think the start of a welcome from staff like Kawana, and Aja, sets the pace for a wonderful stay. We had a peek-a-boo view of the ocean, overlooked the pool / hot tub area - and then enjoyed those hotel amenities (whenever we weren't taking the short walk to Waikiki beach). We'd heard that there were renovations happening, but aside from some work being done to pillars out near the pool ... no sign of workers and equipment, no noise at odd hours ... just a perfect, wonderful, memorable stay!

We stayed twice on recent visit pre and post cruise on Pride of America (see separate review). Total stay was for five nights and cost was well under $800. $154 a night (including all fees and taxes) in heart of Waikiki, a short walk to the beach, right on The Bus (see separate review) line . Very friendly, helpful staff - good sized, clean room (showing some age, but remember where you are). Not sure a better deal can be found. I relied on Oahu Revealed and TripAdvisor reviews and we were well pleased with our choice. If you want to take advantage of the free DVD's, brush up on your PlayStation skills (I have none and was frustrated). If you want a luxurious resort. look elsewhere. If you want a friendly, convenient, excellent value this is a great choice. The pool area looked inviting, even though I did not use it. Free coffee and papers in lobby, great cost. Not perfect, but a great value.

We returned to the peaceful and serene Aqua Bamboo Waikiki February/March 2019 for a 7 night stay.Having stayed at some of the Waikiki Beach front Hotels in previous years (e.g. Royal Hawaiian Hotel, Outrigger Waikiki, etc), and valuing safety and security 24 x 7, we feel that Aqua Bamboo Waikiki is probably the safest Hotel in Waikiki.There is card only access into the Hotel after say 10.00 pm at night and before say 7.00 am in the morning with a late evening and early morning security guard outside the front doors of the Hotel.We always pay for the previous night's accomodation so that we can check in as soon as our flight lands (early in the morning) and not have to wait until the 2.00 pm normal check-in time. Additionally, if you want more time in your room if you have a night flight from Honolulu, you would be wise to pay for that night because check-out time is 12.00 pm midday. This latter option gives you more hours to rest, bath, pack, have a drink, go out, etc before you leave the room.The comments which we have made in previous reviews remain and, as far as we are concerned, the only Hotel to stay at when you are in Waikiki from a security, safety, serenity, close proximity to Waikiki beach, very helpful and respectful staff, etc is the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki.Happy holidays and we hope that this review is helpful.Mahalo fromJanet and Richard

I would highly recommend Aqua Bamboo Waikiki - the staff were friendly, our room was nice and had everything we needed. It was centrally locates and I liked the decor. They have a free Americano making machine in the lobby and ice cold water. The pool and hot tub were nice. What more could you ask for? My only advice would be to be a tiny bit more diligent in regards to cleaning hair out of the bathroom.

Back for our 5th visit to the Aqua Bamboo, great to see all the lovely friendly staff still there and Kimari for organising our booking. Our room was spacious and clean housekeeping do a great job. Love the pool area and the bamboozle cocktail night. Utilised the free shuttle to the shopping centre a few times and I love how it is so close to the beach and great places to eat. Looking forward to seeing the renovations on our next trip. Mahalo for making our trip wonderful.

Very central to waikiki, everything in walking distance. Despite other reviews here, we had two rooms with no issues with cleanliness at all. Both of our rooms were suites with kitchens, full bathrooms, and multiple beds.The staff was helpful with suggestions and information that definitely helped smooth over the rough edges on a late night arrival!The building is definitely older and could use a going over, but if your goal is visit Honolulu and Waikiki - not spend your days in a room - this may be the place for you.We enjoyed it and would stay again.

To say this place is a sh@#hole is being polite to sh@$holes. Most of the upper floors were sold off as condos and are currently used as airbnb's so there is probabally no regulations on upkeep to include smoke alarms. I'm pretty sure the one in my room was over 10 years old. Even though we stayed in one of the private rooms, room 508, the whole hotel looked dirty and unkempt. If you look at airbnb and the room 508 pops up then move along. Unless you want a nice view of the dumpster below. Avoid this place at all costs.

Property needs a thorough cleaning; the room was filthy with mildew on the windows, hair all over the bathroom, air conditioning unit discharged ashes and was completely dirty and unkept. Staff was helpful. I travel extensively, minimum 100 nights/year mostly on business, typically in 3* hotels and this property is a 1* property in a good location.

This boutique hotel is in a great central location. The staff are super friendly and deserve five stars. We stayed in a one bedroom suite that had a full kitchen and two little balconies. I am very particular to cleanliness and this hotel though worn down, met my criteria. I am a very detailed person though and found some things that could be improved ; having said that- the price was right for what we got. So if things were perfect you would pay way more for this hotel. We got beach towels and beach chairs to take to the beach and that was great. Beach is about two easy blocks away. We did utilize the hot tub spa as it got cold one day. The courtyard was clean and comfortable. The other reviews about the air conditioner and street noise were correct but I just brought ear plugs and it was fine. Upgraded kitchen appliances balanced out the the worn structure. We had all the essentials including a small table to dine and for that this was a great value. The review is three stars for room and location and one special extra star for the staff. Can’t give five stars due to worn parts, but again if it was perfect and new the price would not be affordable!

Back again this year for the 7th year and again its a wonderful place to stay.Clean rooms really good staff free shuttles,heated pool and heated hot tub,coffee all day down on the main floor,apples with newpaper on the main floor,with bus stop right across the street and less than 3 minutes away from the beach.Way to go Aqua Bamboo Staff for all the great work and gfriendly staff.

Check in was quick and easy. The location is great, fairly quiet for a downtown Waikiki hotel. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We stayed in the studio room with kitchenette and it was just what we needed. It was a nice touch to see chocolate covered macadamia nut treats in the room! Yes, it’s an older property, however, it’s well kept and clean. The beds were comfortable and the AC kept us cool. There are laundry facilities onsite, pool and hot tub located in a small backyard oasis, WiFi that worked well, a BBQ, coffee, tea and cold water available 24/7. We met so many repeat guests that love the property, we can definitely see why. If you can secure a good deal, it’s so worth it. It was a nice place to stay for a couple of nights as opposed to some of the large and crowded hotels on Kalakaua - and only minutes to the beach.

This hotel was just what we were looking for, booked through AAA. Great location and yes it’s not a luxury suite but it was clean and we had clean towels in our room every day. We had access to beach chairs and beach towels too! Parking was tricky don’t rent a SUV! We had a full kitchen and yes the air conditioners were load but so was the traffic didn’t expect anything less being right downtown. Anyways had a great time the staff was great our room was kept really clean and great location. The updates were nice and we will consider staying there in the future thank you Aqua Bamboo!! If your a fussy pants don’t stay because you will probably complain about something.

Older style hotel central to Waikiki Shops and 4 mins walk to the beach - if you get this at a bargain price well worth it - Room very Hawaiin style could be a bit cleaner so average - had a few issues - no hot water a few days - not notified about renovations - door wouldn't lock - had to tell cleaner to clean the floors as still sandy from previous tenant - very quite location and staff are nice - parking very expensive USD30 a day even for 1 few hours - don't loose beach towels you will have to pay - handy coin laundry on 3 levels - 1 bed apartments with Lanai are nice - make sure you check your total price with the extra resort fees and taxes and upgrades you pay for so if you get for a bargain that is nice as older place so not worth it though to pay top dollar but location is good....

Every 3 years for the last 12 years we've come to host our family gathering in the balcony sweet. It's always a memorable time. The maintenance and some of the crew need to bring a bit more of the "aloha" spirit but otherwise we love the Aqua Bamboo and Spa

. . . of the Aqua Bamboo hotel for a six night stay in Oahu. The hotel is unpretentious but clean, comfortable, and well maintained. The location, two blocks from Kūhiō beach, was convenient. Parking was available for an extra fee, although limited and tight. Our studio kitchenette was spacious and well equipped. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

We had stayed 3 nights at this hotel in Waikiki and i found it was very convenient. The location is perfect and we got greeted with attention and warmth. We had a room with 2 balconies and ocean view. The hotel staff are very kind and welcoming. The best quality/price in Waikiki.

Aloha! This was our first visit to Waikiki and the Aqua Bamboo Hotel has been the perfect base for us. Booking through the Aqua Bamboo website was easy and everything was ready upon our arrival including orchids on our towels and chocolate macadamia nuts to welcome us. The room we stayed in (807) had been recently renovated and it was just perfect for the two of us with a really comfortable bed, a full size fridge, 2 burner glass stove top, coffee maker and microwave. The outside pool area is clean, well kept with a heated pool and hot tub surrounded by tables, lounge chairs and a BBQ for guest use. The location is perfect as the hotel is 2 or 3 blocks from the seafront, has a bus stop across the road, loads of convenience stores nearby and some super restaurants and bars easily within walking distance. The staff have been fabulously welcoming, informative and happy to help! All in all this has been a fabulous holiday and we highly recommend the Aqua Bamboo if you’re planning a trip to this Hawaiian paradise whether it’s your first visit or you’re a seasoned visitor.

We stayed at the bamboo for 10 nights. Very nice hotel. No complaints. Nice pool area. Very quaint. Very clean. Centrally located in Waikiki. The bus stop is right across the street. A grocery store is just down the block, which I thought was quite reasonably priced.

Recently stayed here for 4 nights and the hotel has a great location, it’s walking distance to everything you need. The beach is a 5 min walk away and all the shopping is located right there on the same road as the beachThe hotel is a little older hotels but is kept well maintained and the staff was friendly. The on-site concierge was super friendly and helped us out with booking tours. Pool area is super cute and clean but kinda small and only has a few chairs. Our room was super comfortable and very clean with a nice view of the pool with 2 balconies. I would for sure recommend this place to stay cause it is so close to everything and you can walk everywhere you need to go

This was our 1st time going to Hawaii but my brother wanted to get married there so we said why not. The flight from New Orleans was incredibly long but forgotten once we arrived. The Aqua Bamboo was the perfect place for us because it was located near everything. The beach was a couple of blocks away but we had a view from our balcony of the beach and the mountains. There were also a variety of shops, restaurants, and bars within walking distance. They were also close to the hop on hop off Waikiki tour buses which were extremely reasonable with very knowledgeable guides.

We stayed at the Bamboo, Jan 2018... loved it! Was excellent location! Great staff. Pool area have a lovely tropical feel to it. We had a 1 bedroom kitchenette, was great have the amenities to cook. We were only a very short walk to anything, beach, food... I really can not fine any negative to say... we are actually planning on going back again soon.. ( we have stayed a three Places in Oahu.. our Favorite)

We were here in August when Hurricane Lane was hitting the islands. Before the hurricane, temperatures were in the 30s (celcius) and I have to say the AC in this hotel is top notch!Although the decor is a little dated, everything else was great, especially the staff. We were supposed to leave the day the hurricane was forecast to hit Oahu, so in the middle of the mad rush to re-book flights and accommodations, dealing with the Bamboo staff to extend our stay was quick and easy in a pretty stressful day. Location is great, a couple blocks away from the beach, supermarkets, restaurants and ABC stores. Bus stops were also very close and the heart of Waikiki is only about a 10-15 minute walk away.The only thing about coming in August is that you might want to bring earplugs with you as the AC in the rooms is loud and in August, there is not way you will want to turn the unit off, even at night.

The staff couldn't be nicer or more accommodating!! They were awesome from beginning to end. However, we were sadly disappointed, as the pictures we viewed did not reflect how old this facility is and not the best maintained. They are also very close to other hotels, and the noise carries easily.

wasn't expecting too much after a long flight.. but, was pleasantly surprised! the room was really good! the pool and spa were excellent!!! and the location was perfect for us! even the balcony got a thumbs up from the other half!the staff were friendly and the security lady was a darling!!

Stayed at the hotel 16/8 to 26/8/18. Great location, friendly staff and kitchenette room good. Lucky we got the kitchenette with Hurricane Lane shutting down Waikiki. Would stay here again. Nice and close to the beach and plenty of ABC stores nearby

Our second trip here the room was fantastic ! The Staff was excellent, the hotel was pleasant and beautiful to stay at.the tropical poolside patio ads to good memories of Hawaii. Nearby Is Cheap good food. two blocks from a grocery, on major bus routes with frequent service I recommend

When booking a room there make surch to book with the hotel versus the Airbnb/private. We had an issue where our daughter had taken the one set of key you Are provided when arriving. We went out at night and she kept the key well she decided to eat with a friend late night so we arrived before she did and the person working At the front office whos name is Moana would not let us in. First because we are private and they didn’t even have our name registered as the person staying in room 706. It was a complwre disaster. I highly recommend to book some where else. Not to mention when booking private you are not allowed any Of the amenities. Never coming here again.

Centrally located to what we wanted, launching at the Duke Statue to surf daily and a short walk to just about any type of food you wanted. The hotel itself is pretty nice, small pool and hot tub that are kept well, a perfect spot to keep boards ( bring your own locking cable) short walk to launch of about 2 blocks, located behind the Hyatt a block. We will stay again. Came for my Bday surf trip and had a blast.

We had a lovey stay here. The rooms were quite large, beds were great and location is very central walking distance any way, and a bus stop across the road. The bathroom was functional, but could do with a makeover. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay here.

Aqua Bamboo is a nice little hotel. The rooms do need remodeling and we did have some troubles with our bath tub stopping up while there. However, the staff were VERY ACCOMODATING. The front desk sent maintenance up to our room right away and when he could not fix the problem they moved us upstairs to a suite. It was a "bumpy" start, but the customer service went above and beyond. The free movies, water, and coffee in the lobby are a plus as well! We would recommend this hotel to our friends and family anytime.

We stayed at Aqua Bamboo twice over the last few weeks after my parents recommend this hotel. Friendly staff & best location in Waikiki for the price. Would recommend to anyone looking to stay on a budget. Special mention to Aja at the Front Desk, great personality and enthusiastic approach to her work.

Filthy noisy room. Very dated and worn out. Curtains were torn and dirty, bathtub was stained with dirt and filthy behind the toilet. The room smelled old and stale. One of two elevators was not running and hadn't been in a while. We cut our stay short and got a new hotel. The only nice thing about the hotel was the pool area. Do not stay here.

We had a really lovely holiday here ! The room was clean, beds comfortable, fluffy towels and endless hot water, friendly, personable staff, close to our favourite swimming spot and restaurants, spa and pool easy to access (great spa after a flight from Sydney!)and , because we were celebrating a special birthday, we were presented with bubbly and chocolates !! Happy to reccommend and will definately return. Thank you !

Fantastic location very central. Staff excellent. Rooms somewhat outdated & in need of some work. Court yard & pool area very nice to relax in. Close to beach & all shopping. Otherwise overall good. Had a lovely holiday.

5 minutes from the beach, great staff and security. Manager extremely helpful. Nice outdoor salt pool with activities. Nicely priced. I will return every 2 years. Easy to get to with the airport shuttle. Room was perfect.

Arrived to be advised that our reserved 2 room accomdations no longer available and staff advised they "upgraded" us to a "better" room with two queens. Sorry, this was not what we wanted. When we got to room, it was dirty as I was grossed out by disposable eyelashes on floor from prior guest??? As well, loud humming that hotel tried to drown out by a water fountain that was even more annoying. Worst part was mattress on on of the queens had a massive crevasse in it. DO NOT STAY in room 903!!! As well, ants crawling everywhere.

We arrived in Hawaii late at night excited to get to our room and relax, we walked into the hotel and wasn’t acknowledge/greeted by the receptionist. Then we found out we had a two beds instead of the one that our agent had specifically requested for us but the receptionist claims she never got the request. We then got to our room and the washroom was absolutely filthy, the bed frames had dust all around, and the fridge wasn’t cleaned. We immediately contacted our agent and got re-situated at the Hyatt which was 10x better. The men working the reception in the morning, at the Bamboo, were kind and understanding with our situation and didn’t charge us any fee...I’ve been to 3 star hotels before and they were all clean...the photos of the hotel rooms online are very misleading...

Room was very small, cramped and noisy due to traffic outside. Also the building was very old with a loud air conditioning couldn't turn on because of this annoyance. Staff are very nice and friendly.

Nothing but good things to say about this hotel. The staff was pleasant and professional from the beginning to the end of our stay. We were on our honeymoon, so we were telling everyone and anyone that would listen including the staff. I think they heard us because our room was very nice. (Perhaps that's all their rooms) It had a full kitchen, 3 balconies and a huge king size bed. Also, awaiting us was complimentary champagne and chocolates! The only downside was the balcony that was off the kitchen opened to a building that was undergoing construction, so sitting out there was not the best idea, not the hotels fault. Just had to use our other two balconies. We were on the 8th floor facing the beach which I believe is 3 blocks away. This means the view was mainly other hotels with a sliver of beach in the distance. However, it was still nice because of the palm trees and the sounds of the ocean. If you want a view of the ocean you will have to go up to the top floors. You get complimentary towels and beach chairs. Now parking is not included as is the norm in Waikiki, but the valet car service is complimentary! I am not one to usually use this but was trying to maximize the relation vibe on my honeymoon. They have a pool and a hot tub that looked very nice from our room but we went to the beach and other spots the whole time. Pros:1: Location is right downtown. 3 Blocks from the beach and 3 blocks from the heart of Waikiki shopping and eating district. 2: Complimentary towels, beach chairs and valet parking service3: Free wifi (a lot of places charge extra)Cons: 1: Parking Not included (very common in Hawaii)2: No Room Service 3: Limited On Site Restaurant

The hotel is a bit old, but the beds are comfortable and the room clean! The best part of the Hotel are the staff!! They go out of their way to be polite and helpful all the time! We've have had such a wonderful stay and will recommend to all our family and friends

This hotel has a great location. It's a couple of blocks to the beach, close to a grocery store, the International Market Place, bus stop, and many other things. The pool area is fantastic. They provide free coffee, lemon water, and cookies in the lobby and have fancy coffees available for $1. They have lawn chairs that you can borrow to take to the beach. The staff are great. They upgraded our room to a kitchenette without us even asking. We've stayed there 3 times and will totally stay there again the next time we go.

The Aqua is a Hawaiian gem bamboo themed interior . A pyramid shaped building It has a serene courtyard with pool. Palms and bamboo surround the courtyard. A Pizza and Pasta restaurant is located in the courtyard it's vegan I am not. It was fantastic. The hotel has beach towels chairs and more for you to use.Thursday's they have a hotel party at the pool courtyard area. Local Music, complimentary drink "bamboozle"and snack. Good time to forget the mainland and live Aloha!

Lovely place to stay, super close to the beach and markets nearby. Bus stop a minute walk away. Staff were super friendly, they offer a complimentary activities afternoon every Thursday which was nice to do while relaxing by the pool

We have been coming to the Bamboo for 9 years. This year was very nice and relaxing.The hot tub was actually hot which was very nice and the pool was heated. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I noticed there was not as many staff. A big disappointment was that the Lovin Oven is no longer there. They made the best pizza in all of Waikiki and greek salad.We enjoyed our stay sitting in the garden enjoying the outdoors. Visiting with friends from past years and new friends. Thank you again

In exchange for the room tariff, I was expecting the room to be nicer. It was fairly shabby and drab. With very little expense, the room could be made to be much brighter and fresh. New towels and bed linen, fresher curtains, and a little more attention to the cleanliness overall. (Light switch panels were dirty, towels discolored, curtains left hanging off the hooks, unpolished bedhead and fridge door etc). A full length mirror would have been desirable, and a torch or light near the safe would help distinguish the numbers, which were in a dark area of the cupboard. On the upside, being a lone female traveler, I felt perfectly safe, the pool area was pleasant, tea,coffee and iced water were available at all times in the foyer and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. An ice machine was available in the pool area, and the cutlery/crockery and microwave in the room were a bonus The location was perfect, being close to the main beach area, shopping and eating establishments. The amenity fee is not something which Australian travelers are used to. However, in this instance it included wi fi, coffee in room, shuttle bus to a major shopping centre and use of beach towels. Considering I didn't make use of neither the shuffle service or beach towels, the fee was on the high side, but it is not negotiable, therefore, something to keep in mind when looking at room tariffs. With some minor changes, I would stay again.

This small hotel is centrally located in the middle of Waikiki. It’s only 2 blocks to the beach. Close to many restaurants, ABC Stores, coffee shops, and a Food Pantry grocery store. It’s outdated decor is old school kitschy Hawaiian, so its cute. This is one of the few hotels with microwaves and some rooms have full kitchens. You’ll save a ton by shopping at Food Pantry and cooking, or using the microwave to warm up leftovers. The pool area is small but pretty with lots of beautiful foliage. They have baskets of apples or cookies as free snacks during the day. You can rent free movies or games to play on the game console in each room. Every Thursday they have a free reception in the lobby complete with ukulele music. Lastly, the employees are super nice and helpful. This is my third stay here, and I will be back.

Sure, this hotel could use a renovation but besides that it is actually pretty good: There is an underground car park, the spacious room has a large comfy bed, a stable wi-fi, 2 balconies and even a playstation (without games though).
user_name:
Dino W
Canton of Zurich, Switzerland

review_body: Stay away from this place! We got robbed in our room today. Frankly I’m shocked by all the positive reviews here.First off, don’t expect anything except bare minimum customer service when you’ve realized you’ve been robbed (our iPad was stolen from our room). The manager apparently will be reporting the crime to the insurance company... tomorrow. It was our responsibility to report the crime to the police. Secondly, this place is in very shabby conditions and I’m being kind when I describe it as shabby... (worn furniture, discolored bath tub, sliding doors that do not block out the noisy traffic sounds, not to mention the extremely noisy AC that leaks water outside on the patio). Oh let’s not forget that we have a view straight into another neighbor’s room... I swear you could almost jump from one lanai to another. Worst yet, they charge a $25 + tax resort fee per day... for what? I’m not sure bc the amenities here are definitely subpar compared to all the other hotels around here. Of all the hotels we stayed in, this place is the worst. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place!

This is a great boutique hotel located super close to the beach! It is about a 2-5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach which is definitely where you should spend most of your time! The rooms are somewhat small, but are comfortable and are perfect for what you will need. The hotel staff is very friendly and helped us with everything we needed, including our bookings to Pearl Harbour and Hanauma Bay (Definitely inquire about these activities). In terms of its location to the city centre, it is about a 10 minute walk to all of the shopping and restaurants that you could ever imagine. Overall, this hotel was perfect for our needs and this will definitely be the spot we stay at next time we are in Honolulu!

Unfortunately my husband & I were on the horrific united flight 1175, which lost one of its engines during flight on Feb 13, 2018. We endured one of the most horrifying experience of our lives, within in minutes of finally landing to safety it was all over social media & the news. We were taken to our hotel "Aqua Bamboo" a boutique hotel, which we then were told they did not have our reservation which was made and paid for 8 months prior. To much distress from what we just went through I was still shaken & lost it all over again with this news from hotel guest services, Fe was helping us and was very sympathetic to our experience we just went through, after many attempts to resolve our issue, she called hotel manager Kimari who was as puzzled as the rest of us, she made some calls to get to the bottom of it, with not much explanation to her of why they didn't ever receive our reservation from the 3rd party Kimari offered & put us in their top level 3 room suite. Complete with kitchenette, bedroom & sitting/bar area with large outdoor patio with bbq, high top table, lighted hut with couch's & chairs & view of lighted city. After getting to our suite, we shortly had a knock at the door & to our surprise they brought us a bottle of Chandon Brut & a box of chocolate macadamia nuts, which we thoroughly enjoyed. We were so very thankful for Kimari & Fe for their concern, generosity. This boutique hotel is quaint & quiet & has definitely made a horrible start to our week vacation on Waikiki a very pleasant start. As we start our 2nd week in Kauai this Sunday we hope we have guest relations as great as we have had here with Kimari & Fe. Definitely will return to Aqua Bamboo!

We booked last minute from January 29 to February 13, 2018. We arrived late evening & had a very friendly greeting. Loved our room. This hotel is close to everything, clean & friendly. We loved the pool & had no problems at all. Can’t say enough about comfort, clean, & friendly. Thanks to the staff for all their help in directions, suggestions on restaurants & cleaning our room every day. Would definitely come back.

What a shame!!!.....we had arrived at this resort for 8 days, and from the minute we walked into this reception to until the time we left, it was a disaster. From the bad attitude of the staff on the front desk, the bad smell in the reception/sitting area, the old worn sheets on the bed, which I feel weren't changed in the 8 days, to the old, grubby looking apartment. (I am sure the cleaning staff did their best) Two positive things - the hotel is 2 streets back from Waikiki Beach and the guests we met were lovely.

Aqua bamboo is central situated close to waqkiki Beach app 4 min walk fem the central area of wakiki Beach, it is a small hotel with a nice pool area and very nice Staff. Roms are okay with all you need but they are not renovated for a long time. Be sure that you get room to the pool side, frontside Rooms to the Street is not recommended.

Like to say thank you to all the wonderful staff at the Aqua Bamboo. All the staff work so hard to make our pleasant stay.They have a heated pool also a larger hot tub with a extra heater if desired.Rooms were very clean.The staff very friendly and very helpful.Close to the Bus stop right across the street and a two minute walk to the beach.Aqua Bamboo has beach toys for the pool and beach chairs for the beach,Aqua Bamboo has a free shuttle for the hotel guests.Also a Big thank you to Kimari for all the good work you have done WAY TO GO Aqua Bamboo.

I had booked this hotel for party of 3 due to reviews I read. However, the good reviews did not match what I had witnessed. Although our room has renovated kitchenette, there were just too many bulky furniture in such a small space which made it challenging to find a place for the “dining” table for us to eat comfortably. Neighboring hotel balcony has a view of our bathroom window that they could see you shower. I wish the management repaints the walls in white to give the illusion that rooms &lobby are bigger than they appear & get rid of the unnecessary furniture. There were also chipped paints on the wall, noisy AC box & you could hear the heavy traffic from the street. Since there’s kitchenette, better to remove the room carpet for a cleaner look & easier maintenance, have one type of flooring throughout the rooms & replace sliding doors with double pane, old tub & fixtures. The good thing about this hotel is its prime location, just parallel with Kalakaua & 2 blocks to Waikiki Beach. It is situated on a busier road due to public transportations traveling on this street. But, this place is a walking distance to many restaurants, shopping areas, & definitely easy access to bus rides/stops. The main highlight of this hotel is its private pool (I think the jacuzzi had been renovated). There is a veggie Pizza place onsite which I was not able to try. This hotel is old but rich in history. If management only gives it more care & love, this place can be more in demand because it has a nice private pool with paradise ambience, & friendly & helpful staff. Guests: Don’t forget to try the shave ice at Vintage Island Shave Ice (outside Royal Hawaiian Shopping Mall) & check out Longs Store on Kalakaua, & Whalers on Kuhio as sometimes they have more items for those on a budget. ;) Mahalo nui loa for reading this review.

Stayed here for the first nights in Honolulu. The location is kind of in the middle of Waikiki. Bus stop is right next to the hotel. Althought there is crazy homeless man living behind the bus stop and he is shouting daily there so you can hear this to your room.We had a room from the 12th floor and balcony facing to another building. There was a glimpse of Waikiki beach and almost a glimpse of Diamond head. Other than that it was a view of other balconis forward of the hotel. The balcony was nice but the furniture(chairs) were little heavy to the surroundings. Little smaller chairs would be more practical maybe away to be folded if you want more space on the balcony. We had rented a car for two days (that makes a 1 night) parking fee is 30$/night.The room was ok, bathroom tap was dirty and the water didn't come out of it properly. Seemed like calcium from the water. Other than that the cleanliness was good. There was a coffee maker in the room and fridge. Safe was in the room too and free of charge which was handy.The hotel has a swimming pool and jaquzzi. There is also Loving oven the vegan pizza plaze in the hotel grounds we didn't try it tho as it seemend little expensive to a pizza place.When checking out we receivet the receipt of the total. My hub was ok. And when we went out to wait our shuttle i looked the repeipt properly. We had been charged parking for 4 nights. My hub went back and told the clerk we had a car for two days. He was like ok ok so two nights. Than hub again no two day(between two days there is only one night). So they returned the $90 dollars they had charged for nothing(no car, no parking fee) So look your receipt properly! Overall: ok hotel, decent price, need a little small things fixed on the rooms. Good location for Waikiki wise.

Stayed at the hotel for a week over the Christmas holiday. Pros: central location in Waikiki makes it easy to walk everywhere. Close to restaurants, grocery stores, quick and reasonable places to eat, the beach, etc. Front desk and housekeeping were very friendly. Reasonably priced for Waikiki. Clean rooms. Nice to have a kitchen for making breakfast. Cons: underground parking lot is very small and hard to maneuver a large vehicle like a minivan. Rooms have window air conditioners which are loud but it helps with the street noise. Rooms are not soundproof and it's common to hear garbage trucks, emergency vehicle sirens, etc. throughout the night. Rooms and hallways are tired and could use some tlc. Furniture in room and bathroom have scuff marks, mirrored closet door had a broken mirror. Hot water for shower didn't get very hot....didn't need to turn on the cold water at all for my shower. No fan in the bathroom...just an open window with horizontal metal shutters. Tip: Reserve your parking spot before you arrive as there are only about 9 spots and ideally, your vehicle would be smaller than a minivan. Mandatory amenity fee includes wifi.I'd rate this hotel as a 2.5* but it was fine for this trip since we spent most of the trip out of the room. Usually, I want to stay in a 4* hotel.

Can't ask for a more central location with such a good rate . Everything is within walking distance and the buses are running right out front to get you to the further afield venues. The staff are friendly and the place is clean, very clean. The little oasis that is their pool area is a treat for relaxing. Pool, hot tub and plenty of tables to take your meals to. One drawback is with it's central location it can be noisy with the traffic. Kuhio Avenue is busy most of the day. But you'll probably be exploring as you're on vacation

I really liked this place. Great value. Friendly front staff.The pool area is beautiful and uncrowded. Has a hot ub too.location is great and a close walk to the main drag.decor is a bit dated, but not a big deal.

I have stay in several different hotels, this little gem was a beauty. Lovely room, with all the amenities that are required. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.It was close to beach, restaurants and buses. I will certainly go back to this lovely hotel again.Everyone enjoyed the hotel that I had spoke too.

We stayed at the Bamboo for a week, meeting friends who were already there, The price being quite reasonable we weren't sure how comfortable we were going to be. We were surprised by accommodations that included a kitchenette, a little breakfast nook and, get this, three balconies, two of which offered a view of the ocean. One balcony had a divan to seat 6 people. We had our friends over and had wine out there; very pleasant experience. The Bamboo is a two minute walk from everything, the car rental, shopping, clubs, etc., and since Waikiki is jumping these days, the location enabled our fun experience.

My girlfriend and I really liked the place. Great place to get away from typical Waikiki and relax. Many rooms are spacious with nice kitchenettes. The jacuzzi was unfortunately unavailable for repairs

This hotel gets rave reviews so after staying at the beautiful Sheraton Princess on my previous visit I thought I would try this one. If you like old, lots of street noise, no real balcony and street views you’ll love it. If I had not have paid my deposit I would have moved as soon as I walked in the door. Money does not come easy to me and I saved for this holiday to bring my two daughters away for a break after we lost my husband, their father.Very very disappointed.Would not recommend.

A somewhat dated hotel, that being said, our room was very comfortable, though I must agree with a previous review of the fact the bathroom took a while to "de-humidify". Our air-con worked well and we used our little screened balcony to hang clothes out to dry in private! The little kitchenette was useful thought it took two days to obtain an electric kettle..oh well, saucepans boil water too. We were advised to use the coffee machine to heat water, but it took a very long time. The staff were very pleasant, the pool area was very nice and the bonus of this place is that "The Lovin' Oven" pizzeria is right next to the pool. Beautiful pizzas boys!!!! Thankyou very much! A shuttle to Ala Moana is provided too, but we have to say, the location is superb..a short walk to beaches, shops and a gorgeous little coral museum across the road. Our studio room was 309...our son stayed in room 1104, a bigger room than ours.

My mum and myself stayed here from the 11/09/2017 to 25/09/2017 we came here as special holiday for my mum who is 80 in January. Before I start there is an $18 a night resort fee and a $50 deposit, you get the $50 back on leaving. This hotel is situated a couple of minutes walk from the beach but it is away from the bustle on the main beach road. The hotel is dated but is very very clean and the staff are friendly. Our room was tidied daily and had a nice balcony to sit on. The pool area is lovely although not very big and the pool is the size of a peanut but enough to cool you down. We could walk easily to the Zoo from here and to catch the local buses and trolleys. Everytime I went for coffe in the lobby it was all gone so only had about two cups the whole fortnight. A bar area would make all the difference to this hotel as you could get a drink in the evening and sit in the pool area. All in all a pleasant stay. The area near the hotel was a bit rough round the edges but we had no real issues. There were people at the hotel who stay often at this hotel. Would I stay here again? No I do not think I would. Apparantly there is shuttle bus service but we were not told about it and to where I do not know!!!!

We were in Waikiki for a business meeting, and they put us up at this hotel. The hotel is nicely located within easy walking distance of shops, restaurants, and the beach. The rooms, though dated, were clean and had a kitchenette (a very nice feature). My room smelled musty, but I remedied that by turning off the air conditioning and leaving the windows open. The pool area was an inviting place to hang and many of us chose to sit there rather than in our rooms. The hotel had a pau hana happy hour one of the days during our stay. It was nice to meet other guests while enjoying mai tais & pupus. Free but slow WiFi. The parking garage didn't look as though it could accommodate all the potential guests, so we opted to not drive in the evening. Instead we walked to our chosen dinner location. All in all, a comfortable stay.
user_name:
Nancy Z
Captain Cook, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Older, dated, but clean and adequate. Staff friendly and helpful. Shower and lobby a challenge for taller people. Good location: off the beaten path but close enough to walk to shops and pick up places for tours.

Our introduction to the Aqua Bamboo was not pleasant as my wife and I and our friends travelling with us were presented with rooms that were well below 3 star quality. Our friends air conditioner did not even work. We explained our disappointment to the staff and they worked hard to help us move to other rooms. A layer of dust remained on our phone table despite the room being serviced each day. The A/C needs cleaning or replacing as both my wife and I suffered sore throats and congestion after just a couple of nights into our stay. The hotel is in a central location, but the area seems a little seedy. Our friends saw a man jump from a 1st floor room just next door to the hotel as Police were chasing him.On the positive side, it has a nice pool area and is a short walk to places like Waikiki Beach, The Cheesecake Factory, Dukes and all the shopping and restaurants you could hope for.Make sure you go to the Rock Island Cafe on Kaiulani Ave for a trip back to the fifties and good food. Also enjoy a great meal at the California Pizza Kitchen on Kalakaua Ave. The steaks are great.

Stayed here for 6 nights and found it very comfortable and relaxing. The front desk staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Our rooms were spacious and very clean but if you want a good nights sleep, ask for a room on the pool side on one of the higher floors. Hotel is located 2 blocks back from Waikiki Beach on Kuhio Ave which is one of the main thoroughfares so can be quite noisy- garbage trucks go past at 4am! Good beach/pool towels are loaned out on a card system and you can get a fresh dry one any time. Coffee and tea is set up in the lobby and there is an excellent Pizza cafe in the court yard/pool area. Buses to all the major attractions stop outside and the shops are handy too. Would highly recommend the Aqua Bamboo to anyone looking for an affordable holiday on Oahu.

close to the beach and various shops; drinking water tea and coffee available during whole day; free shuttle bus to Ala Moana canter. nice staff on the reception - very friendly and helpful; in rooms you will hear the streetnocie - worth to have earpluggers. swimming pool was OK. You may spend there a time before check in - restroom and decks. In the room kitchen there is a microvail and corkscrower you may take from the reception.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 6 nights in room 610 the room was fabulous. 2 big doors one overlooking the pool area and the other with a balcony with city and mountain views. Bed was very comfortable. Room was large and also had a lounge in it. They service the rooms daily. Pool area is great... has a spa and a very lovely cabana to laze around in.Staff was very friendly and helpful. There is free coffee and lemon water down stairs in the reception area. We would grab a cuppa to have by the pool most days. Also by the pool is a pizza restaurant. I would recommend their yummy pizzas. The only negative I would say is the air conditioner was noisy. The hotel is close to beach and shops. We will definitely be staying there again on our next visit.

We enjoyed our two night stay at the Aquarium Bamboo. The room rate was fair, and we were upgraded to a suite, with two queen beds, a kitchenette and even a futon. The decor was very attractive, all with a bamboo theme. There is a pretty garden and small pool in the back, and free coffee in the lobby. It's a very short walk to the beach and other Waikiki attractions.

I spent 7 nights at the Aqua Bamboo in September 2017.This boutique hotel is ideally located just a short walk from the beach, shops and a grocery store.Although the rooms are quite dated, I spent very little time in there and they were equipped with all of the necessities.The staff were very attentive and happily assisted on all occasions. The inclusion of a shuttle bus and tea, coffee, fresh water services were all welcomed.In terms of areas for improvement, there were a couple of occasions where house keeping did not replenish the shower amenities ie. body wash etc. however the reception staff were able to provide this upon request. The air conditioner was also very noisy which I thought would pose a big problem however I became accustom to it throughout my stay and after a few days, it was not bothering me too much at all.I would recommend this hotel as a budget friendly option for those not to fussed about high end luxury that may be provided at more expensive and well-known hotel chains.

Just spent 8 nites here 2 blocks bak from the beach in a great location and affordable price. The room was dated but was large with a small kitchenette who h we utilised for our breaky each morning. The staff were amazing so friendly and helpful and nothing was a problem to them. I would recommend this hotel for its position, friendly caring staff and affordable price point. The only complaint would be the size of the pool which is quite small but orher than that its a great little hotel.

We stayed at this hotel for a week in August. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a room on the 11th floor overlooking the pool. The room had a small kitchenette with everything you would need except an oven. Pool area is very nice and we enjoyed many evenings there. The location is great, walking distance to the beach, stores and restaurants. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel and we took bus 2 to Diamond Head. There is a reception on Thursday evenings in the main lobby with free snacks and a specialty drink. I also got to make my own Lei. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely stay again.

This is a small boutique hotel which is a little dated in decor and has very very noisy window air conditioning. These are the worst things about it - everything else was good. The location is perfectly balanced between the beach, bus stops, food or alcohol shopping. We had a 9th floor kitchenette, 3 balconies, an ocean view and since it was poolside no street noise. The cleaning lady was very attentive. The dishes, glasses, silver and pots were clean when we arrived as was the fridge, the room and bathroom. I have read other reviews that she did not wash the dirty dishes daily - WE did not expect her to. They had several coin laundry machines and daily lemon water, tea and coffee in the lobby. They provided free beach towels as needed and everyone at the front desk was helpful and pleasant.

We had a wonderful vacation in Hawaii. Partly in Thanks to the Aqua Bamboo Hotel. They made us feel like Ohana (family). Great location too. In walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping. We will be staying here again next time.

The standard room was: very Little, dirty, old and we found also ants and beatles! Also The swimming pool was closed for some 'problems" and when we claims to change room They answer us that we need to pay more to have a 'better' room.Non rispecchia per nulla gli standard accettabili di un hotel europeo. ..Anche il personale per nulla gentile : DA EVITARE ASSOLUTAMENTE! !!

I had arrived at the hotel with my stressed out mother who had booked our first night a day later by accident. They immediately sorted things out and eased her stress by reassigning us to another room. Additionally, the Lovin' Oven behind the hotel serves the best pizza and was run by the friendliest man, Luana.

From the moment we arrived the staff were exceptionally friendly and professional. The hotel is boutique Hawaiian and has a great feel about it. The pool area is really well done and there is an ice machine and restaurant. Free DVD rental, coffee, tea, lemon water and fruit in the lobby area, and a shuttle to the big Ala Moana shopping centre. Wifi, towels, beach chairs included in resort fee. Just a short walk to the main street with heaps of shopping and restaurants, and about 10 minutes to the beach in front of the Royal Hawaiian hotel (which was our favourite). Loved my stay here!”

I Just recently stood here with my family during the week of July 23rd. The lobby is very cute and they provide lemon water, tea and coffee for every guest in the hotel at no charge. The front desk employees are very nice and helpful. They also provided beach equipment's such as beach towels, beach chairs, floaters, etc which was a nice touch because the beach is very close walking distance, and walking distance to two ABC stores, and numerous other food places around the hotel. The pizza place called The Lovin Oven which is located in the hotel is very very delicious and would totally recommend it. My room was located on the street side, which made it very noisy during my stay and to make it worse their AC is tremendously loud as well. Makes it hard to sleep peacefully at night.My main complain is the cleanliness of the rooms, which i take very seriously, and supposedly the hotel does too. I stood on the 8th floor and the housekeeper did not do a good job at all cleaning both rooms in which i had stood in. There was so much dust on every desk and counter, and obviously showed that it had not been cleaned properly or at all. ( as seen my pictures).During my stay i had dropped some tea on my sheets and went ahead to clean it so it doesn't stain, and brought the sheet off my bed once it dried and placed it on the floor, so i can receive a new set of sheet the next morning. To my surprise, the housekeeper put the SAME sheet that was on the FLOOR! Back on my bed again. That is utterly disgusting!! She didn't even bother to properly fix the sheets on the bed as seen in the pictures i provided. I also had placed a robe that they provided on the floor, so it can be washed and she just left it there, which made me question if these robes are even washed continuously during ones stay. The bathroom, wasn't even swept. I had my doubts that the housekeeper wasn't doing her job properly so i went ahead and left a cap to the lotion on the floor to see if she would actually pick it up or sweep. Which, she did neither ( as you can tell in my picture). The bath tub wasn't cleaned, nor the walls of the tub, and left with hair around it. By the end of my stay, due to the fact that rooms are not cleaned properly, i had a huge COCKROACH come to my room. YES, a roach! I understand that Hawaii has numerous roaches, but to have your hotel room have one isn't right to me, it should be properly cleaned, sanitized, and some form of pest control.I hope that management retrains their housekeeping section and takes it more seriously, because the rest of the hotel is very pleasant.

We stayed here for a week and LOVED it!The location is perfect - two blocks from the beach. We booked a kitchenette and got a lovely view of the ocean from our 12th floor balconies. Near all the restaurants, bars, shops and beach. There's even a food mart nearby if you want to save money. Friendly, helpful staff. Adorable pool with shade. It is a small hotel and definitely great value for the money. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to others!

This hotel is an oasis two blocks from Waikiki Beach! The staff is responsive and friendly, creating a welcoming atmosphere. The rooms are small compared to contemporary hotels but, for the price, they are comfortable. The beds are great and the property sparkling clean. Our favorite parts were the cool, relaxed lobby and the lush green courtyard and pool that feel 100 miles away from the crowds of Waikiki. Our special thanks to Kawana, who quickly answered several email inquiries before we arrived and helped us throughout our stay. Great place for the price! :-)

we stayed here for a week in the end of June 2017. We stayed on the 5th floor with one bedroom and the 2 sofa beds. My sister and i both stayed on the sofa beds, while my parents were in the bedroom, it was actually super comfortable and the staff was super accommodating. I definitely would recommend this place for everyone. It was close to everything with lots of options for food my family really enjoyed the market around the corner some nights with the fresh fruit and the interesting food. I was very happy with my stay here. the only bad thing i would have to say was just the noise at night if you aren't used to the sirens but the noise from the aircon blocks that out

We have stayed here many times over the years & this hotel never disappoints us.The staff are friendly & helpful and the facilities are great, nothing is too much effort for the staff.There is a nice pool, spa & beauty area.I love that it is close enough too the beach & shopping without having to be right on the esplanade. The shops & restaurants are great.The beach is safe & the water warm, I can't wait too come back for another visit. Great value for money.

We stayed here for 9 nights recently. We were a little nervous after reading some negative reviews; however, we were very happy with our room, the pool area and the staff. Yes, the hotel is a bit dated but we weren't looking for luxury. We spent some time relaxing by the pool and enjoyed the Thursday Happy Hour. The room was clean, there were 3 (!) balconies off the room and we enjoyed the view from all 3. We had a "kitchenette", which was handy for breakfast and storing some leftovers to eat the next day. We were ok with the A/C noise as it blocked the noise from the very busy Waikiki area. The location was great - very short walk from Waikiki beach. All in all, we were very happy with our choice of hotel.

We stayed here for two weeks in June 2017. We stayed in a corner room with a kitchenette and this was great for us. The staff were very helpful and the pool area excellent for chilling out. Although dated the room was clean and the bed extra comfortable. We would recommend this establishment for anyone looking for a mid level hotel in Waikiki.

Our family enjoyed our stay because it was close to beach, restaurants, and major hotels for easy shuttles pickups if you book a bus tour. The rooms were spacious and housekeeping and staff were awesome. Unless you plan to stay in your hotel all day (and why would you do that in here!) this hotel provides a spotless room after a day of adventure and a good night's sleep. We'd stay here again!

We booked here because other family members were also staying here, however after the second night we asked to be moved to a higher level as the noise from the street kept us up all night ( we were o the fifth floor, street facing). Hotel staff were friendly and accommodating and moved us to the 8th floor. The room was smaller and cramped and as it was still street facing was just as noisy. Family members told us to keep the air conditioner on all night to drown out the street noise. The air conditioner was so loud we could hardly hear ourselves talk. The balcony was so small only one chair and even to stand on the balcony we were dripped on from the air cond above us. Very unpleasant. The room was full of dated furniture, the lighting so bad. The only two good things were the location and the pool. We booked for 8 days , but after 5 , counted our loses and upgraded to the Astin. We will never go back and will never recommend . There are so many other choices with ocean views and similar prices money. We paid $25 a day for hotel fees, same price as the Astin where we received gift beach bag on arrival, better WiFi, larger and more luxurious pool area, with gym and adjoining restaurant and bar. Don't do it.
user_name:
Kaylene M
Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

review_body: To cluttered,in rooms furniture everywhere just a small dining table to sit at and to single beds in lounge only two people staying could have a lounge so can watch tv instead of lying on bed cleaner left sliding door open front desk did not really care air conditioners, rattle all the time and leak on the floor and do not cool very good,room did not get cleaned until 3 pm not worth the money better places around.

We recently stayed here for 2 nights on a family holiday. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and the pizza restaurant at the pool was good. Could use a bit of updating but overal a great place to stay
