We stayed here after our Pride of America cruise. It was great, the staff are amazing!! The hotel is a little older (standard for Waikiki though), but the pool area is beautiful and the location is awesome. Would recommend.

This was a very disappointing hotel after viewing photos online.... what you see online does not reflect how dated and run down this place is. Our room had that much furniture in it you could hardly move the old saying "less is more" needs to be adhered to.The shower over the bath was a mission for me having two broken legs and the water pressure left a lot to be desired. Manoeuvring around the bed was lethal with the sharp wooden corners on the base and so much furniture - If there is one thing I would recommend to management "get rid of all the big furniture and open up the space in the rooms they would feel a lot more spacious, claustrophobic and possibly less dated...The air conditioning in the room is very very noisy especially the bedroom unit (they are the old boxes that are stuck through the wall) and we got very little sleep when we had to turn it on.The street outside even though entertaining with the people that are milling around this us a very busy and noisy street even with all the windows shut.On a positive this hotel is well located to the centre of Waikiki with everything within walking distance beach, restaurants, shops, etc. The staff at the Aqua are friendly and very willing to assist you with your needs. They organised our transport to Pearl Harbour and transfer to airport without any hassles "thumbs up".

We booked this hotel because it had decent reviews for value and quality on here and other booking websites. Positives were that the staff was so friendly and they left us a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts in our room with a greeting card, and a voucher for a free pineapple from a store down the street.The negatives, however, are why I will never stay at another budget type hotel in Hawaii. The rooms were dirty, with hair on the walls in the bathroom, and crumbs on the floor. We switched our first room because we found a dead bug (I think a roach) on the curtain and the AC unit made a continuous loud noise...and our second room had dead roaches under the bed.Our second room also had a shower knob that came off every time you turned the water off, and the AC unit barely felt like it was cooling the room off. We checked out earlier and checked into a much nicer (which cost more) hotel...definitely worth it to enjoy our trip to Hawaii more.

I found it offensive to be charged an extra $25 per day for the use of the very average and sometime non existant internet, a pool towel that I didn't use and free coffee in the foyer that I didn't drink! The room was ok except for the old wall airconditioner was louder than a jumbo jet so you couldn't sleep with it on. The house keeper never washed the coffee cup or glasses and took 4 days to replace the soap. The morning staff were friendly but the afternoon staff couldn't even say hello.

Old but still very nice and the rooms are great with a little kitchen, fridge, stove and microwave. A serperate lounge area also, this place is very conveniently located with everything in walking distance. ABC stores are on every corner with them selling all your needs including alcohol. We would stay here again

This hotel has great character. Clean rooms, Nice pool, great location close to beach and shops. The mini kitchen was handy as there is a great Super market close by with good selection and pre made foods.

This hotel is in a great location--just a few blocks from Waikiki Beach, Diamond Head, and zoo. The hotel is an older hotel but well maintained. Rooms were clean, tidy, and average in size . The hallways are narrow. We had a room on the side of the hotel which overlooked the top of the next building. The back of the hotel overlooked a nice pool, tiki hut and sitting area. Next to the pool was a small little hotel operated restaurant that served pizza. Pool towels were available to use at poolside or the beach. Boogie boards and beach chairs were available for borrowing. Equipment was in good condition. The room had a mini kitchen with a two burner stove, sink, and small refrigerator. Pots, pans, dishes, cooking utensils and eating utensils were present and in good condition. There is a grocery store several blocks down the street. Restaurants are available close by. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The concierge helped us with reservations for events we selected. Valet parking for your car is available at $25.00 per night. Public transportation is available within a block of the hotel. We will definitely stay here the next time we are in Honolulu. Good price and great location.

We rented two regular hotel rooms with another couple. When we arrived they upgraded us to mini-kitchen rooms with two queen sized beds, a fridge, two burner glass cooktop and microwave. We used the fridge to store some drinks and food that we bought at the nearby ABC store. Everything in the kitchen was clean. I was prepared for some street noise after reading reviews, but none of us had a problem. Our rooms were 208 and 205. 208 was at the side facing another building, 205 was facing the front. The air conditioner made some noise, but also helped to mask the traffic sound. All in all, not bad. The bed was very comfortable so we slept well.We were fortunate to be there on a Thursday evening when the hotel put on a complimentary luau in the pool area. Free Mai Tais and snacks. We liked the little pool and the garden. A nice place to unwind after battling the crowds of Honolulu.We thought the staff was very friendly and helpful. We scheduled a shuttle to Pearl Harbor through the concierge and that worked out well. The location was ideal for people who don't have trouble walking. The beach was about three blocks. The hotel loans out beach boards, chairs, towels etc.. The Eggs and Things. Breakfast place was about the same distance. We would recommend that place for a good and reasonably priced breakfast.Not a fancy place and a little dated, but if you don't expect luxury, you should enjoy your stay.

This hotel was perfect for our family of four. We have two teens and the space was so practical. We walked to the beach one block and had a blast. Nice hotel for the price! We went in Nov 2015. Everything is so expensive but Aqua hotels are more Affordable.

From the moment we entered the foyer of the Aqua Bamboo, until we departed 18 days later, nothing was a problem for the staff, the facilities was first class, room was cleaned and refreshed every day by friendly staff, My family and I have travelled to Honolulu for the past 20 years and have stayed at most of the '5* hotels, but the Aqua Bamboo has been our choice for the past 10 years and will continue to be our choice.From the 'boss' Nicole to Zenie at the front desk Junior maintaining the grounds, pool etc, every member of the staff treat you like Ohana- family.As Arnie said, WE'LL BE BACK.

Ok, three of us stayed in the room, had stove, microwave & full size fridge, so that was good. We didn't really speak with staff as we were out most of the time, so can't really comment on them. Place is in need of an update, it is looking a little old & worn. Had a really noisy wall mounted air con. But if you just want somewhere to sleep & you don't mind noise, then you'll be fine. If your someone that likes a clean modern room, then this place is not for you.

The location is right in the middle of Waikiki, near the water and that's the only positive thing I can say. The room was disgustingly dirty. The staff was unhelpful and largely just didn't care about me the paying customer and my horrible experience. I couldn't figure out why until I spoke with the owner. Yeah, he's not a nice guy. He manages to leave some nice sounding responses that makes it seems like none of the issues people complaint about are his fault. If you stay here you will likely get sick or take home roaches or something. It is that dirty. I also couldn't sleep because of all the sirens and trash truck noise (all night long) and with a broken balcony door that wouldn't close all the way it was like having the tv on loud all night. It's impossible that all these positive reviews are real. They must be faked.

I normally am not the type to leave reviews, but this hotel and my stay there was the worst experience! First things first, we call the hotel that morning(4/20/17) to make a reservation for that night, checking out on 4/21/17. It was a one night stay, thankfully, as we were traveling around the whole island. We get to the hotel to check in around 8:30pm, and we are told they can't find our reservation. After a few different people looking and a few phone calls, turns out they had made our reservation for the 21st, to check out on the 22nd. Strike one. I should have taken this as a sign to go find another hotel, but my wife and I were exhausted from a full day of travel and just wanted to sleep. The front staff was very rude to my wife and I, telling us the mistake was our fault (said I told them the wrong dates, but how could I have been at fault for saying "we need a room for tonight, only") Then, the price we were quoted in the morning for a room wasn't even close to the same price we were given when we got there, but nobody bothered to mention that I went from paying $115 give or take to almost $200, plus they charged extra fees, and the valet price was outrageous, considering they wouldn't let us park the car ourselves. The guy doing the valet seemed completely displeased when we asked if our bags could be taken up to our room (Yes, they were 35 lb bags, but there were only two, and I had already pulled them out of the car and placed them on the cart), and took his sweet time doing it. Strike two and then some. Now, I feel the need to say that this hotel is SEVERELY outdated. The whole place looked like I stepped out of a time machine into the 1960's. While on Kauai, before coming to Oahu, we stayed in two other Aqua owned hotels, and they were magnificent, so I was extremely hopeful, based on pictures I had looked at, that this one would be just as amazing, and I was oh so wrong. The front counter woman continued to be rude when I asked her basic questions, like how late is the pool open, what kind of bed is in the room, etc.When the contract was presented to me, I noticed the huge price increase, and inquired about it, as it wasn't as before. I was told that the rates change (which I know and believed) but that also the room that they mistakenly put us in wasn't as nice as the one we were going to be in that nice, and I was also told it was a pool view room. Okay, that's fine, I'll pay the extra for the nicer room and nicer view, I just wanted to be in bed! Here's the kicker, our "pool view room" was on the second floor, and when I opened the curtains, there was no pool in sight. So, thanks for the lie! Instead I got to look at the hotel or condos being built directly next door, which workers started coming to and building at about 6:30am the next morning. Not that we got that great of sleep anyway!In addition to being lied to about our view, our room was horrendous. There was a window unit next to the sliding doors that was the loudest thing I've ever heard in my life. We had to choose between AC or the television because we couldn't hear the TV of the window unit was on! Also, there were surge protectors plugged into other surge protectors, and wires all over the floor, and even near the window unit, which leaked and left a wet spot on the floor and made an awful smell! We had to move the wires and surge protectors away from it so they wouldn't get wet! The window unit itself didn't even have glass next to it, to continue the window, (the window unit itself was practically sitting on the floor anyway) it instead had plywood sealing off the hole, and the ply wood was put in so poorly that it made the window unit work even harder due to holes leading outside! First impression wasn't great. The tv reception was spotty, so we ended up renting a DVD from their kiosk downstairs (probably the only good thing about this place is the free DVD rentals) to watch before bed. The room has a Playstation 3 on it to play the DVD's, which is great, except ours didn't seem to want to play Blu-ray Discs, which is what 95% of those DVD's were. Awesome. Called the front desk about it, they said they would send someone up in a few to replace or fix the PS3, and no one ever came. Great. We resorted to the good old laptop and Netflix. This room had a little kitchenette in it, which was nice, except all of the cups and dinnerware we were provided were dirty, and the fridge still had someone else's drinks and leftovers in it. Needless to say we left the kitchenette alone and ordered pizza instead. Just when I thought it couldn't get worse, I go to use the restroom, and the toilet wouldn't flush. I took the top off the tank and there was NO water in it! So I called again and we were told that the water may be off, and to turn it on by twisting the knob under the toilet, or to refill the tank ourselves. Excuse me?? We should have been offered another room on that alone. I tried turning the knob under the toilet to turn the water on, and I turned it every which way possible and the tank never refilled. I ended up using the trash can in the bathroom to refill it just so I could flush. I called once again and said that no matter what way i turned the knob, the water never came back on. Again I was told someone would look into it, and no one ever showed. If it wouldn't have been after midnight by this point, I would have packed everything back up and left, but we were dog tired, and I left everything up for the morning, where I planned on telling the next shift of people what happened, hoping to at least get an apology for the lies we were fed and the terrible state of that room. We got up the next morning, I went to make a cup of coffee, and there were two roaches in the sink. At that point, I was livid. I woke my wife up and showed her, we took pictures of everything, packed our things and went to check out. I didn't want to spend another second in that room. We packed our stuff, called down to have our bags brought down and our car brought around so we could check out. We waited about 15 minutes and no one showed, so we ended up taking the bags down ourselves. Whatever. We go to check out, and I explain to the woman "helping" me what happened the night before, our complaints, and how uncomfortable our entire stay was there. Her "apology" was "Sorry the room wasn't up to your standards, but we hope you'll stay with us again!" Why on earth would I stay here ever again? I showed her the pictures, told her about maintenance not showing up twice, the bugs, everything, and I was more than polite considering how unhappy I was with everything. They proudly display plaques behind the counter of their ratings and awards but I honestly have no idea how they earned those. I asked for phone numbers to contact someone higher up to share my complaints with, and was given two non working phone numbers. I went online looking and called, got placed on hold and subsequently hung up on twice. I feel like we should have been, at the VERY least, offered a new room or something for what we went through, but not one person working there seemed to care. I'm still working to get in contact with someone who will take me seriously, and I really want some sort of compensation or full refund for all of this. Completely unprofessional, extremely outdated, and not worth the $200+ we got suckered out of. I hope Aqua drops this hotel, because it is really putting a hurt on their image. They say you get what you pay for but I stayed in hostels on three different island during my trip that were nicer, cleaner, and more accommodating than this hotel, and hostels are less than $40 a night! I hope someone sees this, because the way that hotel is run, the rude staff they employ, and the condition of the room (probably rooms), is NOT okay for a so called "one of the best hotels in Waikiki". I've stayed at Motel 8's in the middle of nowhere that were nicer. They should advertise as a 1 or 2 star hotel with a 60-80 dollar price tag, at least then I would have known and expected it to be as bad as it was. Again, luckily it was only for one night, but this trip was for my wife and I's first wedding anniversary. Thank god we were traveling around so much and island hopping, because I don't think I would have been able to stay more than one night in that place, even if we had moved rooms, because based on other reviews, the problems we had seem to be consistent problems other people are having. Way to put a damper on our anniversary. For that price we could have stayed somewhere on the beach, with a working toilet, no bugs, and a quiet AC. Really hope this hotel gets a makeover and either a better trained or completely new staff. It's in a prime location and has potential to be great, but a lot of work needs to be done!

I like Honolulu. It's safe, people are friendly & whilst some aspects are a bit expensive, tourists can get good value for $s spent. We were placed in Aqua Bamboo as part of our cruise package, and having previously used up to date TimeShare resorts in the city, this was rather sub-standard. The pool area was comfortable & secluded, but there is only one toilet. and the key must be obtained from the front desk. The air-conditioner was so noisy I could not hear the television, and it leaked onto the carpet, giving rise to mould. The bed was shorter than the standard queen-size, so my feet dangled off the end during the night, and I'm only 5'10"! However, the youthful staff were very polite and helpful. If I were a secret boss, I'd give them all a raise & secure them positions after the building had been knocked down & a new edifice erected!

Disaster! Room 1205- on the 12th floor! Don’t stay there! Facing Kuhio- very noisy! Ask for a quieter room opposite the pool. Tiny reception area. You had to get a key to use the only one toilet outside in the pool area. The poolside pizza cafe sells 30” pizzas for $US30 at dinner time and you can bring your own wine/beer from the nearby ABC/liquor stores. Free tea/coffee iced water in the lobby. Our room was tiny, with a small double bed and a huge fridge/freezer, TV, coffee percolator, 2 hot plates, microwave, cutlery & crockery. Tiny ants appeared on the chest of drawers. Noisy, old, dirty, wall air conditioner, so bad we had to turn it off at night time, so we could sleep- but the noise from outside was deafening! The sliding door curtains to the tiny balcony were mouldy on the outside. Ended up with a migraine! The air-con unit leaked water outside the room, which then somehow seeped back into the carpet, which was wet & smelt of mould! The management sent an old guy who could barely speak English, with some insect spray for the ants, who then said that we must have kept the sliding door open! We could only check in at 3pm. Tiny pool and spa outside. I would not recommend you stay there, hotel needs a total overhaul! We had no choice since it was part of the Carnival Legend cruise from Sydney-Honolulu deal. Thank heavens we only had to stay one and a half nights.

This hotel is just off the same strip of hotels in Waikiki. Hotel is adequate and suits the price charged for the accommodation. Rooms a big and we had two rooms. One with queen bed and main room with 2 single beds. Great kitchenette with very large fridge, full stove and microwave. Road is very busy outside and a fair bit of traffic noise in the rooms but didn't stop us from sleeping. The pool area is beautiful and very private. Hotel staff were lovely and very helpful. We didn't get to try the breakfast as we had a very early flight and left at 3.30am. Hotel arrange a taxi for us. Would definitely stay here again for a short stay. Not complaints really.

Loved this place very central to all amenities lovely friendly and helpful staff will definitely go back and stay. The pool and the spa were helpful when the beach was to packed. Very close to public transport helpful organising tours of the Hawaiian islands

Super close to beach, shopping strip and great eating places. No need to take beach equipment ie lilos, blow up tubes they can be purchased cheaply at the ABC stores. Suggest booking online to some eating places - Cheesecake factory, Dukes and Tiki Bar and grill, all excellent places to eat. If you like shopping outlets is the way to go. Is a little pricey to get there by taxi, lots of shuttle around the $18US per head.

We stayed at the aqua Bamboo the start of March and had a one bedroom suite with kitchen. After 2 nights on Level 6 we could not sleep due to the noise.Early morning we went to the lobby and asked if we could be moved to the pool side and Fe advised that the suites are on Kuhio Avenue.She was fantastic and we had been moved to Level 12 and we finally got some much needed rest that night.We loved the hotel but the street noise on the lower levels is unbearable.

We travelled with a group of 32 people to Hawaii and stayed 3 nights at the Aqua Bamboo. Although not a 5 star hotel it was a pleasant stay. The staff was very helpful and the location was a short walk to Waikiki beach. Having the ability to make breakfast in the room was a plus. We would recommend this hotel to the budget conscious travellers.

This place is located only few minutes from Waikiki Beach. There is bus stop just across the road. Rooms are well equipped with nice view. The staff is very nice and helpful. There is pool with salty water outside with nice garden seats. Coffee is free of charge! I do recommend this place.

I'm sure you have read many reviews describing the physical attributes of the hotel and its location. But the thing that makes this a special hotel is the staff...EVERYONE of them are very nice people and make you feel like you are staying with friends. In particular I would like to mention Kimari, Kavana, Dylan, and Asia (Aja?)...So nice! My last night while I was waiting for airport shuttle I had a nice talk with Asia (is that spelled correctly?) and Dylan......I was seriously sad to say goodbye to both of them. Such caring people!The staff makes you feel well taken care of at this hotel and that's why I will choose the Bamboo again when I return!

We returned again this year.It was very relaxing for the most part. We enjoyed the garden and the pool area. This is like coming home. The staff was very helpful if you had a problem.Very pleasant to talk to

I went back to Waikiki because it is my favorite place to vacation and get away. The weather is great, humidity is perfect and helps me breath easier, and the people at the Aqua Bamboo are always happy and helpful. I like to stay on the 12th floor, 1201, because it is quiet and has a great view of the ocean and has two balconies, they call them lanais. I found them very relaxing in the morning drinking coffee and reading the free newspaper they provide, in the evening watching the sunset, and relaxing reading a book before bed. Everything in Waikiki is within walking distance because it is so centrally located. In fact, there is an Alamo car rental place less than a block away with we used to go to the North Shore on the other side of the island and visit all the great places in between. All I know is that I had such a fun and fantastic time, I can't wait to go back.

We were on the 11th floor and arrived 12.30am so very late arrival. We were upgraded to a room with a small kitchen and 3 balconies as a corner room. Room clean and comfortable. Staff for all visit very helpful and only 1 complaint we had a lot of night time noise eg rubbish being picked up early morning in street and not sure on other noise even from 11th floor, but after 1st night it didn't seem so bad maybe accustomised ourselves to it. I think most hotels in same area would be same and clean ups done early hours of morning better than during busy day with lots of tourists. Position so close to beach, buses tourists bookings etc etc SO WOULD RECCOMMEND and price pretty good considering the position.

I read a couple of reviews before booking this hotel. One thing that was repeated over and over was an excellent customer service. It really makes a difference. Here is an example. When I was borrowing a beach towel, an old couple came down. They wanted to warn staff members that a handle came off in the bathroom. They were not angry, apparently they fixed it, just wanted the staff members to know. The service was so good that if something did not work out as expected, you just don't get angry. Hotel is old but clean. No central AC, so it was noisy. Parking is really tight. It is in a central location close to the beach. For the price you pay, I recommend this place.

We had a nice 2 night stay at Bamboo. While the rooms are a bit dated, the location and staff can't be beat. The front desk employees were incredibly helpful and kind. We enjoyed Bamboozle on Thursday night by the pool, and took quick walks to the beach and dinner both days.

We stayed at Aqua Bamboo for 4 nights , walking distance of the beach and many shops in the immediate area . The room was clean , the beds are a little small since there were 2 in our room , but we managed to sleep comfortably in them . We did not try the pool or the pizzeria in the back , but sitting out there was very nice and calm with a nice looking waterfall behind the pool . Staff at the front desk was very nice during check in and said hello whenever we passed . Overall a very nice stay , would definitely stay again !

Helpful, knowledgeable and friendly staff up to and including the security personnel made for a pleasant stay at the Aqua Bamboo, The room was of a good size, with kitchen facilities, queen size bed in the master bedroom and two day beds in the other.Location wise, you're practically on the beaches doorstep and close to the majority of the nightlife up and down the main streets. buses are constant if you don't plan on driving. Take a tip and head down to Leonard's Bakery for some delicious Malasada'sTo sum up, would i return to the Aqua Bamboo?...the answer is yes!
user_name:
rj m
New York City, New York

review_body: If you don't know where to stay in Waikiki, Aqua Bamboo Hotel is the best one.. its location is perfect to move around to all island, as you got Bus stop in front of it..we did 4 pass day bus for 34 dollars, is worth it if you wants to see around at lot. The beach is only 2 minutes walk, my favourite one is Kuhio beach protect by wall, is like natural swimming pool ideal for kids, also you got lots restaurants and takeaway M m Bbq, very cheap and very tasty.. when we arrived we have been offer free upgrade as we mentioned that it was our honeymoon, the room very spacious and comfortable, feel like more than 3 stars.. and the service is impeccable.. every Thursday there is free cocktails and nibbles by the swimming pool, don't miss it..well if i had chance to go back, i will definitely choose Aqua Bamboo again...❤️

This place is a great hotel for people who want to be in the heart of Waikiki. We had everything you needed from a kitchen to wifi. It was a 200m walk to the main beach and shops. It offers a bus for free to ala Moana as well. The day we left our transfer never showed up and Dan the night manager was there to assist us and helped ring around. It's a bit noisy on the side we were on but I didn't really care since I wanted to be up early doing things anyway. Thanks for the hospitality aqua bamboo

I stayed here two years ago and raved about the experience. Now, on my second stay I have noticed a few not so nice things about the place - that the rooms are all not created equal ( some are in better condition than others), that the staff ( while nice) can give out wrong information, and that the entire property is looking a bit dog eared and worn down. It's still a convenient and decent place to stay but for the price, is it worth it? Great pizza place at the back though...Lovin Oven.

Love this place we were welcomed back for our fourth visit to this amazing hotel. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite on the 9th floor it was clean and very spacious. The hotel is located close to the beach and lots of great restaurants, love the free shuttle to ala moana shopping centre. A big shout out to all the staff who do an amazing job making our stay memorable especially Nicole. I like that it is a smaller hotel so the staff get to know you and I have met some wonderful friends who like to stay here to. Would definitely recommend this hotel to stay at.

This was our first visit to the Aqua Bamboo and we had excellent, friendly service throughout our stay. The location is perfect- close to shopping, great restaurants, and of course an easy short walk to the beach, and Kapiolani park. Our room, 807, was beautiful, and just had a refreshing, new reno/update. It was very comfortable, and unique, with beautiful furnishings. The kitchen was perfect for us, and our needs.The pool and area is so lovely, and is like an oasis with gorgeous plants and trees.We would definately stay here again.

Great staff and mangement love you all there so much.Already booked for next year and counting the days to go by.I would tell everybody who reads this this Aqua Bamboo is one of the best places to stay you get treated by staff very special.We were there Jan8/17 and this is our 5th year at this Hotel,close to beach, shuttle close to the hotel and many more stuff that they include which a lot of hotels that don;t offer.Try it you will be very surprized

We made a return visit for a week in December 2016 to the beautiful Aqua Bamboo Hotel.The Aqua Bamboo Waikiki is one of the few mid-priced hotels in Waikiki which we have found to have the required level of safety and security for guests. The main doors to Aqua Bamboo lock at around 10.00pm each night and do not unlock until around 6.30am each morning. Guests or people wishing to visit therefore must have a working Hotel access card which they must swipe outside the main doors to get in. There is a night front desk staff member as well as a night security guard outside the main doors guests.Being only a 5 minute short walk from Waikiki beach, the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki could not be in a better position. You are off the main drag and busyness of Kalakuaua Avenue and this, we have found, to be more appealing and cheaper than staying in some of the 5 star Hotels on Waikiki Beach such as the Moana Surfrider, Royal Hawaiian Hotel, etc.There is a well stocked ABC shop one street corner away which opens at 6.30am every morning, so visitors do not have to pay more say at The Pantry which is further down Kuhio Avenue and more crowded to shop in.The Bus is still only USD 2.50 per person and, depending upon the length of your excursion for the day, you can ask the driver for a Transfer ticket (usually they hand these out automatically) which last approximately 2 hours. This means that you can say go by bus to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and back within 2 hours or so (the bus drivers are usually fairly lenient on accepting beyond the 2 hours same day transfer ticket) for USD 5.00 per person - even around the island within the 2 or so hours grace period. You can also walk - takes a leisurely 30 minutes to Ala Moana Shopping Center - if you choose, as we often do providing it is not too hot.In terms of dining and recreational facilities close to Aqua Bamboo Waikiki, there are a wide variety of things to do so you will never be bored in this beautiful God-given paradise that is Hawaii.The front desk staff at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki go out of their way to ensure a very happy and safe stay for every guest. We would particularly like to mention and thank Lokahi, Zenie, Fe and Aja who are such polite, friendly and helpful staff. Aqua Bamboo Waikiki Management and guests alike are very lucky to have them. The housekeeping staff, as on our many return visits to Aqua Bamboo Waikiki, are excellent ensuring that each room is cleaned thoroughly and bathroom supplies are replenished.There is even a special 'Bamboozle' evening put on by Aqua Bamboo Waikiki staff, every Thursday afternoon from 4.30pm to around 6.00pm. This is a great way of meeting fellow guests by the pool/spa whilst enjoying a Hawaiian cocktail, some food and entertainment from a local artist.In terms of room requests, we recommend rooms above Level 5 (more peaceful) with an 01 at the end of the 3 digit room number. These rooms usually have ocean and hotels views, and have generous sized decks for reading, soaking up the sun /views, etc. For those visitors who want lighter rooms with better mirrors, request a room ending in a 10 above Level 5 (e.g. 710).Thank you, Mahalo and Aloha until we return again to the beautiful Aqua Bamboo Waikiki Hotel.Janet and Richard

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 4 nights, booked through AirBnB. it's located on Kuhio drive, so 3 minutes walk from the Duke Statue side of the beach, an ABC store, Alamo Car rental, EggsnThings etc. It's a smaller establishment, great little pool area in an awesome location. Rooms are self contained and comes with balcony. Clean, neat and tidy, perfect for short or long stay

we rented air bnb condo unit. pool area was small and old. the hot tub held two or three people and the same large woman occupied the tub most of our week. the location is excellent, 1 blk to the busy beach of Waikiki. request a room facing west, not on kuhio which is very loud and nosiy with the buses running all night. The lanai was so tiny, it was unusable. For $200 / nite, i should have stayed at outrigger east or aston sunset.

Great hotel very clean& nice accommodations! Close to the beach ! Very nice staff too ! I would stay here again ! We got early check in due that our ship arrived @9am & the manager went out of his way to get us in & even up graded our room ! Beautiful room & very clean !

My partner and I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo, Waikiki in the summer of 2016 to attend a wedding. A large number of guests also stayed here. The staff went above and beyond to cater to our needs and were genuinely happy to help and have small talk with us. The location is two minutes walk from Waikiki beach and another 10 minutes walk from what I'll call 'Downtown Waikiki'. The only negative would be the AC unit sounds like a jet engine, and be aware of the mandatory hospitality fee. It includes beach towels, beach chairs, local shuttle bus, etc.I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here in a private condo on the 5th room. The hotel is very well maintained. The pool area was very quiet and had plenty of comfortable chairs. Hotel provides guests small beach chairs, rafts, beach towels, etc. We never had to wait for an elevator. There is some street noise at night but we ran the air conditioner and didn't hear it. Great location, easy block away from the beach. Would stay here again.

We booked a one bedroom suite for our family of four. There were two twin beds in the entry room along with a full kitchen, and a double bed in the bedroom. It wasn't spacious, but was clean, comfortable, very charming, fantastic location just blocks from the beach and the open air market, and the price was very reasonable for Waikiki. There's a small pool with lovely landscaping. The service was very warm and friendly. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Stayed for 6 nights at the Bamboo and really enjoyed the location. It is a 3 minute walk to the beach, close to different shops and venues. Tour pick ups are just around and are well organised.The room was comfortable and had a large queen bed, bathroom was a little dated with the shower over the bath.The swimming pool area was neat and tidy and it maintained each day.The staff were helpful without being overly excited.It is a 3 star hotel so don't expect perfection but any day in Waikiki is a great day
user_name:
Arn135
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

review_body: This is the only hotel I stay at when going to Hawaii. Been there 4 times so that says something if I keep coming back. I like the location- 2 blocks from the beach and around the corner from some good restaurants. They have a nice pool and hot tub, valet parking, and a few other basic amenities. I recently stayed there and by calling the hotel directly, we got an upgraded suite for the price of a basic room. Stayed on the 9th floor and had a huge patio with grill to ourselves, 2 mini fridges, a microwave and a stove. So, call reservations directly as opposed to going on those so called price slashing sites. This is a noisy place though and I have stayed on 4 different floors. You are on a busy street with bus traffic and garbage trucks loud enough to wake my toddler even all the way up to the higher floors. So if you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs! Hawaii is expensive and even some of the cheaper hotels have a lot of tax. This place included with a daily hospitality fee of 18.00 and a "transient accommodation fee" of 20.00. Whether you use valet or park yourself at the garage next door, it's 25.00 a night. So, expect to spend at least 50.00 more a day than just the room fee. All in all, for 10 days, using daily valet, we paid close to 3,000 dollars for our stay. I don't remember it being that expensive any of the other trips, so we may have to start saving sooner or figure something out for next time.I would stay here again though ....

Aloha, Stayed in May 2014 in a 1 bedroom suite, with a well appointed kitchen. Room was clean, beds comfortable, there was a lot of street noise from Kuhio ave, but bearable. The pool area and the Lovin oven restaurant was good and not too crowded. Free cold drinks in the foyer area and use of beach chairs. Now for the but... I left the hotel to do some sightseeing, 1 of the hotel bellman named Raymond assumed that we had all had gone sightseeing, but my wife and kids stayed in the pool area. My wife returned to our room to hear rustling of shopping bags in the main bedroom, she thought someone had broken in to our room. My wife went into the bedroom and was confronted by bellman "Raymond", he was standing near an open wardrobe where all our shopping bags were and the in room safe. Raymond made some poor excuse about washing on the balcony, and he was dropping off our departure gift (we still had 2 days before checkout). My wife told him we were not checking out and he should check his list, Raymond then said " I better wear my glasses next time" and left. My wife checked our belongings went and checked on the children, and then reported the incident to the front desk. They said that they will report this to the manager and she will be in contact. The next day my wife was asked by the front desk staff to write a statement of what occurred which she did straight away. The only correspondance we have received to date is an email from the area general manager, Kahealani Colon, the day after we had left Hawaii, saying that she agrees that this incident needed investigating and he would be in touch ina few days to advise the outcome of their investigations. My wife sent follow up emails to see what were the outcomes of their investigation.....radio silence, and we didn't ever actually get our departure gift. Up until this incident, our stay at the hotel was excellent, the front desk staff and the other bellmen we're helpful and friendly and we would have definitely revisit this hotel in the future. Very disappointed nobody from the hotel has contacted us inspite of the follow up emails. We have waited until now to post this review in case a response was received. Disappointed to have heard nothing further.....MahaloBTW I visited Waikiki December 16 and stay at another hotel (14 days) because of this incident

I was unable to get a room at the usual hotel chains. Apparently, there was a marathon the week I was there. Hence, I booked one night here based on all the good reviews.I saw the pictures before coming here and kinda knew what I was going in for. But the pictures on TripAdvisor looked soo much better than in person. The room was dark but clean. It provided basic toiletries, a mini kitchen with lots of supplies, and a small balcony. If you're looking for a place that's close to the beach, the price here is reasonable. However, I saw a roach in the bathroom and it ruined my whole night. I was glad I only booked it for one night.All the staff there were very friendly and made sure we knew about the marathon, road closures, etc. They even gave me a Macy's discount pass!

Our family decided to spend a sunny Christmas vacation in Waikiki Hawaii. We were given a room on the second floor of the hotel, however the noise from the streets was bothersome and we requested a room change. The staff was friendly and immediately offered us a room with a bigger kitchen on the 7th floor. The pool in the hotel was a special treat---especially the hot tub. After a thrilling day of surfing, hanging out by the hotel pool was just what we needed. The hotel even has complimentary dvd rentals! Our stay at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki made our vacation that much more relaxing and enjoyable. We would definitely recommend it to friends and relatives.

Staying here a week before our island cruise. We arrived before check in. Our room was nkt quite ready and could either wait or leave our bags to explore. We waited, and spot on the time they menioned to us our room was ready. Room is clean and well maintained, nice start to our holiday.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for a total 5 nights at the the start and end of our Hawaiian holiday. The location is great just a few minutes walk to the chaos of Waikiki Beach. We had a room with a small kitchen which was perfect for our family. It was one of only a few hotels that I found with a queen bed and 2 singles that was suitable for a family with 2 teenagers. The price was very reasonable for Waikiki. There are many restaurants and a supermarket just down the street. It is a bit noisy at night with the traffic but we still slept well. Parking is limited so book in advance.Would stay there again.

It's right on the hear of Waikiki. Next door Alamo car rental and groceries right next if you are using Kitchenette. Walking distance to Waikiki. Staffs are great. They have free coffee and fruits. In hotel laundry is really helpful. You can get detergent and change from front desk. There are few cons .. bath room really need ventilation. And took with Kitchenette has a strange smell. Would be nice if they give room freshener.

Waikiki can be quite expensive, but the Bamboo is a great value. The staff are most welcoming to this small and intimate hotel and helpful with the normal inquiries. The rooms very nice and clean with adequate elbow room. Ours featured three balconies no less and a small galley kitchen with a table for two. The beach is a short and convenient two blocks away. This was our third time at the hotel, and we look forward to our next stay. Highly recommended.

Have just come back from a girls week away with my Mother and Sister. I was pleasantly surprised by how lovely this hotel was.We were upgraded to a suite with a large balcony and ended up with two double beds.Check in was at 3pm and our flight arrived at 6am! By 12pm we got a phone call to say our room was ready.The room was lovely and clean. There was plenty of room for the 3 of us and sitting on the balcony for breakfast over looking the mountains was beautiful or resting before bed with a nice breeze of a night was just as good.The beds were comfortable and I usually hate hotel pillows, but these ones were great (or I was just to tired after all the tours and shopping to notice??).We were on level 9 street facing (I had read it was really loud with street noise), we honestly didn't hear to much. Either we were so tired we slept through it or because it wasn't peak season??? Either way, we had no issue with street noise.The location of the hotel was great also. Two streets back from the beach and shopping strip and only one street back from where most of the tours pick up/drop off from. Everything was within easy walking distance.Unfortunately the weather wasn't all that great, so we didn't spend time at the pool. But it looked pretty. And there are so many wonderful restaurants around that we didn't eat at the hotel.The staff were lovely and Lydia from the tour desk was amazing booking our volcano tour on the Big Island for us prior to our arrival.The only thing I can say that I was disappointed in, was, when asking directions to places, we were never told about the trolley's we could catch and where to catch them from. We found out on our own and it did make life so much easier. For first timers to Waikiki and Hawaii in general, that information would have been great.All in all though, we really enjoyed our stay and we would stay at the Aqua Bamboo again.

A small hotel in Waikiki that offers a quiet environment and well situated. Close by, you have the only grocery store on Waikiki. A good thing considering that I had a kitchenette in my room. The bed was very comfortable. The closet offered spacious space and the kitchenette was fully equipped. I had a view on their nice pool that comes with a waterfall. Down at the pool area, you could have access to the BBQ, long chairs and tables. Vegetation made you feel far from the city.The lobby was very open and welcoming. There was access to fresh water and tea all day long.The staff was very helpful. I found it very special that when I got to my room on my last night, there was a letter for me along with a box of chocolate, to thank me for visiting the Aqua Bamboo.

Currently staying at aqua bamboo. I find it conveniently located for all our tours, restaurants, and walking distance to the beach. I like that I can take one elevator to go from my room to the parking garage which is below the hotel. Staff seems friendly and the rooms are clean. It has everything advertised. I am very happy, still have another five days here.

I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at this hotel. Before arriving a had read reviews about the property being old and dated and was somewhat concerned, but I kept my reservation since others people that I was traveling with were staying at this hotel as well and I wanted to stay with the group. I was traveling with my goddaughter and our flight was delayed and I called the hotel to let them know so they would not release our room to someone else. The attendant I spoke with was very nice and assured me that our reservation was secure. When we arrived at the hotel after midnight, the front desk clerk was extremely nice. He greeted me by name before I even gave it to him... you must be Mrs. ___ he said, we've been expecting you. He then went on to say I have good news for you...you have been upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. He checked us in quickly and gave information about complimentary morning services. When we got to the room it was very clean. I did find the hotel to be a little dated but this was actually a good thing as it gave the facility and our room a very appealing vintage look. On the table by the bed was a personalized welcome letter that I was very pleased to find. I appreciated the kitchenette area as even though we didn't cook anything the amenities were useful for heating and handling food items we had purchased. The beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed the robes and our view from the balcony as these amenities helped with relaxation. As a part of my reservation I received a delicious complimentary scone from a quaint little muffin shop next to the hotel. There were also several little stores and shops right next to the hotel that were very convenient. The pool area was very pretty and the lobby was nice and clean. The staff was very nice and accommodating. I would stay here again.

My wife and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon in September 2016. The rooms were decent, I do not have many complaints about them, however, they really screwed me over when they damaged my rental car during the stay. Upon checking out, valet the rear bumper on our rental car but did not tell us. Since the valet loaded our bags we did not see the dent until we got to the airport. The rental agency charged us for the damage, and even though I filed a claim with the Aqua Bamboo they denied it because we didn’t report the damage on site. They have sleazy kids working the valet, beware. Emails to customer service regarding the valet damage fell of deaf ears.That wasn’t the only issue. The hot tub was broken the entire time we were there. A lot of time there was no one at the front desk when we went down to get towels or speak to someone. They charge an $18 “resort fee” for no reason, it’s a hotel with a pool, that doesn’t even have a working hot tub. AVOID. Much better options in Waikiki.

This hotel was great! I wasn't expecting too much since the price was so reasonable but I was blown away! It was very close to the beach, about a 5 minute walk. The room was great and the staff was incredible! Very friendly and helpful! The little pizza place in the courtyard is great as well! I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki!

We got to the hotel past midnight and we were told we'd be in Room 309. I had asked my travel agent to request a higher floor since there was supposed to be some construction going on. The front desk fellow, who was definitely gruff, said that my travel agent didn't make the request and that there were no other rooms available anyway. So we took the key. Slept and got up in the morning to go out onto our balcony which was totally screened by bamboo. Honestly, we couldn't see anything. All we heard was the noise of construction from the building being renovated which was right across from us. No natural light was coming into the room and we had to have lights on. Had a busy day that day and following day. Our next day was a free one and my husband and I decided we didn't want to stay there any longer unless we had a room change. I had NEVER asked for a change of room in a hotel before but I was determined on this request (demand). I was very polite and when I explained the problem to the front desk, the gentleman was very accommodating about changing our room. We were only moved up 2 floors -- actually was just above the building being renovated -- but we saw palm trees, sunshine and other hotels... We were just thrilled with the room change and used the balcony quite often during our stay. We could even talk to one another since we were above the construction.Otherwise, our stay was great. Room was clean and comfortable bed and we had kitchen facilities. Grocery store was just a few minutes away. All the other staff that we dealt with at the hotel were fabulous.Pool was very nice. Location was great. Five minute walk to the beach and lots of shopping nearby -- food, souvenirs stores, restaurants...Upon departing, my husband and I said we would not hesitate to stay at that hotel again so I did end up giving it 4 Stars. Had we not gotten a room change, my review would've been a 1 star.

Beautiful, relaxing, outdoor swimming pool area surrounded by palm trees. reasonable rent, units with full kitchen, or just bedroom with breakfast facilities. Very enjoyableBuilding itself is a little old, but kept clean. Coffee and lemon water on the house all dayFree WiFi and Whats App. Friendly reception. Family style atmosphere

This hotel tries to be a designer hotel. It is not as the room and lobby have strange and terrible smells; probably backed up toilet sewage.Read other Poor and Terrible reviews First.Swimming pool is terribly situated. It barely gets any daytime sunlight. So if you want to sit by the pool forget it about it as this swimming area is useless as the hotel blocks all the sunshine that would hit the swimming area.This hotel is on Kuhio Avenue and not set back away from the street. You will hear the weekend traffic till 2:30 A.M. in the morning.Other hotels on Kuhio are set back further from the street and are larger. Meaning other hotels have quiet and loud sides depending on your preference.This hotel is too small to have that preference so it is always noisy !Better off staying at an Aston or Outrigger Hotel as these 2 chains have been in Hawaii longer and are much better hotels at the same costs.Read more reviews and check other hotel chains prices. We would never stay here again even if it were $60 or less a night !

Pros: Central location that's midway between Diamond Head and Beach Walk. Excellent staff were friendly and helpful. Suite with kitchette was large and spacious. Corner suite with lots of light during the day. Room was clean. Free hourly shuttle to the mall. Comfy beds. Room had double sink, a shower stall, and a bathtub. Kitchen had all the amenities needed. Two TV'S in the room - one in living area, one in bedroom area. Free DVD rental downstairs in lobby. Two blocks from the udon place and Nordstrom rack/Saks. Can arrange shuttle to airport for $14 per person (taxi one way would be about $40 one way). Free mini pineapple from next door when you check in. Cons: Pool is small. Decor is a bit dated. Sliding door in room either had gaps or there's a vortex outside the room (not street facing) because you can hear the wind loudly all night. Bedroom area could use more lighting. No ceiling or floor lamps, just one table lamp. Kinda dark at night.

We stayed 3 nights on the 10th floor and had an awesome view from the balcony. The room had everything you need including beach equipment, outdoor chairs and cooking equipment.The BBQ near the pool was a great addition and sitting around the pool was very relaxing. We will certainly be returning.

Perfect rental. Everything you need to have a super bomb trip in Waikiki. Easy walking to everywhere, great building with excellent pool situation for kids. Easy parking. Even an oven for baking pizza. What more could you want?

This was our second stay at the Aqua Bamboo and as usual our room was immaculate and the staff bend over backwards to look after you.We stayed 5 nights in a kitchenette room these rooms are well appointed and great value.We would not consider staying anywhere else when next we visit.

I stayed for 3 nights and had a fantabulous experience!! Location is accessible to everything, and just a block away from the beach. The hotel's security and privacy is great for solo travellers. The pool is lovely and not crowded. Definitely a home away from home!!!I am looking forward to coming back with my family!! Mahalo

i first stayed at this hotel on my first trip to honolulu and loved it enough to choose to stay here again. A few of the changes include - the spa has been taken over by a pizza restaurant where the pizza's are just perfect. The wifi which could only be used has been sorted and you can now access wifi in everyroom of the hotel and pool area. Other than those, it felt like i was right back at home. We arrived super early into honolulu (6am) and the hotel had been booked out fully the day before we stayed. We were advised from the offset that the hotel could and would hold our luggage and that while they couldn't guarantee that they could organise any early check in for us, they told us to arrive back earlier than the time we would have been due to stay (check in at 3pm). They also gave us the opportunity to change clothing and get refreshed before we ventured out again. The rooms were well kept and whilst not the most modern, they were most definitely comfortable. The hotel had amenities that actually worked and it was properly maintained. The lobby area was clean and large enough to accommodate groups waiting to check in and out; the pool and adjoining jacuzzi are the stars of the courtyard and they make for a great and tranquil time. The hotel itself is less than a 5 minute walk away from the hustle bustle of Kalakaua Avenue where the beach and famous shopping strip is. it's the perfect location to just get away from the business of waikiki and to relax. The staff are super accommodating and are probably the most patient and customer focused you could ask for - from those who work in the Lobby to house keeping and maintenance. I've been recommending this place for years and will probably do so for years based on this experience. A major thankyou to each and every person who helped us and who we dealt with in our dealings during our stay. To the management that read this, you should be proud of your team because, because of them, people will return. :)stayed - sep/oct

Right from the start, this hotel and its staff impressed. We arrived early and were unable to check in right away, but were given keys to use a bathroom to freshen up and offered a drink and a piece of fruit. When we did check in, we were upgraded to suite on the top floor and given champagne and chocolates for my birthday. The rooms were very well kept and the housekeeping staff were lovely. The pool area is very tranquil and lush. Thanks for a great stay, we will recommend the Aqua Bamboo to family and friends.

The Aqua Bamboo, is a good priced holiday base. Not the most modern, but ideal to start an adventure. Room is adequate.The staff were helpful and informative.If you are a person that needs a cup of tea first thing, don't go here as there is no Kettle, but they do provide a coffee perculator. The view from the bedroom was a brick wall, and a passageway, so not that great but as mentioned I was not there for the Hotel environment .Over all adequate place to start a holiday adventure

we spent 2 days at bamboos, warm welcome, clean & nice big room w/kitchen, a/c & fan working perfect. could sleep at night w/open window/terrace door > only getting noisy in the morning when traffic starts. nice pool (one cold, one warm jacuzzi pool) at the courtyard for relaxing, very close to the beach & shopping area( less than 5' to walk)

Great location , one street back from the beach, extremely attentive staff, very comfortable rooms , we had a king size bed that was as good as ours at home, importantly the pillows were vert nice. Small kitchen for cups of coffee and breakfast.Local shop next door for beverages at local prices, the " lovin oven " resteraunt by the pool served the best pizzas, all in all highly recommend the hotel and next time I am back I w I'll be stealing here .

We chose Aqua bamboo for our family holiday and we weren't disappointed. The room (we got the 2 bedroom) was large and the room had all the amenities you could need and more! Full size oven, microwave, fridge, coffee maker (no kettle though??) PlayStation, tv etc. There was a balcony for each bedroom. We were on the street side of the hotel and yes the was a fair amount of noise, but we filled up our days so much that sleeping was not a problem! It would have been nice to have a tv in both rooms. All the staff we encountered were lovely.The shuttle bus was very handy.The pool area a great stop off after a big day shopping. And the location was just the best! Right smack bang in the middle of everything. The quickest walk to the beach (hotel lends out beach gear too!!), so many places to eat and shop nearby. We were very happy with our choice :)

We had to book in here because of an error in our booking elsewhere. We were pleasantly surprised with a lovely clean room overlooking the pool with two balconies. The well appointed kitchenette with full size refrigerator and stove as well as a microwave. The pool area was lovely with swaying palms and of course bamboo. Staff were accommodating and friendly and couldn't do enough for us. The hotel is a little old and probably needs a Reno in the near future However if usual place which is undergoing renovations, also renovates its prices, we will return here for a much longer stay. It is better appointed, has a better pool but is further from the beach. Have no hesitation in recommending this hotel Thanks everyone

This hotel is only a block away from Waikiki Beach. Our room had a small kitchenette which made grabbing a small breakfast or quick sandwich for lunch very easy. A bus stop was also close to the hotel making using public transit very easy.

Advantages:- Central location (5min walking from Waikiki beach - not the best beach of Hawaii at all but very famous)- Kind employees- Small kitchen (if you manage to find some fresh food...)Disadvantages:- Needs to be renovated- Moldy smell- No sound isolation at all: if you have a chamber close to the road, you will hear cars passing as if you were sleeping on the roadside- Very noisy climatisation ; you cannot sleep without earplugs- Rooms are dark- Orange stains in bathroom- Bug traps under the bathroom sink- Expensive- Honolulu (the worst part of our trip)

Stayed 11 days. 9 days before cruise on Pride of America and 2 days after. On arrival first time room was not as good as we expected. The front reception happily changed us to a larger room overlooking the pool. When we came back from our cruise the same room was given to us which we appreciated. The hotel is quite old but the rooms were clean and tidy. Air conditioner was very noisy. The location is about a 2 minute walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. There is a great pizza restaurant beside the pool. Also close to small supermaket and of course many ABC shops. Free shuttle to major shopping centre. Also on bus route. Good value for money as Waikiki seems very expensive. Resort fee was $US18 per day. When booking make sure you have all fees and taxes included before committing.

This was our second time staying here, 2 weeks +, and once again we weren't disappointed.Love the location being a short 4-5 minute walk to the main shops/restaurants and Waikiki beach. The room was clean although a little dated but at the price/location it is unmatched. The pool/spa area is beautiful/clean. Our 10month old had the time of his life climbing up the waterfall area at the pool - it's unlike any other pools you see around Waikiki.The staff at reception were so friendly and helpful - always welcoming you and having a chat which made the holiday experience all that much better.The rooms need to have the air conditioners upgraded as they are too small and noisy - split units would be much better. Everything else we loved.Request a pool facing room - highest level if you want minimal street noise for those morning sleepins!

Good location and nice staff. Loved the pool area and the specialty coffee machine in the lobby. Also had a filtered water machine. We found our room a little small and when they heard, they offered to move us to a bigger room right away.

1. Hotel is within 2 blocks of beach2. Rooms are older and somewhat dated, had some maintenance issues.3. Small outdoor pool and hot tub in back made for a nice quiet place to relax4. Staff at front desk, hotel employees, housekeeping staff all friendly and helpful5. Air conditioning needs to be on all day to keep room cool, but very loud. Need to keep it off at night or noise may keep you awake. Spent most time at hotel either by the pool or in the lobby.6. Close to beach, transportation, shops, and restaurants7. Recommend for budget conscious travellers as hotel is reasonably priced but with little frills.

My husband and I stayed 8 nights recently it's rated 3 stars which I think is fair. It's perfect if you want short walk to beach and shopping . The staff are friendly ,rooms clean but not as good as other place's Iv stayed and the pool could be cleaner but we went to the beach everyday so that didn't bother us.

The apartment is comfortable, well equiped, in a good position, near the beach and the shops. Beach towels available at the reception and can be changed every day. Parking is also available at the near public parking. We were here for four days we had a very good time.

Great Hotel for a reasonable price just seconds away from Waikiki Beach. Rooms rather small, but totally OK if you've ever been in NY hotel rooms.Modern, clean and cosy.Comfortable parking at the hotel next door. Fresh beach towels every day.Definitely our #1 choice for our next trip.

Older hotel, I was given a corner room with 2 balconies and nice ocean view obstructed in part by Hyatt towers. Room was rather small with a mini kitchenette. AC never got to the required temperature, my estimation the lowest you can get is 70 F. But room looked modern and in a good condition. The location is the best possible, 5 min walking to the beach, grocery store or shopping. Overall would recommend, as room was better than in surrounding hotels of similar class I visited.

We stayed in a one bedroom with a kitchenette on the top floor (12th) for our first visit to Hawaii. Whilst the hotel is dated, the room was clean. The kitchenette was very tiny, but it was adequate for our stay as we weren't planning on cooking everyday. The staff were very attentive and helpful. The concierge was helpful booking us a trip to a Luau. We also arrived on a Thursday in time for the hotels free reception by the pool, with a lovely cocktail, snacks and a lei making demonstration which was complimentary. There was a resort fee but I believe most hotels in the area are charging this. Ours was quite reasonable in comparison to other hotels and covered wifi, unlimited dvd rental, newspaper, beach towels, shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre. The hotel was only a couple of blocks from the beach. This hotel had everything we needed and we were happy with our stay.

Just back after a 10 night stay, my girlfriend and I enjoyed the hotel, the location was great, staff friendly. For what we expected, we got. I thought it was a very good 3 star plus hotel. A nice pool area, rooms serviced every day, air conditioning. Would go back.
user_name:
Struan B
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: Everything is just perfect - ly off-key. A room, reserved two months in advance, is not available. But after a dramatic pause, a receptionist offers you a suite instead.Possibly more luxurious - I’ll take their word for it. But instead of the promised ocean view you get a spectacular overlook of a service area. And most importantly, instead of the promised full kitchen, there is only a tiny kitchenette in a nook. But at least we got a counter-top stove (used as a counter for the lack of space), and a fridge - no, two of them! Two tiny cold bars, tucked in different rooms and working like every cold bar in an economy-priced hotel.OK - room itself (because it is definitely a room, not a suite - a pull-off divider does not qualify as a door). Panoramic windows - oh yeah, but so fingerprinted, it makes me think of a conserved crime scene; but again, it is no stickier than the rest of the furniture, so it might be part of decor; speaking of which - fabulous three balconies! Unfortunately, only one opens (so if you want to air the room - forget it). But the access to that one (accidentally with the view of the service area) is blocked by a huge bed. So to get out, you need to go through the obstacle course. I am looking at it not as discrimination by fitness level, but a free gym included in the package. Naturally the bed closest to the only chance to step outside, is broken by those unfortunate ones who are not fit enough to jump its ample queen size, and bolted to the floor.All in all, we felt on a quest, making do with counterintuitive appliances and electric sockets always just a trifle out of reach. Determined not to let anything spoil our vacation, I compliment the designers and maintenance staff for making our stay so challenging and refreshing (except for the bed sheets, not changed once in 9 days). But price for this attraction and the quality of the service provided just do not coincide in my mind.Oh yeah, the parking, for which you need no reservation. There is parking - $25 a day. WHEN available.

traveled in May and enjoyed our stay at the aqua bamboo! the location was just perfect as it was not on waikiki but away from the hustle and bustle. was on the third floor and construction was going on at that time with the garden hotel in the front, it made it noisy but we did not mind as we were out most days. food was so readily available around the corner. the beach was like a 10min walk so location was just perfect!

Perfect location at the hart of Waikiki just 50m to the beach. We had a One Bedroom Suite with Full Kitchen. It was perfect for us. We could make our own breakfast before going out exploring Oahu. The rooms are clean, good service and the staff helpful. The small pool is great after a trip on the road or to Waikiki beach. I can highly recommend Aqua Bamboo.

I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo due to its close proximity to the beach and its great price! If you're looking for a great deal with amazing staff, look no further :) Dylan was an awesome host, he made sure we had everything we needed and he was very friendly! We took a lei making class with him during the hotel happy hour where they had free drinks and snacks at the pool, which was so pleasant. It was so nice of the hotel to personally write a letter to us welcoming us to Honolulu and also gave us free pineapple juice upon arrival. Upon leaving, they gave us a free box of macadamia nuts. The room itself was quaint, not big but not too small. They left orchids everywhere in the room and I thought that was quite welcoming. Not the newest and nicest things but it was fine. It did have 2 balconies though, which was really beautiful to wake up to! We really liked the location because it was near lots of restaurants and the beach. Definitely would come here again!

I recently stayed at The Aqua Bamboo Hotel with over 30 members of my sporting club - no not the noisy football kind of club. The hotel went out of their way to accomodate such a large group and was in a very convenient location just a couple of blocks back from the tourist hub of Waikiki. The rooms were generous in size with large kitchens featuring full size stove and oven, microwave and larger fridge. The staff were very helpful in every way. The only shared complaint from our group was rooms facing Kuhio St. were noisy and the air con was old and very noisy as well. Overall I was very impressed and pleased with the accomodation.

I booked my Hawaii trip last minute and couldn't be happier with staying at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel in Wakiki. The rooms are spacious, cleaned to the highest level every single day and everyone in service has a genuine smile and desire to help and answer any questions that you have.I love to travel, but get nervous about things, such as where to go, how to get a cab, etc and the staff here answered all of my questions and I never felt like a wimp asking for it.If you're coming to Hawaii, stay here.

After reading previous trip advisor reviews we requested an upper level room. We were on the 11th floor street and this was great. Very limited street noise and our toddler had no trouble with day time sleeps.Short walk to the beach and shops.All staff very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and fresh.The bus stop was on the opposite side of the road so it was easy to get around if required. Food pantry (supermarket) was 2 blocks away.The washer and dryer came in handy located on 3 different floors for a few dollars. Reception sold laundry powder.I certainly recommend this hotel for families.

The service at this Hotel is amazing. The staff are gracious, patient & friendly and always approachable. No question was every a problem. The only flaw was the rooms. The Air Con was extremely loud and in our sons room it leaked. The fridge had no water jug for cold water and the kitchenette no kettle, or 'hot pot' as Americans call it. Very small and basic rooms when your bunking in with a 13 year old but needless to say the beds were quite comfy. I think a 3 star rating for the amenities is generous. The staff I would give a 4.5.

Enjoying our stay - great location, close access to beach, shopping and restaurants.Whilst the property is a little dated, rooms are clean, tidy and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Amenities are good with kitchenette in our room, laundry facilities located on several floors.Pizza Cafe by the pool, and their pizza is delicious!Looking forward to the remainder of our stay!

Well, lets' do the air conditioners first. Yes, they are noisy! But after two days I did't even notice them. Plus they take away the street noise in the morning to help you sleep in:) The staff here are ALL great! They treat you like you are their friends and make you feel very comfortable. The pool area is a unique setting and feels very Hawaiian. Loved it. The property is very close to the beach also...a nice bonus! The rooms are older, but nice. That's why the four rating.Would suggest to get a view of the pool if possible. But everyone wants that so don't get your hopes up:) When I first arrived I wasn't sure if I would go back there next time, but when I left I realized I definitely would book the Aqua Bamboo again!

Great location. Unfortunately we had a street facing room on the 5th floor and it was very noisy. Lots of street noise so you couldn't enjoy the balcony day or night. The air conditioning units in both rooms were also very noisy so you couldn't have them on at night.The Lovin' Oven pizza was excellent as was most of the staff and the couple of issues we had on check-in were attended to. Our small gift on checking out was appreciated.

This older hotel has only 12 floors, making it more welcome, attentive, and easy to get in and out of than a plain, overcrowded high-rise hotel. The decor and furnishings are perfectly adorned with bamboo and tropical plants. The room had plumeria blooms tucked in many places, which gave a very appreciated touch. The outdoor pool and garden area was absolutely beautiful; you really wouldn't know you are in the middle of the city. The plants and trees were tall, lush, and green, and I loved the waterfall leading into the pool. The service and staff were very friendly and helpful. So many little things about this hotel to mention that I adored and appreciated. I went to three islands in Hawaii, and this was by far my favorite hotel. All for a very reasonable price. If you find yourself in Honolulu/Waikiki, I highly recommend the Aqua Bamboo!

We stayed 3 nights at the Bamboo. The hotel is in a great location. Room was clean and had good amenities. It is an easy 2 minute walk to beach, cafes, restaurants and the busy centre of Waikiki. We had a tour booked - the tour pick ups are at the Sheraton which is a 1 minute walk. I would recommend this hotel if you are out and about and want a good clean place to stay.

We had a room with a fully equipped kitchen with two balconies, one with a sideview and the other poolside. It is centrally located near the beach, luxury row (shopping), and the zoo. There is also public transportation that will also take you anywhere you need to go. We had a late flight and for a reasonable fee we were aloud to get an evening check out.

Upon arrival, shown to our room, not appealing at all.Tap handles fell off, power point not working, could not connect to WIFI.Air conditioner very noisy.Complained to management, they agreed to move us.2nd Disappointment, room overlooked busy street so besides a noisy air con, we also had extreme traffic noise.Once again complained to management, obligingly they moved us again, success at last, unable to use aircon at night, due to noise, outlook much better, overlooked pool area.. Lokahi, at front desk very sympathetic to our needs.

When I arrived, I found that the room was nice, but overlooked a service area in the building right next door. I asked if another room was available - I was given a much upgraded suite. There was no problem and the front desk clerk was very amenable. The room overlooked Kuhio. It was noisy because Waikiki is noisy and busy at all hours. The kitchen area was really clean, and the appliances new. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows soft and squishy. The pool area is attractive and a quiet refuge off the street. Ask for a room above the fifth floor as the buildings next door on each side are cheek to jowl with the hotel. The location is a short 2 blocks to the Moana Surf Rider and thus to the central area of the beach. This is a pretty basic, older hotel that is comfortable, clean and well maintained, with reasonable prices. Unless I can afford to stay at the Royal Hawaiian on my next trip (!), I would definitely return.

We extended our holiday by one night and ended up staying at the Bamboo (we booked into the Aqua Pacific next door but they overbooked so put us up in the Bamboo).Although it was just my wife and I, were given a family room (twin room, separate double bedroom, kitchen) which was a nice surprise.However, the room was situated by the main room and it is very, very noisy. It is nigh on impossible to get any sleep beyond 6am and the windows are so thin you might as well sleep on the balcony. The aircon in the room was a very old thing and was also very loud (think broken sewing machine).We did venture into the pool, which was fine but too small to properly swim in. The hot tub was fun but it was switched off about 10 minutes in!The hotel also offers a free shuttle service to the Ala Moana shopping centre but it is a farce (drivers refused to pick up hotel guests on the way back). We reported this to the hotel and the $15 hotel charge was waived (although this was spent on bus fares for where the shuttle was supposed to take us anyway).Wifi worked fine and customer service at the hotel was good.Stayed June 2016.

We our a military family and stayed here on the TLA program for a week before heading to our next duty station. We enjoyed our stay very much. I have read many of the reviews of this hotel and sometimes I feel you just can't please some people. They are going to find something to complain about and they expect everything to be perfect. We lived on the island for 3 years and the cost of living is expensive. I understand that this hotel doesn't want to waste lobby space or hall space when real estate is so high in Hawaii. To get an idea of how high it is, we lived in a 700 sq foot apartment and paid $1750 in rent. The hotel is priced just right I feel for being in the heart of the city close to so much and 2 blocks from the beach. Yes there is street noise but what do you expect being in the city. If you don't want the city noise than don't stay in the city. The air conditioner is a normal sounding window unit. It sounds like a large fan. I enjoyed the sound of it because I am use to sleeping with a fan and it drowned out the street noise at night. The thank you chocolates at the end of our stay were a nice touch. We enjoyed the atmosphere of the pool and the lobby. We enjoyed being able to walk to the beach and many shops and restaurants. We enjoyed the lemon water in the lobby. We enjoyed being able to do our laundry on site. We enjoyed being able to cook in our kitchenette. We enjoyed the staff. We enjoyed the smell of the lobby and elevators. Was everything perfect....no, but I understand life isn't. Did the staff do everything to make our stay as perfect as it could be...yes and for that we are grateful. Thank you for a good experience and a great place to say bye to our home for the last 3 years. Mahalo ~

Great location, great staff, well serviced and we were made to feel very welcome.
