Some previous reviews have commented the "pool is small" - it's a small hotel and the pool is a great place to relax at the end of a busy day with a couple of drinks and we found it a great place to get away from the hustle of Waikiki.The air-con and traffic was a bit noisy but didn't really bother us.

The photos in the advertising are nothing like the "real" thing. So shabby. The age of the place would not have been a problem had the maintenance been kept up. Just awful. The curtains in our room were mended with black "dogtooth" thread on cream fabric. Air conditioner so loud we had to turn it off, and the "wet" smell in the whole building was off putting. My husband and I have travelled extensively and been in many types of hotels, old and new, luxurious and humble. But the smell and shabbiness of this hotel was not a good advertisement for the beautiful Hawaii. Attention to detail and cleanliness would make such a difference. We had a kitchenette. However, because of lack of ventilation, I would not have even tried cooking. So disappointing, but the beauty of the island was worth the time and effort.

We are a family of four with two teenage children. We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 10 days in May. What you see in the photos is what you get. The rooms are quite dated and could do with refurbishing. Air conditioning was extremely noisy there was no way you could have it on at night. The location was fantastic. We had a one bedroom unit on the 4th floor it was very small but we knew that when we booked. It was very noisy, the hotel is on a main thoroughfare into Waikiki so traffic noise is horrendous I suggest when booking ask for a pool facing room. The balcony was very small and the chair could only sit sideways so didn't use it much. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bus stop is right across the road and we used this most days, much cheaper than the hotel shuttle. We were charged USD $15 per day for incidentals, I found this was very expensive considering we used the shuttle to the Ala Moana Shopping centre only once. The pool area is very nice and our daughter spent a lot of time in the pool. The Lovin Oven Restaurant on site did great pizzas, at a cost of $30

My wife and I were in Hawaii for a friend's wedding, and most of the guests stayed at the Aqua Bamboo hotel. I have to start with our first night there. We had a terrible room with a strong mildew smell from damp carpets, a big cockroach lurking around the kitchen area, and the air con was noisy! This was on the 12th floor, and right next to the laundry room. It was not a good experience at all.So, we made a complaint to reception the next morning and requested for a room change. Aja was on duty at that time and she managed the issue extremely well. Immediately, she agreed to move us to another room, organized for a hotel porter to move our belongings for us, and gave us an upgrade. She was very apologetic, understanding and courteous in handling the matter. This new room was on the 10th floor. It was facing the pool, and we had some views of the ocean. More importantly, it was a big difference to the room we originally had. It was a lot more spacious, had a new air con, 2 balconies, no mildew smell nor damp carpets. The bathroom in both rooms however were the same - it was clean enough, but not refurbished in the way it was showing on their website. All in all, the new room was a lot more comfortable. We also had an opportunity to view some of the other rooms that our friends were staying in. Most of them complained about the noisy air con, but other than that, they had a comfortable stay. As for the bride and groom, they had a 1 bedroom suite with kitchenette so their room looked a lot newer. Location wise, Aqua Bamboo was very well located, only 2 blocks away from the beach. No complaints there at all. It was excellent.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Hawaii! The room switch at Aqua Bamboo made a big difference to the quality of our stay.

The Aqua Bamboo is an older property redesigned and fashioned into a comfortable boutique hotel. Just two blocks from Waikiki, in the midst of numerous restaurants and shops, this fourteen story hotel with a limited underground parking lot is very reasonably priced for Oahu. The hotel does charge a $15/ day resort fee that includes wifi and beach equipment. Rooms with kitchenettes have extra fees and include microwaves, refrigerators, two burner cooktops and all necessary kitchen equipment.The higher floors have fewer, bigger rooms I noticed after staying on the eleventh and then on the eighth floor. The air conditioner kept the room comfortable but was quite noisy. Staff are friendly and helpful. The lobby is small but nicely decorated with a tea and coffee service. A small pool with chaises, tables and chairs is available but the restaurant that adjoined the pool is now closed.

The lobby is lovely and sets an expectations of the rooms. The kitchennette in our room was great and the beds were comfy. However, the bathroom had red stains all up and down the walls of the shower and seemed very "murder-scene esc." The a/c also leaked onto our carpet and down the balcony door. The majority of the leak was thankfully outside. Hotel staff were kind and friendly. Location was great! Right by the food pantry and only 2 blocks from the beach. The stinky smoke shop next door was a downside though. Would definitely consider coming back!

A fantastic place to stay. Was put up on the twelfth floor. WOW great view with two balconies. Centrally located with everything within walking distance. Car rental next door so we went to the north shore one day. I can't wait to go back. I will definitely request the twelfth floor again!

Right in the center of Waikiki, close to the beach and all amenities, but hotel is old and rooms are noisy due to old air conditioning. Even with the more expensive rooms we had a very small double bed. The pool area is not very inviting, the pizzas are good though. Ok for a night before moving on to other islands.

We spent about a week at the Aqua Bamboo. We enjoyed our stay. The kitchenette was a great feature. The Managers Hour on Thursdays was also good featuring music, dancing and free food and drink! We had a courtyard facing room on level 9 which was lovely and we could see the pool and a little bit of the ocean! Aja was very helpful, so friendly and always remembered little things about our day that made us feel welcome. She is a star! There is a shuttle that runs between the aqua hotels which is quite good as it can drop you off at Ala Moana Centre for free but it takes quite long and only comes every half an hour to an hour! The best thing about this hotel is the location. Very central location within Waikiki beach, just a block or so away from the beach, that's what you are paying for as its not a fancy hotel. The rooms are quite outdated and could do with a revamp. The air conditioning was the loudest thing I have ever heard, we couldn't sleep with it on because it was so loud, during the day it was okay and necessary to have it on. We slept with the door open which then meant we had all the street noise which is quite significant but it's either that or the air con so it's not the most quietest of places. This might be pedantic but something that would have improved my stay was to have a more consistent room clean. Everyday the towels would be in different places or on different racks, nicely folded or just placed on the rack like normal. Some days we would have a bed full of fancy pillows and then some days they were gone. It would just be nicer to come back and it be the same everyday so you would know what to expect. Despite these little things it was a pleasant stay and would recommend. Thanks guys! Also thank for the macadamia nuts :)

We didn't stay in this hotel long (just one night) since we were off to Kauai right after, but I still felt the hotel deserved a review. The day we arrived the hotel had a lovely outdoor event prepared complete with lei making, live music, fresh juice cocktails and food. It was such a welcome surprise! The staff is friendly and the hotel is in a great location next to Waikiki beach. Definitely recommend this area!

If you are looking for a reasonably quiet room, ask for a room which over looks the pool. Otherwise with a street facing room you will be subjected to intolerable street noise from vehicles and tourist buses. Some of the rooms are double glazed which reduces some noise but we stayed in a room with old glazing and I was weeping with relief when we checked out after 5 nights of incessant noise. IF we hadnt hired a car and escaped Waikiki for one of the days we were staying I'm unsure if I would have coped. Waikiki is a very noisy congested commercial city and its no holiday. Get out of Waikiki if you can but then you see how the whole island of Oahu has been stripped of native vegetation to make way for cropping and development. I spoke to a local at Sunset Beach and he said that the sea waters away from Waikiki are much cleaner and he wouldnt swim at Waikiki even though it looks blue and clean. If you prefer peace and quiet, avoid Waikiki.

After reading TA reviews and studying the Aqua Bamboo website I wanted to love this hotel! I will start with the positives...Friendly staff, clean, attractive lobby, beautiful pool area, family suites with three beds and kitchenette, nice beds and linens, lemon water in the lobby and close to Waikiki Beach! Now the negatives...Hallways, rooms, furnishings are all very dingy and worn. Sliding glass doors to balconies are very hard to open. The traffic was so loud that it felt like I was trying to sleep on the side of a freeway. The room darkening shades were also inaffective. Sleep was very difficult and when I am vacationing a good night's sleep is so important! Many nice features and such friendly accomodating staff, but...

Great remodel done on the few floors they have done. Didn't hear any construction noises during our stay. Pool area was nice and clean, the water fall was fun and looked good at night. Only bad part was when they redid the room door they didn't sand the edges so the door was hard to open and close and the A/C unit needed a good cleaning some mold was forming.

April 2016 my family stayed at the Aqua Bamboo. The overall experience was good, the location is very good but...The road noise and air conditioner noise was a big issue. It really was a toss up between listening to the cars going past or suffer the the " hole in the wall dual aircons. We stayed in a family room, which was great, 2 single beds in 1 room and 1 queen in another but...There is only 1 TV and it is in the single bed room, so there is not enough comfortable seating for a family of 4 and when the young ones go to sleep there is no more TV???? I do have to say that the staff were great. Always friendly always happy to help. The pool area was also great always clean. Aqua Bamboo also have complimentary beach gear, Boogie boards, chairs and mats which were great considering he 3 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. I really don't think I would stay here again.

We had booked this hotel via an agency as a "boutique hotel". and it had really a specific atmosphere.The staff was very friendly and helpful, but not insistent. The location is great - for the beach AND the points of interest in Honolulu: you have all the agencies round the corner, but also the public bus. There is also a free shuttle available for the Moana Shopping Center. - It was very relaxing to come back from the tours - nearly as coming back home.

We were warmly welcomed by Aja at the front desk. The suite was superb with a great patio and view of mountain and had every amenity you could want. Beach & grocery store were 2 blocks away. A great hotel at a reasonable price. Small pool was well looked after and pizza was available after 4 pm. Free coffee, tea and lemon water in the lobby were available. Staff were most helpful. Many shops and restaurants close by.

Stayed for 3 days after cruise. Should have asked for a change of room 208 due to noise from Street and laundry but to be honest we were only there to bathe and sleep. Room itself was good clean and comfortable and staff very helpful.

I had the pleasure of staying for 4 nights at this Waikiki Aqua property recently. This is part of a small group of properties - all with the Aqua moniker...I really enjoyed the location: 2 blocks from the beach, close to several little shops and services and central to so many food and beverage options. The WiFi was good and free, there were complimentary apples in the lobby and daily newspapers. The staff were hit and miss. Aja was a STAR...as was the tall young man with the Hawaiian first name (apologies but I can't recall it) who checked me in early one morning (and did a darn fine job I might add). A few of the staff were clearly just there for the paycheck as they were more interested in their phones, chatting to each other and looking 'busy' which was a shame because staff like Aja made them look really lame given that she was always smiling, 'guest-orientated' & upbeat - like I say, a STAR! It would be nice for some of the staff here to be made aware of the importance of name recognition when dealing with guests and also that most of us have travelled extensively. While standing awkwardly waiting for an elevator, I personally really don't want to hear staff at front desk discussing how dead the afternoon shift can be and how they like it when it is busy for the first couple of hours as it makes the shift go by soooooo much quicker etc etc etc....that's lame. The room (1001 I think it was) was well appointed and I found the kitchenette & fridge fantastic for keeping drinks and treats cold. I loved being able to 'stock-up' at the ABC Store and keep everything in my room for lunch, snacks, etc....There were 3 balconies (!) & 1 of them was massive complete with loveseat, tables, chairs and ocean glimpses. I really was surprised as I thought the door led to a closet but nope, it was a massive, AWESOME little Lanai.....The Queen bed was a little soft but nothing too dramatic. Lot's of great pillows and linens - good towels and washroom amenities (shower gel/shampoo/conditioner/soap). The housekeeping staff were really kind and pleasant- they all did such a wonderful job of keeping this property looking great...The pool was clean and quiet. It doesn't get a ton of sunshine but that can be a good thing some days.I would stay here again, if for no other reason than the location, the safe/clean facilities and of course Aja's smile and presence.Thank you Aqua Bamboo. You did well. 4/5 Please give Aja a raise/promotion/free trip immediately ;)

The Bamboo is in a great location. We stayed in April 2016 for 12 nights. There were some major pitfalls of our stay here, as well as some highlights. Our fist impression was good, Lobby is beautifully renovated, however our room was not so great. Very dated, also we found things were not to the standard we would have expected, like our bath having rust holes and mould, also the cupboards sliders didn't slide, also the toaster was broken on the centre element, there was paint peeling and the air conditioner, although worked well, was extremely noisy, and the hot water was lukewarm at best on most days, and there were even times there was no hot water at all. They are in the process of renovating and it seems as they are going floor by floor, that would have been nice to know at time of booking, or have been informed of as our travel date got closer. Their pool area while small is very nice and a relaxing environment to be in, the spa is a little too hot I think. They were having issues with the fire alarm, and as such we were woken at least 7mornings at around 4-5am with what they called a "glitch" then our smoke detector randomly went off at 4am one morning, to which we had to call reception to have it turned off, these things did not make for happy guests. Upon leaving we had to pay our resort fee of $15 per night of stay, however that was waived for us, so that was something we appreciated, a considerable saving over our length of stay. The staff were nice and friendly and can only do so much with an old building. Would we stay here again? Probably not, not until it was fully renovated at least.

Fab stay at aqua bamboo had kitchenette which was very handy. Staff very helpfull and friendly. Room clean and pleasant. Great location just a couple blocks back from beach front. Missed not having a bar although many stores available to stock up the room. Ideal for busy travellers rather than for relaxing stay. Would definately come back

Hi, we stayed here for 3 nights, it's just behind the Hyatt Regency on Waikiki beach, excellent location and quick access to the beach and all of downtown shopping. The Hotel is good, clean and suited our needs as we only sleep three and sightseeing otherwise. The staff are great and helpful and we certainly would stay here again

My family & I stayed at the Aqua Waikiki Bamboo in April 2016 on Level 3. The only good thing I can say about this place is its location, short 5 minute walk to the beach, close to ABC store & food pantry. This place is so old and dated it's ridiculous, shower handle kept falling off, noisy air conditioning, traffic noise all night, will never stay there again!!

A great hotel and a great price. Room was small but clean. Only concern was carpet was getting old. If you wanted to pay the extra money we did see a upgraded room which was big and fantastic. Free coffee, tea and apples were great every day and the appetizers onThursday night was a treat. Raymond is a great guy at the front and made us feel right at home. And Lydia at the concierge desk was really nice and a great help planning for our stay. All staff was helpful.

Aqua bamboo 1101 has nice partial ocean view, high enough up to avoid most of the city noise. resort has nice pool and hot tub with waterfall feature and pizza shack in pool area, welcome snacks/beverages and entertainment on thurs eve. overlooks Kings landing where farmers market fresh food is great. short walk to beach and tour bus pickup locations. If we return to Waikiki we will book this room again. Priced right

I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo with friends. This is your basic Hawaiian hotel. The rooms were nice but the hotel itself is average in comparison with some of the mega resorts on the Island. If you're passing through Waikiki this hotel should do the trick. There are plenty of buses for travel to the mall, tourist attractions, and restaurants. It's right in the middle of Waikiki so the location is good but other than that it's just okay.

Location was good and that was important since it was just myself and my daughter (we felt fairly safe) and we did not have a rental car. All I can say is that it was a little quirky. It is an older hotel but it is clean and the amenities are nice. I think the old elevator was probably my biggest deterrent and that's probably just me. We did not use the pool at all and it is very small. I think for kids it would be a disappointment but was not a factor for us. Overall it was a good place for us but it depends on what you are looking for.

Nice clean room with fragrant soaps, etc.Good view of the area (we were on an upper floor)They let us have an extra hour which we appreciated.Lobby has lemon/lime water and coffeeGood location - just a block off the main drag - easy to walk to anywhere in Waikiki we thought.Would stay here again if in the area.

Good location, pool area was okay, the shuttle bus to Ala Moana shopping centre was great - worth the hospitality fee! The room was good, bathroom quite rundown though - shower tap fell off! The room was quite noisy, had to use ear plugs on the odd occasion, as was the air conditioning. Staff were very lovely though! Left us chocolates on our last day before we left and greeted us with fresh pineapple juice on our arrival to the hotel. Other hotels would have been more luxurious but good hotel for just leaving all your shopping at the end of the day!

The General Manager of the Aqua Ewa Hotel(Lendy) put 4 of us in the Aqua Bamboo Hotel after we complained of the poor condition of the Aqua Ewa. That hotel (Aqua Ewa) is in a deplorable condition. However we were given the Penthouse Suite at the Aqua Bamboo, where conditions were much better, for the same price. The staff at this hotel were courteous, helpful and hospitable and made the remainder of our stay much more enjoyable. Being a 5 minute walk from Waikiki Beach was great. Breakfast on the terrace in the brilliant sunshine was fantastic!

Rooms were clean and nice,. It was very nice to have a kitchenette so you could do all of your cooking there. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful with anything you needed. It was a very good place to stay. Great location. Close to the beach, grocery store , bus stop and all of the shopping. Will definately stay here again. Loved it very much

Stayed 13 nights here, family of 4 in one room. best priced hotel offering 2 single beds for our children in one room and a double bed in adjacent room (all be same hotel room). Room: Living area with two single beds: Contained functional kitchenette, gas hob, oven , sink, microwave & fridge / freezer, Neat & tidy. Single beds comfortable but no seating area so this is essentially a twin room with kitchen, Adjoining bedroom: Comfortable double bed, chest of drawers, large built in wardrobe but no TV. Only room to walk around the bed on ne side by the wardrobe, tiniest of gaps on the other side.Balcony: 2 of them, 1 on each room, just deep enough to locate a single chair. We only had 1 chair (no table) between two rooms (rooms were facing street but we didn't intend on using them, we didn't come to Hawaii to sit on a balcony.Lobby: Staff friendly and helpful, pleasant environment, filtered and chilled water available, fruit and coffee all complimentary. free DVD and concierge desk.Pool area: Sunbeds, and plenty of table/ chair seating, lots of shaded area too. Pool was refreshing on a hot day (not heated), a bot on the small side but never crowded.Hotel offers free beach chairs & the use of boogie boards / beach mats or anything else left by previous travellers. These will save you a fortune as two loungers & an umbrella on the beach will set you back $50 for two hours! Go to a supermarket and but a small umbrella which we did! Free wifi in your room and also poolside if you log on to another room!Location: Centrally situated a couple of blocks back from the main strip on Waikiki. Only a few mins walk from the beach. Plenty of local supermarkets around (ABC stores seem to be every 500yds or so), Walmart can be found out at Ala Moana, get there using the hotels shared transit van (free of charge). This van is shared between other Aqua hotels in the area so it takes 30 mins to get to Ala Moana, you could almost walk it in that time if you wanted to in the heat though! This hotel delivered everything we wanted of it, was an ideal base for our family holiday.If your room is facing the street, you will suffer from traffic noise, this hotel needs to invest in some double glazing for the sliding doors to the balconies. The air conditioning units whilst very efficient are very noisy. So at night you will have a choice of the air con or traffic noise. Ask for a room overlooking the pool side if you can.

We were a group of 10 adults travelling for my brothers 50th birthday. The staff were all very helpful and friendly in particular Robert, Dylan and Aja they went out of their way to help us in lots of ways. The hotel allowed us to set up an area for his birthday and we cooked up a big BBQ which is a bonus to have at a resort so you don't have to go out for dinner every night esp those on a budget or with young children. This is a little hidden gem instead of a big hi rise building great for all ages. They have a great pizza restaurant on site and they are delicious.The only issues I have which are really nothing butThe toilets by the pool need to stay open rather than going to get a key every time you need to use them. Air cons in room work well but noisy during the night and can't sleep with the doors open as street noise is loud. The hot tub was a bit too hot.Will definitely stay here again without a doubt.

Waited 30min to check in due to a large group arriving prior, no help w bags was offered and we weren't informed regarding room fee and what this covered. Location and room was good however the bathroom left a lot to be desired, we had a kitchenette; house keeping did our dishes 1x out of 10days. Fine for the 2 of us.

I would definitely recommend staying in this friendly hotel right by the beach. The staff were so friendly and they even parked our car for us when I was worried about reversing into the parking lot (I'm from England and had never driven an automatic!!) The room was cleaned everyday and it was really useful having a kitchenette in the room- we saved loads of money on eating out. My only complaint was that our rook was on the first floor without a view.

The hotel room was clean, and the staff very friendly and attentive. The room and fixtures are dated, but everything was in good condition. The hotel is very centric and the public bus route is right in front of it, so it is great if you plan on using public transportation to go visit the sites near Waikiki. My only complain would be that there was barely any water pressure in the shower. I was staying in the 11th floor, so maybe that had something to do with it. Overall, great place for a one night stay during connection flights through Honolulu, HI

We stayed here because of the value for the dollar.The location was excellent as we were traveling via public transit. A little older and could benefit from some upgrades but the staff were all very pleasant and helpful which more than made up for any issues. Some traffic noise but location was worth it.

From the moment we walked into this hotel, I was very impressed. The front desk offered us a glass of pineapple juice as we walked in and gave us everything that we would need. We were worried about parking in the busy Waikiki area, but we called before to reserve a parking space (definitely recommend!) and never had a problem. We stayed in the room with the kitchenette, which was great size and gave us plenty of space. We had three balconies which we thought was incredible and 2 of them overlooked the outside pool/patio area. We were very glad that the hotel provided us beach towels to take with us anywhere throughout the day. The hotel also had a variety of movies (included in the price) that we could watch. I had heard that some places in Waikiki were pretty old, but I was impressed by the quality of this hotel and the cleanliness as well. The hotel left us a letter and treat on the day we checked out, which impressed me and really made me feel like part of their "ohana". We happened to be there the day of the manager's reception, and we enjoyed learning to make a flower lei and the snacks that they provided. Overall, this was a fantastic place, and I'm so glad we stayed there.

Pleasant enough but there was an air of change. Some of the staff were very nice others need a wake up call. We have stayed before but do not know if we will return. The hot tub was a warm tub . They should not have babies in the hot tub with diapers on.

This was our second stay at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki. We loved it the first time and loved it even more the second ! Beautiful comfortable rooms, great pool area and wonderful staff. The concierge service is very helpful and friendly. Overall a great place to stop and if we return to Oahu, we will definitely say again. Aloha.

stayed here for a week for its money the place is not bad, the staff was always very helpful although we booked the place from real state agent , the location is good if you need to be in the middle of wakiki strip but our room on the 2nd floor with balcony on the street was very very noisy & we were not able to open the balcony door because of traffic noise which was non stop day& specially night, the room of course have air con & all basic amenities including coin operated washing machines on specific floors, the staff is amazing & helpful all the time which is just so worth it otherwise nothing is really appealing to go back... better off pay a bit more for somewhere a bit more quite .
user_name:
Aliss A
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: First of all, the staff is great! They are helpful, warm and friendly. Thank you Nicole, Kimari, Lokahi, Raymond, Jose and the rest of the staff.This was our 4th time in 4 years staying at Bamboo. We stayed in a one bedroom suite for 11 nights. It had a small stove, microwave, two fridges, toaster and utensils/dishes. The room had wifi and was very clean, spacious with a large bathroom. We felt very comfortable during our entire stay. It is in a perfect location just one block from the main strip and beach right by the Hyatt. We made use of the beach gear that they provided free of charge. During our stay, they also had a small continental breakfast which was a trial run, but hopefully will continue on. They also have a water filtration machine and apples for the guests which were always handy. Mahalo Bamboo! Until next time, Alan, Irene and family

All amenities you require including in room safe ,fridge ,tea & coffee making facilities, microwave etc The room was compact & but the beds were very comfortable & it's was only a short walk to Waikiki beach . The only down side was a fairly noisy wall air-conditioning unit but another bonus was a free shuttle bus to a large shopping centre & a free continental breakfast in the lobby area from 8.00am

This was our tenth stay in as many years and it was perfect to meet my expectations. The hotel is only one block from Waikiki beach on Kuhio Avenue and within walking distance of a number of ethnic and American restaurants, including my favorite, Wolfgang Puck Express on Kalakua Avenue for pizza, pasta or hamburger.The hotel staff is very considerate and accomodating, particularly Zenie and Nicole. I requested a 10:00 am room clean up for my seven days' stay and it was done with a smile. The room is furnished with small oven/ range, micro wave, fridge and cooking utensils and serving dishes. The courtyard view has gorgeous ocean view and other sides have mountain view. The hotel is also located one block from Alawei Canal which has a paved walking and jogging path of more than a mile. The hotel also has a small pool and hot tub.
user_name:
Pevandi
New York City, New York

review_body: We booked this hotel because of its central location to the beach, restaurants, and parks. This hotel is older, well taken care of, and clean. The room was small, as was the lanai, but with a view of the ocean, it didn't matter. Our room had lots of storage, a fridge, a microwave, and wi-fi. We caught the free shuttle to Ala Moana a few times, but there is so much to do and so many stores to choose from in the area that we didn't feel the need to head to the mall a lot. Beach towels were always available at the front desk and various beach accessories were on offer for our use (kept in the pool area). The staff were very helpful and made us feel welcome. The Thursday night reception was nice (free drinks, snacks, and entertainment). We didn't take partake in the small breakfast (fruit, oatmeal, pastries, juice) each morning, but it was nice for a light start to the morning. On the down side, the air conditioner was really noisy, so I wore earplugs to bed every night. Also, the room was not very soundproof so even though we were on the 11th floor, we heard street noise (traffic) and on occasion, some noisy banging from the rooms next door. All in all, a great stay in a great location. The parting gift of chocolates was a really nice touch. Thanks!

The hotel is centrally located with a two block walk to the beach. Rooms were older but clean and small. The hotel is in need of a few upgrades air conditioners are noisy, furniture was well used but the cleaning staff were good and usually thorough. Didn't spend very much time in the room so didn't care that it was small. Price paid was 20% lower than other 3 star properties and the great staff made our stay wonderful. Also the free beach amenities were a nice add on. All things considered I would definitely stay here again.

I had a great stay in Feb 2015 and enjoyed this unique little oasis. Don't expect a luxury deluxe hotel but a comfortable, clean, fully equipped boutique sized hotel property that has a wide range of room styles , some with kitchenettes. Liked the fresh fruit water in the lobby and the happy hour by the pool each afternoon. Also loved how close the beach was and the great restaurants in the area. The staff are nice and helpful.

I was really excited for this hotel, I thought with all of the positive reviews on trip advisor it has to be good! When walking in to the bathroom for the first time it looked nice. There were orchid petals in the towels, and then I noticed a very long hair in the hand towel next to the flower petal. Upon using the bathroom I also noticed a long hair in the bath tub. Then under the bath mat towel. Then I looked up by the light and there were 7 (yes, I counted) small ones on the drywall.  The first impression was not good and things just added up. On the first night we flipped the pillow back and low and behold another long hair. The wall unit air conditioning was super loud making rattling noises and it made it very hard to sleep at night with it running. The vents on the air conditioner were also filthy black! Went to the bathroom in the middle of the night and found what I assume was a cockroach, dead floating in the toilet! (I flushed it quickly, it was a very large bug)On the last morning I noticed there was a blood spot on the comforter that I was sleeping in the last two nights. And no scratches on me or my fiancé so it couldn't have come from us. I'm extremely disappointed with this hotel. We stayed at the Aqua Park Shore previous to this and the place was very clean.I think they need to work on their housekeeping expectations.My fiancé would like me to add that while the hotel was very nice in leaving notes welcoming us and wishing us safe travels. He was disappointed with the actual staff. No one ever said good morning or aloha or even acknowledged us while walking through the lobby or passing employees while they were working. I will not be returning to this hotel based on my experience and I would not recommend it to future travelers.

We fell in love with the courtyard of this hotel. A quaint spot in the heart of busy Waikiki. Nicole & her staff are very friendly & helpful. We just got home from our 9th visit to this hotel & are booked for next year .Have recommended this hotel to many people and they have been happy.

We were able to book a room for the same day because our previous condo rental was double booked. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Many thanks to Ian from the front desk. Very very cool guy! We enjoyed talking to him and asking for advices.

I have to say this is one of my favorite hotels. Staff is lovely, setting is perfect, and the extras are essential to the experience. Everything about this place is charming. The hotel makes an effort to build community and make guests feel welcome.

Very convenient location in the heart of Waikiki close to shopping, ABC stores, grocery, restaurant the beach and many other attractions. This hotel is a short shuttle ride from the airport at about $29 round trip on the SpeediShuttle. The room I was in was on the top floor, good AC, lots of room, pool, hot tub, detached restaurant in the back and close to both luxury restaurants and economical establishments. i had a great time staying there even though I spent most of my time working.

I was in Waikiki for 48 hrs on business. The hotel was great. Some may say it shows it's age. I prefer to say it was retro! Because we booked direct we were upgraded to suites. Very large and comfortable. I received a thank you note from the hotel and a small box of very yummy chocolate coated macadamia nuts. It is in a great location, like 5 min (2 blocks) from the beach and the main strip in Waikiki. Had breakfast and lunch at Dukes. Amazing! And just a block away was Chuck's Cellar, awesome prime rib. I recommend the King cut. Huge!!! I do have to say that even though I didn't take advantage of it, the hot tub was tiny. 3 average to above average sized people would have overflowed it. The one night I felt like going for a swim I was discouraged by the people having amazing pizza at the lovin oven out on the pool deck. Didn't feel like splashing and lazing around while people were eating supper. Other than that it was a great place to stay and better priced than most hotels in the area! Thanks Aqua Bamboo.

We were referred to the Aqua Bamboo by a B&B operator. We were hopeful our budget could afford a good 3 star hotel.(less than $200/nt). We had a small room with a kitchenette that was clean. We were 2 blocks from Waikiki beach and in the middle of all the action. The staff were young, helpful and tried hard and it gave the place a cool energy. The building itself was a bit tired.The A/C units were old and noisy. The pool was cold. The hot tub was tiny The ambiance on the pool deck was interesting and would have been more so if there was a bar or some place to get a drink.Lounge chairs are limited. Most annoying feature was you had to go to the front desk and get a key every time you had to use the washroom on the pool deck.They offer a free breakfast.Its not much and becomes a cluster at 8 am when you are lined up to use one of two toasters. If you want Waikiki on a budget this place has solid value if your expectations are realistic.

This hotel is not overly clean, the bathroom is very outdated, and the continental breakfast was terrible. They have very limited parking and you will most likely be required to park in the ramp next door for $25 a night. It is close to downtown and Waikiki beach making it convenient for activities in the area. Traffic can be bad getting to the hotel as well.

If you're looking for reasonably priced, a few blocks from the beach and not terribly clean... this is your spot! The staff (depending on the day) was semi friendly. The noise from the surrounding streets (regardless of time of day or floor you're on) is annoying! I was surprised to learn they do not perform room service daily (meaning your bed gets made every other day and that also means no clean towels unless you request them) A lot of the amenities were old or broken or outdated. Is this the worst place I've ever seen, no. But just remember the old saying, you get what you pay for.

We were booked here for business travel and because I was unfamiliar with the hotel I was sceptical. I would describe this hotel more of a boutique style.Breakfast was fresh and good. Though small, it was reasonably priced and comfortable. Close to beach and shopping. Staff very friendly. We would recommend it.

All the streets are busy in Waikiki but once you are in your room, and especially if you have a room looking over the pool, you've found a quiet oasis. The courtyard was a quiet relaxing place to get away from the hustle of the city and you are just a couple of blocks from the main shopping street. You have to pay to park but it's nice to just drop it off and let them take care of parking it. We had no issues with the internet in the room and no issues with the staff. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and spacious. We were up on the 7th floor but we had friends on the third floor who had an even larger room. We loved having a kitchen - saved on meals because we could buy the makings for breakfast and lunch and only ate out (but we could have prepared and made dinner as well but we are on vacation.)
user_location: Pompton Plains, New Jersey, United States
user_name:
Peter M
Pompton Plains, New Jersey, United States

review_body: I make myself crazy attempting to find the 'perfect' hotel when I travel. I scour websites, read reviews, and altogether spend way too much time. I didn't want to spend too much, Waikiki can be uber expensive. Aqua Bamboo turned out to be perfect for my needs. I had a lovely studio that faced the inside courtyard, was very clean. The bathroom had orchids strewn about the towels, studio had a full kitchen with a gas stove. Two blocks from the beach, grocery store two blocks away, close to restaurants of all kinds. Highly recommend, great value for location.

The Aqua Bamboo is the ideal place on Oahu as a base for your Hawaii vacation. Located a short walk from Waikiki beach the Aqua Bamboo has all the amenities you could want and more. Our room had a stove top, microwave and refrigerator so we could avoid having to eat out for breakfast and many dinners. A grocery store and farmer's market are literally around the corner. There is a gorgeous pool and spa surrounded by palms and once a week they host a reception with food and drink. For trips down to the beach the hotel provides towels and beach chairs at no additional cost. There are waters and dryers on site for longer stays or to simply dry off bathing suits.

We thoroughly enjoyed our 8 night stay at the Aqua Bamboo for our honeymoon. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room overlooking the courtyard. The room provided everything we needed (we got a kitchenette room) and was clean and tidy. The air conditioner was noisy but we didn't have it going at night. The staff were super helpful and friendly, they were happy to help with anything at any time. The hotel had lots of amenities- a pool and spa, restaurant, breakfast 6 days a week, laundry, parking, coffee facilities for $1US etc. There is a resort fee of $15 per night but it includes free DVD rental, free beach towels and beach chairs, free wifi in each room and in the lobby, newspaper, free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre and they held our bags as we arrived before our room was ready. This fee is well advertised. There was also a concierge desk in the lobby to help with activities and things to do. The hotel was in a great location and quiet as it was small, this meant the laundry was empty and the pool not often used. We were very impressed with what we got for the price we paid. We will be back!

Got here Jan14/2016 and still here.The staff here go out of their way to help you,rooms are very clean.I would recomend this hotel to everybody.Its less than 3 minutes to beach,has a bus stop right in front.The pool area is very clean and very beautiful with all the plants and trees just perfect for relaxing and tanning with a pool to cool off or a hot to relax. Thank you Nicole and all the outstanding staff for the hard work you do here.

We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in October. The location is superb, 2 minute walk to Waikiki beach without being right in the hustle and bustle. The room was well appointed with a separate bedroom and self contained kitchen which we used a lot. Only fault was the air conditioning was very loud but earplugs fixed that. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. the pool area is magnificent, and very quiet, the pizza place on site is fantastic. After trip service was amazing when I wanted to get my daughters the gorgeous robes which were in the rooms. Would definitely stay again.

From the beginning, this was not a good experience. Not just because the room itself is barely nicer than a 1970's roadside motel, but because everything about the information the hotel provides is misleading. We only had one night in Waikiki, so didn't want to break the bank with a luxury room, but did expect good, basic lodging. Website offers $116, actual rate when we arrived was $179 ("oh, those posted prices are just starting rates", says the desk) PLUS a hospitality fee, PLUS an amenities fee, which they tout as an advantage for the guests. For the amenities fee of $15, you get Lemon water in the lobby. (YEA, lemon water in the lobby!!) A manager's reception on Thursdays- (Not there on a Thursday, and wouldn't give AF about the reception if I were.) I don't even remember what the other useless "amenities" were, outside of the use of a beach towel, which I didn't need.They offer onsite parking, which basically doesn't really exist. The garage next door is $25 a day, and the machine wasn't working and they were ticketing even hotel guests who had notes on their windshields offering to pay when possible. We were directed to a place blocks away which only took cash. A real pain in the a... Because of the misinformation we we given at the desk (see IQ of employees below) about the room rates and parking situation, it literally took us and hour an a half to get into our room. The room itself: size ok, bed comfortable, loud street noise, every surface of furniture dinged up and slightly shabby, kitchenette would be convenient if you needed one, (and brought your own knife that could cut something other than warm butter, and paper towels, and and and). Bathroom: sand in the tub, mold on the caulk, handle of hot water in tub came off in my hand when I turned it on (threads stripped, so no putting it back on), a weird oversized kitchen faucet on the bathroom sink. Low quality everything.Not to be unkind, but the guys at the desk were just plain dumb. Especially one of them, who was so bad as to have you waiting to make sure he wasn't kidding (he can not POSSibly be this slow, you are thinking- but you would be wrong). Overall, this was a very disappointing experience. Granted, it is not a luxury hotel, and one cannot expect this to be equivalent to a W. The location is not bad. Stay here if you must, just know that you are paying for a very mediocre experience at best.
user_name:
Jeanie V
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: Upfront, it should be known that I created a trip advisor account just to write this review. Basically from the moment I checked it, it was a mess of a reservation. I am currently residing in hawaii but decided to stay in honolulu when family came in, to be closer to them. So naturally I brought my car because the website clearly says they have parking. Well I get there and the front desk told me I had to have reserved a spot (which was not stated online) and the parking garage next door is broken. So he sent me 3 blocks away to a parking garage, that only takes cash (which of course I didn't have), and I have to return every 24 hours to pay because they don't take advancements. When I returned from this little adventure and told the front desk they didn't even seem to care. I never write reviews or am a negative person. But the fact that I had to walk numerous times back and forth 3 blocks everyday to pay for my parking is absolutely ridiculous. I understand that sometimes the staff can't do anything but they didn't even try to come up with an alternative solution or make up for it.

While the room we stayed in was a bit dated, the lobby, pool area and location are excellent and made for a very enjoyable experience. There was only 1 main negative - the glass doors in the rooms facing Kuhio Ave are thin and so the noise from the road is not blocked, this meant that we heard the bus stopping across the road all night. However we dealt with this as the price suited our needs and we were so close to everything. The staff at the front desk were always so friendly and accomodating, we got to have fresh beach towel whenever we wanted, daily housekeeping with fresh towels, free dvd rental and very relaxing poolside seating.While this definately isn't the Hilton, we didn't pay for the Hilton and I am very happy with the choice we made. My friends and I actually believe that this location is better than the Hilton, however that is becoming something of its own suburb.

This was a really nice hotel. Especially considering how much cheaper it was than the big fancy beach front hotels. The room was large and comfortable. Our view was of the wall from the building next door. So if you want a nice view then this is not your place. But if you want a nice hotel for a good price then this is your spot. The pool area is beautifully themed and very relaxing. The only down side is the parking. But I hear that is problem in all of the hotels around there.

This hotel was a bit of a disappointment. Much like you, we did a lot of research in this price range and thought this one would be best. I found our room to be very small. I was also disappointed with the broken patio door lock and obsessively loud air conditioner. I can usually sleep through anything but the air conditioner sounded as if a plane was taking off next to my head. If you do decide to stay here, call and reserve parking. We ended up having to park next door as there secure underground parking lot was fully reserved for our first night. The next door parking is also secure but not nearly as convenient and still $25.00 USD. On the bright side, the staff were great.

The Aqua Bamboo comes well rated as a budget/mid-level option in a great location of Waikiki, without an inflated price tag. Overall, even at a budget/middle level, I think this hotel can do better. The hot tub does not work, and when I enquired about when it would be repaired, staff at the front desk said there were no plans in place to do so. After asking outright, the hotel staff allowed my family and I to use the hot tub in the hotel next door for no charge. There were also a few events that were advertised as being offered certain days of the week (e.g., free drinks in hotel lobby), which were rescheduled and cancelled without warning, despite being advertised in the hotel elevators as key events. Finally, of the one week we stayed, our rooms were not cleaned two of the days, despite us having left the room all day. Cleaning service didn't come by until the late afternoon, at which point we were already back and getting ready to shower for the evening. I have to wonder why there is an additional daily "resort fee" if many of these services aren't included. The rooms themselves were dated, but clean enough. The hotel lobby was pumped full of pine/cranberry air freshener (we stayed just after Christmas), which was a little too strong for my tastes. Service was good overall, though some staff members were friendlier than others. Still, the hotel failed to amaze me and I likely won't stay again.

Stayed here twice over NYE and start of Jan. Checkin was easy, staff very friendly and helpful. Our first room on the 7th floor was quite large and spacious, comfortable and no real issues. The only comment is that the air con is extremely loud. Otherwise very happy. Our second stay on the 9th floor is similar. Our room is smaller and less spacious however still comfortable. The shuttle to Ala Moana we only used once as it was practically full when we got on and was very uncomfortable and took quite a long time to get to the centre. Apart from that, the location is great, staff are great and I would stay here again :)

This place was so welcoming, especially after a long day of flying to Oahu and the disorientation of the 5 hour time difference. The lobby smelled delightfully tropical, had comfy furniture, was decorated in bamboo themed decor and had coffee, teas, and lemon infused water available 24-7. The hotel is an easygoing walk to the beach and all manner of shopping choices. My room was clean and fairly spacious-not new, but newly renovated with lovely coordinating bed linens & pillows. I appreciated the kitchenette with dishes, cookware, sink, coffeemaker, toaster, refrigerator, cooktop, and microwave. The bed was a very comfortable with several blanket options and loads of pillows. There was an I room safe for added security. I didn't have any view except a cinder block wall unless I leaned out from the balcony-- then could see a bit of the mountains and certainly the street and landscaped walkway below. The mirrored closet doors didn't move smoothly, but all other doors and drawers worked well.

The hotel is in close proximity to the beach and shopping but the rooms are small. The air conditioner leaked on us while we were sleeping and the filter needed changing. Two of us caught bad colds because of that. The shower nozzle in the room was broken. However the staff was friendly and it was ok for two nights. we has a street side room that was super noisy.

Really close to the beach and the rooms are really nice. I love the little kitchen and with complimentary PS3 games, the kids thought it was fantastic!!Lots of great eating options within walking distance. The service was really great. An opportunity to really relax and take in all that Hawaii has to offer.

Great experience. Very helpful staff. Gave us ideas of where to go and sights to see that are off the beaten path. Room was clean and nice. Lobby has free coffee and refreshments. One thing to note is very limited parking spaces available.

This is my 6th time staying at this location. The hotel is small, and slightly off the main drag, but worth it. The rooms are fairly large for waikiki, and very clean. The location is quiet compared to some other places on the busier streets. I do recommend staying on a higher floor is street traffic will bother you. We have stayed in the studios as a family, with the two double beds (2 adults + 2 kids) we have never felt crowded, like we can in an ordinary hotel. The pool area is private and nice. The showers are excellent. And the location is very close (1 long block) from excellent beaches, and less than a half mile from Kapiolani park. I cannot say enough good things about the location and quality of the place. The views are not particularly stunning as the hotel is not on the beach, but from the veranda you can see the ocean, which is nice.

We were updated to room 1004 and what a surprise. Very spacious with a kitchenette and great slate flooring. I had read a lot of mixed reviews about this hotel but found our experience to be on the very positive side. We found staff to be professional and courteous, giving good information on how the bus service ran and also where to go if we needed help. We swam in the pool on most days and also tried out the lovin oven pizza next to the pool which was wonderful.The location of the hotel is great. Just around the corner and two blocks to the beach. The hotel had a courtesy bus which ran a regular service to Ala Moana shopping centre which my daughter loved.All in all a great experience.

Stayed 12/10 - 12/13/2015 in room 509 which overlooked a not so nice location. As a female I questioned my safety. This hotel and rooms are VERY OLD. The air condition is VERY loud, the carpet is old and the window coverings had holes. I will not be staying there again. In the past I have stayed in VRBO #448179 @ Kaiolu Sunrise just down a couple blocks down in a safe area and really enjoyed my time. Cheaper, cleaner and VERY NICE compared to Aqua Bamboo Waikiki

I was attending a wedding of a good friend so I wanted to stay close to the wedding venue, but not spend too much money. My travel agent recommended Aqua Bamboo and it was perfect for me. It was a few minutes walk to the beach, plenty of food outlets nearby and interesting little shops to pop into. I arrived early for my check in, but the staff were really helpful and managed to check in early. The room was large with 2 big beds, and had a kichenette. The bathroom also was large. Even though the room was a little dated, it was clean and comfortable. The air conditioning was a little noisy, but at least it worked! The hotel has a lot of little extras, that made my stay more comfortable. The most impressive part of my stay were the staff. Very helpful and friendly. Nothing was a problem for them.

I booked a room through blind bidding on Priceline. I searched under "condominium" so that the room would have cooking facilities. It did. Also very good location just a block from a Waikiki public beach. I paid $90 per night + tax of about $18 per night . Hotel is older but well maintained. My room was fine but a bit noisy, as if fronted the street.My only complaint is that the hotel charged the dreaded "resort fee" of $15 per night. Until consumers revolt and refuse to stay at places that charge these fees, they will likely continue.

Just a great little Oasis in the middle of Waikiki 2 blocks from the beach!!!! A sweet pool area with a jacuzzi, tables, BBQ Grill, and a nice Tiki Hut which we used for a fun party!!!!!!!! Staff was great, prices sweet, and condo style units were great for cooking-Hotel staff was GREAT-Followed through with anything we asked for-Even printed out a boarding pass for me with a smile included

I just recently stayed at the Aqua Bamboo over Thanks Giving, Saturday through Sunday... an entire week. During this week I had two very different experiences. I arrived in Waikiki several days before before joined by a friend. Because I was on my own for the 1st half of my trip, I opted for a 1 bed suite with a kitchen, and a court yard view. They put me in room 710. I wouldn't call that a court yard view, when you are looking down 7 flights at the court yard. It is more of a city view, unless you lean over the railing to look straight down. Room 710 smelled bad. The carpet was horrible, the bathroom looked like it was from the 1970s, and the kitchen was no better. The room was dark, and the AC unit made a horrible noise when it was turned on. If it wasn't Thanks Giving week, I would of switched hotels.1/2 way through my trip I was joined by my friend, and we moved to room 903. This was night and day. This room was beautiful, with an amazing patio. It looked over the city, which was fine. but the rooms itself was spacious, clean, with an updated bathroom and slate flooring (no nasty smelly carpet). The kitchenette was small, but the amazing patio did more than make up for it. The staff was friendly enough. They don't have a restaurant, so I would go to the Sheridan around the corner for Breakfast, or we would go out. No big deal. The parking garage is tiny. But they do have an over flow lot at the hotel next door. I never tried the pool, but it looks a little small (then again, i was on the 7th floor looking straight down at it). I would stay again just to stay in room 903, but I think upon checking out they could of done more. When I was checking out, they asked me how my stay was, and I told them. I was 1/2 expecting that they would of offered some type of comp for the 1st part of my stay in that crappy room, but I was mistaken.

Stayed here for 4 nights and it rained constantly! Literally the entire time we stayed in hawaii! Helpful staff, good facilities THE MOST EXPENSIVE PIZZA EVER the cheapest being $25! We had an issue with our first room, it was pretty crappy, our view was a brick wall, it was noisey from the roads, the air con leaked and was so loud you couldn't use it, wires for the TV everywhere...so we complained and got moved from the 5th floor to the 8th. Better view, not so noisey and a much better room. Then we found the toilet was already blocked and took a long time to flush! We had to go downstairs to use the restroom as the security guard (it was late when we discovered this) couldn't move us.Overall good hotel but make sure you get what you pay for. The shuttle bus is very confusing and didn't seem to go anywhere we wanted to go (royal Hawaiian shopping). We did get pineapple juice on arrival and chocolates on departure which was nice. Waikiki is a strange place, there seems to be two types of food, takeout or really expensive restaurants which explains why these rooms are self-catering.Mahalo!

Aqua Bamboo Waikiki is in a great location to shopping, supermarkets, restaurants, and, of course, the beach! The neighborhood feels safe even at very late night. While the building seems a bit old, the rooms are spacious and clean.

This place is pretty good. It was very clean. The staff are nice. Kind of like your stern grandpa with a soft spot. The wifi worked well. At the time we came we could've stayed at the Sheraton that has rum fire and an infinity pool for the same price. That would've been better. But if you can't stay there this place is walking distance to everything important in Waikiki, $15 to ala Moana and $20 to whole foods. It's a good time. There hospitality is heaps good. Would recommend 9/10

I was there for work. The hotel was convienent to Waikiki Beach. The rooms were pretty small, and parking was very expensive, of course this is to be expected. The Ac in my room was loud, and there was a cockroach, dead, inside to greet me. The hotel had signs up they were going to have pest control come in the next week, so I hope it has been taken care of. The Lani (deck) on my room was a pleasant surprise! The door lock was broken, but 8 stories up no one was going to break in. It wasn't a bad hotel. But for the same price I think you could do better. I would go back, bit I would try to find somewhere better, minimally acceptable.

This hotel was a great find. It has to be the best location in Waikiki for the price. Everything was clean and well presented, fantastic wifi, beautiful pool area and "The Lovin Oven" which serves awesome food. We were very fortunate to have a beach view on the twelfth floor. The room was compact but well presented and clean, clean towels everyday and free beach towels from reception. The concierge desk was superb as it meant we could book all our trips with a kind friendly person and not a vendor off the strip. I would highly recommend this hotel as I will be visiting it again next year.

We weren't 100% sure what to expect with this hotel since some reviews aren't amazing but we were very happy. I loved the bamboo theme which ran throughout...and I love a hotel with a bit of history which I feel like this hotel does have. It had a very nice feel to it and all staff were so friendly and helpful.Firstly, we were located on 12th floor which at the moment is the top floor (I think!! Maybe the 3 floors above are being redone? They weren't accessible anyway!) and had a corner room with two balconys. This was perfect since it meant we could see the mountains as well as the ocean....and we so loved the view. Our room was compact for sure but it was very clean and well equipped. I think the only thing that was missing in the rooms was a kettle (for our cups of tea!!) but tea and coffee is complementary in the lobby so there's not really a need for a kettle I guess. The bed was really comfy and the blackout curtains were very welcome. I loved the pink orchid blossoms that were scattered throughout the room for us checking in...such a lovely touch. We were able to keep the room on until 6pm since we had a late pick up and later flight which was so helpful and we were able to do this for hardly anything (charge wise) A short walk from the beach and the area seems safe enough!! There is a lot of road noise but the air con mostly blocked this out as it is pretty loud. Neither of these things bothered us though as we needed the air con to keep us cool throughout the night and we chose to stay central so street noise is expected. All in all, we fell in love with Hawaii and would recommend this hotel for those wanting to be central to Waikiki and are on a lower budget. Hope to be back one day. Thanks for your hospitality!!

This hotel is an 'old gem' it has a great vibe and a lovely pool garden area. If you are looking for a high class resort don't bother but I can recommend this hotel for an authentic experience in Waikiki. The rooms are clean, spacious and with a well appointed kitchenette if you book one. The only down-side is the road noise on that side of the building at night and the air conditioner was a bit noisy but it worked well.You can walk to everything easily from here, beach, surf shops, Kuhio Park, nice coffee and restaurants, the bus stop is across the street and most of the staff are friendly and helpful. There is a tour booking desk too if you need some advice, make sure you book a sunset cruise. This location is great for a family, surf trip or couples get away on a budget. Ray one of the staff, helped us store our boards around the back, very friendly service.

The best location for an affordable price.Close to everything, this Hotel is clean with a good service.Quiet place close to Waikiki Beach (5 mn walk)Be sure to get a room on 4th stairs or higher ! We had a room on the 3rd floor on the right side and our view was on the neighbour's balcony at 10 feet of our own balcony !!! such a very bad suprise. We have to keep the curtains closed during all our stay...

Rooms are fine need a little updating. Spa didn't work . Looking a bit tired. But on a good note is really close to the main drag and beach . Service really good. The pizza shop near the pool is amazing. The resort is very quiet and peacefull. Aircon is is very noisy .

This hotel was OK, nothing special. The rooms are not that good, but it was clean and it was a convenient location, not far from the beach and meet my needs at the time. Had a quite serene pool area which was nice.

The location is very good, 5 min walking distance from the beach. 5 Walking distance of most rental car company and supermarket for grocery. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The pool was a great asset after sunset and you could bring you own alcool to relax. Would recommend in a heart beat for anyone traveling in the main Capital who doesn't want to spend 50-100$ US a meal for two each time they go out and eat. This place as everything you need to do your own meal.

we had room 904 which has 2 large queen beds. We were 3 women . This had a small kitchen and a huge patio with a BBQ qrill, a high top table with 4 chairs, a coffee table with 4 seater sofas with a lite covering and also 2 lawn chairs. Great for having a drink at night and coffee in the am. On Kuhio avenue and near everything for walking. We needed a car and you have to book it ahead of time. There is parking next door and the cost is the same. Very hairy parking and having a SMALL car is an adventage.Staff very helpful, also a little eating place with good pizza. Small pool.

part of our world tour was hawaii. hotel aqua bamboo was ideally placed near to waikiki beach. they wanted 15 dollars a day for internet but after a chat gave it for free. they say here paradise is not cheap so 60 dollars a day for 2 sunbeds and a brolly was no surprise. we bought 2 chairs and a brolly from a supermarket for 60 dollars so 4 days on the beach were ok. food was good quality and plenty of it on a sunset terrace overlooking the beach was funny as sun disapeared the americans applauded .plenty to see and do we walked to diamond head a bit of a trek and climb but wonderful when we got there, we saw whales out to sea. an evening of hawaiian culture worth it.pearl harbour was an experience very surreal being above a sunken ship with i think with a 1000 dead sailors still in it . poignant moment !!! trip to see the famous surfing pipeline on north shore was good also.enjoyed hawaii had to go on to LA but wish we had more time there.

The hotel and the hotel staff made my vacation a great experience. I have stayed in many places, this place feel like Hawaii should and the staff made me feel special. The pool and the spa were refreshing after a day at the beach. The restaurant there is great and the location is perfect so I could walk to everything and I did not need a car. Two door down are three car rental places and was able to get a car for a few days to go to the north shore to watch the large waves. This was a great way to visit the island.

Stayed for 4 nights recently and my wife and I had a large room on the first level overlooking the rear courtyard and pool which provided a nice view of the palms surrounding the pool. The hotel is on Kuhio Ave which is very busy and is used by the local buses. I expect the rooms facing Kuhio Ave would be a little noisy. The hotel is only three small blocks back from the beach and is only a few hundred metres from Macys and the main shopping area. The room had a full kitchen which was a bonus and we bought some food from the local supermarket and had breakfast in the room to save some money. The room was clean and comfortable but was starting to show its age. The room air conditioner was noisy especially at night which disturbed our sleep sometimes causing us to turn it off. Complimentary coffee and tea is provided in the foyer (and in the room) which was handy to the pool area. The palms around the pool provided plenty of shade and screened some of the adjoining buildings from view and made the rear courtyard very private. The staff on the front desk were friendly and helpful and complied with our request for a room on a lower level as we wanted to use the stairs and not the lifts. The manager provided pizza slices, snacks and soft drinks on Thursday evening for the guests which is a weekly event and this was much appreciated. The hotel is good value, in a central location, close to the beach and is a good choice if a luxury beach front hotel is not required.

Excellent location in Waikiki, we got upgraded room, which spacious, very confortable and Nice!  Staff very friendly and the decoration was Hawaian style with ma y flowers.Also great views from 11 floor. I would recommend this hotel to everyone

Aqua Bamboo was highlighted in a couple of my guidebooks, and the online information supported the positive write-up. The decor and atmosphere was relaxing from the moment we walked into the lobby and were handed glasses of juice at check in. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Our room overlooked the pool courtyard and was quiet. Enjoyed having the kitchenette with microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to others.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we decided to stay at the Aqua Bamboo based on the good reviews I had read on trip advisor. Upon arrival to the Aqua Bamboo we were greeted with a smile and a warm welcome to Waikiki. The suite was emaculate, 4post bamboo king size bed, kitchenette, large bathroom with a walk in shower and a separate soaker tub and a patio with a mountain/city and partial ocean view. The hotel offers activities throughout the week such as learn how to make your own lei, social mixer with appetizers, etc. The activities are posted in the elevator for the week. The staff were super friendly, nice and knowledgable about the area and events happening around town. There is a concierge there as well if you want to book tours.The hotel overall was clean and very accessible to the main Waikiki strip, across the street there is a bus station and they do offer a courtesy shuttle to Ala Manoa Mall. It takes 2mins to walk to the beach and they have courtesy beach towels you can use. They do have a pool and pizza restaurant there if you chose to use it.The personalized welcome and thank you note and box of chocolates we received before checkout was an added bonus!Cons - no shuttle from the airport to the hotel (much like other hotels in Hawaii) and the courtesy shuttle to and from the mall takes awhile.I definitely would stay at this hotel again (length of stay was 5nights)

I booked three nights at this hotel when I went to visit my boyfriend this past weekend, and from the moment I got there everyone who worked there was very very kind and helpful! Great customer service! The parking was pretty small and kind of hard to get in to, but not a big deal. My boyfriend thought it was a nice hotel just a little on the smaller side! I really loved the pool area and the views from the room even though we never used the pool. It was literally a block away from the beach and I went to see the sun rise! Awesome! The only problem I had with it were the rooms were pretty outdated. Besides that, everything was great! I would recommend it!

This is the 4th time we have stayed here. We love the convenience & location of the hotel. We always get the same room with a full kitchen facing the pool. I jokingly ask them when they are going to put our name on the door. The room is a nice size. The bathroom is a little small but no big deal for us. I like having the kitchen so we can cook some of our meals. The staff is always pleasant as well as accommodating. We will definitely stay there on our next Honolulu trip. Many thanks to Nicole and her great staff.

Hotel is old and not very well maintained. For the most part, it is OK if you want to be close to Waikiki beach and you don't want to pay the high prices that other hotels charge. The pool was working but the area could use some improvement. Chair mats look dirty. Room is good size but has old style window a/c unit which can get loud. Location is really the best part, just one block away from Waikiki beach. You can walk everywhere including the nightlife. We stayed for the weekend and didn't need to rent a car.
user_name:
CliveNYC
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: I feel like Goldilocks who found the hotel that was 'just right'. I've stayed at really high end hotels and at those near the other end in Honolulu. This was my second stay here. It reminds me of a comfortable pair of shoes that might be a little worn. The location is perfect - off the main strip but close to everything. There are nearby restaurants, convenience-type stores, even farmers markets where you can get some inexpensive, local food - all within a short walk. There is a small restaurant on-site near the pool. There are two car rental agencies around the corner - I found it cheaper to rent by the day and avoid paying for overnight parking. There is a concierge desk in the lobby to help you plan your stay. The lobby has a calming Asian decor - nice to come in from a busy day to serenity, ice water, iced tea, and coffee - all before you go to your room. Free daily newspapers are available in the lobby. The staff are welcoming, friendly, and very helpful. Free wi-fi throughout the hotel. My room had a safe that fit my laptop, camera, and lenses easily. I had a microwave, cooktop, refrigerator, and dish sink as well as dishes and pots and pans. I found it economical to get local 'plate lunches' that gave me at least 2 meals each and eat a 'splurge' meal once a day. The room was clean and my bed was comfy. The bathroom has a non-skid tub and grab bar and good water pressure. I really like the over-toilet cabinet for storage. Good quality toiletries that smell nice too.I'll make this my home base when I return to Oahu.

We were upgraded to a two room suite, more room than my husband and I needed. The accomodations were comfortable and nicely decorated. We did not use the stove in our little kitchen but we did use the dishes, the refridge and the microwave. That helped us keep food costs down and, actually, it was quite relaxing to eat in the room.We enjoyed the pool area. It was quiet and a nice contrast to the hustle and bustle of the beach itself. Location is great. We were just about two blocks from the beach and bus stops are close by to get you any place you want to go. Staff was friendly and helpful. The are a couple of negatves. Our room on the street side of the hotel was noisy and we had to wedge the sliding glass door to keep it from banging around in the wind. The faucet or spigot in the bathroom isn't right. It was meant for a kitchen so it covered the whole basin making it awkward to use. We would definitely stay there again. The positives far outweighed the negatives.

The location of this hotel is excellent. The staff is so friendly and accommodating as well as helpful. The rooms are nice but outdated and the bathrooms are very outdated. The carpet looked a bit dirty but not terrible. We had 2 lovely bedrooms and a large flat screen TV. Parking is very limited at this hotel but right next door at the Monarch, they allow you to park for the same rate ($25--i know; it is outrageous ). Be aware that if you want to park your car in the Bamboo lot you must reserve the space when you book your room. They only have 17 spots so we parked at the Monarch one night. The other night we parked at the Bamboo. I would have given this hotel 4 stars but the bathrooms need updating. The tub had rust marks in it and rained slowly. Great full size fridge, oven and microwave which were super clean. I do recommend this hotel. Our stay was pleasant.

Staff were excellent very helpful and friendly. The complex needed some TLC. It was very tired, carpets worn in bedroom, sliding doors to balcony didn't work, air conditioner very noisy . Condom packet left at the side of the bed and a moldy cucumber in the fridge!! Location was great, but wouldn't recommend not value for money.

Aqua Bamboo was one of very few hotels that I found with three real beds (non-sofabeds) in one room. Our family consists of a couple and two adult children, so the "One Bedroom Suite with Full Kitchen" was a perfect fit for us. It was great to have a full kitchen. It was a short walk to the beach and everything you could possibly need, and they provided beach towels. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, and we were on the street side with street noise, but I sleep like a rock, so it didn't bother me.

Very dated needs a spruce up badly make sure you ask for what size bed you want otherwise they put you into a room with 2 double beds ask for 8th floor up or you are looking onto dirty rentals costs an xtra $20 p/n for a view of the court yard pool was awesome ok place for a week but no longer

Dter our bad experience & needing to find somewhere else to stay at Waikiki this wa a pleasant surprise. we were greated at the door by a lovely cool glass of pineapple juice [ just what we needed as it was VERY warm] Thefirst room we stayed in was fine but did have a noisy airconditioner & also looked out on flats next door, so we asked it it was possible to change rooms & they said no problems just pack up your things & while we were out for breakfast they moved us to a city view one, which was great. Nothing was ever a trouble to the nice "cheerful" staff.Rooms neat & tidy [ although a little older like a lot of hawaiian resorts are getting] Position was very central Keno's for breakfast just nearby & ofcourse the usual ABC store right on the corner. About 2 blocks to the beach & main shops. Every Thursday night the Manager puts on an evening for the guests & while we were eating & drinking he played hawaiian songs for us.A nice night. Lovely fresh lemon water in the Lobby plus free tea & coffee. Really couldnt fault the place. Would stay there again.

It was an absoluttly enjoyable stay!Central location with walking distance to the beach & restaurants & shops.A small but newly refurbished hotel with a lovely pool area.Small selfcontained kitchenette was a bonus.Friendly staff & amenities like beachtowels & other beach gear to borrow.I would like to stay here again

Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms have all that are needed, and were neat, tidy and clean with relatively modern decor. Close to Waikiki beach. Good value for money. Only real issue is the quality of the airconditioners - old and very noisy. Obviously a widespread problem for the hotel as reception had a good quantity of ear plugs available when we asked. Not something that should be necessary. Tree lined pool area was compact, but very comfortable. Pizza shop in pool area only accepts cash which is a little problematic for international visitors.
