This was a last minute trip due to the cyclone in South Pacific. We had stayed at this hotel before and found it a great opportunity to stay again. The room was clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. We like the extras that this hotel provides, refreshing water station, DVD's and the managers reception. We were glad we stayed here and we would stay again.

Value for money, very good. Staff and management weekly cocktail party on Thursday 10 September, no staff or management to be seen.Hotel has restaurant for pizza however you cannot charge back to your room and they do not accept credit cards.My wife's birthday and I preordered champagne. It was delivered but no ice bucket son we waited a few hours whilst it got cold.We must hVe been the on,y people at the lovely swimming pool without tattoos.Would we return, probably not. Pay an additional $100 per night and those little nuisance items would not have occurred. And finally, the hotel has old style a/ c which is soooo noisy.

We stayed at this hotel in August/2015. We booked with Expedia and wrote in our comments that we were three people. We have a 17 year old son. We required two double beds and preferably a view of the courtyard. When we got to the hotel the receptionist was surprised we were three people. I showed her a copy of the comments I sent a few months ago. She said their hotel did not receive information from Expedia. Fair enough, however we still need a room with two double beds. It was apparent the hotel was not full. The receptionist tried to charge us $40.00 US per night extra. I stated that it did not seem fair as I had in good faith let the hotel know that we were 3 travelers. The receptionist then assigned us a room with two double beds that faced a tenement building next door. We were greeted with a view of balconies filled with junk such as old mattresses, old chairs stacked-up - you get the picture. The apartment building was maybe 20 feet from our balcony. We had a perfect view of all that was going on in the next building. The building had three floors. We were put on the third floor. The hotel has 9 floors. The receptionist could have put us higher up. I was disappointed and would not recommend this hotel at all. I found the receptionist who dealt with us on arrival was rude and made us look like we are liars? Anyway this is not what one imagines from a Hawaii hotel. Nothing redeeming about this hotel. I would not recommend it.

We returned for another vacation stay to Aqua Bamboo Waikiki and cannot wait to return again!From the moment we arrived at the fornt desk to the moment we left our experience of the service, standard of accomodation and amenities/facilities was absolutely outstanding.Our room was serviced daily by 12.00 pm midday to a very high standard of cleanliness including replacement of Kitchen/Bathroom items.The Front Desk staff are very friendly, efficient and knowledgeable/helpful - especially Raymond, Zenie and Lokahi.The location could not be better - just one street away from Waikiki Beach, 5 minutes walk to the nearest ABC Store (filling most basic traveller needs) and with bus stop across the road to go to the Ala Moana Center (largest shopping center in the Southern Hemisphere) or 5 minutes walk on the same side of the road to take a bus to say the Kahala Mall for shopping.A small token of the appreciation for you choosing to stay at this Hotel is that when you check into your room their is a small box of Macademia chololates with a personal thank you letter from the General Manager, Nicole, and, then, a day or so before you checkout there is the same again. We found this to be a very nice, unintrusive way of thanking us and ensuring that we return again!This Hotel even has a 'Bamboozle' evening every Thursday, by the pool/spa, between 4.30 pm and 5.30 pm. Food is provided together with the Hotel's special cocktail and they have an entertainer playing appropriate music. This is a good opportunity for Hotel guests to unwind and enjoy the Hotel's generous hospitality whilst getting to know other Hotel guests.We cannot speak highly enough of this Hotel - it is peaceful, affordable and very conveniently located slightly away from the bustle of the main street - Kalakaua Avenue.We are looking forward to our next stay at this Hotel in January of 2016.Many grateful thanks and Mahalo to the Management and Staff of Aqua Bamboo Waikiki.Aloha from Janet and Richard Lambert

was impressed with the foyer and the staff the room was clean and well pressented, the shower tap was broken to turn off the hotwater but was fixed next day when the house staff serviced the room. will return again as it is very well priced and central to everything, if one thing could be improved it would be to take bookings for the shuttle waited for nearly 2 hrs and every shuttle that came was full had to catch the bus and then waited for return shuttle for ever gave up and caught the $2 trolley home, the hotel did credit us the service fee for the day though .

The hotel is in an excellent location not far from the beach. However I found the accommodation rather substandard. Our room was on the 8th Floor on the Kuhio Ave side, very noisey traffic and the noise from air conditioning units was almost deafening at times. We opted for a one bedroom suite with full kitchen. The furniture and the appliances in the suite were way too big for the space. Also most the furniture was very worn and chipped and just looking rather grubby. All the staff I came across were excellent. Even though I was aware of the $15 hospitality fee per day charge. I feel that this should not be charged, you are not a resort not even close. Complimentary Wifi, Tea, coffee & water in the lobby are all basics in all hotels these days. You offered a shuttle service to a shopping centre and the use of pool floatation toys, beach towels etc and throw a nice cocktail party once a week for the guests and charge $15 per day. I did not feel comfortable with this charge and think you may need to rethink it.

The hotel is nice. The rooms are clean and pleasantly appointed. The bathroom was a bit dated in some respects (for instance old tub but updated vanity). But the staff were friendly and helpful and it is just a couple blocks from the beach. Considering the price, it's a pretty good deal. We didn't use the pool, but the space was secluded and looked inviting. All in all we would go back for the location and clean rooms.

I had a horrible experience at Courtyard Marriott and with Expedia, then I found this hotel....I love it, and I will never stay anywhere else again!! Great prices, great rooms, wonderful everything!!!

We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 8th floor. Room had a great new galleykitchen with full fridge and stove which was great for keeping meal expenses low. The kids loved the free dvd movies. Pool area was beautiful and tranquil and there was almost always a cabana open when we wanted one. Fantastic location very close to beach and walkable to Zoo. A bunch of affordable (and good) eating spots within a block or so. Very mellow and laid back vibe here. Only minor issue was the pool is a little cold. Overall we had an awesome stay.

Great location . Room and staff were great. Was very noisy though. They have a driveway right out front which is great when checking in and out.mellow themed place. Clean but wish the windows were bit thicker for noise.......I would ask to stay on a higher floor as may help cut out noise

Pluses:(1) Loved the space we had in our room on Level 10(2) bedroom has two double beds and good sized tv. bifolding doors if you want to chill in the lounge while others are sleeping. my boy loved the PlayStation 4.(3) lounge had small work desk & chair & corner unit/shelf with mounted small tv, dvd platyer(4) small kitchen off the lounge with small fridge/freezer, cooking facilities & utensils, table and two chairs(5) bathroom especially good with separate shower as well as another shower over bath(6) swimming pool ok. covered pool side bed thingys are nice to relax/sleep onMinus: (1) porterage fee automatically included when booking made but not sure we got any value for this fee as no offer was made by the porters to carry all our bags to/from our room on arrival/leaving(2) the $15 fee for daily newspaper, internet, phone local calls, movies/games, apples, lemon water, tea/coffee, etc is really good value. however, i wish this was just included in the overall room rate when the room was booked.(3) restaurant is only a pizza place. thought this may have been a restaurant which at least served breakfast/lunch... and i don't mean pizza.summary:overall i loved the place and totally recommend it

So glad we found the Aqua Bamboo in Waikiki! We actually were book for three nights at another hotel, but due to some nightmarish issues, we were able to locate new, MUCH improved lodging at the Aqua Bamboo. I relaxed the moment I walked into the tranquil, beautiful lobby. The decor throughout the hotel exuded a real Aloha charm. Our room was on the smaller side, but included a kitchenette. The pool-area was shady, tropical, and offered all kinds of poolside seating options including table and chairs, loungers, and family-sized cabanas with padded couches. The hotel also had an onsite pizza parlor (which we didn't eat at), DVD-borrowing system (which we did use, and found to have current movies on hand), and free shuttle to Ala Moana mall (shuttle tended to have a 45 min wait, but the drivers were great, and they let us get off at other stops). Aqua Bamboo was the perfect place to stay in Waikiki, and we are so glad we found it!

The room was clean. The staff was friendly. It is near the Waikiki beach, restaurants and gift shops. We parked in the next hotel which was not convenient. We had the street view. It is a nice boutique hotel. It was a good price for an average service.

Stayed here our first stay in Hawaii. Location was ok. Facilities were average. The room wasnt great as they weren't the cleanest and they haven't been maintained that well. The concierge wasn't helpful at all when we asked for directions around the island. Think he wanted to sleep instead of deal with tourists. Wouldn't and haven't stayed here since.

One night stay at the ABW. Staff is very pleasant and helpful. Our room was clean and tidy but on the small side. Hotel is a bit dated but there is evidence that management is working hard to keep things right.I would not hesitate to stay again. Short two block walk to the beach.

My boyfriend was visiting Hawaii and my grandma wanted to treat us to a few nights in Waikiki. This hotel exceeded all expectations! The Asian inspired decor is beautiful, if a little faded, which somehow just adds to the personality of this cute place. On checkin, we were upgraded to a Suite for free! This was a huge surprise and a great add on as we had only booked the day before. The room was clean, and spacious, and management left us a small box of chocolate which was great. The room was beautiful and the small kitchenette helped lower costs for Waikiki as we cooked a lot. Try location is a minutes walk from the beach - perfect.But the pool was a little slice of paradise!

Everyone on the staff were very courtiuos and helpful. Rooms showed sign of age and were not big but were very clean. Housing keeping was very good. Pool area and pool were small but quaint great place tp relax after a day at the beach. Located 10 minutes from the beach. Beach chairs and some floating devices are avaible for guest use on the beach. If you are looking for an affordable place to sleep and do not need to have all the extras the this is the place to stay.Thanks to all the staff for making our stay in Waikiki a pleaseant one.

We stayed here 3 nights 10 days ago. Small but nicely decorated, clean but older, renovated room and bathroom. Fabulous pool lounge area, loved the salt water and that it was open a bit later! Our balcony door in room 708 didn't shut or lock properly but we were on the 7th floor so it wasn't a problem. The a/c worked but dripped all over the dresser top, but it didn't affect us. Bed and pillows were comfortable, Close walk to multiple ABC stores.Favorite part about the hotel other than location (literally 2-3 blocks from the beach!) was that you can borrow a couple of the low-slung beach chairs for the day or evening and its really nice to have them on the beach wherever you set up camp. The pool/beach towels were in decent repair and did the job.Least favorite part- we were told in an email prior to arrival that parking was available but that it may be right next door at the sister property, which was not a problem as it was practically the same driveway. However, when we checked in (late check-in, which we also confirmed with the hotel prior via email) the garage next door was also full. So past midnight, after working a full day shift and then flying 6 hours to get there, we had to walk 3-4 blocks then back to park in a garage that was cash only, and the rest of our stay any time we wanted to park we were unable to get access to the garage next door as it was still full. Bonus is, I guess we got some extra exercise and saved a few bucks as it was "only" $20 at the other garage. Would have given our stay a 5 star review had we been able to park at least next door, we spent a lot of our trip walking to and from the garage when we only needed to stop and shower quickly before dinner, etc.Overall we were pretty pleased with our stay, and would for sure recommend it and stay again.

Upon checkin we were greeted warmly and received great treatment from the front desk and bell hop. The property is showing signs of its age around the edges, and you can see signs of wear on the cabinets, door jambs, etc. But the rooms are fresh and updated, and unique in the fact that they have 2 separate bedrooms and kitchenette. My disappointment is that our room was on 3rd floor, right on Kuhio St, a very active street with buses, motorcycles, ambulances, you name it. The sliding doors must be from the 1960's as they are obviously single paned...you can hear every noise from the street thru the windows. The only saving grace is the noise from the AC units which slightly drowns-out the street noise. I asked to be moved to room on the courtyard side but no rooms like ours available on that side. Too bad..this little hotel would have been a great find were it not for our noisy night.

Had room 510. Really spacious, full kitchen.not excessively noisy by waikiki/ honolulu standards.highly recommended. Good personal service. Much more personal than the big hotels.lovely pool/outside lounging area. We stayed here on 2 occasions for a total of 7 nights. First on third floor then on 5th. Try to get room facing pool.

We (2 adults and 2 teenagers) stayed at Aqua Bamboo for a little over 2 weeks in a 1 bedroom suite with full kitchen and can't speak highly enough about the hotel. Yes it's not 5 star, but because of it's size and location, you don't need all the bells and whistles of the bigger hotels. Some people may not like the street noise but to be honest it never bothered us at all. If you're looking for peace and quiet, you certainly won't get that at one of the big hotels and really, Waikiki probably isn't for you. Maybe try Maui or another island.We found booking directly with the hotel gave us the best price. Kimari from the Aqua Bamboo was just fantastic throughout the whole process.The hotel is 2 blocks back from Kalakaua Ave and is less than a 2 minute walk to the beach. The pool area is just perfect - a real little oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, The advantage of it being a small hotel is that the pool area is seldom busy and you can relax quite easily.Service from staff was excellent and everyone is friendly and welcoming. The US$15 per day Resort Fee is worth it for the use of the WiFi (both in room and pool side) and the endless supply of towels for use by the pool or the beach.We are already planning a return trip and we will be staying at Aqua Bamboo again without any hesitation.Mahalo Aqua Bamboo!!

We stayed in a one bedroom apartment at the Aqua Bamboo (2 adults, 2 children aged 14 and 11) for 2 nights.We have previously stayed here as it is in a great location, only a couple of blocks back from the beach and close to just about everything in Waikiki. The building is showing its age, it is not 5 star, but if you are looking for a reasonably priced placed to stay it is a good choice. It has for us the following advantages over similarly priced hotel rooms:1. You get an apartment with a well equipped kitchenette. It slept the 4 of us comfortably.2. You can use their boogie boards and floating devices at the beach, saving on rental costs at the beach. They also offer free DVD hire from the Lobby.3. There are laundry facilities - washing machines and clothes dryers.4. Good wifi which extends to the pool area.Some other reviews have complained about the noise of the air conditioners at night. None of our family had a problem with this and we ran the aircon all night.

We loved our room during our recent 3 night stay (July 2015). We had an upgraded room on the tenth floor, with several small but openable balconies and even a bamboo waterfall in our room! The staff was extremely helpful in setting up rides to activities and the airport. One bellman in particular went out of his way to get us the cheapest ride possible to Pearl Harbor. One note, we were traveling with a big group and had three rooms between us. Ours was amazing. Another room was on the fifth floor and faced the pool. The last was a privately owned unit that had been rented on Air B&B on the third floor. All three rooms had completely different layouts and quality levels. The privately owned unit had not been upgraded in a while and had some issues with too much furniture. The room on the fifth floor, rented through hotels.com was much better, but more of a basic, clean hotel room. I would definitely recommend trying to get an upgraded unit!

Loved this place.Location was great. Only a five minute walk to the beach. Pool area was fantastic, loved the little outdoor huts they had by the pool. My husband & I used them a couple of times to read a book & relax (and hubby even fell asleep!). Our room was clean & modern but still had that Hawaiian feel. It was a small room but as it was just the 2 of us, it was ok. The rooms also had a small kitchen with a table & chairs as well as a mini fridge & microwave which came in handy. The staff were extremely helpful - we booked a couple of tours with them & had no problems. Also, loved the cool drinks they would provide on a daily basis in the foyer. After a long day out shopping, they really were refreshing.As we were celebrating our anniversary, we found come chocolates & beautiful Lei's awaiting us in our room. Was a lovely touch that made it all the more special.Thank you for a wonderful stay! Will definitely come back again.

I absolutely loved our stay at the Aqua Bamboo. The service was fantastic. I took my mother to Hawaii for our very first time for mothers day along with my nieces and sister. The only thing that bothered me was that online it said that we could all stay in the same room since my nieces are babies but apparently theres a max of two people per room and that babies and small children were included in this. So I ended up having to pay for two rooms. However, the kind receptionist was willing to upgrade us to the penthouse at discounted price so my family could all stay together. The suite we stayed in was absolutely beautiful and clean and very spacious. It was very quiet up there and the staff were kind enough to help us take our bags up to the top floor. I was worried for the relatively cheap price the hotel was going to be shabby but it was very modern, clean, and well maintained. The best part about the hotel was that it was within a five minute walk to everything. We were able to walk to Kuhio beach every morning and grab a bite to eat and do some shopping all within just a short walk. I was extremely happy with our stay and plan on staying there again.
user_name:
Jennifer P
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: This small hotel welcomes you with friendly staff and a lovely, warm, well decorated foyer. The rooms are quiet and tho not all have ocean views, many other hotels would not as well, given the amount of high rises in the area. Certainly not a distraction. Rooms are decorated tastefully with bamboo furniture and pictures on the walls. Lots of added extras, amenities replenished daily, coffee maker, fridge and kitchenettes to give you the opportunity to prepare meals in the room. Very comfortable beds with plenty of pillows! The area around the small pool is well maintained and a relaxing space after a day's outing. The location is perfect for whatever you choose to do. Walking distance to most places.My only criticism, I stayed on 2 separate occasions and on the 2nd occasion the air con in my room was very noisy (looks like an old one). I simply turned it off at night to sleep. In the first room the air con was very quiet.Will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki. Thank you to all staff members for making me feel so welcome. Mahalo

At the Aqua Bamboo everyone treated us very great. The pool and jacuzzi were very nice a clean and the room was great. Unlimited dvd/game rentals really helped when we were trying to kill time. Nothing I could say about this trip would be a negative experience. Thank you for such a great stay!

Friendly service, great rooms, comfy beds, good location. Nice quiet little pool. Free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre. Free dvd rentals includes new releases. No wifi in rooms, only downstairs in reception. You need to pay for an upgrade if you want a view of the pool. We could not use our balcony at all because we looked directly into the back balconies of a poor block of units. Bit of a nuisance having to ask for a key from reception when you wanted to use the toilet in the swimming pool area.

This is our third visit to Waikiki. This time we stayed at the Aqua Bamboo before and after our cruise around the Islands. Our stay was excellent. The facility itself is showing its age a bit and could use a bit of a refresh in places, but otherwise it was great. The location is superb, only a 5-minute walk to the beach and surrounded by a wide variety of eating establishments - from upscale to "unique". The pool area is a real oasis and we spent much of our time just relaxing there. And because the rooms are really suites, there is lots of space and we had the flexibility of eating in when we wanted to. But the real attraction of this hotel is the staff. I have never dealt with a friendlier or more accommodating group of people. They were quick to take care of our needs (for example, we showed up at 9:15 AM after our cruise and they had us into our suite by 11 AM!) and great at giving helpful advice and guidance. We never ran into a glum face. Well done Aqua Bamboo staff! We would definitely stay there again.

The location of this hotel was amazing. Real close to everything...shops, restaurants and the beach. Prices were as expected in that area. Concierges were great too. The room was perfect for the two of us.

We have stayed in this vacation rental several times already and never had any issues. The owner of the condo is really nice and even that one time we missed our flight connection and arrived 6hrs later than planned, he would greet us personally at 3am local time. The condo is much cheaper than the hotel rooms and you can use all hotel amenities as well (e.g. pool, business center). The studio is equipped with 2 queen beds and a kitchenette which sleeps up to 4. The condo is located towards the end of Waikiki, behind International Marketplace.

Definitely one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. The outdoor/pool area is gorgeous & our room was lovely & clean. The staff are very accommodating to your needs & more than willing to help you out with any questions you may have. My travel agent helped me find an affordable hotel for our family so I was very suprised at how nice it is, & although it is not right on the beach it is only a couple of minutes walk . I would definitely stay here again ! Thank you aqua bamboo staff we had a great time !

Perfect stay for our little vacation... Close to the beach and shopping..only thing is i cant figure out how to use the a/c but i realized JUST OPEN THE WINDOWS!!! who needs a/c at night in hawaii!!! Easy to book and hector was really helpful... we got everything done through email.. Thank you so much for making our vacation smooth and hassle free... Till next time Mahalo :)

My son and I stayed in a one bedroom suite. There was a bedroom with a queen bed, bathroom, small kitchen, two twin beds and a dinette in the main living area. The kitchen is equipped with all you really need. There is an ABC market very close so you can stock up your fridge. The pool is a little small, but very nice. There is an evening managers reception with cocktails that is nice. If possible, I would avoid rooms that face the street to avoid hearing the bus run up and down the street all night. You can't open your windows without hearing the noise. Very economical choice and the staff is very friendly and helpful. It could use a little updating but it is still very nice. They will deliver a limited continental breakfast to your room every morning complimentary, yogurt, pastries and juice.

This was a stay booked on Hotwire.com so we didn't know what we were getting but we are so thrilled, we will be back. Older apartments that have been converted to a hotel so small kitchenette, comfy KS bed, great pillows, filtered water in lobby, intimate and attractive pool area and of course, the LovinOven for thin Crust pizza right on sight. Chairs and towel sign out for the beach.2 blocks off the beach with the Food Pantry right out the front door to the left. Just so convenient. Only complaint is the air conditioners are old and very very loud.Staff was wonderful, courteous and helpful every single time. Don't think I held a door the entire trip!

The Aqua Bamboo is similar to several of the other Aqua properties. This is a older property and could use a facelift. That said the Aqua Bamboo has a Very Good location and the Staff could not be nicer and more helpful!! The room has everything you need - Refrigerator, Microwave, Air, Safe, Hair Dryer, etc. The Wi-Fi works Great in the room and is included in the $15 per day Resort Fee (these fees still irritate me but every hotel chain is catching to this easy revenue stream for things that used to be free). Parking was sold out so they accommodated me at their property next door ($25 per night). My room also had THREE little lanais which were a pleasant surprise. Also the small touch of gratis Chocolate Macadamia Nuts was thoughtful. All in all a good stay in Waikiki. And yes - I would stay again...

Clean, good service, friendly, conveniently located. air conditioned but balcony door for fresh air or breeze. Just 2 blocks from beach and shopping area.Only problem is noise from roadway. From sixth floor you hear every bus and it's on a main bus route. Also can hear people talking below AND that's with the doors closed. Some double-glazing soundproofing glass would help.There was no noise from other rooms or lifts or other bathrooms.

I was here during the weekend of May 2nd, 2015. This hotel is in very nice location -- everything is within walking distance. The main part of Waikiki beach area is within walking distance -- it is around 5 mins walk, basically two to three blocks away. Right across the street there are lots of shops. The rooms are neat and clean. They provide wi-fi -- it works well in the room. The staff in the front are very friendly and helpful. The rooms in the upper floor are better from street noise point of view. The hotel is next to the bus stoppage area. From airport to hotel and vice-versa I used the bus. Also to go to Diamond Head I used the bus service. I found it very convenient, I did not have to have car and go through the parking problem in Waikiki beach area..

Location was great and rooms were modern with some areas required updating but overall clean and a good standard. They charge a resort fee and it's a flat rate regardless of your stay which we didn't take everything to full advantaged with the DVDs, sauna, pool and wifi. Overall look of hotel needs some work and pool was freezing

Very nice property, well maintained with beautiful garden pool area. The location is in the heart of Waikiki with on site parking even free valet. The apartment was completely remodeled with separate kitchen and closet areas. Three decks with lovely views and ventilation. The staff and the maid service were excellent. Nice place to relax after a busy day of surfing in Waikiki.

I stayed at Aqua Bamboo for five days. First of all I was impressed by the sincere concern and fast replies of the hotel starting from the reservation process. I was welcomed warmly when I arrive at the hotel. I had the room as I requested and I was amazed by the view. The decoration of the room was really good. The best point of the hotel is that it's closed to the beach, public transport. They have free shuttle to Ala Moana during the day.All in all, I had a great time at Aqua Bamboo and I would also like to thank Nicole Yoshimoto for making my experience with the hotel even greater. Mahalo for everything

We stayed here on our recent trip to the Islands. The lobby is nice, with a nice décor. They have elevators for your ease to your accommodations. Our room was old and could use some repair work. We had two patio doors and a wooden door to the balconies. All of these doors rattled during high wind periods. The room was small but was enough for the little time we spent there. The hotel staff was very helpful with information. We used the concierge for information. Some information was correct, other information not as accurate. The hotel has a surcharge for use of certain things. This included wi-fi which was spotty at best. You had one setting for your room and another for the lobby and pool areas. They offer a shuttle service which we only could use for 3 trips. The service is slow and does cover all places you may want to travel to. One night we waited and the shuttle never came by. There is no restaurant on the property. They have a place that makes pizzas between 4 and 9 pm every day except Tuesday. No liquor or other food items at this location. The room air conditioner was very hard to operate. The remote control worked some of the time, but it usually took several tries to change the settings.

Hubby and I really enjoyed our stay at this boutique hotel. Room was very clean, comfy bed decorated with fresh flowers which instantly gets you into the Hawaiian feel. Good security in a safe area, no one would argue with the night security guard, made us feel so welcome and safe. Reception staff gave us very useful info and were all so nice. Free shuttle bus takes you around town. Many restaurants, pubs and shops close and handy. On our last night we ate in at the pizza restaurant next to their pool, excellent pizzas and byo wine, suggest you book a table as the food is so good and fills up quick, nice romantic setting. We will definately stay here next time. Thanks to managers and staff.

We were in a King bed room with full kitchen. The building is very well maintained. The head housekeeper (forgot name)? Madelyne? also helped you learn how to make Lei's at the Managers Reception on Thursday night. The music, food, and Bamboozle drink at Managers reception on Thurs night is excellent. One of the female managers did a hula dance at poolside.The stay was perfect. It is a short walk to an ABC store to get any groceries, and a short walk to the beach. They offer free beach chairs to use and beach towels. We felt completely safe and had a great time. There is a safe in the room and private balconies. The birds were delightful. Had a view of the poolside area which offers a tropical setting. We would definitely stay there again.

Great place to stay in heart of Waikiki. Just a couple short blocks to the beach and lots of food and shopping options to choose from. Parking is one of the best features -- you can get in and out of the garage in about a minute -- or have the valet park your car at same price. This really does make a difference, especially if you are a business traveler. The staff is very friendly -- just finished my third trip to Aqua Bamboo Waikiki and they always remember me. It's nice to feel welcome in this small hotel. This is an older hotel that is very well maintained -- it has character in a GOOD way!

I booked my room through Trip Advisor. It was a last-minute deal for only $124 total. The room was adequate. The amenities were okay: fridge, microwave, coffeepot, and about what I expected. The shower control didn't work, so I could only get a weak trickle. The remote for the AC didn't work, but I was able to operate it manually. They hadn't activated the room-specific wifi, but I was able to tap into another room's wifi. When I checked out, I told the clerk about these problems, and he seemed totally indifferent. He didn't even offer the routine "we regret your inconvenience" line. But the main reason I'm giving them a poor review is that the clerk tried to charge me an additional $15 "activity fee," on top of what I'd already paid through Trip Advisor. I asked him what this fee was for, and he said "wifi and stuff." There was no mention of this fee when I booked the room. To the contrary, the Tingo booking confirmation made it clear that $124 was going to be my total cost, including taxes and activities. The clerk asked to see my booking confirmation, which I showed him on my phone. He then ruminated over this a bit, and finally announced that he would "waive" the fee, as if he was doing me a favor.

We're on our last day here at the Bamboo Aqua Hotel. We first had a condo booked for our 11-day trip but the place we booked was far off Waikiki and they weren't being straight forward about it on their booking website so after arriving, we decided to find another place to stay. We looked around and called a few places, Bamboo was able to give us the best rate. We came in and spoke with Ian at the front desk. Ian was extremely helpful and nice, he went out if his way (calling his boss) to gave us the rate that we were promised earlier (when we called and spoke to a female receptionist but unfortunately she was off by the time we got there). Besides Ian, there was another employee who helped us with our luggages. His name is Anthony, he always wears glasses, tall guy, he was also very nice and helpful cause he helped us look at a few options for parking garage (we have a rental).Over all I am very happy with the staff service (front desk, bell man, house keepers). The only one I have complain about is the front desk employee who works at night. He's an older guy, grey hair. I've stayed here 10 days and probably seen him about 7 times. And I totally understand sometimes you have a bad day and you just can't be your best self to guests.... But it seems like he never has a good day cause he's always very grumpy. And just last night, when we called front desk and asked if they could call us a cab, he asked where we were going and then told my husband, "You probably better off just walk for a bit and wave them down cause it takes awhile if you call"..... Ok? First of all if we wanted to walk and wave we would have done it in the first place. There's a reason why we didn't do that. Anyway I called the cab company myself and one arrived only 10 minutes later. But like I said, besides the grumpy & unhelpful front desk person who mostly works at night, I am very happy with my stay here. And will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.And we got a little departure gift from them! :) very sweet.

We were staying with a group and wanted to book a few nights away. We found this hotel on a budget and it was a great find ticked away. Central location. Close to beach and good pool atmosphere. Would visit again for sure. We would recommend this if you are not looking for a fancy high end hotel!

I recently returned to Aqua Bamboo (3rd time)- I love the 'not for the masses' low-key vibe. The location couldn't be better, we walked and bussed everywhere! Restaurants, grocery store are within a block, and the beach is two blocks away. Loved having a kitchen and eating breakfast every morning on our balcony. Free DVDS, beach towels and chairs and very friendly and helpful staff! I will return for sure!

The hotel has older decor with lots of wood and bamboo decor. The hotel and grounds were very nice clean. The hotel staff were very helpful. I appreciated the free chairs and beach towels for use at Waikiki beach.

The room was small but clean with a kitchenette, fridge & microwave. We did our grocery shopping at the Food Pantry just down the street and saved by eating breakfast in our room every morning. Our room had a little patio that overlooked an apartment complex and car rental lot. It didn't matter to us since we were out and about all day anyway. Our air conditioner was a bit flakey and could not be adjusted using the remote control. My wife slipped in the bathtub which bruised her arm and caused a bump on her head. The tub needs to be re-treated with more of the non-slip thingy. Other than that, our room was ok. The location was very good; we were near Kings Village and the Hyatt which had a farmer's market just about every night. A shuttle runs to all aqua hotels and is a great way to get to Ala Moana Mall! Fast WiFi in the room! Although there were minor issues, the Aqua Bamboo was a nice, little place to stay.

I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki from 8-14 March 2015 whilst in Oahu on the recommendation of my travel agent. I was impressed with the staff and their efficiency in helping me check-in, book tours, find restaurants and attractions and check-out. The other guests were also quite friendly and easy to talk to.I had Room 1206 which is a corner room on the top floor over-looking the pool and courtyard that came with a mini-fridge, microwave and supplies for tea and coffee. I liked the fact that it had two sliding-glass doors so I could open both and get a pleasant cross-breeze through the room during the day.I loved the location of the hotel on Kuhio Avenue just a close two blocks away from Waikiki Beach and the main shopping area. There were good restaurants close by along with the pizzeria in the courtyard and all public transport was within comfortable walking distance too.The only minor flaw to the room was the noisy air-conditioner and trying to figure out the remote control, but I had ear plugs and got the hang of the controller by the end of the week so just minor things. Please note that there is a $15 add-on amenity fee, but I think it's worth it and includes pool towels, beach chairs, wifi, shuttle access and more, so adjust your budget accordingly.

Just returned from a week at the Hotel. Was very happy, the staff were amazing, nothing too much trouble. Just love the complimentary offering in the foyer of Hot Tea, Cold Water and Lemonade, coffee at a $1 so much appreciated after being out shopping or on a tour to come back and be able to help oneself to a drink. Unfortunately, some visitors are abusing this privledge so please don't spoil this wonderful service for everyone else!Loved the Spa and the Pizza Hut was nice to sit around the pool and enjoy a meal.The room was clean and most comfortable with a great supply of kitchen items if one wanted to use the Microwave and eat in for a change . Had a front room facing Kuhio Street, a little noisy but nothing that worried me too much.Thanks to Raymond for his help and the other gentleman who kindly undid the locks on my suitcase after it they had been mangled by the customs and I had TSA locks on my case so wasn't happy there!Bus service outside the door and a short walk to the beach and shops.Thank You Aqua Bamboo for a wonderful stay if I return shall stay with you again.

The Aqua Bamboo hotel was a very nice stay for the price. It is very quaint, but the room we had was well cared for and very spacious. We booked at the last minute and they upgraded us to a suite. My only complaints would be that 1) the air conditioners in both rooms were broken, in that one did not turn on at all and the other only pushed out hot air. 2) There was only a small pizza cafe as part of the hotel that had odd hours and was very overpriced. 3) We asked for a good place to get food, and they sent us down to the Waikiki strip where the wait times were ridiculous and everything was overpriced. I would have liked better recommendations for the area. Overall though, they stay was quite nice. They offer complimentary Wi-Fi, there was a pool, free movie rentals, and it was conveniently located.

My wife and I stayed at this fantastic hotel in Waikiki from March 16 to March 30, 2015. Transfer from airport to hotel - We received a wonderful transfer shuttle ride from the Honolulu airport to the Aqua Bamboo hotel in Waikiki and the ride took about 35 minutes. Please keep in mind that even though the actual distance is about 10 miles, traffic is a huge issue in Honolulu/Waikiki. So prepare for longer times while travelling via bus/shuttle/car on the island of Oahu. The driver was excellent and very organized.Check-In - Upon arrival at the Aqua Bamboo hotel in downtown Waikiki we noticed that it is a smaller hotel (12 floors) and only 6 rooms per floor. But when we opened the front doors we found it very clean and first thoughts were that it was perfect for what we were looking for (i.e. a smaller boutique hotel that reflects the Hawaiian culture). There was bamboo everywhere! The staff and concierge were fabulous and welcomed us with almost open arms :). We had booked our vacation with WestJet vacations and contacted the hotel about a month prior to our visit and wanted to upgrade to the One bedroom suite with Kitchenette. We paid the hotel directly for the upgrade ($20 per night extra fee) at the time of check-in. Also note that about 50% of the hotels in Waikiki charge a tourist or resort fee of anywhere from $15 per night to $35 per night depending on the hotel. The Aqua Bamboo charges $15 per night for this fee. We knew about this previously so it was not a shock to us at all. Just be prepared for this extra fee! The concierge took us up to our lovely room (room 1104) which was huge! Room (one bedroom suite with kitchenette)- There is a separate bedroom (king bed) with patio doors to the balcony with two chairs on it with an ocean view. A larger TV and PlayStation 3 (for movies and game rentals...free). The bed posts and rails are bamboo and very unique, not modern at all, which was important to us on our vacation. There is a living/family room area with a bar/fridge and another set of patio doors that showed a view of Kuhio Street. The bathroom was huge with a deep tub and a lovely glass shower stall. Double sink and a toilet. There was a kitchen area with stove, cupboards, sink, table, chairs etc. and yet another patio door with another view of Kuhio Street. The large closet houses a safe which we loved. You can use a credit card to open/close the safe as needed (no charge for this). All in all the room was perfect for our needs and expectations! Well done Aqua Bamboo.Pool - There is a smaller pool area in the back area of the hotel. Don't expect any sun tanning until about 11:30am and the sun lasts until about 3:30pm. The pool is small/quaint and very clean. There is a small waterfall at the shallow end of the pool that was a nice addition. There are 10 large lounge chairs around the pool and about 5 tables with umbrellas and chairs. There is also two large covered areas for those who get burned in the sun (myself hehe). Adjacent to the pool is a wonderful pizza cafe called The Lovin' Oven. The pizza from here is old school (stone cooked and thin crust). We didn't actually buy a pizza from here, but we talked to several people who did and they give it a very good to excellent rating. The pizzas were pricey though at $25 to $30 each for a 16". But if you like this type of pizza I am sure it is well worth trying it out. There is a manger's reception each Thursday evening from 4:30 to 5:30pm at the poolside where there is a singer with a Ukulele and free pizza from the Lovin' Oven and free Bamboozle's (an Aqua Bamboo alcoholic drink...great stuff) and smaller appetizer type treats. All and all very impressed with the pool area from 12pm to about 3pm for sunning each day.Extras - There is wifi in each room (a separate router in each room) so connections were pretty fast (I timed in 10 to 12 mbps several days). However there were times when the router needed to be power cycled (turned off , then on again) to improve speed. There is central wifi in the lobby and the pool area as well. All wifi is free (at least for our package). There is a PS3 in your room with free rentals (you get a card at the front desk upon check in) for renting movies and PS3 games from a machine in the back of the lobby area. You also get a beach towel card for free and there is a water and lemonade stand near the poolside doors. There is a free Waikiki shuttle (with an ipad at the front desk showing where the shuttle is) from the hotel to the Ala Moana shopping centre. You could walk to the shopping mall, but it is a 1 hour beautiful walk.Check-out - Check out was simple and there were no hidden surprises. The staff were excellent and very helpful. My wife and I celebrated her birthday and our wedding anniversary while were we were there. For both days I contacted the front desk and they arranged for extra flowers on the bed and for champagne and chocolate macadamia nuts....very classy and beautiful!Overall - I give this boutique type hotel a perfect 5 star rating. My wife and I will be returning next April for another two weeks stay for sure! Great job to the staff for making this hotel everything we could ever hope for on our vacation to Hawaii!If you are the type that like a modern type of hotel, don't look here! If you like old school Hawaiian charm and flavour then this is your hotel. There is none better in Waikiki for the charm and quaintness!Great job Aqua Bamboo Waikiki!From your Canadian friends in Winnipeg!

The lady at reception let us check in first thing in the morning, hours before the usual check-in time. This was so kind and considerate of her. We'd been traveling all night (just off a 9-hour flight from Brisbane), and were dreading having to stay awake until 3 pm. I'd stay at this hotel again. We were extremely comfortable, the location is great, and as I said, the staff were incredibly nice.

We have stayed at the Aqua Bamboo three times in the past five years. While there may be nice hotels in Waikiki, for the value and location we have found none better. The staff is amazing, starting with Nicole (the hotel manager). Everywhere we need to go within Waikiki is within easy walking distance. If you have a rental car be sure to pre-book your parking with the hotel!
user_name:
Richard S
Oakland, California, United States

review_body: My husband and I had the misfortune to stay at the Aqua Bamboo in Honolulu from March 9, 2015 – March 17, 2015. I booked it online on the recommendation of a good friend who goes to Honolulu every year for five weeks in November and who also ran her own B and B in Vancouver for over 20 years. I know from listening to her explain the standard that she had to have her rental suite that room 708 in the Aqua Bamboo on Kuhio Street would never ever pass a Canadian Health or Tourist Board inspection.My husband went out for a coffee, even though there were facilities to make one in the room, on the last day of our stay. Upon his return he chatted with an American couple that were checking out and learned that this was a “Condo/Hotel” not a real hotel. The couple own one of the suites and they said that their unit is lovely.I have never heard of this type of rental and would warn others about checking to see if the place you are considering is in this category.As soon as we walked into the room 708, I was stunned. I thought, what was Jane thinking to think that we would enjoy this dump?” We asked to change rooms but the woman on the desk said I had booked that room and couldn’t change it. It certainly did not look like the room I thought I had booked online. I saw a nice looking room with a king bed and an alcove off to the right with a kitchen and a balcony overlooking the nice courtyard and pool. What we got was a small grungy room with a king bed and a tiny piece of kitchen and a balcony overlooking the balconies of another building. These balconies looked like a slum because they were full of junk.The bed was the best part of the room. The mattress was quite comfortable although it did not fit the bed frame and we kept hitting our shins on the ends and even broke the skin causing it to bleed.Coming in the front door, the room smells damp and dirty. The closet did have a safe in it but it was black and near the floor. I had to turn on the flashlight on my IPhone and get down on the floor to see to set the safe correctly.The bathroom is disgusting. The taps in the tub look as if they are from the 1950’s. The shower nozzle is ugly and nasty to touch to change the pressure. The tub never looked clean. The sink appeared to have a laundry tub drain as opposed to a standard drain that you can open and close so you can fill the sink with water. There was no fan in the bathroom so after a shower the mirror looked like the windshield of my car after I had driven 200 miles. I had to open the bathroom door to let the steam escape so I could see in the mirror. The glasses in the bathroom were neither changed daily as is customary nor even washed and dried. The vanity counter was not cleaned nor was the sink. We began to test the housekeeping staff and sometimes they passed the test but more often they didn’t. One day there were no face cloths left for us and another day no dishcloth. The tea towel was terry instead of linen. The towels in the bathroom were well past their best before date and should have been used for cleaning rags. The Kleenex was so rough that I began to bring home serviettes from the hotels where we ate to avoid using their tissues.The kitchenette was small, beat-up and black. The whole room appeared to be black or brown and so was very depressing. Even the inside of the bar fridge was black. The cutlery was similar to what you would find in a soup kitchen. The cutting board was stained and needed to be bleached. There were no placemats or serviettes provided and the furniture was beat up and damp to touch as were the walls. There was a desk and a chair but you couldn’t use it and have room for anyone to pass.The room was very noisy so we didn’t get much sleep. We could run the air conditioner and not hear the TV or turn it off and sweat with the heat and not hear because of the noise of the traffic. The ceiling above the old -fashioned room air conditioner showed water damage and the walls were damp and cold. The window treatments were shoddy. The blackout curtains were ripped. The sliding glass patio door needed to be replaced and did not have a screen so we couldn’t leave it open for fresh air anyway. If you looked at the edge of the carpet at the threshold of the balcony it was all ripped instead of being finished properly.We spent as little time as possible in this room. As a result we spent time in the lobbies and restaurants of many other hotels that were all much more to our standard. It was wonderful to arrive home on Wednesday night to a clean, fresh, elegant quiet condo.When my friend phoned today to see how we enjoyed our stay she was shocked to hear about the horrible conditions of the room. She phoned the management company who acknowledged receiving my very negative survey and pressed them to contact me personally and offer me a rebate and an apology. A 50% rebate would not be out of line and if you are considering staying at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel in Honolulu make sure that you either don’t accept room 708 or make them prove that it has been totally gutted and redone. I will be sending a copy of this to my friend, to the management of the hotel, to Trip Advisor, and to the appropriate Health authorities in Honolulu. R. DrinnanMississauga, Canada

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Bamboo. The hotel was close enough to the action to be accessible and far enough away to be a little quieter. Our room was clean, very comfy queen beds and nice kitchen and bathroom. The reception and pool area were lovely and peaceful and very well maintained. Staff were very helpful and well mannered - which we came to recognise as being common across Hawaii and the different islands. A lot of the residents were repeat visitors who stay for a month at a time - which has got to be a good sign! The only recommendation I would make is to ask for a room to the rear or to the reception side of the hotel as some residents complained about noise from a neighbouring block of flats.

We found the hotel very clean and the staff, including the manager Nicole Yoshimoto, outstanding and helpful. We had reserved a room with a king bed. When this was not available and the hotel full, the staff worked with us to find a more suitable room. If not luxurious, the hotels is of good value, friendly, and well located.
user_name:
Eric P
New York City, New York

review_body: This was a great hotel to stay at in Honolulu. Very easy to walk around Waikiki from the hotel. The staff were very helpful and great particularly Dan. Great beds and very clean. We only had one small issue which was a very noisy kitchen drain! But all in all, will definitely stay again when I am next in Hawaii!

We were back again in Feb. for 5 weeks. We enjoyed the garden pool area.The staff is very pleasant and helpful. You want to know anything the front desk is the place to ask, they know everything. We will be back next year. Very close to Waikiki beach.

We found this place online -Google and yelp.. and saw that it had really good reviews. We were looking for a room with a kitchen for my whole family to stay in for a week so thought the price point was reasonable too. And what a surprise when we got there! Everything was so clean. Decorations were delightful. And even thought you don't have the ocean view -Hyatt has built a giant hotel by the ocean- the view of the mountains were enough to make us happy. However the best part about this hotel is the friendly service! The non-pretentious and genuinely friendly service. We got help on where to eat, where to go.. since everything we had researched beforehand were too touristy. Our stay wouldn't have been the same if we didn't stay at this hotel.

The hotel was well located but very noisy. The larger family rooms face Kuhio Ave, which is incredibly busy during the day and night. Would only stay here in the future if I could secure a room that overlooked the pool area. The staff were very friendly.

When we stayed here, it was before they redid the hotel. We loved it. the price was reasonable, the staff were very helpful (they upgraded our room immediately for a very small price)and everything was spotlessly clean. The bathrooms were roomy and modern (I see they didn't remodel them).

I travelled with my family- my husband, son, daughter and her boyfriend, we stayed at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki for a period of 20 nights in Dec through till early Jan. Our 2 rooms were booked approx 6 months prior where the rooms requested were on a high floor and pool facing, due to the fact that this was our 3rd time in Waikiki and know how very noisy it is. On arrival we find we are on the 4th floor and facing a very noisy Kuhio Ave, and my daughter and her boyfriends room faced a brick wall, a view I'm sure they wouldn't want for 3 weeks. The complete opposite to what was requested. I would think when you have guests staying for such a long period and in 2 rooms that you would do absolutely everything you could to meet those requests.When I went back to reception to request a change of rooms, I was told we could go to a higher floor, still not pool facing, but not until the Monday which was 3 nights away. The bathroom was problematic from the start, the shower is in the bath and would not drain so you were standing in 6 inches of water while showering, not very hygienic. My daughter commented a few times that our room stank of sewerage and I was to find out why after about 8 nights in that room. The toilet was blocked up and waste was coming up out of the toilet. A janitor was sent up with a plunger which was absolutely disgusting, the whole floor was putrid while he was plunging! I had to go to the lobby so I wouldn't vomit.That worked for 1 night, the next morning, the same thing. Reception were only happy to move us to another room when I said you need to find us another hotel, until then there were no vacant rooms. We could only stay there a few nights though as the room was booked for incoming guests. We were given a lovely room on the 9th floor, the drainage issues however were the same. I believe they need to strip out all the plumbing and renovate all the pipes.Our last room was again quite good but the drainage was still a problem. So for our 20 night holiday we moved rooms 4 times! I felt like I spent half my time packing and unpacking.We found the staff to all be quite nice when approached, but didn't feel like any of them went out of their way to be particularly friendly.Would I stay here again? No way! A much longed for holiday at Christmas with all family together, though we had a lovely time was made very disappointing by our choice of hotels.

First time to Hawaii and Waikiki. We selected Aqua Bamboo following perusal of Trip Advisor Reviews and we were not disappointed. Yes the rooms are a little tired, however the service and friendliness of the staff compensated for this. I was a little concerned that the road noise would be an issue, but this was not the case. If you are looking for an economical holiday close to the beach and main shopping strip of Waikiki, do not overlook Aqua Bamboo.

When we arrived at Aqua Bamboo we asked if we could leave our bags there overnight as we were going to Kona but the staff said the facilities were 'not safe' even though they had a luggage room. It then resulted in us having to use a 'recommended' third party who was hours late bringing our stuff back with no working phone to contact him on, stressing us out on our holiday. We contacted Aqua Bamboo to get them to help us but they didn't want anything to do with us! Funny that?The room itself was musty and smelled like mould, even with the doors open and aircon blasting. Airconditioning was ancient and incredibly loud (when it worked, I had to reset it several times manually whilst balancing on a chair), both my partner and I struggled to sleep that night. The bathroom was tiny and had weird red stains all over the walls (photo does not do it justice, it reminded me of a horror film!). Also my partner found unexpected 'hairs' in the toilet, which just topped off an awful experience and made us super upset. Stayed one night then got a partial refund for the rest of our stay. This hotel is fine if you want cheap basic accommodation but we were very disappointed on our romantic holiday away.

We enjoyed our first stay 2 years ago so decided on a repeat visit. Everything went well the staff is always friendly and helpful. Location is a short walk from the beach and other Waikiki attractions. The rooms are very clean -we turned the air off in the room due to placement and the beds are firmer than my liking. We would highly recommend due price location and size.

The best thing about the Aqua Bamboo is its location. It's a short walk the beach, shops and restaurants and transport. The hotel has a nice pool and spa pool, and offer free juices which are necessary on a hot day. The rooms have everything you need however the view from the balcony was of a next door apartment block but you get what you pay for. Little bit of road noise but in a city what do you expect? Ours had a kitchenette which was great because it meant we could have breakfast there before heading out for the day and we could make lunch and take it with us. There was a pizza restaurant on-site but we did not eat there. On Thursdays the hotel had free welcome drinks, snacks and entertainment which was great. Staff were friendly and helpful at all times. We found it a great place to stay!

We recently spent 14 days at this smaller but very well located hotel. We enjoyed our stay a great deal due to its closeness to the beach, the friendly staff, the overall cleanliness and the unexpected amenities provided to the guests: water, coffee, juices, apples, the daily newspaper and Thursday afternoon welcoming receptions which included snacks, drinks, Hawaiian music and a very special hula performance by the hotel manager in the outside small but pleasant garden/pool/hot tub/restaurant area. Certainly recommended by us. A great big thank you to all the front desk staff who were always ready to help.Aloha.

We were here for a month and the 3rd year back.Very clean rooms..The staff works very hard to please everybody at his hotel.Way to go Bamboo staff for all the pleasure we had and for sure we will be back next year.

We recently stayed here for 11 days. It was our first trip to Hawaii and we weren't sure how to pick a hotel! This hotel is a quick walk to the centre of the Waikiki Beach. It is on the main bus route, and we enjoyed travelling to most of our destinations that way. Within a few blocks of this hotel is many great restaurants and tons of shopping. We had a great little kitchenette. It is clean and simple, nothing fancy. The hallways do look rather dated. What we loved about this hotel was the lovely pool and hot tub area, so peaceful and quiet and away from all the hubbub of Honolulu at the end of a busy day. There is a sweet little pizza restaurant on site also. Staff were friendly and kind.

Thank you to all the wonderful staff at the Aqua Bamboo for another relaxing ''no rush'' holiday at your Boutique Hotel. This is our 5th year with you and you have not disappointed us once. It so much fun meeting up with other repeat guests, enjoying the Bamboozle on Thursday evenings and feeling like we're home. Cheers to all the Staff...job well done!

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for the third time and we just love it. My son and I stayed there for two weeks over the Christmas holidays. Service was excellent from all the staff they all take pride in their work and are willing to help you in any way. We had a pool view on the 6th floor the room was always clean thank you housekeeping, the beds were comfortable and having the kitchen we could have breakfast and lunch sitting out on one of the two balconies we had in our room. The free lemonade and iced tea in the foyer was enjoyed after relaxing out by the pool, and a few lazy afternoon naps in the daybeds adjacent to the pool is is my idea of a great holiday. Took the free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre a few times and the hotel is close to the beach and great restaurants. Mahalo to everyone at the Aqua for making more beautiful memories for myself and son. A hui hou.

My wife and myself have spent holidays in Hawaii have stayed at this wonderful hotel three times the staff are brilliant the hotel rooms are very comfortable with a kitchenette the outdoor swimming pool and spa are excellent also the surrounding out door area is very comfortable the Hotel is very close to the beach and shops restaurants bus stop are very close a concierge is excellent for those trips to the many attractions around the island we would recommend this hotel to anybody the costs are very compatible with they more expensive hotels around the corner

As a former Hawaiian local, I was apprehensive about the idea of using a hotel, but was looking forward to showing my wife the islands on our honeymoon. We wanted to work on a decent budget, and booked a hotel blindly which landed us the Aqua Bamboo. I wasnt totally sure what to expect, but we were both pleasantly surprised.The hotel is great. I will admit at the price we got, our expectations were low, however the Bamboo delivered at a quality that far exceeded its price. It has a kitchentte which was a nice surprise, and the room was restocked each each day with quality products. From the moment we walked in, and through the entire stay, it was a fantastic experience. The lobby smells great, and the hotel is full of little touches that really makes you feel they care. Free DVD rentals are a nice touch, and they provide you with towels and chairs for the beach. Cant beat that.The staff members are truly superb. As a guy born in the islands, it was nice to see people exuding so much aloha. We had a few special requests and they were always helpful and happy to help. I cant say enough about them.I would happily recommend the hotel to anyone. It is a pleasant experience at any price, but for what we paid in comparison to surrounding hotels, it was an absolute bargain. Mahalo Aqua Bamboo for an amazing stay.

My husband and I recently spent our Holidays at this wonderful Hotel. Our stay was made more enjoyable by the excellent staff in all departments particularly "Ray" who went out of his way to make our stay most enjoyable. We will surely stay here on our return to the beautiful state of Hawaii. Our room was very comfortable and clean as well as all public areas in the Hotel. We enjoyed the complimentary coffee available 24 hours a day and the cozy smoking area.Keep up the great work that all of you do at the Aqua Bamboo. We will be back !!!!! Luwana & Ron Daoust (Victoria BC, Canada)

My daughter and I recently spent eight nights at this hotel in a kitchenette room. It is a small older style hotel, very conveniently located - two blocks from the beach and within easy walking distance of shops and restaurants, and the hotel chain provided a free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre. The staff were very friendly and obliging. Our television wasn't working, and when we finally reported it (who has time to watch TV in Waikiki?) we were given a replacement. The room was serviced each day, and we were supplied with toiletries and coffee daily and the lobby had plentiful supplies of free tea, coffee and cold water. The pool area was very pleasant, with barbecues and a small pizza place - the Lovin Oven. I didn't try the pizza because they did not have gluten free bases, but I was told they were very good. The free wifi worked well in our room, the beds were comfortable and the street noise wasn't bad - the main noise being from sirens. The air conditioning was a bit noisy, but did its job well. I felt quite safe walking in the area alone at night. We were very happy with our stay and considered it good value. Thank you to everyone at Aqua Bamboo for making our stay so pleasant.

Our accommodation was booked by our travel agent. She chose the Aqua Bamboo based on our budget and location. Our room (1 bedroom apartment) was great as we had a separate bedroom with queen bed for us plus 2 single beds for our sons plus a kitchen and bathroom that met our needs. The room was serviced every day, always immaculate. The staff were wonderful - nothing was a problem. The pool area was quiet and relaxing place to go in the afternoon after a busy day out on tours. The Lovin Oven had the best pizzas which we enjoyed poolside. It is close to everything - Wakiki beach, shops, restaurants, car hire, board hire. If you're after somewhere that is clean, tidy, always helpful staff without a huge price tag I would recommend the Aqua Bamboo.

My family of 7 stayed for a week at the hotel and we all had a great stay. We had 3 rooms (2 standard rooms and 1 Suite with a large balcony area). The staff was very accommodating with all of our request and always available to help out. The rooms were clean, but the standard rooms could probably use a renovation soon, as there are scuffs on the wall and the furniture's. The One Bedroom suite with balcony was AMAZING. I highly recommend renting this room if you have a large family, because it gives you all a place to gather and it also have an amazing balcony with a BBQ! The location is really great too, right in the center of everything. Very conveniently close to enterprise car rental, 2 blocks away from the beach and all the major shopping.Thank you Aqua Bamboo for a great Trip!

My wife and I, along with our 2 kids (10-12) stayed for 12 days at this hotel and had a great experience. The staff was friendly, and the location was great. There is everything you need within a few block - car rentals 1 block (Thrift, Alamo, etc) - decent grocery/liquor stores (smaller ABC store or larger Food Pantry store), shopping, and of course the beach is only a couple blocks. Although there is some street noise, its not that bad considering you're in the city. We found that by having our room fan on high throughout the night, it muffled the street noise.The rooms are clean and well maintained. We also had decent wifi in the room, and if you need it by the pool they have free wifii, just ask at desk. They also provide free coffee and juice in the lobby. There is a movie DVD rental machine below, a concierge desk to arrange for tours etc, and an onsite pizza place that make the BEST thin dough pizza's, great salads, and more! On-site pool is salt water, and smaller size, but great if you need to cool off. Beach towels and chairs are provided at desk.On a side note, If you're looking for great places to eat, there is a place a little ways away called 'Da Spot Health Foods & Juices' - which is an amazing place to eat for cheap (10$ for a huge plate) - they serve many types of chicken & other meat dishes....worth looking them up on google.They offer parking for $25/day or you can park a few blocks down at the Waikiki Banyan for $15/day. Boogie board & umbrella rentals are pricey at the beach (10-20/hr) so we ended up buying some cheap boards and umbrella at Walmart and just leaving there rather than packing home.If you have a car and want an amazing beach with white sand, blue water, and no rocks/coral, check out Kailua Bay (Kailua Beach Park) - parking can easily fill but you can also park down the residence streets or in the back alleys - just park in front of someones house - everyone does.

Our stay at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki, from Dec 25th 2014 to Jan 2nd 2015, was our best holiday accommodation ever in Hawaii.From check-in to check-out, every aspect of Aqua Bamboo Waikiki's service was excellent, including the very reasonable room rates considering the time of year that we stayed.For 2 people (of any age) Room # 1001 is, in our opinion, the best in the whole block. It is very quiet, with views to the ocean and the beautiful pool area below. It is definitely like a 'home away from home' and we will be requesting it when we return later in 2015. Room # 1001 is privately owned with the owners having undertaken refurbishments in recent months such as new sliding doors in front of the bed, etc, etc. They will be carrying out further upgrades going forward in order to maintain the quality and appeal of this room and to keep it occupied!The 3 lanais/balconies are large - our favourite is the one to the right of the television - ideal for reading, relaxing, and enjoying the magnificent views and street activity below.We would like to specifically mention and thank Lokahi and Zenie at the Front Desk for their outstanding helpfulness and customer service during our stay, and Raymond for his courtesy and promptness with our luggage. Finally we would like to thank the housekeeping staff on Level 10 who tirelessly worked to ensure that we came into a beautifully made-up, clean and cool room when we returned from each of our many excursions!Mahalo for making our stay in Hawaii so beautiful and pleasurable, once again, and we will be back!Janet and Richard

Rooms are clean, staff friendly and location great. The garden pool and spa are calming and the happy hour entertainment was delightful. A bonus is the lovely lobby and free movies. Would definitely use again.

We spent one night here. We had a clean, small room but was clearly worn out with yellow and neon painted walls and bathrooms, no side tables and the TV plug was in and out. The hotel is tired, but we slept well as it was quite quiet on the upper floors. We appreciated the microwave in addition to the mini fridge. But it is a 3* hotel, good location but nothing like a Holiday Inn or even a Courtyard.

Aqua bamboo is a very good hotel and has a pool and a hot tub. If you are into spa's this hotels' hot tub is not worth it. It is about room temperature and the main pool feels like you are swimming in the arctic circle.But however, the rooms are very nice with a stone floor and reasonable sized lavatories. I have stayed in this hotel once and I would not do it again. I would much rather go to some of the hotels like the Outrigger, Hyatt, or even The Royal Hawaiian or a hotel along the Waikiki beach. If you are into surfing or love water stay somewhere along the shore.In all I would rate this hotel 6/10

From the outside this hotel may look rather old and tired, but the rooms are excellent, clean and comfortable, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The garden is an oasis of calm in the bustle of Waikiki. The hotel is an old-style small hotel in an area dominated by soulless tower hotels. It may not have all the amenities of its competitors, but it's a gem.
user_name:
John G
Portland, Oregon, and Edinburgh, Scotland

review_body: Just returned from a two week stay at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel.The location was very good, a short walk to the beach, bus stop right across the street, lots of restaurants close by ,you can walk almost everywhere. This location is noisy as some reviews mentioned, but not a problem. Our room was clean and comfortable and we enjoyed our stay. If you want good value, good location and you don't want to blow the budget, this might be a good choice. Hope this helps.

Stayed here recently to break up our trip around the islands. Staff great but the rooms definitely need a makeover. Was quite noisy when trying to sleep off the jetlag. Hotel is in a great location but looking tired, fine if you only are staying for a short visit.

We enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel. We did not rent a car for the time we were there, after reading other reviews, because the parking costs really add up. We rented one for a day, as there are rental places very close by and returned it before closing.

Great location but need to book room on higher floors 10 & above. If budget allows go for a suite. Moderate rooms very average, bathrooms in these rooms horrible. This hotel needs renovating but if on a small budget is okay, staff very nice an concierge is great.

This is a close call between 3 and 4 stars. I would give 4-plus for the staff, but three for the physical hotel. I stayed here overnight on a layover for a trip to Australia. I chose the hotel because of the good price and was not disappointed. Although the hotel has some aspects that are a bit rundown, it is located very well, just two blocks from the beach and the great shopping on Kalakaua Avenue. I had a 10th floor room for which I was very grateful as I think that the lower floors might get too much street noise, but I had neither interior hallway nor outside noise.The room was very basic, and a tiny bit delapidated, but there were lovely orchids tucked into all the towels and everything was in working order. The bed was fine and I slept quite well. Above all, the hotel has a small and homey feel which is such a pleasure compared to the big skyscraper-type hotels the predominate in Waikiki. I asked a lot of questions of the staff and needed help with the business center several times (they do need to replace and upgrade their computer for sure) and each person was smiling and gracious. The walk to the beach and shopping is quick and easy, and I felt safe walking at night alone. I would definitely consider staying here again for the price and convenient location.

If you need a place to get there late at night/early morning to sleep, take a shower, and leave the next morning going after your sport or date, this hotel may be a good choice for you.But if you are a social / economical minded person, would like to learn form your trip and other cultures, family oriented and have kids with yourself, work hard to make your money and care where your money goes, then the following may be helpful.PRO:- Hotel location and hotel swimming pool area.CON:- Noise from the refrigerator, AC, and street (it seems the windows are well sound proof).- The hotel building and the elevator need a major renovation, elevator outside doors are either so dirty, worn out, or both, they look terrible.- Arrived at daylight when easy to see, the bed sheets were very dirty with long hairs in it and black oily stains left from human body. They were not replaced for at least two weeks or so. At least, you expect to have fresh sheets at you first night when you arrive. Had them to replace.- Little tiny pin-point creatures that is hard to see (like very very small ants) running all over the counter tops and floor.- Not sure what is the $15/day hospitality fee plus 4.7% tax for, but it would be nice if all of the Waikiki hotels use a fraction of this money to provide a shelter and food for the homeless people in town. Saw no more than 10 homeless individuals wondering around the Waikiki in a very poor and heart breaking conditions. These rich hotels in town with a very little contribution could change the life of these US citizens. It is good for their business and we look more prude in the eyes of those international visitors.

We stayed here for two nights prior to a cruise. Even though our flight from Australia arrived early in the morning, we arrived at the hotel at around 9am and a room was available immediately for which we were very thankful. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Our room was very comfortable and clean. It had basic cooking supplies in the kitchenette but was quite adequate. The bed was very comfortable. We were allocated a room facing the road which was a bit noisy, but luckily it was not a busy street. Rooms facing the pool were more expensive, but as we were only staying two nights we were satisfied with the room.  The hotel has a pizza parlor at the rear, next to the pool, and we ordered a Mexican one and it was delicious, only one size available, but plenty for two of us. As we could not finish it, the waitress supplied several sheets of tin foil and we were able to take it back to our room. We were able to bring a bottle of wine as well.The hotel is located only a short walk to the beach and main shopping precinct.

This hotel was surprising, small by Waikiki standards, not on the beach but within a 5 min walk to the beach and main shopping/dinning precinct. Staff were great, with our rooms given to us early. Beds were good, room had small kitchenette if you wanted to use it. Bathroom was very small, but more expensive hotel used later was just as small.
