This hotel does not have a restaurant, so you will have to go out for meals, but this did not bother us as many options for food. Has free Wifi, and is great for short stays.

First this is an older hotel that has bang for the buck with rooms that have cooking facilities. My room had three outdoor spaces on the 10th floor. Although not much view you could see ocean through the surrounding tall buildings, two blocks from the beach. Great dining options just a few minutes walk off the main drag felt more local than the beach haunts. The zoo is close by and the parks between the zoo and the beach have BBQ, tall trees and beach rest rooms. The staff is outstanding! Yes the decor is dated but not hanging inside in Hawaii but the pool area is really lush. The only negative is the surrounding buildings create a concrete canyon which echo the street sounds of Waikaki which is a big city!

Clean, comfortable, friendly staff. Located right near all the business of Waikiki but on a quiter street. Would definitely return to stay again. Variety of restaurants, transportation and beach all in easy walking distance. Near zoo and Diamond head.

We stayed here for a week in a pool side room early November and found the location to be great and team was friendly and helpful! The hotel was just basic and not over the top, the pool area was lovely and bed very comfortable. Great value for money, would stay again.Mahalo!

We recently stayed for 5 nights at aqua bamboo and I was very impressed with service and facilities. The pool area is beautiful and the complimentary iced tea and coffee in the lobby is a really nice touch and tasted great! We hired some cars through the hotel and it was very efficient and straightforward. All of our rooms were very comfortable, though my bathroom was slightly in need of a renovation! But it was clean and comfortable. One of the only negatives is that it sometimes took a long time to have the room serviced, up until 3.30pm, and this was slightly inconvenient with a toddler.The only other thing I would like to bring to other travellers attention is that when I checked in, I was told there was now a $15 a day service fee. I refused to pay this as it was not a cost that was published when booking through my travel agent (all of the motels in the area that have a service fee are listed on the agents system) and I explained one of the reasons I actually chose aqua bamboo was because it did not have this fee. It was sorted out and I did not have to pay for this in the end but was told that it will be a compulsory fee very soon, so this is something to be wary of fellow travellers! It was a shame to have had this experience as the rest of our stay was very enjoyable and our rate reflected excellent value for money.

I stayed in Aqua Bamboo for a week in November. I found it to be a clean and well maintained hotel. Friendly reception staff, especially Lokahi who always had a smile and gave excellent help. My room was a good size and the beds are very comfortable. The location is fantastic, just minutes away from the beach and many restaurants and shops. I can't think of one bad thing to say about this hotel. Really appreciated their personal welcome letter and departure letter. Such attention to customer service is exemplary. I won't hesitate to book here in the future.N.B: the reviewer that recently described this hotel as gross is extremely unfair. There isn't anything gross about this place, stayed here for over a week and the cleaning was top notch.

We stayed here for one night on our last night in Hawaii after 5 nights in a terrible hotel elsewhere, so it was a relief to stay in accommodation that was modern, clean and comfortable. Short walk to the beach as well as many bars and restaurants. All was well until we went to check out and our shuttle that was supposedly booked with front desk wasn't actually booked! So that left a sour taste in our mouths when we had to get a taxi which was more expensive and we didn't get an apology from front desk for their error.

Free wifi in your room, lovely amenities, pizza restaurant onsite, swimming pool...you may not need to leave the hotel! Our room faced a main road so there was a lot of street/traffic noise and the A/C competed well with the outside noise so I would recommend getting a room that faces toward the swimming pool. That being said, the location is fantastic and the staff very friendly and helpful so a little noise can be fixed with earplugs and get on with enjoying your time there!

Absolutely gross!! It's budget FOR sure. Bedding cheap, carpets fraying and the free coffee so awful. If you are planning on coming to Oahu... Don't stay in Waikiki the whole time. It's just too much like SF with palmTrees. Go to Kailua, north shore etc.

The room was clean and cozy with clean sheets and towels. Nice amenities including a spa robe. One block from the beach makes it easy to go for a quick swim in the ocean. Much better than waiting 20 minutes for an elevator at a large resort. The noise level is my only complaint. I was on the street side. Perhaps the pool sid eis quieter if thats important. Loved the location. Close to hralthy restaurants and the farmers market on tuesdays and thursdays. Will be back!
user_name:
Martina M
Altadena, California, United States

review_body: My friends and I wanted to enjoy a relaxing yet fun weekend in Waikiki. The aqua bamboo was the perfect hotel for us to achieve just that. We had a beautiful suite with an amazing lanai with tiki torches and a BBQ grill. It was amazing!!! We enjoyed being in the heart of Waikiki and being able to walk everywhere as well as lounge around in our comfy, quiet suite grilling. We will definitely stay here again!

This hotel was great for our staycation and I would def book this hotel again for future events. The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating and it felt like you were a part of the Bamboo Ohana. The suite that we had was absolutely amazing, from the room itself to the outside lanai, this hotel had everything you need for relaxation...we never watned to leave the room because it had everything! The salt water pool and spa was just what you need to enjoy the paradise views of the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of great shops, the beach, and night life. The price was worth the experience. I cannot wait for our next staycation at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki.

The location was terrific, the service was very friendly and on time. Check in time was much earlier than the given time which allowed us to get there earlier. The deluxe suite was a great price for the amount of space given to us.. The outside cabana area and lounge made my weekend a spectacular one. The staff were fast paced and indeed helpful and of course the amenities of air conditioning and bathroom were by far the greatest. My best weekend in waikiki yet.

Another great stay at the Bamboo our 6th stay over the last 4 years. As always neat and clean, with friendly staff who are only too willing to help. There is now a small restaurant on site and whilst we didn't eat from it the meals that came from the kitchen looked great and I heard positive comments around the pool from other guests. We look forward to our return stay

I honestly don't know where to start with this hotel, we travelled with my family to honolulu for my wedding arriving at 8am to the hotel after along 10 hour flight from Australia we were so tired we went up to the desk and asked was there any chance we could check in before the 3pm check in time the hotel staff were more then Happy to allow it at no extra charge and we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom apartment for again NO EXTRA CHARGE the hotel was in the perfect location close to the beach, shopping and restuarants rooms were nice and quiet, very spacious I honestly cannot fault a single thing with this hotel my parents stayed at the hotel next door nearly paid double the price and what they got for there money was a rip off we stayed at another hotel for the 2nd week and it had nothing on this one and again it was also more expensive when we go back to Hawaii we will definately be staying here again.

I booked here for 2 nights then stayed for an extra 2 figuring it had just what I needed - a good price and just a few extra steps to the beach than the beachfront properties three times the price. The hotel was functional - small bedroom and bathroom and a small balcony with a sliver of view of the sea but all good as most time spent outside either et the beach or the many bars and restaurants nearby. I would stay here again.

My husband and I recently went to Oahu for two weeks to celebrate our Anniversary. My parents had previously stayed at the Aqua Bamboo so we booked our stay there. What a beautiful hotel with a lot of amenities. The location is perfect, very close to the beach. The pool area is like an oasis. It is decorated beautifully, surrounded by palm trees and has a waterfall into the pool. Our room was spacious, clean and had a kitchenette. This was great for having breakfast before going to the beach or a light lunch afterwards. The staff was so friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and we are definitely going to stay there again!

We found it a perfect place in Honolulu, not too far from, and not too close to, the beach and access to highways to go elsewhere, garage for rental car. Very comfortable, staff friendly and most responsive. Indoor court with trees and small pool good place to relax. Would definitely return.

This was our first visit and not our last, we highly recommend it.We call it our Oasis in the city because of the location is surrounded by palm trees and felt really private. The pool area is BYOB and very comfortable.Very centrally located, very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.

Really nice place to stay, one block to the beach. Nice pool area, friendly staff. Would definitely stay again, Room had all you need, little kitchenette with microwave and small bar fridge. Bus to Ala Moana 100 meters away

My Mum and I stayed her for seven days of relaxing and shopping. The Aqua was great, the location is perfect for sightseeing, access to the famous Waikiki Beach and of course the shopping. The rooms are tidy and clean, the beds were comfortable. The pool area is a lovely and a great place to relax. We stayed on level 6 and the street noise was a bit noisy but it didn't really bother us too much. The staff are very friendly and helpful,would definitely stay here again.

The rooms were "cozy" but very clean, updated, and comfy. Loved the fresh orchids on the towels and scattered about the room. Didn't mind the small size because we were never in our room. Always at the beach or poolside. All of the staff, from front desk to poolside, were pleasant and friendly, going out of their way to ask what they could do for you. My kids weren't along on this trip but it was obviously a family friendly place. Even the free Thursday happy hour had popcorn and juices for the kids (as well as the complimentary "Bamboozlers" for the adults--yum!). Very short, easy walk to the beach, restaurants, and shopping and on a main street so grabbing a cab was never a problem. Parking the rental car was a bit tricky. The parking garage is very small and needs a few "12 point turns" to fit into a spot. If you're going to use it, I'd recommend letting the valet park.
user_name:
HAC22
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Fabulous location. The pool area was great and it was BYO so we could have casual drinks by the pool and enjoy the weather. Just a few steps from the beach. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We will be staying there again.

Overall not a bad stay. The first room we received had two twin beds instead of the queen we requested. Staff happily moved us to another room. It also had twin beds. Never mind. We couldn't be bothered dragging our baby and luggage to yet another room so left it be as we were only staying one night. Room was clean but a bit scuffed around the edges. We were on the second floor which unfortunately also holds the hotel laundry and staff room. Noise from Kuhio Ave was loud. Really loud. Even with white noise playing we could still very clearly hear it. Definitely request a room on a high floor, away from the road. Fine for the price.

I stayed at Aqua Bamboo over the New Years Eve period for 8 days, it was just what me and my boyfriend needed. It was clean, comfortable and had a balcony.It was central and the staff were great. Especially the young girl that took bookings for day trips etc she was extremely helpful and patient. Would recommend and stay in again!

On our 4th stay over the years, Aqua Bamboo is unchanged from the last visit. 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach on Kuhio, and is planted firmly amidst the towering highrise hotels, Bamboo is a cozy, 12 story, welcoming but dated, tranquil oasis, with bus stops right outside. Good sized rooms, comfortable bed, pool, hot-tub, helpful staff, restaurant on premises. Close to everything Waikiki, not a bad price. Noisy, old fashioned air conditioning.

Aloha, Stayed in May 2014 in a 1 bedroom suite, with a well appointed kitchen. Room was clean, beds comfortable, there was a lot of street noise from Kuhio ave, but bearable. The pool area and the Lovin oven restaurant was good and not too crowded. Free cold drinks in the foyer area and use of beach chairs. Now for the but... I left the hotel to do some sightseeing, 1 of the hotel bellman named Raymond assumed that we had all had gone sightseeing, but my wife and kids stayed in the pool area. My wife returned to our room to hear rustling of shopping bags in the main bedroom, she thought someone had broken in to our room. My wife went into the bedroom and was confronted by bellman "Raymond", he was standing near an open wardrobe where all our shopping bags were and the in room safe. Raymond made some poor excuse about washing on the balcony, and he was dropping off our departure gift (we still had 2 days before checkout). My wife told him we were not checking out and he should check his list, Raymond then said " I better wear my glasses next time" and left. My wife checked our belongings went and checked on the children, and then reported the incident to the front desk. They said that they will report this to the manager and she will be in contact. The next day my wife was asked by the front desk staff to write a statement of what occurred which she did straight away. The only correspondance we have received to date is an email from the area general manager, Kahealani Colon, the day after we had left Hawaii, saying that he agrees that this incident needed investigating and he would be in touch ina few days to advise the outcome of their investigations. My wife sent follow up emails to see what were the outcomes of their investigation.....radio silence, and we didn't ever actually get our departure gift. Up until this incident, our stay at the hotel was excellent, the front desk staff and the other bellmen we're helpful and friendly and we would have definitely revisit this hotel in the future. Very disappointed nobody from the hotel has contacted us inspite of the follow up emails. We have waited until now to post this review in case a response was received. Disappointed to have heard nothing further.....Mahalo

This hotel was fantastic for me and my family ( 2 adults and 2 teenagers)- the staff where helpful polite and always professional-- it has a pool, all day drink facilities and a great little kitchenette that we used for our daily breakfasts and at times made a great lunch. It is near to the main hustle and bustle but just a little bit away- which we loved. We highly recommend this hotel-- ps- our beds where super comfy with excellent daily house cleaning-- The HUGHES family :)

Lots of hotels in Waikiki, but this offers a lot of value. The place is clean and nice, if not brand new. But the location is the deal that will bring me back again. We only needed a car for a few days in Oahu and so used the bus for 14 more days. And the bus stops for about 10 buses is directly across the street. It's barely 2 blocks to Kalakaua which has all the shopping a major hotels. Directly to the beach are several hotels with great free music every night. The best udon noodle restaurant is just a few blocks away on Kuhio, and the best grocery in Waikiki is closer still. The staff are really helpful and friendly. And I got a great rate.
user_name:
poocherTampa
Aguilar de la Frontera, Spain

review_body: You can't beat the position of this hotel a block away from the beach. As most of the posts say, it is not a 4 star hotel but it is the location that everyone likes. Unfortunately, we were given two rooms on the 2nd floor which were not very good but rather disappointing. Our friend had 202 which had a problem with the toilet. I might add there was a major plumbing problem in the hotel at the time we were there but I think it was on the 7th floor and it had caused some problems with the water pressure. We had room 206 which was at the front and very noisy (and so was the air conditioner) - it was also opposite the laundry and next to an employee only room which had people coming and going from 530 am!We asked to see the rooms first and we did ask to be moved but we were told that was all that was available. The lady wasn't very helpful. We decided to make the best of it. At least the room was clean but the electricals looked like they needed an overhaul.All the other staff were really good and there was a young man on the tour desk who was very helpful. Overall I can't recommend the hotel because of the rooms we were given.I've tried to be balanced and fair but I think you should be able to find a better hotel in a similar location. We paid about $1000 for 4 nights which I think is a lot when compared to other hotels of a similar price.

This was our second visit to the Bamboo and while it is not the Marriot or the Royal, it is comfortable, a great location close to everything, the rooms are older but well kept and the price is exactly right. When looking at hotels (worldwide) I always remember that 'you only sleep in the rooms' but it is the service that comes with the property is what makes it a great place to stay. Well you certainly get that feeling at the Aqua Bamboo, its a smaller boutique style hotel with the most helpful staff that you will ever find. Nothing is a problem, extra coffee for the machine, Thursday night complimentary drinks and snacks by the pool, great housekeeping staff, a most helpful lady operating the tour desk. Just personal and nice. While there is a bit of street noise (the main bus routes operate on this street) it is convenient as the bus stops are right out front.So if you want a nice stay with nice people at a price that allows you to enjoy the other attractions, then the Bamboo will do.

The room wasn't exactly what we expected but the Aqua ticked all the boxes. Affordable, very clean and tidy, great staff and an excellent location. Our room looked over the street which was abit noisey. Could do with a bit of an update. Beds very comfortable and wall air con was noisey as well. Loved lazing by the pool. There is also a great pizza place Luvin Oven by the pool. Free daily papers, apples and iced tea and lemon water was a bonus. Overall very comfortable.

We are regular guests to Aqua Bamboo, visiting Hawaii every year. We always choose to stay at Aqua Bamboo. The location is great, easy walk to the beach, close to all the shops and restaurants. Hotel is small and friendly. The staff are great, it's like visiting friends when we return each year. We stay in the Junior Suite or Penhouse - both great!! Hotel is good price for Hawaii with all the amenities you need. The pool area is lovely, plenty of sun beds and nice cabanas to laze in.

Not expensive, provides the basic's well. Great staff. If you are looking for a clean, well appointed no fuss place this is a place to be considered. Good central location, short walk to beach, shops, restaurants

Great price, certainly adequate. Some words of warning; bathroom is very small, I'd guess 5 x 5 with combo shower/tub. Room for one only. Property has been somewhat updated but is older. Very well maintained and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Furnishings and décor nicely updated. Wall air conditioner was a bit hard to regulate. Walking distance to beach, shopping and restaurants. Parking extra $25 per night. Staff was friendly and available. Compact kitchenette came in handy; fridge, sink, microwave. Very nice but small pool area. Beach mats, tubes and surf riding toys available and loaned free of charge Overall, I left feeling like I got a good deal for the price.

As others have said if you are looking for affordability and comfort Aqua Bamboo is ideal. We had booked a kitchenette unit but when we checked in we asked to be upgraded to a room facing the pool (an extra $20 p/night). We were given a couple of options and the opportunity to have a look at each room before settling on the one we preferred. We loved the pool area as it provided a tranquil oasis to escape from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. The location of the hotel is close to restaurants, shopping and Waikiki beach, the bus stop is across the road. There is an on-site concierge for booking tours, etc. Lemon water, iced tea and coffee/tea is provided in the lobby, along with free daily newspapers and delicious apples. Beach towels were provided and the laundry facilities were very reasonable at $1.25 per load. The staff were all very friendly and helpful with someone at reception 24/7. We had a fabulous time here and the only thing that would put us off staying again is the noisy air conditioning unit as the heat made it uncomfortable to sleep without it on but the noise affected our sleep.

The Aqua Bamboo was perfect for us - good location, clean and above all friendly. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite and had a lovely time. Don't expect 5 star surroundings but do expect comfort and service.

Great little hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. 3 min walk to the beach. Rooms were a good size, bed comfortable and bathrooms clean and well stocked. Had a lovely pool area available for all guests and beach towels were included. I would suggest booking a room overlooking the pool area - slightly more expensive, but the cheaper rooms had a balcony that looked straight into the apartment block next door so we upgraded as soon as we got there. Fantastic hotel for the price.
user_name:
Emma B
Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: This was my first time in Waikiki loved that everything was close, I was upgraded to a kitchen area for free, never cooked but fridge was useful. Beds were very comfortable, sheets changed daily room cleaned, free WIFI is a plus, loved the flavoured water (lemon) in the lobby area. On a return I would definitely stay here again

I stayed here for 3 days in June 2014 to attend a workshop. I booked the cheapest room, but was surprised to find when I opened the door that I had been given an upgrade. I had a top floor room, with two lanai and a kitchenette! It was so nice to drink my tea (or wine) in the evening and look out over Waikiki. On Thursdays they hold a little free reception around the pool, and I figured why not, so I went down and listened to some great music, made a fresh flower lei, and nibbled on a little pizza sampler from the cute little pizza shop (oh, and enjoyed a tropical drink, of course!) The pool was small but clean, as was the hot tub. My room was very clean and the included wifi was so key for me as I had to work (sniff) at night to prepare for my training meetings the next day. The staff was always very nice and polite and as a woman traveling alone, I felt safe in this hotel. Great experience - I would definitely return.

Overall decent stay but be warned:- the second day I was there water was flooding a high room resulting in a cascading type waterfall of waste water down the pool side of the building - the third day we had water dripping into our closet and bathroom from an overflow in the room above (we had Rm 605)- when asked if the water was waste water the employee replied "some of it" nasty!- the problem persisted the following day hence this review - the hotel responded by apologizing but I would save the trouble of bad plumbing and look elsewhere

This was a return stay to the the Aqua Bamboo. I had previously stayed here with my partner in 2009 and 2010. And as expected, it was a great visit/experience. The room was very clean. Both double beds were comfortable. The rooms were cleaned and made daily. (Well, on the days that I didn't forget to remove the "Do Not Disturb" sign from my door. I was on the 8th floor so there wasn't too much street noise even though I was facing the Kuhio side of the hotel. The clerks at the desk were very helpful. Especially when I nearly lost my driver's license at the beach. I would definitely stay here again so long as it fit my budget.
user_name:
Ben P
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: My significant other and I stayed here for 4 nights and we loved the overall package we were getting. At a great price we got a comfortable stay really close to Waikiki beach and other walk-able destinations. If you don't plan on staying in your room a lot and just need it as a hub to prepare you for your Hawaiian adventures then this place is a great choice. The bed was comfy and our room had a kitchenette to store leftovers. We rented a car and parking was $25/day rate which isn't all that bad. It isn't the nicest and luxurious of hotels but it gets the job done! If I were to stay in Waikiki I would not mind staying here again.

This place was real friendly and the front desk was really helpful. Room was alright for the price you pay. The hotel is center of everything in Waikiki. Would come back again if my line of work is there again.

I just PCS to Hawaii and this hotel made the TLA process very easy to handle. The hotel is only 2 block from the beach and it's centered around restaurants and shopping areas. The hotel is very secured, clean, and have lots of good amenities like beach towels and chairs! Love the restaurant next to the pool. Definitely we'll visit again and would recommend for any family vacation!

Spent two weeks here and was thoroughly pleased with accommodations and staff attentiveness. Complimentary beach/pool towels + always available lemon water & iced tea in lobby a nice touch. Clean and tidy saltwater pool was a great hangout spot when we needed done down time. The Lovin' Oven is an on-premise pizza place (BYOB) that requires an advance reservation, but is well worth it. Highly recommend!

Nice hotel close to Waikiki beach probably built in the 1970's but very clean with extremely helpful staff.Had a nice pool area that got good afternoon sun for relaxing.Handy to Waikiki Beach and the shops and restaurants around Waikiki.The only fault would be noisy air conditioning units but we turned them off at night so not really an issue

All good here. Very clean room with great facilities and friendly staff. A smallish hotel with basic amenities which is what we wanted given we planned to spend all day out and about... And we did. The pool was nice and refreshing but lacks a bar and the restaurant had limited services but we didn't hang around there anyway.The only small gripe was the rather noisy air con unit but at least it worked well and after the first night we were so knackered we didn't notice!Recommend for solo or couples who go out and explore rather than sit around the pool all day.We enjoyed our stay.

This was not the hotel we were supposed to stay at, but we encountered problems with our previous hotel meaning we had to change and it was he best thing to have happened! As we arrived (much earlier than check in) we were greeted with the aloha spirit. Our room was fantastic, so clean and everything you could imagine needing for a stay. The concierge was great recommending fantastic tours and companies to explore Hawaii with. The front desk offer support and always have a solution for any issue. The location is so close to the beach with chairs, beach towels and umbrellas offered free on a daily basis. Their kindness is unbelievable and I cannot recommend this hotel enough. It had all the makings of a traditional Hawaiian stay - pineapple juice on arrival, flowers in the rooms and macadamia nuts on departure on top of the aloha welcome throughout the stay. Thank you aqua bamboo we will definitely be back soon.

My wife and I stayed at the Bamboo for 8 days in August. Our room faces a solid brick wall which gave us complete privacy both day and night The wall does not encroach and as we have been here before were quite happy to stay there . The rooms are modern clean more than comfortable.If you close the balcony door you hear little street noise however if you prefer not to use the air con and leave the door open at night the street noise can be intrusive however we were happy to adjust.[take a sleeping pill]. I had my surfboard and went down to the beach every morning and left my wife relaxing by the pool which is the most pleasant pool area we have experienced in Waikiki with beautiful palms all around .

My husband and I stayed here for the last night of our honeymoon. It was in a good location, 1-2 blocks back from the beach, close to restaurants and shopping. We were upgraded upon check in, and in our room we found a box of chocolates, champagne and some pretty flowers scattered around the bathroom. This was a lovely gesture which we appreciated. The bed was a big comfy king. Only complaints about room is the air con was so loud, it basically sounded like a car engine starting up. Also the bathroom stank of sewerage. But other than that, was fine and we would stay again

For the first part of our trip we stayed at this hotel. I regret ever leaving it. This was the cleanest and best hotel that we stayed at during our trip to Oahu. I loved the staff and the room. It was super clean and comfortable. We did have an issue with the tv at first but it was quickly fixed. The staff at the desk were friendly and nice. One negative was the view. But after staying at other hotels on the island, I really don't mind it anymore! . I would definitely stay here again!

For our first visit to hawaii, we couldn't have asked for anywhere better to stay. We stayed for nine nights in August and loved every minute. The location was great as it is really close to the shopping strip and a very short walk to the beach. The room we stayed in was huge, overlooking the pool. We had two double beds and a kitchen with a full size fridge and oven. Not that we cooked at all but loved the fridge as we were able to go to the ABC store and stock up on breakfast items so we didn't have to go out early every morning. Pool area was very quaint and we had pizza at the little cafe there which was delicious. Staff were very cheery and helpful and we delt with three different concierge staff who were all lovely. Only negative, if we had to find one, is that the air conditioner was quite noisy. We did get used to it but may be a bother to some. For a cheaper, boutique hotel that gets you away from the busy beach front, this place can't be beaten. Would definitely stay here again.

This was 5th Stay at Bamboo and again the friendly staff, ideal location and relaxing pool area enticed us back. Although not a glitzy beachfront hotel , Aqua Bamboo has its own unique charm. This is not the place to stay if you are after the large resort style experience. It is the place to stay for a unique smaller hotel experience. The staff are friendly and welcoming and happy to share local advice. Rooms facing the street can be a bit noisy on lower levels however Waikiki is a noisy place! The refreshing drinks available in the lobby are a welcome relief and the tropical pool sanctuary an ideal place to relax with choices of sun or shade. An easy walk to beach and Waikiki activities, Bamboo is an ideal place to stay at a reasonable price.

We (my wife and 15 month old son) stayed here for two weeks from the last week in July. By way of background, our travel agent in the UK (DialaFlight) had misunderstood our requirements and the type of room we wanted (something with a separate bedroom with a closeable door) and had booked us a regular room. Luckily we found out about this before we left as we had been in contact with Aqua Bamboo to arrange a crib for our baby son. To cut a long story short, DialaFlight kindly picked up the bill and upgraded us to a "one-bedroom suite with full kitchen". When we arrived, the upgraded room was not really what we had in mind. It was on the 4th floor and it did have a separate bedroom, but the living room had two single beds which took up quite a bit of space in addition to a kitchen with a huge refrigerator. It was also facing the front of the hotel alongside Kuhio Avenue which was a little noisy. To be honest with the sound of the AC, we did not really notice the traffic noise, but large vehicles such as buses woke up our little boy which was not ideal. We asked the lady behind the desk if we could move and she said that was difficult as the hotel was full, but she would see what she could do. True to her word, the following morning she offered us the same room on the floor above with two futon sofas instead of single beds which was a much better arrangement with regard to a toddler having space to play, but said if we could hold out another night they would move us to a "one- bedroom suite with kitchenette" on the 12th floor. This was an excellent room - lovely tiled floor, windows around two sides (nice views of mountains), huge very comfortable bamboo bed, bathroom with his and hers sinks, living area, kitchenette with refrigerator, hob, microwave, toaster & coffee maker and another fridge in a small "bar" area. It also had a huge TV in the bedroom and a smaller one in the living area. The maid who serviced the room was excellent and worked around our schedule with our son to make the place very clean and tidy. The front desk staff moved all our luggage and other items for us without fuss. We were so grateful for their help in swapping us to this room - it really made our holiday and their was no charge for the upgraded accommodation even though we did offer to pay! We also did not need to pay for the crib which I understand is normally $30 per night. As this was on the 12th floor, the traffic noise was much reduced which was great for our son and there was plenty room in the living area for the crib and his toys. A really good result for us - thank you Aqua Bamboo!The hotel is nice - there is coffee/lemonade/flavoured water available for free downstairs in the lobby plus free newspaper. Whilst we were there, they put PlayStation 3s in all the rooms and you could rent games and films from the Redbox kiosk in the lobby for free. The pool is small, but the whole courtyard area is pleasant. On Thursdays, the manager hosts a reception where you get some traditional drinks and snacks and also make a lei or two. The biggest advantage is the location of the hotel. It is two blocks (5 minutes walk) from the beach and the main drag through Waikiki. There is some limited parking under the hotel, but we used the parking garage next door, as it was easier and the same price of $25 per day with in and out privileges.We also saw filming of Hawaii 5-0 both on Waikiki Beach and in the streets around the hotel. We could see all the action on one day from our balcony - it was really cool and an extra bonus of our stay.In terms of other things we did as well as Waikiki beach, we toured the entire island by car, ate shrimp from a van, went to the north shore, went shopping and visited the outlet mall, strolled around Waikiki, went into downtown Honolulu and I went on a day trip to the Big Island to see Hawaiian Hawks (I saw 6 - makes me wonder how I missed them on the previous two occasions I have been there!).We had a great stay and I would recommend the hotel to anyone but choose the room type you want carefully

My wife & I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for two nights from July 30th-August 1st. The staff was outstanding as well as the atmosphere. Very clean hotel with excellent service with the manager greet on Thursday night by the pool area. I would stay again when we return to Waikiki. Great location, just two blocks from the beach and main area of Waikiki. Ice Tea, Lemonade and Water along with Apples available in the lobby was a plus. My wife & I appreciate it as this was our first trip to Oahu visiting our Son in The US Army. We thank the staff of Aqua Bamboo for making the first leg of our trip enjoyable.Mahalo
user_name:
Bill S
Williamsburg, Virginia, United States

review_body: I think we were very unlucky to get a room facing the street but as 50% of the hotel faces the street - be careful booking here! We had flown from New York to Honolulu for a good night's rest before flying another 9 hours home. The traffic noise was literally unbearable as the hotel has single glazing so every truck (and there seemed to be lots!) rumbled into our room. We were on the 7th floor but I don't think it would matter. So the sleep was basically ruined. Sleeping on the sand down at the beach would have been more pleasant! The rooms were fine but very poky, dated but clean and good beds. We have never stayed at a Aqua hotel of any kind and will never stay in the chain again. So basically unless you have a room on the pool side, get up and leave! One good thing - the pool area was lovely and quaint.

We stayed here in January. Myself,my dad and my brother. It was a really nice hotel and we loved the beverages and the once a week snack table and lei making. It was great for us. We stayed in the nicest rooms there are at a very low price. If you are going I reccomend these rooms because they are worth what you pay for! Beautiful balcony with bbq, a kitchen, tv room, bedroom with 2 double beds and a big bathroom! The normal rooms weren't what we hoped for when we first went in because the showers were stained and the room was very tiny and hot. So that's why we changed and got an amazing room we are very happy about! Hallways are sort of small but it is an old building. The pool was freezing which is why barely anyone swims in it. If the pool was much warmer I'm sure people would enjoy it a lot more. Overall, I liked the hotel and I would go back because it is a great place to stay at!

Great accomodation, spacious bedroom, living room and separate kitchen and bathroom. Very central and reasonably priced. Fully serviced and close to centre of Waikiki and `1 x block back from beach. Pool was small but it is heart of city. We would stay there again.

We stayed here last July & were very pleased with the hotel. We stayed here again for 5 nights in July for a family reunion and were very happy with our accommodations. We had the same room with a kitchen as last year. The service from the hotel was fantastic. We used the valet for our car & they always got it promptly for us. I love their pool. It is decorated in such a way that you don't feel like you are part of a large open area. We did not use the restaurant but did use the comfortable tables for some of our meals with the rest of our family. We will definitely stay her on our next trip to Oahu.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo during the first part of our Hawaii trip, and were pleased enough with the stay, but not overjoyed. The location is very central and is only a couple of blocks from the beach. Shopping and dining options are literally right outside the door. The staff was pretty nice and helpful and they do a few activities at the hotel that are a nice touch (e.g. free cocktails and snacks on Thursdays for Happy Hour). Our room was clean, but the set up was a bit odd. It was basically set up like a 1 bedroom apt with a kitchenette. The "living room" had 2 futons that were comfortable, but fairly no-frills. The cushion on one of them kept slipping down and didn't sit properly. Not a huge deal, but it's that lack of attention to detail that is an issue. Our room faced the street, but we didn't find street noise to be a huge problem and the AC unit drowns out the noise at night. Also, the view we had from our balcony was actually pretty nice towards the mountains on the backside of Waikiki. The decor throughout the hotel is dated, but not really in a kitschy way. We spent little time in our room or at the hotel in general, and we didn't miss much. Bottom line is, if we head back to Waikiki, I would probably either opt for something nicer and pay the high cost or really aim to go budget and drive to Waikiki if needed.

My partner & our friends (also a couple) stayed here recently & we had an awesome time!For the first night that we arrived we stayed in our own separate standard rooms, which had everything we needed & the quality was good.What really blew us away, was when we checked into the 2 bedroom penthouse on the top floor the following day. We were pleasantly surprised with everything! The kitchen was lovely - the oven & microwave were huge! The fridge was also pretty big, it also had its own ice & water machine in the front, which saved us from having to go all the way downstairs to get ice. The rooms were really nice as well, each couple had their own bathroom, which made it a lot more comfortable for us. My partner & I had the king bed & it was more than enough room for us both! Each room also had its own TV but there was one in the lounge as well! One thing that I really loved about it was the deck that almost went right around the penthouse, it was amazing! We had views on every side of our room & it had some nice deck furniture as well.Overall the room was nice & the staff were very helpful as well, I'd definitely stay here again!

STAYED HERE 3 TIMES AND WILL STAY HERE AGAIN.....NICE COZY PLACE with outdoor pool, great location 1 block to WAIKIKI ,shops, bus stop, grocery store, all employees very nice and reasonable hotel prices..

My family and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The front desk personnel were cordial and accommodating. The housekeeping staff did a great job in keeping our room clean and tidy. Percey and the rest of the valet staff were very prompt and helpful. Kudos to everyone for doing such an outstanding job in providing service.

Definitely somewhere I would want to bring guests back to! Management was friendly, and offered an oustanding deal since we were bringing well known musical artists to their hotel. Despite a cracked window that was covered and tucked in the corner, the guests definitely enjoyed their stay. The two bedrooms accomodated our booking team and helped us cut costs in a major way. Thank you again!

Got a room facing the street and cause to the traffic it was like sleeping on the highway. The hotel is in great need of renovation. It is more lika living in a appartement than staying at a hotel. Everyone was nice but they seamed extemly uninterested in you. You hade to approach them and almost interupt if you wanted to aks about something. They were always talkeing to eachother and never said hello when you passed the reception. Small poolarea that perhaps is nice if you have small children. Location is goo and only two minutes from the beach. The cleaning was not good. Kitchen was good (frigde, stove and oven) but they lacked most of the utenciles you need in a kitchen. Only a few balconies hade chairs.

My husband and his co-pastor and her husband and I had the pleasure of staying in Waikiki as he and she performed a beach wedding for two of our church members. We carefully chose this hotel, wanting a lovely, quiet, less crowded environment amidst the "hustle and bustle" of Waikiki. We were not disappointed. We found the staff exceptionally friendly, helpful, ready to please at any moment. Our suites were quite large, with huge balconies, and plenty of space to relax. Great stay! We have already recommended this hotel to friends.

I was surprised by how big the room was - I probably could have brought a couple of friends with me and we would still have fit comfortably in the space! The building was older style, like many in Honolulu, but the room was perfectly clean and well maintained. The kitchen was great for making a simple breakfast each morning, especially as there is no restaurant for breakfast. There was a bit of noise from the street at night, but the beautiful breeze coming through the door made it worth keeping open! It was also nice to have air con when it was super hot. I liked the nice touches like a welcome letter and water/iced tea/lemonade/tea/coffee/apples in the lobby. There was also a desk in the lobby to book tours and activities. Staff were helpful with directions and advice. The pool area was lovely and comfortable. The hotel is also conveniently located to get to Waikiki beach, bars and restaurants in just a few minutes.

We loved staying at this hotel! It was so nice to be near Kalakaua, but not in the midst of all the Waikiki traffic. Being a block or so behind the "main drag" is great. Super quick walk to the beach, close to a couple of great restaurants (try ME BBQ for lunch-VERY good Korean BBQ), friendly staff, safe, small, quiet! The price is great, and they will beat any price - just ask! We will definitely come back.

Enjoyed staying at this little hotel off the main drag in waikiki. While my view was of the building next door, it didn't really matter to me since I wasn't in the room much and wasn't planning on sitting on the balcony anyhow. rooms were clean, beds comfortable, and staff was friendly. Would recommend.

Traveling with another couple we were able to reserve the 2 bedroom, 2 bath penthouse for slightly more than 2 separate rooms. It worked out great. You get both mountain and ocean (albeit from a distance) views. Great access to beach 2 blocks away. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would stay at this properly again if in Waikiki...

I stayed here in 2008 I think. It was sort of hard to spot if your not paying attention since it blends into the busy streets of Honolulu. Though, that doesn't mean it isn't a relaxing hotel. I and a friend of mine enjoyed this hotel on our way home from being stationed overseas and as a treat the hotel manger upgraded us to the 2 bedroom rooftop pethouse that included two free masages at the in-house spa. SCORE!!! The only thing that I will say with a minor flaw with this hotel is that the hot-tub on the rooftop was not working and was empty at the time. Though, I did not complain since the upgrade was already a great gift.The hotel is a couple of blocks from the Waikiki beach but surounded by tons of things to do. The little spa on site is nice and the courtyard is small but relaxing.

Good value and great location, as you are in the central of everything. You are literally 2 blocks from Waikiki beach, shopping and many restaurants. There is a bus stop and trolley stop directly across from the hotel.. Rooms are small, but nicely done... If you are use to luxury this is not the place for you, however if you are looking for a clean hotel with a great location, this is the place for you..

Stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for the past 4 nights and overall, I would say it was a nice hotel and worthy of it's ranking on TripAdvisor. If you're looking for something large, corporate and with all sorts of modern touches and flair, then the Bamboo is probably not for you. If you want a reasonably priced room that's close to everything Waikiki has to offer, then I would recommend the Aqua Bamboo.Positives:- My girlfriend & I walk everywhere on our trips and the Bamboo's location is excellent. Less than a 5 minute walk to the beach, 10 mins to the zoo, 15 mins to the aquarium, the main shopping and dining streets right outside the door, bus stops right outside...really everything you can ask for within short walking range.- We got a clean, quiet room with a comfortable bed on the 10th floor, nice sized washroom with plenty of storage, closet with safe and free and fast wifi.- Free use of beach towels with a convenient system of replacement and free use of beach chairs.- Refreshing ice tea and lemon water in the lobby.- This was our 3rd trip to Honolulu and we've definitely paid a higher price at other hotels for a similar experience. I would say that the best thing about the Aqua Bamboo is the value you are getting for a reasonably low price in Waikiki.- Prompt email and phone responses when we made certain inquiries about our reservation.- Received a bottle of bubbly and a box of chocolates since it was my birthday during the stay. Thanks Bamboo!- Secured front entrance after 10:00 pm.Negatives:- Being on the 10th floor, street noise wasn't an issue however the air conditioner was quite loud. If you're a light sleeper, then the a/c in our room would keep you up at night.- Cleaners were friendly when we met in the hallways, but might have been a little inconsistent in doing their job in our room. Nothing major, but worth noting.- Front desk staff were friendly enough when we approached them with certain questions, otherwise they kept to themselves whenever we walked in & out of the lobby. This was consistent with morning, afternoon and evening staff. My girlfriend and I are accustomed to front desk staff being a little bit more openly welcoming. Again, it's not a major disappointment, but worth noting.We would definitely stay at the Bamboo again. It has such an excellent location and as long as you're not expecting a 5-Star hotel, then I believe the many positives outweigh the few minor complaints.

We have used another Aqua hotel before and thought to try Aqua Bamboo. We got a room with a kitchenette which was good as we can cook our own breakfast. However, we were on level 3 so the view we got was the next door neighbour. We tried to get another room but was told there was none. Disappointed as we used Aqua 2x before. The hotel has free cold drinks at the lobby and free drinks Thursday early nights. The concierge Raymond is very helpful and friendly, not all of them at the registration is like him. Manuela at the tour desk is so helpful, compared to her other peers. Housekeeping was a disappointment as we had to call the front desk very 2nd day as the housekeeper forgot something - toilet paper, sugar, creamer, there was always something! We also noticed housekeeping didn't fix the sheets properly. Location of he hotel is great, walking distance to the bus stop and Food Pantry!

My friend and I recently stayed 6 nights at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki (BAW has 92 rooms; being small it feels "homey, non-commercial"). The room rate was great; at a modest increase we upgraded to larger room with a patio & mountain view. Hotel staff is tops: from entering the front door they were friendly, informative and cheerful! The hotel is steps to Waikiki beach plus there's has a nice pool in the back patio (Outer Sanctuary/OS). the OS also has the "Lovin-Oven" that makes delicious, fresh homemade pizzas & salads > we ate there 2 nites. On Thursday nights there's a complimentary cocktail get-together; cultural activities are also held for guests to enjoy. I would for sure stay there again per BAW's quality of staff, the amenities - comfortable rooms and its convenient location (buses are across the street = the best way to get around).

we arrived early due to our flight. Upon arriving there told us to go and come back in 1 hour, we did and then told to return 2 hours later. Arriving after a 10 hours flight there was nothing. as we had never been to Hawaii we didn't even know where to walk.... as asked for some water and we were pointed outside. After waiting 5 hours to check ... there wasn't a Hi or welcome, first question was how would you like to pay your balance. had 1 bedroom kitchenette. completely shocked at the size of the kitchenette. We booked it as we wanted to use it and it costs more than a standard room because of the kitchenette. It was a sink with a microwave above it... one person only could stand in there... so it was completely pointless to pay extra for a sink and a microwave. when asked is there was anything a little bigger or spacious they told me that it would cost extra. we stayed there for 10 nights and obviously that meant nothing to them in the reason we wanted a bigger room. There are mini ants or bugs everywhere. all in our cutlery and over the table, desks. those the rooms were cleaned well daily these insects returned every day....there were 2 balconies. 1 was complete unaccessable as the bed is bolted to the floor in its doorway. So for staying again 10 days we could only open it by going onto the bed and climbing over it. the other balcony had a door but nothing to go out to. it was 20cm wide this balcony.So this hotel is central and clean but choose wisely the kind of room you book. Morning staff - don't lift their head to even acknowledge you, as many Australians would walk past and greet, then they would lift their head and smile. Evening staff were very helpful, so we waited until they were there for assistance

I had a spur of the moment trip required for business and had to find a place quick. Discovered this place randomly, and I have not complaints. The room was very well put together, full amenities including stove, refrigerator and microwave. Air conditioners worked well which is a requirement, it is Hawaii and the heat and humidity outside was ridiculous, so walking into a nice cool/dry room was a welcoming experience. Beds were comfortable, and the room upkeep crew was on par. My room had a balcony, small but nice to sit outside and have a smoke and observe the traffic of the city. Miss Aja at the front counter made the trip exceptionally well, after being on a flight for over 14 hours due to delays, she made sure I had everything I needed and was comfortable. My only issues, and they aren't big ones, were the inconsistent hot water, and the rather slow internet. Hot water is negligible, it's Hawaii and you don't need to take a ridiculously hot shower, and the internet was good enough to check mail and make a few posts to social media so as I said, these are not deal breakers! If you are on a budget, this place is right there around the corner from Waikiki beach, and all sorts of food and shopping. I recommend this place.

We had stayed in the area on this trip but wound up coming back to Waikiki after not finding what we wanted in Makaha. We called Bamboo and luckily they had a vacancy they next day.We felt the room rate was reasonable especially with all of the amenities. The hotel is centrally located and only a block off of Waikiki park. Restaurants all around. Plenty of prime shopping close by.We had requested a king bed but ended up with a queen and water/city/pool/garden view. Really nice. Kitchenette in room was nice. Bath was nice with tub/shower.Parking in basement was secure. Not a large place so not much waiting at elevators.The amenities included beach equipment such as chairs, boogie boards and towels.Sitting around the pool was great, especially with all of the trees and flora they have planted. It felt as if you were out of downtown. Not a large pool but we never saw it crowded. Cabanas poolside.Restaurant on premises does some cooking.Window A/C did good.Clean rooms.Nice smoking area.Relaxed atmosphere.Friendly staff.

Spent 1 week at this place and we absolutely loved it. No long lines to join for checking in and out. Perfect location for shopping, restaurants, Waikiki beach and car rentals, even if you want to take the bus, the bus stop is just right across the street. Staff were really friendly and were always helpful, especially Raymond. Our room was nice and cosy with clean fresh linens. Loved the signature scent in the lobby...they had fresh apples & lemonade. Free unlimited Wifi in the rooms, compared to other big hotels you will see guests clogged up in the lobby for internet..whereas in Bamboo you will enjoy chatting home at the privacy & comfort of your own bed. Yes I do recommend Bamboo and Yes I would absolutely return here on our next trip... A Home away from home. Mahalo!!
user_name:
galuokos
Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea

review_body: Travelled to Honolulu solo and just wanted a convenient little hotel with no fuss and a good location. This place delivers on that score. Good staff, friendly, clean rooms great lobby. If you're there for the beach and the sun, this is a good option.

My husband, myself and another couple stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 2 weeks in March 2014. We are all 55+. Normally I book all our holidays online myself but since we were taking a one-week Hawaiian Island cruise first and then staying 2 weeks in Honolulu after that, we decided to have a travel agent handle all the arrangements and book flights, cruise, transfers, and hotels. This was all booked early in May 2013. Several weeks before we left on our holiday our Travel Agent called the Hotel to confirm our rooms and request quiet rooms, close together, overlooking the courtyard. She assured us the requests had been put on file at the hotel. On arrival at the hotel late on a Saturday afternoon, we were told we had rooms side by side with a city view. When I advised the staff of our Agent’s requests, they told us that they had no record of our requests on file and that there was a $20 per night additional fee for a room overlooking the courtyard. You would think they would have given our Travel Agent that information when she called!? Although disappointed, we went up to our assigned rooms. As we always do on a holiday, the first thing is to check out the view from the balcony. To our absolute horror, our view was of a brown brick wall just a few feet from our balcony!! We immediately returned to Reception and told them that the rooms were absolutely unacceptable! After booking almost a year in advance, that was the best view they could give us, in Hawaii, at $190 per night plus tax!! They assured us that no other rooms were available but that they would try to get us different rooms in a couple days. That evening they did inform us that they had arranged for us to move in 2 days time to rooms overlooking the courtyard at no additional cost, with one room even having a full kitchen, although they were on different floors. We agreed! Once Monday rolled around and we were actually moved into our new rooms with a courtyard view and no wall in sight, we could finally unpack, relax and begin to enjoy our holiday. Oddly, the new Studio kitchenette room assigned to our friends was much, much larger than either of our original rooms. The first rooms were basically the size of any regular hotel room with a mini fridge and microwave in a short wall of cupboards. Not sure how they could be classified the same and valued the same!?? During those 2 days our friend did visit a few other hotels and found out that we could easily have had equal or better accommodations in the area for a much lower price. After having caused such a ruckus, and just wanting to get on with our holiday, we opted to stay put for the duration. On speaking to other Aqua Bamboo hotel guests we did learn we had been charged substantially more than many others for our rooms.  That all being said, the ‘new’ rooms were large and comfy and we enjoyed our stay and our holiday. The lobby area, and pool area were always nice and clean. The pool was tended to daily. Our cleaning lady could have done a better job. There was hair behind our bathroom door for the entire 2 weeks of our stay, so I don’t think it saw a broom or vacuum once. The beds were comfy and the kitchen was great to have. Wi-Fi was available in the rooms and in the courtyard for Free, and that was much appreciated.We were within easy walking distance to Waikiki beach, many restaurants, a grocery store, liquor stores, a market, and many ABC stores. The bus stop is right nearby so it was certainly easy to get around, and there is a car rental place just around the corner. There is a small restaurant in the courtyard which is open for lunch and supper, with a small menu, but the food was good.Fresh apples were in the lobby each morning, although you had to get down there fairly early to be sure to get one, as they disappeared quickly and were not replenished. Iced tea/lemonade, coffee and tea were available at all times in the lobby, which was a nice touch.The staff was very helpful when we had questions for them, and the Concierge was very good. We booked several of our tours with him. Honolulu is a lovely place, but if I was to visit there again, I would search out a hotel that was closer to the beach instead of in the middle of town, and a little cheaper, especially when staying for a while. Had the wall-view not started off our stay on a sour note, it would have been a much more positive experience, as we had a good time there. It is a relatively small hotel, so not swarming with people, which is what we like...and the courtyard was nice to have.My suggestions if planning to book at the Aqua Bamboo, is to make sure you are getting a good rate and that your requests are on file. Maybe had our agent made our requests by email instead of phone, it would have been better, as I would have had a paper-trail and proof that the requests had been made. Don’t hesitate to stay here though; it is a quaint little hotel, close to everything.

We have stayed at the Bamboo several times and would not even consider any where else. This property is in the heart of Waikiki and conveniently located to world famous Waikiki Beach. The staff is one of the bast we have encountered even at 4 star hotels. Raymond the bellman actually greeted us by name and is one of the most friendly person you could meet. We happened to encounter a couple of Japanese guests who were upset over something and guess what Raymond who happens to be Hawaiian spoke to them in Japanese and soon everyone was happy and laughing, what an exceptional young man! We had a room facing Kuhio Ave and with the exception of an ambulance with siren driving by the room was very quiet. This property is reasonably priced and has all the amenity's you would need. Kudos to Aqua Bamboo and their amazing staff.
user_name:
Randy D
Wailuku, Hawaii, United States

review_body: This hotel is good we have had nice stay there. Advantage is location, aprox. 300m to the waikiki beach. At the concierge we met one girl, cant remember her name… She was very friendly and helpfull and my wife recived Lei from her, that was really nice :)

From the person who handled the reservations on the phone (Cheyenne-thanks for being so great) to the warm greeting at the front door by Fe and even the maintenance man who came up to make sure the air conditioning was working, I couldn't find a single complaint about the hotel. There were plenty of towels, there were refreshing drinks in the lobby and best of all there was a saltwater pool. They have a small pizzeria on the pool deck and we were unfortunate to miss it but drooled over what we saw coming out of their doors. It's not a big fancy hotel but they made you feel welcome and as we were right in the heart of Waikiki we were close to everything. I recommend it highly!

It is reasonably priced. The pool was nice, I did not use it. Parking is horrendous in Waikiki anyhow, the hotel itself has limited parking spaces available, we had to use the parking next door. It was not too great. It is near Waikiki and it is somewhat noisy, but it quiets down, I thoroughly enjoyed the personalized letters written to me at check in and the gift of chocolates at the end of the stay. Kana was extremely helpful when I could not get the printer to print. As well as when he checked us out of the hotel. It was a smooth experience. All in all the staff is very helpful and willing to go above and beyond.

Reasonably priced for amenities included. Close to local shopping and restaurant district. Walking distance to Diamond Head. Beach towel service was a great inclusion. Pool and spa area lovely, although spa slightly small.

I enjoy "boutique" i.e. older hotels. I really like the Aqua Bamboo. It's fairly priced and while not on the beach it is a five minute walk away. The full kitchen is helpful for travelers on a budget (and Hawaii is incredibly expensive). I can't give it 5 stars because of street noise (we were on the street side of the hotel) and the antiquated AC units that had to work like the dickens to cool our room. Minor quibbles. Otherwise loved the place.

This is a very handy place to stay. Close to public transport, shopping and the beach is only a few minutes walk away. Very clean and tidy with excellent, friendly and very helpful staff. The room we had was comfortable and the beds were too. The pool area was nice and private and in a very comfortable setting. Good laundry facilities. We were very happy with our stay here.

We have just returned from a 8 day stay at the Aqua Bamboo. The location is fantastic right in the middle of the action close to the beach and eating establishments.The rooms were clean and tidy and serviced to a good standard. The pool area was well used and have comfortable loungers around it.Staff always happy to help and offer advise.The only negative was the noise - we wore earplugs at night to try and cut it down . We did ask for Pool side accommodation when we booked in December but when we arrived we received an upgrade instead so we didn't feel like we could complain. There is some much good stuff about the hotel that we would not let the noise stop us from returning.

My wife and I booked this hotel online for 2 nights. We paid a very reasonable $135 per night, but I think they upgraded us to a bigger room at no cost. The service was good, the pool and hot tub was convenient and very accessible, and the location is great. In terms of what you get for price, we are very happy with this hotel and staff.

Just like home but everything done for you. We couldn't have picked a better hotel. Even got upgraded to a bigger room. Place is clean, friendly, and everything you need is there. The outdoor setting is sublime - an oasis amongst the multi-storey buildings and the busy streets and the swimming pool was well utilised. The "Lovin' Oven" provides food if you just can't face the traffic again. Thanks Aqua for a wonderful holiday.

Aqua Bamboo is everything you could ask for in a quality, cheaper hotel. I paid about $120/night. I will not stay anywhere else! The sheets are clean, the service is incredible, the pool and hot tub are the perfect size. Did I mention they have a sauna? They serve complimentary applies, and two types of iced tea every day. They have a free happy hour for guests every Thursday. They have an adorable mom and pop pizza restaurant next to the pool. Very comfortable lounge chairs and close to everything. A liquor beer store, is 2 doors down and ABC stores are on every block. This hotel is also 2 blocks from the beach and zoo which is perfect!Wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!!!! GO AQUA BAMBOO!

I'd like to start off by saying I love this hotel. I marked 4 only because the rooms are a little small & there really isn't an ocean view from this hotel. Otherwise the location is awesome you can walk to virtually everything on the Waikiki strip from here. The entire hotel is super clean and the beds are so comfortable. Most of all I felt the service here was excellent. One individual in particular I felt went above and beyond as far as customer service goes- Lokahi. I needed major help shipping my (birthday) dress back to renttherunway.com. Usually these dresses come w/ a prepaid return shipping package. This was not the case this time- I can't thank him enough for all the help getting that taken care of!!!

We have just recently stayed at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki for 2 weeks with my hubby and 2 kids 12 & 15 yrs. We arrived early morning after a long flight from Australia at 9.30am and was checked in straight away and taken to our room. We stayed in the 1 Bedroom Suite with a Kitchenette Room 1003, it was perfect for us with 2 queen beds, 2 showers, 2 TVs, 2 Fridges, separate lounge area, microwave, toaster, 2 split system air cons and a balcony that looked straight down to the amazing Waikiki Beach. We also had 2 other small balconies that the sliding doors opened right up and looked out to the mountains and golf course. The staff were great and very helpful. The pool area was great and loved the free nibbles and cocktails every Thursday afternoon around the pool for hotel guests.You have free use of pool toys, boogie boards and chairs to take to the beach which was great.The room was cleaned every day and loved the little bamboo decorating touches around the hotel and room. Also loved the free Iced Tea and drinks available in the lobby.Great location only a few minutes to the main swimming area of Waikiki Beach and all the main shopping and restaurants are all close by.My only complaint would be the same as other reviews I had read was the outside street noise at night. We got use to it but on some nights it was loud with just passing traffic. I would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Hawaii and the cost and location is perfect for what you need.Thanks AQUA BAMBOO for your hospitality and we will see you again :)

Absolutely love this hotel! The location is perfect. They even upgraded our room without us even asking. The only thing I would mention is my husband is 6 ft tall and the bed was a little short but that wasn't a huge issue. We can't wait to go back!

The Bamboo Hotel is an older establishment that is very well maintained. Located 2 blocks from Waikiki, it is just blocks from most of the major hotels and restaurants in Honolulu. The direct city bus to Pearl Harbor Monument is just across the street from the hotel making an easy and inexpensive way to see the city on the way to the Monument. The area tends to be noisy,so the hotel has created a tropical area around the pool and restaurant area to help dampen the noise and have created a very pleasant space. The rooms in the front of the hotel facing Kuhio Ave.seemed to be the noisiest. Those in the rear would tend to be quieter. The staff was exceptional and were able to take care of all requests.

This hotel is in a great spot just one block from the beach at Waikiki. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are adequate with small fridges, microwaveand plates and bowls etc. it has a pleasant pools area and tea and coffee are available to help yourself 24 hour. Good value for money.

An excellent choice if you want space and proximity but don't require luxury. Yes, the lobby and the elevator's a bit dated and worn but it is a good choice if you want to be close to the beach and save a $100-150 off the luxury hotels. The one bedrooms are great - around $230-250/night and have rolling wooden doors to partition it off from the seating area (which also has a futon bed). It had two little fridges, a microwave, stove, and dishes. No free breakfast but there are so many fast restaurants around like the Korean-run Me BBQ, KFC, Subway, and many other little mom and shop restaurants. This is the next street over from the Hyatt Regency, around the corner from the little cute King's Village shopping center, and down the street from the Courtyard by Marriott. It's half-a-block from the Waikiki TroIley and Hilo Hattie bus stops as well as close to a great grocery store (Foodland) and a pharmacy. It's also near the urgent care at the Princess hotel. There's free WiFi in the rooms and lobby as well as coffee. We ordered a taxi on the way out and got a great,new, clean taxi.

For our family this is the best hotel in Waikiki! If you are looking for a five star resort, this may not be the property for you. If you enjoy a BBQ, with a glass of good wine, under a palapa enjoying the sound of a waterfall, tikki torches blazing, in a jungle setting then this is the best kept secret in Honolulu. For us, we get to enjoy all the amenities a big city has to offer but then when we choose time for some tranquility we are in the perfect location. Our family has a tradition of what we call "the dine around" which means one family member is responsible for one meal over the holiday. It is fun, saves money, offers a few laughs and everybody gets a holiday with the exception of the one day you are, "on". One family member even threatened to order in pizza, which would have been a treat had they picked it up at the onsite restaurant called, "Luv' n Oven". The hotel is showing its age, the décor is dated but the rooms are exceptionally clean, very comfortable, with great beds. The mini fridge, sink and two burner cooktop offered some manageable challenges for the cook. It was tough to find enough room for the beer and vegetables in the mini bar fridge.Saving the best for last, thank-you Nicole for your understanding and the effort put into fixing my internet diabolical. Zenie, a delight to see you again and Kimari, what a treat is was to see your sparkling smile every morning. And forgive me that I didn't get the names of the porters who always made it seem like it was nothing but a privilage to retieve our complimentary beach chairs no matter how many times of day we checked them out, then in, then out, then in. Started a savings jar for the next trip! See ya then!

in a quiet area of Waikiki but still four great restaurants around the corner. room was fantastic with a frig and two burners and a microwave and three balconeys. wow. if you can request a upper floor on thep ool side do so as thereare incredible sunset views. small restaurant onsite that serves breakfast and lunch. decent sized pool and a hot tub. oh I forgot they have a bbque that you can use for free. I think there are probably many good things I forgot. wifi is freebtw -- management responses to every review make some of us suspicious

We were traveling with friends and booked a 3-night stay prior to cruising NCL Pride of America. Our kitchenette room was 705, on the street side with a partial view of the mountains from our balcony. Although this hotel is showing her age, our room was very clean and had been modernized in recent years. The kitchenette was modern and well equipped with all that you could want. There is a grocery store a block away and ABC stores on almost every block in town. The room size was adequate and seating was good with two tables in the room. We had two queens. The AC is a window style but we liked the white noise for sleeping. We experienced no problem with street noise at all. Se rented a car and used valet parking at $25/d. Our car was always delivered promptly. The free concierge service was very helpful planning our day trips all over Oahu. The staff was friendly and happily loaned free beach towels and chairs to those walking the short 2 blocks to the most popular stretch of Waikiki Beach.

We were very happy we booked this hotel. It was our first trip to Honolulu and the location, value and quality of this hotel really made our trip enjoyable. We were upgraded to a suite on the top floor (12th) and had plenty of space: two queen beds, a kitchenette with all the basics, and a balcony with a view of Waikiki Beach. Well, a small view, but we could see a sliver of the beautiful ocean ;) Will stay here again and would definitely recommend the hotel.

My favorite hotel in Waikiki! Yes I know there are the big names around the area but they just don't do it for me. I've traveled to the islands at least 5 times in the last 2 months and Aqua Bamboo has been my go to hotel. Staff is wonderful, they are very attentive and offer great service. Very quick check in and check out process. Very secure hotel to stay, after 11pm the hotels doors are locked (for security purposes). You can still access the hotel but with your room key. Great location, very close to the beach and many places to eat right down the street on Kuhio. Hotel offers free wifi, unlike the other hotels that charge for it (which is ridiculous). Overall this hotel is great. What keeps me coming back is the staff and the comfort of the hotel.

Stayed at the Aqua Pearl last year and decided to try another Aqua property this time. We were very pleasantly surprised. Bamboo is an excellent location, well maintained, with a very helpful staff that seems genuinely interested in you enjoying your stay. Beautiful pool area with teak lounges, cabanas, landscaping, waterfall, jacuzzi spa, outdoor shower and even a great little on-site pizza cafe offer a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Rooms are very nice and very reasonable; like all of Waikiki - there is a premium for a pleasant room view. This is not a 4 or 5 star resort, but you won't likely find a nicer 3 star hotel anywhere and I will gladly stay there again.

It is a great location just a few steps form the beach. Also, it is very close to nice restaurants and shopping area. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. It was very pleasant to stay there. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. It has a nice swimming pool, perfect for relaxing!.  There is a nice Koren restaurant across to the hotel. (Only receive cash). I did what other reviews recommended. I order food to go and eat it in the pool area.  A plus is that the hotel give free water and lemonade which is perfect for the hot days. Thanks!! Will definitely stay there again!.

A friend was celebrating their 50th birthday and chose to do it on Oahu. We stayed at Aqua Bamboo, and it was a terrific time. The staff were all great and very helpful, the pool area excellent, and it's just a three minute walk to the beach (and Duke's for a sunset Mai Tai). Will definitely be staying there on our next trip to Hawaii.

We like to travel often so we try to be as frugal as possible. However, I won't sacrifice safety and/or cleanliness. The Aqua Bamboo provided both. In addition, the staff was friendly and accommodating. Free wi-fi in the lobby and guest rooms was a plus. The lobby and pool area are nicely decorated. Last but not least, the location was perfect for what we needed. Just a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach and so many other attractions within walking distance, we didn't even need a rental car. There is a bus stop in front that makes getting around the island convenient and affordable. We will definitely stay here again.

The hotel was very nice because when we arrived in our room there's a wine, lei and a box of macadamia chocolate (which is my favorite) Staff was very nice and accommodating. Concierge was very helpful. The kitchenette was a big deal cause we were able to sometimes cook and have our morning coffee. The Waikiki beach is only a block away from the hotel, very convenient and also public transportation just in front of the hotel.

We stayed for 5 days in Waikiki a few days ago at Aqua Bamboo. It is an excellent property just a block away from the strip. That helps reduce the noise from the street traffic. While still being very very close to the restaurants and the beach.It has clean efficient rooms. The property is a bit old but very well maintained. The main door could be changed to a sliding door. The pool is very cool with a hot tub. The private backyard was very cozy. It has a surprisingly nice restaurant with a limited menu "Lovin Oven". Their nachos were excellent. We would definitely stay their again.
