I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki back in Jan.2014 and it was my first visit to Hawaii. This hotel, the employees and the service are lasting impressions in my mind when I think of this trip. I loved that it was a smaller hotel, as the employees were very kind, helpful with suggestions, made you feel personally welcomed and the service was amazing! They went above and beyond for me, as for the first part of my trip I was by myself and they were always looking out for me. The rooms were a good size and the balcony, modern and clean, great rates and an amazing location considering the price for the rooms. When I return I will go back and stay there again! Thank you for contributing to my amazing visit to the island.

If you are looking very affordable, tranquil, peaceful, serene and safe accommodation only a block from Waikiki Beach, then stay at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki. We have stayed at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki on a number of occasions and have found the staff to be extremely helpful, nothing is too much trouble - from changing cash to organising a tour. They go out of their way to make your stay the best ever in Hawaii! The room we stayed in was # 1001 (10th Floor) - it was extremely comfortable, quiet, spacious and had generous sized lanais/balconies with comfortable seating and privacy. It was serviced daily, often before 11.00am, which suited us because we were swimming or shopping in the morning and so welcomed coming into a clean and cool hotel room which had been freshly serviced. As far as security is concerned, you need a room card to get into the Hotel Lobby area (and then into your room) from 10pm-6am daily and there is even a night guard who patrols the outside of the lobby ensuring that entry is authorised and guests and staff are safe. The pool/spa at the back of the Hotel is absolutely wonderful and therapeutic with tables and chairs (under shade protection) if you want to rest and/or read a book/magazine. Something, perhaps unique to Aqua Bamboo Waikiki, is the "Bamboozle" evening which the Management put on for Hotel (and invited) guests every Thursday between 4.30 and 5.30pm. This is a wonderful opportunity to 'mix and mingle', make new friends whilst enjoying the original Hawaiian entertainment, generous cocktails/food all in the serene and beautiful bamboo setting. We have enjoyed the weekly "Bamboozle" evening for a number of years and can thoroughly recommend it. Being set only one block back from Waikiki Beach, and with the Food Pantry, Pharmacies, ABC Stores, Department stores like Macy's and the main Kalakaua Avenue Hotels such as the Moana Surfrider, Royal Hawaiian, Outrigger Waikiki within easy walking distance, the location of the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki Hotel could not be better! Also, the bus stop taking visitors to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre or around the island of Oahu, is directly opposite the Hotel as is the bus stop for visitors wanting to go to Diamond Head, Sea Life Park, the Kahala Mall/Hotel, etc, and is just next to the Hotel, 5 minutes walk down the same side of Kuhio Avenue. This is the best Hotel which we have been privileged to stay at in al the years that we have been vacationing in Hawaii (since 1988). We are indeed very blessed and lucky to have such wonderful accommodation and to be treated so royally by such wonderful staff! Mahalo, Mahalo - a BIG THANK YOU to all the staff and management of Aqua Bamboo Waikiki for making this our best holiday yet and we are already planning our next stay at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki, hopefully later this year, 2014! Warmest regards and with much Aloha until then, Janet and Richard Lambert

This is a condo hotel that has recently been refurbished. It's three blocks from Waikiki Beach, and it's an easy walk to plenty of stores restaurants, zoo and aquarium. The staff is great. They'll make your stay memorable. Raymond met us when we arrived and had our car ready whenever we needed it. Housekeeping was very attentive and the concierge was quite helpful. Note that parking is $25.00/day even if you select the "snooze and cruise" package. It's still a pretty good deal if you want to be free to explore the entire island on your own schedule.

Spent a week at the Aqua Bamboo. Hotel is located in Waikiki, 2 minutes walk from the beach, handy for groceries and transportation. Comfortable, clean bed room with balcony overlooking central swimming pool, quiet location, really friendly and helpful staff.Poolside restaurant friendly, not licensed but as they say "BYOB encouraged", and no corkage. Service is very relaxed and friendly, small menu (a few things done well, rather than a vast list of mediocre food) and the food was great.Staff really work hard to make sure you enjoy your stay; advice on sightseeing, shopping etc. Quiet time requested later in evening, so good night's sleep possibleWe had some airline schedule problems outward bound, and staff were very flexible, first in setting up a late check out, then changing that to another night stay. Hard to be annoyed with the airline that gives you another day in Hawaii......hotel was great, we'll be back next time in Hawaii.

Pool area is very nice and they kept it immaculate. Room 201 faced the pool and was very quiet. Great pizza at the Lovin Oven where couples and families would dine poolside. Their menu notes BYOB - no corkage fee. This hotel is in a great location, close to the beach, shopping, groceries a block away. Can't beat it!

my stay at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki was enhanced by the service I received from the front desk to the maintenance staff.The concierge was most helpful.and because I was travelling on my own I was most impressed with the availability of information,nothing was a problem. The room was clean,bed was comfortable.air con was available,towels etc were changed daily. the hotel is located ,handy to transport and close to shops and beach. my stay was most enjoyable,and i hope to return.
nice view, quiet, cleen, very comfotable room.very nice staff of all.Thank you Mahalo.

Smiling + helpful staff. They made us feel right at home. We loved the extra attention with the letter and the flute the second day we were there. Super clean everywhere. The price is great! The location is perfect.

Can't find a better place for being close to all the Waikiki sites within easy walking distance. The setting was so peaceful with gardens surrounding the pool. Rooms are very nice and the most reasonable price for Waikiki. Also recommend the Lovin Oven located next to the pool for excellent pizza.

We were very pleased w/this hotel. It's not too big, so you don't have as much hustle and bustle going on. The Good - - Close walking distance to beach. - Towels and chairs provided for you to take to beach. Pool area has lush plantings making it feel more secluded....you kind of forget you're in the middle of town. - Our room was plenty big enough for the two of us, had 2 queen beds, and we were surprised to see the little kitchenette, which also came stocked w/dishes, pots and pans!! - Nice robes in the closet.- Blonde concierge, she was VERY sweet and helpful. I'm sorry I don't remember her name.- We had street view room but only heard sirens and large trucks, not bad at all- Were always acknowledged when coming and going past front desk- No noise from neighboring rooms or other floors- beds and pillows goodThe Not AS Good, but very minor -- coffee in lobby. Go out door to the left a couple of blocks to The Coffee Bean- A/C was a little loud for me, but I still slept.- Thursday Manager's "meet/greet" was ok...veges and dip, chips, popcorn. There was pizza, but not even enough for all 20(if that) ppl there to have 1 of the 2" x 3" pieces they offered. Bamboozal drink was pineapple juice, Midori melon liquour and club soda, ok but a bit weak. I was a very nice gesture for management to have this get together, but I didn't see anyone from management "meeting and greeting." There were enough flowers for 4 ppl to make leis.Overall, I feel this is a very nice hotel and would consider staying here again. I might try to stay on pool side to get a tad quieter, but really, the street side was not bad. We did not eat anything from their small food service area The Lovin' Oven.

Nice location with free beach chairs/ towels. Best deal for rooms with full kitchens. Ocean view with three decks. Beds were pretty firm/uncomfortable, but overall a nice stay. Gift upon checkout, let us check in early, champagne waiting in room for us for anniversary! Had some issues with billing at first but sorted out before check in.

I stay at this place on business, because it's clean, neat, reasonably priced, and close enough to where I need to be without being in the heart of the tourist madness experience called Waikiki. If you want quiet away from that, it's good. And if you need to go have a drink and watch the sun set, you're five minutes easy walk from the waterfront.

We really enjoy the Aqua Resorts Bamboo Waikiki - it's an oasis of peace n quiet in the midst of the urban jungle that is Waikiki. We live on Kauai and have been to the Bamboo 4 times now and the quality, comfort and reliability are excellent. Their wifi service has been an intermittent issue on a number of occasions but that's the only criticism we have. The lobby and pool areas are serene and smell divine. We've stayed in a variety of rooms from the big suite, to an average, to a studio...all are clean and comfortable. Price to fit any budget! You do have to battle w the Waikiki noise and the A/C gurgling along overnight when trying to sleep. Again, we live on Kauai where it's rural and we have no A/C so...it's an adjustment. It's in the heart of Waikiki so it's convenient. The staff are fun, accommodating and informative. Get your Urban Aloha on w Aqua Resorts Bamboo Waikiki!

We stayed a total of 9 nites 5 at the beginning and 4 at the end. An older style property and book a room overlooking the pool as these are quieter. 1st stay we had a full kitchen and 2nd stay a kitchenette both were good plenty of room and 2 or 3 balconys. Plenty of restaurants and grocery stores nearby and the beach a couple of blocks. The pool area and the outside area are lovely and the complimentary drinks and nibbles served Thursday evening a great idea for all guests to mingle and enjoy. The only issue was the air conditioning was noisy as it was an older style.All the staff were fantastic couldnt do enough to make your stay enjoyable. We wernt looking for a 5 or 6 star property and this really suited out stay.Pam and NormBrisbane.

The staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly. There were cool beverages offered in the lobby. We had a kitchenette which is nice when traveling with children. There was a little grocery store close by which made shopping for food easy. On the downside, all kitchenette suites are located on the front of the building above a VERY noisy street. We were several floors up but we might as well been sleeping on the sidewalk. The cleanliness and range of kitchen supplies left something to be desired. The pool area was set up nicely and there were beach toys for borrowing. Because the pool area is shady, the water was really cold. Although there is a restaurant on site, we would not recommend it. Much better food can be found elsewhere around the same price.

It was nice to be in Waikiki and we got a good price online for two rooms and a kitchen. Nice there was a two person and two single beds. The concierge was helpful and the location was easy - can walk to shops, food and the beach with no problem. Enjoyed the free lei making by the pool one evening.

Just returned from a 3 week stay at the AQUA BAMBOO. This was my 10 time staying at the Aqua Bamboo and already planning my next trip for next year.People ask why I stay at the Bamboo and I tell them- it is not for the aloha feeling of the staff, from the front desk Zenie, Fe, Nicole, Kirmari, Raymond, Brandon ( all these people treat their guests like 'family' and you feel like family). Is is not the salubrious atmosphere of the pool, cabanas, palm trees and deck chairs. No, it is not the fresh tumblers of cold lemonade, ice water or coffee/tea.I can get over the weekly Thu. bamboozle, snacks, the cocktail and Danny, the story teller, singer, and Nicole, doing a hula and telling the history of the Islands.NO, IT IS NOTHING OF THE ABOVE THAT CALLS ME TO RETURN-IT IS THE APPLES, YES APPLES.A HUGE BOWL OF THE JUICIEST, (the juice drips down your hand) TASTY APPLES.Therefore, all my attention for now is to organise my diary for 2015, so that I can get another 3, maybe 4 weeks if the boss is in a good mood, to get my hands on a Aqua Bamboo apple.terry cameronGroup Sales ManagerCRC TRAVELSydney. Australia

When I checked in, even though I travel alone, every staff said "Welcome Back, Tom" very friendly. At that time, I feel "I've just come my home in Waikiki". That's Aqua Bamboo hotel with ALOHA spirit. Heart-warm hospitality, clean and nice-value room with kitchenette, convenient location...I'd like to say to Aqua Bamboo "MAHALO NUI LOA!"

We stayed three nights at the Aqua Bamboo on our two-island (Oahu and Big Island) trip. We reserved the one-bedroom suite with kitchenette, as we were traveling as a family and it is always nice to have that extra space to stretch out a bit. We were very pleased with the room. It was tastefully decorated, clean, and comfortable. We were on the 10th floor and we had great views out all the windows of Honolulu, Waikiki, and the surrounding mountains. Even a nice balcony where we could sit out and enjoy the beautiful weather. We were only two blocks from the beach, which was great, and a quick walk to all the Waikiki shops and restaurants. I thought the room was a very good value compared to many Waikiki properties. It was right on the bus route also, which was very nice as we did not rent a car and we were able to get to Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor very easily. There is a very pleasant outdoor courtyard with a small pool. Not sure the pool was great, but the patio was a very tranquil and relaxing place to sit out and enjoy. Only small complaints were about the plumbing (which seems to be a common issue with many hotel properties). The toilet was constantly running at a very low rate. Also, there was a lot of water which leaked out of the shower stall. As it turned out, our room also had a shower in the tub, so after the first day, we just didn't use the walk-in shower anymore and that little problem was solved. I would definitely stay here again.

Clean, renovated hotel just two blocks from the beach. Close walk to stores, restaurants, Starbucks, pedicures. The staff was friendly, parking available is convenient for $25 a day (valet is the same price as self-park).

Overall great place to stay if you are looking for proximity to the beach (2 block walk). Grocery store, markets, restaurants, all within an easy walk. Hotel is in need of updating so don't be disappointed...but the staff is great!

This place is a gem! It's located only a block away from the beach, so it avoids the crowd and hubub of Waikiki shop-a-holics while still remaining a stone's throw away from the ocean! My husband and I checked in to celebrate our anniversary and we got upgraded to a suite on a high floor so we even have a partial ocean view - all we mentioned was our anniversary and the very friendly woman at the front upgraded us right away! The staff is so friendly and they also made sure we had a room on the pool side to avoid street noise so we don't have trouble sleeping. The hotel has a beautiful ambiance of bamboo and our room is so clean and refreshing with three balconies; the view of the city at night is so great! And as if things couldn't get better, on our first day we arrived back to find chilled champagne and chocolate macadamia nuts waiting for us to celebrate our special day! The hotel does not have complimentary breakfast, but it does have a cute little lunch/dinner cafe by the pool that isn't very expensive. The pool is so cool and refreshing, and has a little waterfall to drown out street noise (clever) and also has a tiny two-person hot tub, which is rare in Honolulu (and was important to me, because not matter how hot the weather, I love hot tubs). And to make it even more refreshing, the hotel offers iced tea/lemonade and chilled water as well as tea/coffee all day for guests and you can rent clean all-day beach towels. I will never stay anywhere else in Waikiki. This place just goes to show that you do not have to spend a fortune to have a wonderful vacation. If you're thinking about your Hawaii vacation and reading this review, trust me... I did HOURS of research on tripadvisor before our stay for practically every place in Waikiki, and I was nervous as heck that this place would be a bust... and it was PERFECT! Thank you forever Aqua Bamboo - you helped make Hawaii that much more amazing.

This was our 3rd time here and it will always be our home away from home. I love the quiet and friendship of the courtyard, the helpful staff, the short jaunt to the beach. I also enjoyed the Lovin Oven this year. Great food when you don't feel like going out.
user_name:
Faye R
Swift Current, Saskatchewan, Canada

review_body: Right on Kuhio, close to bus stops. Good room with small kitchenette. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Great pool area to relax! 24 hour coffee and cool drinks. Pool and hot tub. The only drawback is the noise from Kuhio - no sleeping in. Would definitely stay again

After trawling accommodation websites for ages, and reading a variety of reviews on the huge array of hotels in Waikiki, a friend came to the rescue and highly recommended Aqua Bamboo.THANKYOU!!! It is a great little hotel in a wonderful location. So close to the beach and walking distance to restaurants/shopping and the 'high end' part of Waikiki without the extra $$$$. The hotel pool is a little tropical oasis in the centre of the action. Also, a lovely family run restaurant on site with awesome pizzas. The hotel is not new but it is tastefully furnished, very comfortable and very clean. Quick and easy free Wi-Fi. Our Moderate Room had a fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and all required plates/cutlery. Everything we needed.Our last night (after returning from a cruise) we stayed one night at the same price as our previous stay the week before, in a kitchenette unit!!! Only a small negative - the air con is a through wall variety which is a little noisier than split system or ducted. But look around at most surrounding buildings, as their air cons are the same.The highlight was the staff......they are so friendly and helpful, while being laid back. Thanks Fe and Raymond.....much Aloha. Stay here if you want real value for money.

This is the third time I have stayed at the Aqua Bamboo and I can't imagine staying any place else. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the rooms are attractive and comfortable and the location is perfect. The pool courtyard is really an oasis away from the business of Waikiki and the Thursday get-togethers are entertaining, friendly and a nice way to meet other hotel guests.I look forward to my return visit! Many thanks to Nicole, Zenie, Fe and all the other staff members who were so kind and helpful. 'Til we meet again….

The Aqua Bamboo is a quality hotel for a good price...and just blocks from the beach. The furnishings and amenities were very nice and the water pressure was good in the shower. Each person we encountered at the front desk was genuine, friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

This is a very difficult place to review because there are some great things and some truly awful things and I'm genuinely conflicted. The good: Great location, very close to the beach, shops, car rental, etc. The staff are excellent, there are free towels and chairs for the beach as well as boogie boards that can be loaned (no charge), good pool area (pool a bit cold and spa a little small, would bother some, but not me), laundry facilities onsite (have to pay) good size room (not massive though) with separate master bedroom (very handy as we were travelling with a 2 year old). Good kitchen facilities.The bad: very, very dated (but TBH I expected this for the price), bench area in kitchen very small. The absolute worst part though is the noise from the street. We started on level 3 the first night and luckily upon arrival, the staff offered to move us to level 8 for the following night (without prompting), which made things better. The noise on level 3 was unbelievable!!! It was like we were actually on the street (which is a major street), there's no noise insulation at all. Level 8 was still loud, but tolerable. The air conditioner units are also loud, though we did manage to sleep through this. I cannot overstate this, you need ear plugs if you anything like a light sleeper.This would be a 2 star review because of the noise factor, but have left at 3 because of the little features like the staff that made the stay enjoyable.I'd still recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again. But... bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. If you think that's an unreasonable thing to have to do then unless you can get a room very high up, probably best to avoid.

I stayed here recently with my adult daughter. We had 9 nights. The good points, Location good one block from Kalakahua Ave (main drag).and one more block from the beach. 5min walk. It is close to food and shops of all kinds. The food pantry is 5min walk (groceries) Lots of Starbucks around and Coffee Bean good too. Reception is 24hr and very helpful, they also have a tour desk also helpful. Coffee and water available in the Lobby. There is also the little restaurant called the Lovin Oven on site open for lunch and dinner. The pool and surrounds are just lovely very relaxing. Also a hot tub which was very hot. You can use all the free beach chairs and mats and blow up toys to take to the beach. Free beach towels available all the time. We were in 601 pool side and it was perfect everything you could want. We started on the same floor roadside but way too noisy for us so decided to upgrade to the poolside. Was well worth it. Overall this hotel is a home away from home.

After reading all the negative reviews before going l was concern that l may have booked the wrong hotel. After staying 10 night l can honestly say l have had a very enjoyable and relaxing time at this hotel. All the staff are friendly and over the top helpful. I think the negative review failed to tell the hotel of there issues. While the hotel is a little old in style and décor. there is a feeling of friendliness the moment you walk in the hotel. We arrived at 7.30am after flying all night from Australia and got straight in to our room. There is a daily paper available in the lobby which you can take back to your room to read. The Thursday afternoon happy hour at the pool was superb, great entertainment and drinks and nibbles. While the room is a little out-dated in had a comfortable bed and was clean and well serviced each day. The location is perfect for the beach,( one short block from the beach), public transport at the front door ( The Bus in both directions ), the local restaurants are easy to walk to and have great meals at very cheap prices. Tour company can be booked thru the hotel and they pick you up at the front door. Washing you clothes was easy , washing machine and dryer one floor below our room. Easy to use. Food pantry store 5 minutes walk and have all you need for breakfast or snacks, ABC ( like our 7/11 stores ) on nearly every corner .It was the staff and there helpfulness and wanting to help which impressed me most.

We booked this hotel because of the good price on a package deal and hoped for the best (you get what you pay for.) We were very pleased when we arrived. The location is great! Easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping and about 1 block from a major pick up spot, perfect for if you do a lot of tours that include bus transportation. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Chris and the concierge desk helped us plan our stay and we had a great time! We were surprised with champagne and chocolates (it was an anniversary trip) which was very nice! And unlike many other hotels in the area, there was no "resort fee" and the "free" amenities they advertised really were included (no hidden charges.) Overall, we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel because we were out enjoying our vacation, but our room was clean and comfortable when we needed a break from all the activities.

This place was excellent, the staff were so helpful, the bed was extremely comfortable and the room had plenty of space, even a kitchen. Had a great happy hour on Thursdays besides the pool. Was close to the beach and the shopping, and a market around the corner twice a week into the evening. We never had a chance to try the restaurant, but would recommend this place definitely.

This was a last minute booking and I couldn't have been more pleased. The staff was second to none. Eager to please and always friendly. The room was very cramped (but I wanted a King size bed), the furniture in the room was somewhat worn, and the frying pan was way too big for the two burner stove, but it didn't detract from our overall enjoyment. The pool area is very nice with comfortable chairs. I like that it's not a hotel with 2 or 3 hundred people. The location was great, close to shopping, the beach, and great places to run. The great service extends to the restaurant by the pool as well. The "Lovin Oven" has great food at affordable prices and the owners couldn't be nicer. I would highly recommend The Aqua Bamboo to couples or business travelers.

Great location, 3 blocks from beach and main street in Wikkiki. Everything is within walking distance. The hotel staff made this a great experience. Rooms are avg, no continental breakfast. Tip: We looked for a hotel with free parking, this hotel advertised free parking a $25 per day value. We did have to provide proof of that advertisement.

The hotel is well located, and the staff is friendly.It seems like everyone genuinely wants you to have a good stay- usual in Wonderful Hawaii.They even helped me get a shuttle at the last minute.Only downside would be the view from the rooms. But again, 3mn away, you have wonderful sights of paradise.

This is our fourth time staying here. We really enjoy the gardens,hot tub when it was hot. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We hope to be back next year.I have already booked for 2015.Hope to be back then.

This is a great hotel in a great location for the budget traveler. It is comfortable, clean and fully equipped to make a short stay away from home an excellent experience. Recommendable for the business, couple or family traveler.

Considering how expensive Waikiki is, this hotel was a good value. I was pleasantly surprised at the comfort of the beds. The location can't be beat; although not on the water, it is close enough, and having the Food Pantry close by made eating affordable. The pool area is cozy and amazingly quiet. I agree with other reviews: if you can get a room poolside I am sure it would be much quieter than the Kuhio Street side. The older air conditioner did get a bit noisy, but covered up enough of the street noise and cooled off the room comfortably that I didn't mind. Above all, the staff was very friendly and accommodating.

We booked a studio through Ali'i Beach Rentals at the Aqua, even though the booking was private the staff were lovely, nice cafe/rest in the pool area (good pancakes & pizza) walk or bus to 'anywhere' from here. Loved it!

We enjoyed our 3 days stay at this hotel. Staff at the front desk were friendly and they even gave us some advice to save money in town. They even mailed our postcards for us. Hotel is well located near the waikiki beach and lots of good restaurant all around. Bed was very confortable and we had good nights of sleep. There is a small table, fridge, microwake and even dishes. So you can buy groceries and do some cooking and eat in your room. Very satisfied.

very friendly and helpful staff. The manager was interactive and always willing to help. They accommodated us with no problem when we needed a late check out. The courtyard and pool is beautiful and comfortable , hidden away like a little jewel in the middle of the city.We are going to make this our home away from home forever.

We arrived on an early flight from Sydney on a busy Saturday morning. My daughter was sick and the fantastic staff made sure we could access our room prior to check in time. Over our 10 day stay nothing was too much trouble for the wonderful team at the Aqua Bamboo. The room was comfortable and clean. We could have benefited from some extra crockery and cutlery in the kitchen, but we managed . I was surprised that for a full kitchen we only had a small bar fridge, this made it difficult to keep the groceries we needed. Yes, it was a little noisy at night, and I think it is time to replace the noisy airconditioning units. I would stay here again and ask for a room on the pool side. Thank you Aqua Bamboo for a great stay.

stayed for 8 nights. staff were brilliant. had to have a room change-upgraded to 1 bedroom apart first one smelled of wet carpet..biggest complaint is noise from facing kuhio st- noise is constant.Problem with that was doors closed most of time but air cond is noisy so no relief from noise. ceiling fans may help with this problem,or newer units that are not so noisy.good location to all areas of shopping and beach-just a pleasant walk.bus stops across road.bit expensive for older smaller hotel.rooms had everything in them(kitchenettes).pool area very nice. pizza rest had great food and lovely owners.overall enjoyed my stay but would probably check out hotels more in side streets.

This boutique hotel was in a great location for restaurants, driving to University of Hawaii, and good music down the road. Parking was a bit expensive. Internet was very spotty and frustrating when trying to take care of business, but the staff more than made up for things with their helpful attitude.

We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Waikiki...very beautiful boutique hotel...and we were upgraded to the studio! Everything else in Waikiki is starting to feel dated and old...this hotel has been remodeled and is beautiful, you won't be disappointed. Wonderful friendly staff too!

This place was such a dump. Sure in the photos they show some great sheets and linens with orange accents with wood trimming in the room, but once you're there it is totally schizophrenic. Sure, they invested in the nice sheets and some new wooden modern styled lamps and clothing drawers, but it was all very cheap so falling apart. The walls were all scratched up and stained like out of a horror movie, wooden furnitures chipped all over the place, the air conditioner was from like the 1960s and emitted an awful moldy smell (that, or it was the fridge), the bathroom was peeling. Worst of all, it was IMPOSSIBLE to sleep if you unluckily ended up with a room facing the street. Who knew for such a small street it would be so noisy. The patio doors barely close so all night you hear speed races zooming by, the bus, people at 2am walking back from the bars. Another thing was the internet didn't work at all the entire time we were there, checking in at 9am until departure at 11am, but well that was just a fluke incident beyond the control of the hotel.The common areas were even more horrifying- the lobby was a bad episode of Trading Spaces. They couldn't replace the old structure, such as the walls and marble flooring, but added some new things and it just makes it look tacky. The elevators were ancient, and the decor on the floors were just totally weird. If this is just to hang out with friends, that's fine but for a honeymoon or something romantic this place will be a huge disappointment.The strangest part was the parking situation. I don't know if they have a normal lot below their hotel, but I guess since it was full you have to park at the hotel next door. Absolutely scary. My god.On the positive side, the pool was lovely, lots of free newspapers, and breakfast had some nice coffees and simple eats. The staff was also great, I mean granted the hotel is what is physically is, but the people were really quick to address any questions and were really helpful. But remember, if you do stay here, BEG for a room facing the pool and not the streets. That seemed to be quiet, those lucky guys.

What a great hotel, with all the amenities, and particularly friendly and helpful staff. We had a week stay at the Aqua Bamboo, and were wishing it was two! Our room was spotless, and very comfortable. We had a great little coffee-maker with Kona coffee supplied by the hotel, which was a great way to start our days, and was much appreciated. There was a microwave, fridge, and two burner cooktop in our room, and all of the dishes and cutlery needed. We had towel cards, which enabled us to have as many beach towels as we needed. The lobby is very welcoming and always had lemonade, water, tea, hot chocolate, and fresh apples. The welcome was very nice, and the staff at the desk were very helpful, and very pleasant. We also had use of the laundry facilities, which were great. The pool is beautiful, and is a perfect oasis. I can't wait to return!

Me and my girlfriend enjoyed our stay. Very nice and quaint hotel. Was better than I expected. Room was updated and had a small fridge, microwave, and small kitchenette. Comes with free in-room WiFi. Hotel supplies beach towels which is a great plus. Exchange them as much as you want at the front desk. Staff very nice and accommodating. Has a nice pool and hot tub in back. The rooms facing the street are a bit noisey but for the price this hotel is a great value. Hotel just about 2 blocks from the beach and very close to many restaurants and activities. $25 per night to park your car but that is typical for the area.

I think this is a great place. 2 blocks from the beach, clean and really lovely energy, friendly and helpful staff. Only two drawbacks for me, but these aren't dings on the place: one, I had a rental car and the garage with the hotel is tiny, so I ended up parking a few blocks away at a public garage (upside: it was cheaper!), and two this hotel is right in the hustle and bustle of the commercial area of Waikiki. So if that's what you're looking for it's great - if you want something more removed then you might want to look elsewhere. Once inside the hotel it was lovely, though.

We stayed on the 11th floor of the Aqua Bamboo and had a view of city and partial view of the ocean. We enjoyed having kitchen facilities and the proximity to the beach. The housekeeping staff did a great job. The front desk staff were very nice and friendly. Lokahi at the front desk was very helpful and always so obliging. We enjoyed the Thursday night reception and the leis making. Our stay was from January 26 th to Feb 3. Thanks for everything.Ron & Linda

We stayed three nights and very much enjoyed an excellent comfortable room, The staff are very friendly. It was so nice to not be in one of the big hotels with their surging.masses and inevitable errors. We felt we were well looked after. A highlight of our stay was the restaurant service provided in the courtyard by "The Lovin Oven". It was such a soothing locale that we ate there more than once. The beach is a short walk and towels and chairs free at the front desk. A 24 hour hour grocery is half a block away and a liquor store is nearer.

We had a couple of days enroute home from usa to nz and stayed in this hotel. The welcome by staff was efficient and very helpful. We had bookrd a room with kitchen facilities and it was very adequate for our purpses. The room was a bit small, but clean though it did have a musty smell when we first entered. We thougt this hotel provided good value for money and its location was extremely good for a short stopover.

We have been to hawaii 4 times and although the other hotels were nice this hotel is the only one I would recommend. Like most things it's the little things that make the difference, like free wifi in the room, free coffe in the lobby free use of beach towels. A pool that isn't square and boring but has a waterfall and a Jacuzzi.

We rented a 1 bedroom suite for 4 blissful night's and we both enjoyed every second of it. I am from Ewa Beach, Hawaii and my Wife and I had made a commitment that we would love to stay at The Aqua Bamboo Waikiki for our yearly marriage anniversary! Lots of Love and Aloha Spirit. The Hotel check-in went smooth and The check-out went quickly, the only flaw about this is that it ended to soon for myself and my wife had to get back to the hustle and bustle of reality.A Hui Hou e' Malama Pono,Koko Hookano

We had a wonderful trip. The staff are great and were helpful with questions on activities and places to visit. The courtyard is serene, tranquil and above all it was like being home away from home. We plan to stay at Aqua Bamboo on our next visit.Thank you,Gwen B.

We rented a one-bedroom suite in the hotel for a week and were very happy with our experience. The suite was just big enough for my husband, two teenager daughters, and I to be comfortable. The kitchenette was a great asset. The hotel lobby and gardens have a lot of nice touches, including some lovely buddhas and a picturesque pavillion amongst the palm trees. The location was such that we were very central, but it was still an escape from the rush of traffic and tourists.The Bamboozled event on Thursday night was wonderful, with the chance to listen to a musician singing and playing his ukelele as well as to make leis. We would definitely stay there again.

This was our fourth visit to Oahu and we always stay at the Aqua Bamboo. We would not stay anywhere else. The location is perfect, the staff are excellent, friendly and takes good care of you, The rooms are clean and comfortable which makes for a relaxing stay. We love the peace and quiet you can nave in the middle of the city. We love it and will be back

Had a great vacation and good times at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel in Honolulu. The staff and location were excellent. We has stayed at the Aqua Bamboo before and they have upgraded the rooms. The pool and hot tub were refreshing. Located in the middle of all of the activities in Waikiki, I strongly recommend this hotel. The staff were on top of everything and were very helpful during our 1 week stay. Check in was quick and smooth. Check out took 1 minute. Love that the hotel is smaller and not overcrowded. My family and I will stay here again on out next trip to Waikiki.

The wife and I travel to Oahu several times per year and have been staying at the Bamboo for several years. The property is conveniently located in Waikiki and within walking distance of everything. This hotel is a great value and gives guests more than their moneys worth. The staff is wonderful and I personally can't understand why this property has only a two star rating. If guests want more and are willing to pay for it the Hyatt is right around the corner. We don't use the pool but it looks clean and inviting and there is now a place to eat on property. I would probably never stay at another hotel while visiting Oahu.
user_name:
Randy D
Wailuku, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 8 nights. I had read previous reviews that suggested we ask for a room at the back of the hotel, so we did. We stayed in room 1106 and had a view of the ocean from our bed. The kitchenette is very small, but for my husband and I it did the trick. The bed was comfortable and location hard to beat. It was a bit noisy in the mornings, but honestly, what do you expect when you are staying in a hotel that is right in the middle of Waikiki? If you want peace and tranquility, stay outside of town! The room wasn't decorated beautifully, but again, for the price you pay it's really quite nice. For what you pay, this really is a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again. I can't vouch for the other rooms, but I enjoy pampering myself and staying in nice places, and this hotel suited me just fine for the price point :)

The wife and I spent one week in December 2013. Upon arrival we were shown into a room that was very old and needed lots of repair. We were then given keys to another room which was little better...to make a long story short we viewed four rooms before one was acceptable. Owners have done nothing or very little to to replace outdated or worn out decor, including dishes, etc. A complete disappointment!! On a brighter side, the location is great, close to beach, food, entertainment. Staff were very pleasant and try to assist, but with little to offer from the owners. If the owners do not wish to invest in repair and upgrades then they should price this property no better than a 'dive' or Motel '6'. Pictures shown on the web certainly were not represenative of the rooms shown us. Aqua management should be embarrassed to represent a property in such disrepair...speaks volumes about the Aqua company.

This Is a Great Hotel I can't say anything bad about it,Bamboo have a great staff very friendly very good team work, Way To Go Aqua Bamboo Staff keep up the good work,This hotel is like 3 minutes away from the beach ,there is a bus stop right across the road,Me and my wife are here right now and also booked for next year.Bamboo also have a tiny restraunt by the pool and the pizza is to die for,free coffee in room,free internet in room and lobby,Also in the lobby they have 24 hours free coffee, ice tea and lemonade.I would strongly recommend this hotel to everybody.

Our studio kitchen unit was just fine for our trip. There is really nothing horrible about this hotel but there's nothing great about it either. Kitchen is stocked with equipment ; but much of it is old ,chipped and worn out. Cleaning staff does the most rudimentary amount of work needed. Dishes are not washed and kitchen is not cleaned. Tub is not cleaned. Our room was on the pool side and on a higher floor so noise was not a huge issue. It was nice having two balconies for a crossbreeze. Staff is friendly. No real restaurant or breakfast is served here. Parking is expensive too-even for Waikiki($25).Might or might not stay here again. Mahalo;)

I can't seem to understand all the terrible reviews! We just arrived home for a fantastic stay here. My only wish was that we had started our trip here from the get go. We originally arrived at the Doubletree hotel and after 4 days and a terrible stay moved over to the Aqua Bamboo as they were so accommodating for our big group. We had 25 of us in total (U16 Boys Rugby Tour) The Staff was so incredibly helpful and friendly. We were able to feed all of our group between the in-room kitchens and poolside BBQ. The outside atmosphere was amazing and the location is so convenient.I do agree that the windows could use some double paned glass but this is by far not the only hotel in this area that suffers from this problem. The nights are quite it is just in the mornings if you sleep in! LOL I highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling in groups especially if you are travelling with a team on a budget. Being able to cook poolside is invaluable and the staff is soo amazing!Thanks you so much to the Aqua Bamboo and we look forward to staying here again really soon!

To all our friends at the Bamboo, you guys made our Bayside Rugby Tour epic. The facilities are perfect for a group or large family setting, customer service was AMAZING. .. Coming off a terrible experience at the Double tree the first couple of days of our stay you guys stepped up and made the rest of our trip awesome. Pool and bbq are the best in waikiki. Staff our great and the in house pizza lovin oven is fantastic.. can not give them more stars 5 is max to bad they deserve 10. The Bayside families and friends will be back
user_name:
Larry K
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: We enjoyed our time here. It is a good location and an easy walk to Waikiki. The added bonus was that we could get twin beds for our kids. I feel that the staff tries really hard to accomodate your needs. We had problems with the air conditioning units in our room. Very finicky though we finally figured them out in the wee hours of the night and they are loud. The restaurant hours are not reliable. There was a notice in our room saying that they serve breakfast but they didn't and the front desk staff did not know what was happening with that. A little odd. We enjoyed going up to the twelfth floor and poking out the back towards Waikiki. The pool area was very pretty. Otherwise we were comfortable and felt safe. It was a good value for the money considering what you could be paying in this area.

My husband and I stayed in a studio kitchenette for three nights in mid-December. I've read a whole variety of reviews on this hotel, and I honestly can't tell why people have left such negative reviews. I'm not the most forgiving person when it comes to my accommodation, but we found the Aqua Bamboo to be quite good. We purchased in advance for a decent rate (particularly in comparison to other Waikiki hotels!). The reservation agents were very cheerful and happy to answer my queries about our options.The room was a decent size and the king bed was very comfortable. It was also very clean. The air conditioner is a bit noisy but you do get used to it. The only down side is that the noise from Waikiki can be a bit loud at times even with the balcony door closed. The pool downstairs is small but quite nice, and they offer iced water, lemonade / iced tea complimentary to guests. After the long flight from Sydney, this was a blessing!We loved how convenient it was in location to everything. Aqua Bamboo staff were lovely, and the concierge service was top notch. The only thing I will say is to stay away from the in house cafe - it's overpriced for what you get, the lady that runs it is borderline surly and the food was pretty bloody average.All in all, we would definitely stay at the Aqua Bamboo again. I don't agree with their website's description of it being "luxury" accommodation but it was definitely a pleasant stay.

My stay at the Aqua Bamboo was very pleasant.Pros: Great location just 1 block up from Waikiki beach and in the hub of the area, very clean room, the free wifi was quick and never dropped out, 24-hr reception, door locked after 10pm is safe (keycard access needed), cute pool area, free iced tea & water provided in reception, beach towels provided for free, microwave, cutlery and crockery in roomCons: The only major con is that even though we were on the 10th floor of the hotel and our balcony was not street facing we could still hear street noise very loudly from Kuhio Ave. Other small cons: the pillows were VERY thick and hence a tad uncomfortable, bad shower head pressure, very loud air-conditioner, no full-length mirror in room

After five weeks of trying each island staying in some good and bad b&bs hostels it was just nice to get my own bathroom double bed tv etc 300m from the beach front road I would rate the room 3.5 star the location 4 star all good at a fair price if you want a better room and sunset location expect to pay twice as much but as ive had sunsets for a month im happy away from the crowdsOne last tip if you like a good walk head to kaena point the Albatross reserve is magicallywatching there courtship on sunset with whales rising not far out and the odd monk seal on the rocks was the highlight from this island you have to drive past Dillingham airfield where Obama came into go to the end of the road where the taac runs out there will be losts of cars parked it takes 1-2 hours each way.

We (my husband and I - in our 50's) and my mother and uncle (in their 80's) had a 3 night stay in one of the two "luxury" suites just before Christmas, capping off a wonderful two week stay in Waikiki. We chose this particular accommodation because we needed a unit with a bedroom with two beds (for the elderly siblings) plus a bed in the living room for ourselves. Many Waikiki one bedroom units have only one bed in the bedroom, so we were happy to find this.The Aqua Bamboo is very central to all Waikiki has to offer. It is right on Kuhio, the main bus corridor, and is a very short walk to the most lively area of Waikiki beach. Several restaurants are nearby, as is the Food Pantry, a pretty well stocked small grocery store.The hotel has a welcoming cozy retro vibe. Ceilings in the lobby are very low, which we noticed at some other Waikiki properties built in the 60's and 70's as well. There is a free beverage station (ice water, lemonade/ice tea, coffee) which we really valued. Behind the hotel is a tropical and secluded (for Waikiki) pool area - waterfall, pool, hot tub, comfortable seating, and BBQ. This was a very relaxed place to spend time, an oasis in the city. The pool water was cool (colder than the ocean), and the tiny hot tub was just warm. There is a small restaurant off the pool area - didn't eat there so can't comment.Staff we encountered at the hotel were warm and helpful. As you enter the hotel, it is necessary to walk right by the front desk (also the place where you pick up fresh beach towels) so we interacted with front desk staff frequently.Room 903 is quite unique - I would describe it as a beach cottage transplanted to the 9th floor. It has undergone renovations in recent years so is in pretty good condition. It has a fairly open plan and has a huge (party-worthy - not that we tested that) North facing lanai (600 sq feet I believe) including a table for 4, comfortable chairs and coffee tables under a palapa, 2 deluxe lounge chairs for sunning, and a full sized BBQ. A second lanai off the bedroom (East facing) has a nice ocean view. Although lanais were a bit noisy, it helped that we were on the 9th floor, well above the street. The main lanai was so comfortable that we ended up eating breakfast and dinner there all 3 days of our stay. We saw some great rainbows over the mountains from there.Beds in the bedroom were comfortable, but we found the futon in the living room to be uncomfortable for sleeping - a regular sofa bed would have been a huge improvement. The "bedroom" was separated from the living area by louvred doors only (something we new when booking - this seems to be common in Waikiki). The kitchenette was tiny and scantly stocked with dishes and equipment. We discovered at the end of our stay that we could have asked for more dishes etc. but we managed to make do with what was provided and didn't make a request.The bathroom was very functional (2 sinks, a stand-alone shower, plus a tub).We met several other guests during our stay and many were repeat customers of the hotel. They appreciated the hotel's location, comfortable atmosphere, staff, nice pool/BBQ area, and overall value.The Aqua Bamboo is not a new or 5* property, but it is clean, has had updates in recent years, is centrally located, seems to be well-managed, and offers good value. The "luxury" suites are unique and worthwhile to stay in - if staying in another room type I would probably request a pool view room to minimize noise and possibly catch a glimpse of the ocean. This hotel is a solid Waikiki choice and I would stay there again.

We stayed here for 2 weeks within which the staff were knowledgeable when we had questions, prompt when we had nagging problems with our room, and friendly throughout our stay.The room we booked was equipped with a kitchenette which was important for our needs in addition to saving money by preparing and eating in-situ. Our room on the 6th floor faced the road and to be honest, noise intrusion was not too bad despite the reviews here. I agree that the a/c unit was noisy and leaked from the outside when it was in operation but you soon get use to the drone. Beds were made daily with the exception on 1 day and we had to request for shower lotion when it had runout.The location is only 1 block away from the beach, and is in close proximity to convenience stores (ABC and food pantry) and some decent and reasonable eateries including Me BBQ (Korean) and Marukame Udon. It is also situated on a principal bus route into downtown and beyond so there are numerous bus options from the bus stop opposite the hotel.Beach towels, floats, inflatables and surf boards are available to guests upon request to avoid unnecessary hire for the latter.We parked our hired car for several days in the hotel underground parking for $25 a night which is about the same charge as other parking that can be found in the area.

We are a family of 3 that stayed right over Christmas and although Waikiki was full of activity Aqua Bamboo was a welcome oasis. So many special touches which made us feel welcome and really enhanced our experience.1. Apartment was cleaned every day (which is unique for an apartment stay).2. Upgraded to a nicer room free of charge.3. Welcome juice and cool face cloth on arrival.4. Free beach amenities, Boogie board, inflatable tube, kids beach toys, beach chairs and towels.4. Manager's cocktail reception5. Christmas dinner organised at cafe by the pool if you wanted to partake. 6. Welcome and parting note and gift.All in all this isn't a fancy 5 star hotel with a huge pool and lots going on, BUT if you are the kind of traveller that is looking for a base at a perfect location in which to explore Oahu and experience Waikiki then this is the place. Superb value for money, the rooms were clean (see room notes) , bright and the staff very friendly.

I was in Waikiki and had an extra night so I booked the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki. It is very close to the main street with all the shopping and restaurants. The room was very comfortable, clean, and had a kitchenette - which was great for storing food and drinks. Also, the staff was extremely nice and helpful. Not an extremely luxurious hotel, but exactly what I wanted.

A group of 6 of us stayed at the Aqua Bamboo on 2 occasions in October. First for 4 nights and again for 3 nights. We stayed in 2 X 2 bedroom, rooms. We found them to be spacious, clean and good value for money. Apparently all the 2 bedroom suites are located facing the street which can be quite noisy. On our return later in the month, we asked for rooms on a higher level and we were accommodated. This was much quieter. The air conditioners in our rooms were all old and noisy, but you get use to the drone. There is a tour desk in the lobby, though I'm not sure how there prices compare as we didn't book any tours. Small intimate pool area. Managers (free) drinks & nibbles by the pool on Thursdays is a nice touch. Oh and also chocolates as a thank you on our first departure and a bamboo flute on our second.

Our travel agent once described the type of hotels we should look for as clean & comfortable - we like the big flashy hotels of course, but can't afford them! The Aqua Bamboo was right up our alley. We stayed in 1 bed with full kitchen on 8th floor, had big double bed in the bedroom & 2 single beds in the other room, so would have happily accommodated family with 2 bigger kids than our little one.Room had everything we needed, full kitchen, table & chairs, decent bathroom.The staff wee great, very helpful & friendly. We especially liked the personalised welcome & farewell letters in our room.Very minor down sides were: The room faced the street so quite a bit of road noise, but the air conditioning units made enough noise to block most of it out;Some of the towels had holes in them - not enough to stop them functioning, but not really great.The cot for our infant son was a bit rickety but he didn't want to sleep in it anyway (kids hey!) and we had other beds to chose from, so this wasn't a problem.The only real negative I would say is that I think the carpet needs cleaning - after letting our son sit on the floor one day & getting dirty hands, we wouldn't let him down there again.Would we go back - probably :)

My husband, myself and our daughter stayed here for 15 nights and we really felt at home from the moment we arrived. The spacious and very clean room had 2 double beds, a fully stocked kitchen, 3 balconies and a view of the pool. The staff was wonderful - from the management to the front desk, the housekeepers - everyone. We had a slight problem where our bathtub wasn’t draining properly and within 5 minutes there was someone in our room to fix it. The front desk staff are very helpful and go out of their way to help you. We love the staff at this hotel. This hotel is very good value, in a great location (a few short blocks to the beach and shopping), has a lovely little outdoor pool (and sauna) with chairs and air mattresses to bring to the beach. There is complimentary coffee and iced tea as well as fresh apples in the lobby for all the guests. We highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely be back again next time we visit Waikiki.

Stayed here for 6 nights and found the hotel a great place to stay. The staff were very helpful and the room comfortable and large (it had 2 doubles in it). Complimentary tea, coffee and iced drinks in the lobby was a nice touch. The air conditioning was a tad noisy but didn't really bother me. the pool area was relaxing and the "Lovin Oven" eatery (separate from the hotel) served up some cracking dishes for breakfast and lunch.

Recently stayed in a number of hotels in Waikiki, ranging from expensive to cheaper. This was in the middle in terms of price but probably the best quality. Preferred this to the Marriott and this was only a fraction of the price. Definitely recommend.

My wife and I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo (our second time) in November. The stay was great as usual.Staff:Just like three years ago, the staff were excellent. The staff were friendly and attentive. They would print off directions to attractions for us and accommodated our very late checkout on our last day. The front desk will also store your bags in a secure, locked area when you have a late flight.Location:The hotel is located less than two blocks from the beach. The hotel also provides you beach chairs, floats, and wave boards. The location is very convenient and in a great area for food and entertainment.Room:We booked the Lanai room which was excellent. We had a great patio with a lounge area, a high top table, a barbeque, and two loungers.Our room had two balconies. We also had a nice lounge area, kitchenette, and bedroom.Our main balcony had gas "torches" that we had lit in the evenings when we would have drinks on the patio.Pool Area:The Pool area is great. It is a private secluded pool with a nice "tropical" look. There is also a great hot tub that is usually free in the evening.Overall Recommendation:I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone. The staff are great and really make the stay very enjoyable.

This hotel is super close to the really expensive part of Waikiki so we had all the convenience of high-end restaurants and shops and beaches without paying extremely high prices. The pool area is friendly and tropical, and the staff was over-the-top - every single person from the front desk to the concierge to the people cleaning our rooms - everyone took pride in their jobs and did everything to make us happy. Very high quality service. The front desk allowed us to pay a fee to stay until evening because of a late flight home, and I had to do some scanning for a work project, and they happily and efficiently helped with that as well. This is a great place to stay - I will definitely visit again!!

We needed a break from all our activities and found this very delightful hotel near the center of Waikiki. We rate this excellent due to its central location, moderately priced, modern amenities in the room, friendly staff, convenient beverage machines, and all the pretty little flowers they leave all over the room. Some easily overlooked drawbacks were the slow draining bathtub, our view of another hotel from our room and not really a spa hotel. There was a tiny kitchen and wares, very modern looking, and the shower curtain frame was circular with weights, so it didn't cling to your skin when using the shower. Furniture looked new, and bedmattress very comfortable. It is located no more than two blocks from lots of restaurants, food court, the beach and all public transportation. We would stay again any time.

We stayed at this hotel from November 17 to November 23, 2013. The staff were very hospitable and made our stay most memorable. There are a lot of free amenities at the hotel including free Wi-Fi, coffee, lemonade and even beach towels and mats, But it was the service that impressed us the most. We were extremely happy about how they remembered it was our anniversary and surprised us with a bottle of wine along with a lovely greeting card. To top it all, they presented a cute parting gift on the last day of our stay. The relatively small size of the room compared to other hotels we stayed at was the only flaw but, since we spent most of our day outside, it didn't affect us in any way. We would definitely stay at this hotel if we ever return to Hawaii.

Another great stay at Aqua Bamboo ( 4th time). As always staff are friendly and helpful and rooms and other areas are very clean. Thursday night activities around the pool are a great way to meet fellow travelers. Whilst hotel is not on the main strip, it's close to everything and the local bus company "The Bus" stops right across the road - for $2.50 you can pretty much travel anywhere on the island.The charm of the hotel is that with a small number of rooms you don't have the "tour groups" staying there so it's almost like you are staying with family and the staff make you feel like you are right at home.

My wife and I spent a lovely relaxing couple of days in the Aqua Bamboo in early November 2013. We arrived from our flight around 9am and the Bamboo had our room available. It was lovely to be able to move in and change before going to see the sights. The Bamboo staff at each opportunity were helpful. The front desk, tour desk and concierge all assisted with our questions and need for direction in a very friendly and efficient manner. The room was clean and comfortable with TV and free wifi. The room wasn't huge, but comfortable for a couple with a small table and chairs, and a small kitchenette ( sink, frig, microwave etc) which made it easy to bring take out back to the room. The pool was a good spot to refresh and relax between wandering around the shops and sights of Waikiki. Highly recommend the Aqua Bamboo.

We really liked staying here. The rooms were spacious, clean, and affordable and the amenities were lovely! We like the pool and it is a nice perk that the hotel provides you with free beverages throughout the day. The location is also incredibly convenient. This is a good place to stay if you are on vacation or if you are on a business trip. One of our favorite places to stay in Waikiki...

My husband and I spent our 15th Wedding Anniversary and my 50th BD at the Aqua Bamboo and enjoyed every minute of it! It is a close walk to the beach (passing the best Mexican restaurant + margaritas in town) along the way.Our room was clean and we found the front desk staff very helpful and friendly regarding any questions we had re restaurants + arranging our tranportation whenever needed.We totally enjoyed the pool area, a very relaxing atmosphere after a day at the beach! We would/will recommend this place to everyone.Thanks to all Bamboo staff that made this a memorable time for me and my husband.

Spent my bday weekend here with my bf. Always an enjoyable stay. Friendly staff. Zenie & Lokahi & the entire housekeeping staff were very friendly. id recommend this place to anyone. Close to restaurants, shopping area, beach etc. will be coming back in the future.

My husband and I returned to Aqua Bamboo in November. We contacted Nicole via email and she was able to provide us with a discount. She also gave it for my parents who I highly recommended this hotel to.We love that it is a smaller hotel, less rooms, more homely. If you want lots of contact with staff you can have it, if not you can just keep to yourself and no one bothers you.The rooms are always clean. We learnt from our first stay to ask for a room which looks over the pool, less noise from the busy Kuhio Avenue. FREE wifi available is every room.Lovely refreshments available in the lobby 24/7 along with fresh apples and newspapers daily. There used to be a massage business next to the pool, it is now a small cafe open till 4pm daily. We had a panini for lunch which was delicious.Aqua Bamboo is a close walk to everything, you won't be disappointed! Also, make use of "The Bus" right out front as this can take you all over the island for $2.50 per person.We even received a departing gift (bamboo flute) on our last day. Those special touches make staying here so nice. The only thing is that I wish the pool was heated :)Thank you Nicole and staff for another lovely stay.

Stayed there Oct. 28 - Nov. 2, 2013. Really nice boutique hotel. 3 short blocks to the beach. The room was clean and comfortable with a little fridge, coffee maker, microwave, stove, dishes cutlery, 2 person table and an alcove with a desk. Came with free Wi-fi to help us stay in touch with our kids at home. They provide you with cards to obtain beach towels from the front desk so that you don't have to bring wet and dirty towels to the room. Staff was friendly and very helpful.The pool is a little oasis surrounded by greenery. The only down side was that the air conditioning is provided by a wall unit so you have some variable ambient noise when it starts and stops in the night. The majority of the time we didn't notice because we came back to the room pretty tired from our busy days. The bed, mattress and pillows were very comfortable..

Our family stayed here for a week in November 2013 and just loved it. Bamboo felt like a little oasis with its beautiful pool area and spa like feel in the lobby. Room had a lovely view of the pool and the king bed was very comfortable. Wireless internet in the room was great & front desk staff were very polite and helpful. We would recommend this hotel and stay again on our next trip to Oahu.

Stayed here with a friend in September and had such an amazing time. The staff were incredibly nice and welcoming, couldn't have asked for anything better!My friend and I were lucky to be upgraded to a pretty incredible room on the 9th floor (room 903 I think). This room opened out onto a HUGE balcony with a private BBQ, cabana and sun lounges.It had city views from the large balcony and a partial view of the beach from the bedroom balcony.Loads of space, great location, really happy with our choice.

We booked the Aqua Bamboo as the hotel for the second leg of our trip to Hawaii. Admittedly we stayed the first leg on Maui which is a far nicer and more relaxed island. The aqua bamboos positives- Location Location location- it is awesomely located.Pool area is great and very relaxingThursday cocktails and snacks with other guests (nice touch).Fairly clean.Staff had good local knowledge.Its obvious that hotel management are trying very hard to add the nice touches. Negatives - The locations makes it very noisy, not a great chance of a good nights sleep.Some staff were less than friendly. This goes a long way. When guests return to the hotel look up from your computer screen and say hello. Its this welcoming approach that some staff missed completely. The bathroom is small and has some issues with showers etc.All in all an ok stay and a review that is probably effected by the fact that for 30 dollars more a night we stayed in a beautiful hotel right on the water with ocean views etc.

What is the most important thing a hotel can do for you? easy ! let you rest, let you sleep, let you recover from a busy fun day !something that the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki didn't accomplish for us- you here the street traffic even windows closed- the AC is one of the worse i've seen in a while, noisy ! stinky ! water dripping on the balcony every 20min and gave us a sore throat mid vacation that never went away ! making me cough all night and prevented me from sleeping, i kid you not, i was a zombie with red eyes coming back home, worth feeling ever !Yes the rest of the hotel was fine, nice decoration, nice selection of drinks in the lobby, friendly and helpful staff, nice city view above the 8th floor (under you are stuck with a crappy building), perfect location ! and fairly priced UNLESS you take into account the sleeping factor !Again this hotel could be great, only really thing they need to work on imo is double insulated windows to block sounds upgrade their air conditioning unit too with high quality filters, being sick for half of my vacation really turn this hotel stay into a horrid nightmare !!!

A wonderful find in Honolulu. Located in the heart of Waikiki and only 2 minutes walk from the world famous Waikiki beach. Great boutique feel with friendly and helpful staff. We were upgraded to a suite on arrival at no extra charge which was fantastic. Our room included a largeprivate lanai overlooking the mountains, kitchenette, sitting room and bathroom with separate bath and shower. Thoroughly recommended.

We have stayed at the Aqua Bamboo before. The location is wonderful. Although it is an old property, it is a good value for the money. It is in walking distance to everything. It is also right next to the bus stop. The pool and the lobby area are beautiful. My only issue is that due to the age of the building, the rooms could use refurbishment. They are very clean, but need to be painted and upgraded. The staff was very friendly, especially Lohaki. Would stay here again!

We recently stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for two weeks. The staff were personable, friendly, helpful and extremely accommodating when we asked for a change of room to the pool side. The rooms had everything we needed and we could walk to Queen Kapiolani Park, the beach and downtown Wakikii and easy transportation. Great location and service!

We stayed four nights in October. Location was good and staff were friendly and helpful. However the whole place is outdated, rooms dark and the air conditioner VERY noisy. Would not stay there again.

This hotel is quaint, clean, and perfect for expensive Waikiki. The price was reasonable, free wi-fi, large room, one block from the beach. Even though it's in the middle of non-stop activity, this hotel is quiet. Staff is courteous and friendly. I will definately stay here upon my return to Waikiki.

Staff very friendly and helpful.Their knowledge of the area was very good and only to happy to help you out with any directions or suggestions for activities. Rooms are clean and well maintained. If you are looking for a smaller hotel (boutique) I would recommend. Close to all amenities and transport.

We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Aqua Bamboo. We had been staying at a condo on the North Shore and had some problems with bugs so we decided to move down to Waikiki for the last few nights. This little boutique hotel was heaven!! The entire staff was exceptional!! Our room overlooked the courtyard and pool, which was very tranquil in the center of town. We were amazed at how quiet it really was considering that you are in the middle of a city. Loved the little touches, like the welcoming letter and the note the day before you check out along with the bamboo flute. We will definitely be visiting this hotel when we return to Oahu!!

Quaint Hotel with everything within walking distance. Quiet, Clean comfortable room. Very nice garden/courtyard with pool. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate us as we arrived early. would stay again in a heartbeat.
user_name:
Jack S
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: This little hotel had everything I needed and a lot of little luxuries I would expect at a really upscale place. The room was small but modern, with little touches like orchids and throw pillows, and the free upgrade to a kitchenette was a lifesaver! The courtyard has a lovely garden feel to it, with a small pool and hot tub - I barely used these since the walk to the beach was so easy. The restaurant was relatively pricey but good food and friendly service. Loved the lemon water and the espresso machine in the lobby. I was able to get late checkout at the last minute, too.A few cons: the bed was quite soft (and therefore uncomfortable for me), the airconditioning unit was a little loud, and the bathroom was a little awkward, but these are minor issues and not a big deal when you consider what value and character you get for your money. I'd definitely stay here again.
user_name:
carynsweeney
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were upgraded by mistake to a beautiful 1 bedroom suite, living room with seperate fridge, plus kitchnette (room 1204).Manager waived all upgrade charges.Kitchnette is a must for Waikiki. Great savings by having breakfast in room. Foodpantry (Grocery store) a few minutes away and ABC stores at every corner. We enjoyed our 2 week stay.Concierge in Hotel made excellent recommendations for Island Tour, Luau etc.Nick and Linda, Oakville, Ontario, Canada

We love to go to smaller hotels rather than the huge resort hotels and this hotel fit us perfectly. It had a great kinda retro touch to it that really gave it a lot of character. We loved having a little kitchenette in the room where we cooked breakfast sometimes and could keep sandwiches and what not in the fridge. It a great walking distance to the beach (should only take you at max 10 minutes) and right by a bus stop as well that can take you to downtown Honolulu and other parts of the island. It was clean, comfortable, welcoming and convenient.

We enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Bamboo. It is close the beach and all the sights in Honolulu. It was nice to have a kitchen and the upgrade to a suite was wonderful. We ate a several nice restaurants in the area and there were some farmer's markets where we could buy apple bananas and other fresh fruits.

It was a close walk to the beach which was a big plus. The price was decent and having a stove in the room was helpful. It was also convenient to near by shops and transportation. I would stay here again.
user_name:
Vicky H
La Verne, California, USA

review_body: We stayed here for four nights in June, based on many reviews stating how stylish this 'boutique hotel' is. Unfortunately we did not find it to be so. The hotel states it had a far eastern vibe but we did not catch that, other than a few rather tacky attempts at an eastern feel (a couple of statues and plasticky walls). The area in the lobby has a very 1970s feel to it, with chintzy sofas which leads out to a small pool, which feels like someone's back garden. The room was very clean and good size beds, which were very comfortable, although they took up most of the room so there wasn't much room for our luggage. The room was very basic in decoration and unfortunately the view was of the wall of the neighbouring building. The air conditioning was also incredibly loud. The bathroom was clean but basic again, as was the 'kitchenette', which is a really just a counter. This was fine for us as we ate out the entire time and it was nice to come back and be able to make a hot drink before heading out again. The location is pretty good and the staff provide towels for the communal beach, which is about a 3 minute walk away. We would say this probably just reaches a 3* standard although the look and feel if the hotel wasn't to our taste. Of all the wonderful hotels in Waikiki we wouldn't stay again, although for the price it's not bad value in an expensive town.

Fantastic place to stay. It is huge with 2 large queen beds. We were 3 women friends coming to see an uncle that had had a stroke. We had some family members over and there is a large BBQ which one could use for ribs, fish .and they joined us for dinner. If you need more plates they will get them for you. Very accommodating staff and eager to help. We loved the back area near the pool for eating and playing cards at night. It is 1 block over from the Sheraton Moana. You can walk everywhere. Would go there again for sure..

I went to this hotel based of the reviews. The hotel wasn't in the best condition. But when I'm comparing this hotel I'm comparing it vegas hotels, and i'm not talking about the 5 star vegas hotel. I'm comparing this hotel interior and condition to an average vegas hotel (ie Excalibur, Luxor, etc...) I was not impressed with the condition. The kitchenette was just a small counter with a small talbe top electric stove. The carpet was not in the greatest condition and could be replaced. The location of the hotel was decent and reasonable for the price.
user_name:
Tony N
La Verne, California, USA

review_body: Although this is an older property and after having stayed previously at other fancier hotels closer to Waikiki beach it was one of the more spacious rooms we have had. Location was good, room clean and comfortable. Staff helpful and friendly. Rose our room attendant was lovely. We would stay here again. Our room over looked the pool which was nice too.

We've stayed here before and knew what to expect.. It was exactly what we expected, plus a little added bonus..A new cafe! The hotel has such a nice spa quiet kinda feel with nice touches and attention to small details. The staff is mature and pleasant! The cafe by the pool the lovin oven offers breakfast and lunch was awesome. The food is surprising spot on and the pizzas are suburb. Really nice people. Wished they were open for dinner. Such a nice surrounding and location.. We'll be back for sure..

We booked the hotel as part of a special and found it to be very good value being close to the beach and shopping. The room was well proportioned and the bed very comfortable. The street noise was, unfortunately quite loud, possibly because the room faced out to a brick wall. The air conditioner, necessary at night, was also quite loud. The hotel supplied free beach chairs and towels. The free iced tea and lemonade in the lobby was very welcome after returning from the beach. The hotel's pool was clean and great to use. The hotel also has a washing machine and dryer available for guests on the 12th floor.

Location was excellent, as was the outdoor pool area, was an area you felt you could get out off the city and relax in the evening. The hotel room was updated (with the exception of the curtains which actually on first glance could make it look older), and very comfortable with the exception of a louder air conditioner, but that did drown our any street noise :). I would stay again if back in the area, definitely value for your money when compared with other options in the area. However would not use the Lovin Oven - restaurant in back (not owned by hotel), ordering was confusing and service was not great - and the food was much overpriced for what you got..... We would likely have eaten often there in our 10 day stay, but after the first day we ordered there we said never again.

This is a charming hotel. Modern style and very clean. We stayed in room 1104 (one bedroom suite) and we loved it. We thought it was very spacious and had all the comforts of home.
