The kitchenette was the perfect size for making simple meals. There is a sitting area/living room just outside the bedroom with a futon, T.V. screen, small desk and a mini fridge/bar area. Bathroom had both a tub and walk-in shower. Air conditioning worked great. Quiet room too. Pool was lovely and relaxing. Ice cold drinks were available in the lobby during the day. An oasis from the busy city of Honolulu.

just arrived home 13 october we had a lovely weeks holiday the only down side was the street noise.The hotel is conveniently situated for the beach and restaurants and the staff were helpfull and frend.There was water,lemonade,ice tea and coffee in the lobby,beach towels and beach chairs for our use.We had fab time

Very friendly staff, great location and very nice rooms for the price . We will definitely stay at the Aqua Bamboo again. One word of caution, avoid the cafe, I think it is called the lovin oven. The food is not very good and the service is terrible. There are plenty of eating establishments close by so take a short walk to avoid the disappointment .

Great location, nice and central, easy to get to both ends of the main strip of Waikiki in walking distance.Our room was on level 8 on the side it was nice & quiet, the AC was great at cooling the room, yes it's noisy but we didn't mind that at all.Rooms we're serviced well everyday and i loved the complimentary iced tea, lemonade & lemon water everyday in the lobby.Wifi was good, it would have been nice if we could have had it in room but it was a good excuse to laze by the pool to check in with home.We loved our stay here and would come back again
user_name:
Sarah W
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia

review_body: we arrived by shuttle and had 5 bags btn 2 people and not 1 of the 4 staff in the lobby helped us. once checked in we had to ask for our bags to be taken up to our room. Our room although functional was terrible. we were facing the front of the building and there was a bus stop below our room and the noise of the traffic was so loud we had to buy ear plugs in order to get some sleep in the time we were there. Our room was next to the employees tea room, so the door was banging all day and all night as well as being on the same level as the hotel laundry. Although we spent little time in the room as we were sightseeing it would have been nice to be able to sleep properly and have a sleep in as we were on holidays

My wife and I were in Honolulu for 10 days. I had business during the week and we spent the weekends visiting all the spots in Oahu on the weekend.Many of the comments I read about this central Waikiki beach hotel stated the property was not updated, Well as of Oct 2013 everything I saw was in good shape and seemed contemporary.The rooms are cooled with a wall mounted AC which may seem a little noisy but it is a fair trade-off when the humidity is up. We didn't have a car to park so I can not comment on the parking garage issues.And the comments about the friendly staff are exactly right.
user_name:
Chrystal T
Riverbank, California, United States

review_body: We loved our stay at the Bamboo. Yes, it is an older style hotel (as many of the hotels in Oahu are due to the very strict demolishion and rebuilding codes) but it has been tastefully renovated. The air cons are not split systems so therefore a litttle noisy - we however, did not use the air con at all - we prefer to open the sliding doors - the breeze is glorious. Hotel is only 12 storeys in an excellent location, one block from the main beach on Wakiki. Nice pool area with spa and sauna and bbq. Excellent for families.

A happy and helpful front desk staff, but a neglected property. Scruffy, unkempt (a dirty desk chair, scratched elevator doors), dark and tired. The Internet (WiFi) was a consistent disaster. I had four bags and never did a hotel employee touch one of them!

We have just returned from two weeks in Hawaii and we started our trip with three nights at the Bamboo. This was a return visit for us and we were just as happy this time with the friendly welcome and great service we received. We were upgraded to a higher floor with a king sized very comfy bed for USD8/night and it was well worth that to have better views and be further away from any street noise. The pool is such a lovely quiet spot in a busy Waikiki - you could be in a neighbouring island - it's such a sancturary there. Our only complaint is a common one by the looks of things and that is the noisy AC. We actually turned ours off in the end in order to sleep, but maybe will try ear plugs next time. Other than that, and it isn't a major really, just keep doing what you do guys, you're great and we hope to visit you again soon.

The staff at Aqua Bamboo made our stay friendly and welcoming. The room was just as we had requested. Good to have a small kitchen as we like to do breakfast and snacks. On the 8th floor, a bit street noisy. If that is a problem then ask for a room overlooking the pool. Nice pool area, a small oasis. Lots of space to relax and enjoy the free wifi too. I used Skype and it was very clear. Within a short walk to Waikiki beach without being in the crowd. Good shopping, loads of restaurants, beautiful swimming beach all only 2 small blocks away. Would stay again, affordable in a very high tourist area. Safe too.
user_name:
Ann H
Whangarei, Northland, New Zealand

review_body: Great personal, nice place , complete place Butnaru noisy air conditioner sistem, and old ac Equipment Services and personal nice and familiar place my wife and I just had a great time and good place to stay

The hotel is quite good except that the AC is a bit noisy. People here are nice and helpful. The room is well equipped. It is close to Waikiki and is at a convenient location. However, the network here is lousy. I have to call the ISP (a company named HDT, I believe) in all of my three days here and the problem doesn't really get solved. If you need the internet to get some job done, to plan your trip, or to share photos with your family, then you will be very frustrated here.

I can't say enough about this hotel and the gracious staff that works there. From the moment you pull in the drive through to the time you leave for home you are lavished in the true Aloha Spirit. My wife and I will never stay at another establishment on Oahu. We have visited there several time and each visit surpasses the last. The staff here actually makes you feel like family. We were on the second floor overlooking the pool and it was lovely and clean, what a beautiful view from our lanai. The location is awesome two blocks to beach and International Market Place, my wife loves all the little shops and I like all the different places to eat. There was also a personal greeting letter in our room welcoming us back that made us feel extra special. We will be back on our next visit.
user_name:
Randy D
Wailuku, Hawaii, United States

review_body: This was the second time we stayed at Aqua Bamboo. We knew what to expect and love the friendly staff who will go beyond the call of duty to make sure your stay is great. The rooms are great and comfortable. The free Thursday drinks and nibbles by the pool are a favourite. Plenty of fresh drinks make daily are refreshing and free, along with coffee and tea in the foyer. Not to mention free apples to take on your way out for your look around. We would certainly return to Aqua Bamboo so close to everything and well priced. I loved that they knew we had stayed before and recognised us as soon as we walked in.....

Great Location and atmosphere. The staff was so very patient and helpful. We had a great room and enjoyed the amenities the next morning. Would definitely stay here again. Nice pool area and we had a great dinner nearby at Jinroku.

This would be a wonderful hotel for an extended stay or a family. It's well located. It has a kitchen and extra beds instead of sofa and chairs in the LR. The pool area is lovely, as is the lobby. The fresh flowers in towels and on tables is a nice touch. The staff is helpful. We had a wonderful Hawaiian meal due to the suggestion of the person at the desk when we checked in.

Loved the room with great lanai, clean hotel, staff was helpful and courteous. The location is good too, about a block up from the beach and a convenient walk to good shopping. The decor made the Aqua Bamboo a fun place. We would stay there again.

The location of this hotel is good, just a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach. You get given a couple of cards for beach towels which is good.The hotel itself is very dated and could do with refurbishment throughout. The lighting in my room was quite stark. The beds were comfortable but small. The linen was clean and the room and beds were nicely made up every day.The air conditioning was very noisy and not particularly effective, but it helped drown out traffic noise!The balcony ovelooked the wall of the building next door (about 15 feet away), so it wasn't really something we wanted to use. The wifi was flakey but if you persevere it's ok.The staff were very nice so they improve the experience, although we didn't use any of the facilities like the swimming pool because it didn't look very inviting, especially compared to the beach.Overall it was fine just to rest my head overnight, but not somewhere I wanted to spend lots of time.

Located 2 short blocks from The beach and right in the middle of downtown Waikiki, this quaint hotel was excellent. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was spotless. The king sized bed was very comfortable. Our room,with a balcony,faced almost downtown so we did not experience much traffic noise. The lobby decor is lovely and the pool is tranquil and inviting.If you are renting a car, make sure you reserve parking at the hotel, $25. However there is a parking garage next door for $20/24 hrs.Also on site, but not part of the Aqua Bamboo, is a small cafe, Lovin Oven, that serves breakfast, lunch and pizzas. We had breakfast 2 mornings. The continental breakfast consisted of eggs, muffin,fruit ,oatmeal and coffee for $6.50. Other meal options are available. Well worth the costs.

We have stayed at the Aqua Bamboo on several visits to Hawaii. We have found that the rooms, lobby and pool area are always clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and competent. From the Bamboo it is a very short walk to the beach, shopping, and all kinds of restaurants. There is a new breakfast / lunch casual restaurant which just opened in the pool area. They are open from breakfast hours to about 6pm, with breakfast items, fresh hot sandwiches and pizza from scratch. Great for enjoying a snack or light meal by the pool. Honolulu Bus service is excellent and there is a bus stop within a short block from the Bamboo. Kuhio is a busy street in the heart of busy Waikiki, so city and traffic noise is the price you pay for being in the middle of the action. (If you want quiet and solitude, stay out at Ko'Olina, but of course you will have to fight an hour or more of traffic to enjoy all the shopping, restaurants and activity of Waikiki). The Aqua Bamboo is a great value and we will continue to return.
user_name:
Lani B
Desert Hot Springs, California

review_body: We spent a lovely two weeks at this boutique-style hotel in August. We were pleasantly surprised on arrival to find that we had been upgraded to a 1 brm suite on the 11th floor which had an extremely comfortable king size bed. The hotel's location only a block from the beach and its closeness to the main Waikiki shops and Restaurants make it very convenient, even the bus stops across the road. Loved the pool area - it's like a peaceful tropical oasis and the many little extras supplied by the hotel such as free wifi in the rooms, free coffee, iced tea, lemon drinks, fresh fruit in the lobby and towels and chairs for the beach add to its charms. Being a smaller hotel, there's no waiting too long for the lifts, or queues to get attention at reception like you get at the larger ones. The staff were always helpful and pleasant. We saw that a small eatery was about to open in the pool area just after we left, which would certainly further enhance it. We hope to stay there again when we next visit Waikiki.
user_name:
Gaylene W
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 5 nights. It was my first time in Hawaii and I had searched the internet extensively for a hotel that got good reviews, would meet my standards and was still within my budget. I could not have been more pleased with my choice!The location of the hotel is great. It's only 2 blocks away from Waikiki beach and Duke's statue, and there is a busstop that serves all main bus routes right across the hotel. The front desk staff is genuinly friendly and nice. They would be one of the main reasons I would go back to the hotel.The housekeeping staff is also friendly and nice. However, I do agree with some of the other reviewers that it is not topnotch (e.g. no consistency in how fresh towel are placed). My room was kept clean in a satisfactory manner though, so no complaints there.The hotel has a nice, quiet pool area that is great for chilling and relaxing. I didn't make a lot of use of it, but it was nice when I did.Free use of beach towels and chairs are great amenities. I actually did not know that they also lend out boogie boards and blow up floaties - I just read that on here ... They should promote that more. I think I would have used it if I would have known. Other amenities include free wi-fi (fast!), an i-Pod/i-Phone dock system in the room (I was pleasantly surprised by that), free lemonade or ice tea/cold water/fruits and the manager's reception on Thursdays with free Bamboozle cocktails and snacks.The rooms are nice. The beds are so soft and comfy! As some have mentioned before, the AC do is quite loud. Also, if the hotel would do renovations in the future, double glazed windows would certainly be a good investment. I did not use the microwave or the stove, but it was nice having the option nevertheless.I would definitely recommend people staying at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel. It's the next best thing after those expensive all-inclusive beach front resorts!

Staff is wonderful but doesn't make up for the poor condition of hotel . The first room we got had a dripping ceiling poring water on our toilet. We called down for help and employee was unable to handle problem . My husband had to go down to front desk and ask for a new room . We got another room that reeked of mold . At that point we we're so tired we just accepted it. Big mistake , as we both ended up very sick when we arrived home. Stay away !

My husband and I stayed here one night prior to a cruise.We were pleasantly surprised. Queen sized bed. Beautifully furnished.Had a fridge, stainless steel gas stove microwave, coffee maker and utensils. There were orchids placed around the bed and in the bathroom.It was spic and span clean. There was a balcony off the bedroom and one off the kitchen, and we did not stay in their best room!! The staff were very professional. Check in and out was a breeze. There was a pool and Jacuzzi . The property is two blocks from the beach and in a great location to all that's happening. I would definitely stay here again!!.

We recently spent 6 nights at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki Hotel and for the most part enjoyed our stay. Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them - they really made you feel welcome. The pool area with BBQ (which we used twice) was lovely, like a little oasis with beautiful tropical gardens and waterfall. Our room, a one bedroom apartment was clean and well laid out if not a little small but still adequate for three adults. Location was excellent and an easy short walk to beach, shops and restaurants. The free use of beach towels & chairs, blow up floaties, body boards & even surfboards was really appreciated and I think unique amongst hotels in Waikiki. The only bad thing about the hotel is the street noise, especially at the front of the hotel where our room was. Of course, we realise we were in the middle of a big city, but perhaps an investment in double glazed windows would help cut down the constant drone of cars & sirens and make the stay more pleasant. I'm not sure how bad the noise was in the back rooms overlooking the pool but I would request one of these next time. If you are a light sleeper bring ear plugs. The price for location is excellent though - it's a matter of budget. You can spend a fortune at the beach front hotels or stay here and have extra spending money for shopping, tours and dining. There is no bar at the hotel but we took our drinks down by the pool & enjoyed at lovely self catered bbq steak & salad purchased from the supermarket 50 metres away. A pizza restaurant, The Lovin Oven opened up by the pool two days before we left. We were going to have pizza and wine by the pool on our last night after a day tour but strangely it closed at 6 pm. It also serves breakfast for $6 which is a great price. I would recommend this hotel and would probably stay here again. It would be great for groups of friends or families who could use the bbq facilities and save a little cash that way. Just keep in mind the noise issue and ask for a pool facing room.

I wanted to start out by thanking you and the reservation staffs for their prompt responses to all my questions.However, I was very disappointed with the front desk staffs and the housekeeping staffs as well.For the front desk staffs, there were no greetings with "aloha" or "hello" or "good morning" in almost the entire time we stay there. I actually only get a greeting of "good morning" this morning at 4:00 am when I checked out. I feel that there's no aloha spirit at all even upon arrival and/or at this hotel. I travel a lot and know when I find front desk staffs to be friendly and welcoming their guests. I'm sorry to say, but I don't find that friendly hospitality at this hotel. As for the housekeeping staffs, I felt that all they do are "make the bed" and "replace the towels". In fact, the towels are not even properly placed. I do have to say this though. We do like th hotel and its location. It's also clean and we feel comfortable in our room. A big plus with 24 hour coffee and ice tea machine.Room is clean, but the air condition is VERY NOISY. if you are a light sleeper, you can forget about having the air condition on. It wakes me up a few times during the night even though I'm not a slight sleeper. If you do decide to stay at this hotel, don't expect the front desk staff to be friendly toward you.

My 4 day stay was outstanding. This place is old-school nice. The staff are genuinely friendly and very helpful in a not-patronizing way. The room was clean and decorated with retro charm. Love the mid-century polynesian vibe and architecture. Great value, great location.

We found this hotel on a desperate effort to get away from another hotel we had booked to. We were VERY lucky. The staff were all friendly and helpful, they let us see our room before we even decided to book it. The prices were very reasonable.It's beautiful, with nice decoration and a lovely small pool at the back. Our room was big, spacious and clean. We had a view of a tall wall from our 5th floor balcony, but no complaints.We'd definitely stay there again! Highly recommended!

We stayed more than 2 weeks at the Aqua Bamboo hotel. We got a very spacious and cleaned studio with three lanais (!) two of them faced the pool area. The full kitchen contained all the needed facilities. We also enjoyed using the complimentary beach amenities such as umbrella, chairs, mates and boogie boards. This is our 5th visit to waikiki and we already knew the hotel location is great, at the heart of waikiki (a block from food pantry super-market, just step awasy from the bus stop, two blocks from the beach).We enjoyed very much the Thursdays complimentary cocktail, at the pool area, that included some refreshments as well an Ukulele singer and also Lei making workshop.The staff was very kind and helpful. We hope to stay here again in the future.

It is always difficult to find a good value and with the Aqua Bamboo I was pleasantly surprised. The room with kitchen was roomie (bathroom was small but bigger than most in same price range and area). My daughter and I enjoyed our stay and we were close to the activities and beach at Waikiki. This is our favorite part of town and it is nice to find a hotel that we can go back to. Kitchen was adequate enough to cook breakfast.

We were sent there as an upgrade since our first hotel was overbooked (see review on Aqua Waikiki pearl). The place looks great, the staff is very kind and helpful. The location is near everything in Waikiki and 2 blocks from the Waikiki beach. I have only two negative things to say. First their kitchen suites are outdated and too small. If it is important for you to have a kitchen look away if you are more that 2. Secondly, the room service could be better. We left an hair dryer on the wet towels with a note glued on the dryer saying "does not work. broken." When we came back the hair dryer we were surprised to see that the hair dryer was replaced in the bathroom cabinet with the note still on ..... The room was not fully cleaned under the beds and furniture. Still i recommend the place because it is greatly located and the staff is very helpful. the overall place looks good.

Stayed for 4 nights, first trip to Hawaii August 2013. Used the speedy shuttle to and from the airport which worked great! Had a kitchenette room which had everything we needed, was comfortable and roomy. Foodland just down the street. Location was great. 2 short blocks to the beach and the hotel provides free chairs and towels plus other beach equipment. Enjoyed the pool area and our balcony. Yes the area is noisy, but wasn't a problem.. Staff is very friendly and we would happily stay here again.

I spent 5 nights at this hotel and it wasn't a bad place to stay (for the price). I don't need a lot a upgrades when I travel just give me the basics and I can make do. Besides, these rooms had a small fridge and microwave which come in very handy. The room was clean, bed comfy and I was high enough that I wasn't annoyed by street traffic. The hotel is located along a busy street by day. Yet, it's very close to the beach which was my main reason for being in Waikiki. I had several transportation choices but I walked to all my destinations, with the location being great for me. The staff here is way way way friendly. The housekeeping staff is friendly and pretty efficient. I was a goof and missed the Thursday reception down by the pool and regret it. So don't be like me and take advantage of that, I heard it was very nice.

I stayed here for 3 nights in August while visiting my parents. I usually prefer 4 or 5 star hotels, but because of the short trip I just wanted something clean and reasonably priced. I searched most of the hotels in and around Waikiki and settled on this one because of the great reviews. I did upgrade to the kitchenette room. I had a balcony looking onto the condo next door on the 7th floor, with a peep of the ocean. I would have to agree withthe positives all the other reviewers have noted; good location, clean, nice pool area. It was a little noisy with the sliding door open, but not that bad. I didn't use the staff for advice since I am a local. The free coffee and cold beverages were very nice. I think this is a great value, especially given the kitchenette, free beach towels/chairs, and the location. It is an older building, so my room had a musty smell that cleared up after they shampooed the carpet. Free Wi-fi was great. It looks like they are going to open a restaurant by the pool soon, which would be nice. If you just want somewhere clean and pleasant to sleep and shower for reasonable price in the heart of Waikiki, you will be pleased. If you want the Four Seasons, stay elsewhere.

We stayed for 5 nights in june 2012 in this hotel. We are closed waikiki beach, 2 blocks from the beach. Rooms are quite news and with all that you need for holidays. In comparison with other hotels rates, this is a good option for to be accommodated in waikiki. On the other hand, we had an small group in the room next to us, listening to music and making so much noise at night. But the security staff of hotel was very friendly with us, and the response was quite seriously.

We stayed in the Bamboo for 3 days prior to and 2 days after a recent cruise. The location is very convenient to the beach and many very good restaurants. The staff was wonderful and helpful. The beds were so comfy. We did pay for a courtyard room to help with the noise and it was very nice. The pool area is a wonderful oasis in the middle of the bustling city. Nicole was great at answering all my questions via email. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. They also helped us with shuttles and cabs when needed,this was a big help to us. We were travelling with another couple and we had a lot of luggage,so they got an Escalade taxi to and from the pier and it was only $30 total for 4 of us. All the staff was very courteous and we will recommend this hotel to friends who are visiting next year.

We had a great stay at Aqua Bamboo, the staff were fantastic, service was always with a smile, nothing was an effort. The hotel was clean. The wifi worked well in the room and other parts. We had one bedroom kitchenette which was fantastic, with 2 kids we ate breakfast in most mornings and even had dinner in a couple of nights. The hotel is very central to everything. The only complaint I could make was that the air con was a little noisy, though after longs days out and about no one had a problem sleeping and sometimes the street noise can be a little loud, we were on the 7th floor, so maybe higher up would be better.It also had washing machines and dryers on 3 different levels which came in very handy and also cheaper than the laundromat down the road.

Stayed overnight on our way to Maui. Excellent room. Extremely comfortable bed. Great location. Good service. Very good value for money. Concierge directed us to 'where she would eat'..and it was excellent. What more could you ask for?

We had a wonderful time in Honolulu. The Aqua Bamboo Hotel was a great location. Just a block away from the beach and without paying exorbitant prices. The room was very comfortable and having cooking facilities and free Wi-Fi made our stay very enjoyable. The air con was a little noisy and if you don't live in a city the street noise can take a little getting use too (In future i would request a room that is not facing the road). The staff were always very helpful and so polite. Thank you

My friend and I stayed at this hotel for about 10 days July / August 2013. When we first arrive from our Sydney flight 8.30am we actually a day early due to my over sight of the date change, point being, the hotel staff were so helpful, accommodated us without fuss and we stayed in those rooms for the rest of our stay. The hotel has no food or drink on site, seriously who cares, everything is at your finger tips. Pool area is great, clean and quiet, there were next to no children while we were there, very quiet and peaceful. You don't need towels for the beach or the pool, the hotel loans it all out. The concierge was great, arranged all out activities precisely and without fuss, even the rental vehicle. The hotel is older but it's really really good, the beds have comfortable pillow top mattresses and pillows were fine. I will defiantly stay at this hotel again, for sure.

we really enjoyed our stay, the staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. our room was fantastic we had the most amazing balcony. we were very comfortable in our room which was very spacious. would have been good to have WiFi in our room but we could get it by the pool and the lobby. The bathroom exhaust fan was very noisy but that is our only complaint. location was very convenient, close to the beach, shops, restaurants - price was great too. we hope to return one day :)

I enjoyed staying at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel Waikiki. The staff were friendly and welcoming upon my arrival and departure. The room was comfortable and clean. I had fantastic views over looking Waikiki. I loved the onsite swimming pool and spa pool. Having complimentary WIFI in the lobby and in my room was fantastic. Would totally recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Joy P
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: This was our first trip to Hawaii as a family and we did a lot of research into hotels. We knew we wanted good location and a full kitchen. Bamboo has both. It is right in the middle of the excitement of Waikiki, but it feels like a small oasis. The staff was so friendly and heplful. When I returned home I realized that I had left a somewhat insignificant, but very sentimental item in my room. The staff at Bamboo found it and made sure it was returned to me in California. I was so thankful. We stayed in a one bedroom, full kitchen room. It seemed a little small. The air conditioners were a bit noisy, but we were so exhauted each night we hardly noticed. Overall a wonderful experience.

Do to unforeseen circumstances my children and I had to find a hotel unexpectedly on our trip to Waikiki. Fortunately we read some wonderful reviews about the Aqua Bamboo and made a reservation. We were only supposed to stay one evening but the day I became ill the day we were to check out. My daughter went down to the front desk to see if we could extend our visit. They had already booked our room but were able check us into another larger They were kind enough to give us the same rate as the smaller room.I would definitely recommend staying Aqua Bamboo. The three biggest reasons would be: the location which is close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping; It is reasonably priced, and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

When our accommodation at another motel fell through the staff at Bamboo were fantastic. They found a room for us on the spot and although we had to change room a few times over the 9 days, they went out of their way to help us move each time. Staff were always friendly and helpful and showed genuine interest in our time spent in Waikiki. They even went out and bought a baking tray so that we could use the oven.

There are many more hotels and rental units available in Waikiki than you can imagine. Visitors are always looking for a well located accommodation that is clean, modern and an oasis of an experience. The sure bet is one of the premier 4 star establishments along the legendary beach. Aqua bamboo is a more modest priced hotel but you will not be disappointed! It is very centrally located on Kuhio boulevard no more than a 5 minute walk to the beach. We had a beautiful studio on the 11th floor with a modern look, lovely kitchenette and bathroom ; the room had 3 balconies with pleasant views of the city ,the mountains and the beach! the main lobby offers coffee, water, fresh fruit and the oasis pool area has a barbeque and sauna pool. We were celebrating our 25th anniversary and the staff pleasantly surprised us with chocolates and a bottle of sparkling wine. The family like staff of approx. 30 people were exceptional. For the most part, the premises are lovely and refreshing. We recommend this hotel as you will not find a staff that is more accommodating and friendly with unsurpassed warmth!Alex and Maria

We stayed here from July 17 to July 24 in the Deluxe 1 Bedroom Suite. We comfortably slept 5 with one on the Futon Sofa. The room was delightful and the large Lanai complete with Bar-B-Que was excellent. The whole ambiance of the hotel is fantastic. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the constant supply of Lemonade or Iced Tea in the lobby is an added extra. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. My 15 year old granddaughter also thinks Hector the bellboy is "hot".

We stayed in a one-bedroom suite for 6 nights. The unit was large, with a bedroom (2-beds), a living room (with a futon), functional kitchen, balcony and bath. Plenty of room to move around without feeling as though we were living on top of one another. My son, who slept on the futon, said that it was quite comfortable and he liked having a TV to himself in the living room. The queen (?) beds in the bedroom were also quite comfortable. We sleep peacefully, through the night. A bit usual for me as I am an incredibly light sleeper. If you have a chance, upgrade from a one-room unit to a suite....you won't regret it.The unit was expertly cleaned each day and the actual décor was pleasing to the eye and comfortable for our family of 3. I've been to Oahu 5 times. This was my first time with a "city view", as I've always opted for an ocean view in the past. I have to say, it won't be my last. I really enjoyed the view from our suite. In fact, we fell asleep each night with the drapes wide open....I really loved the lights on one side and the mountains on the other...quite a treat. The staff was friendly when approached, but I would have enjoyed an uninitiated, "good morning", "hello", etc. I must say, whenever asked, they always answered with a smile and were very responsive to any question or need. The tea, coffee, etc. in the lobby was a nice touch. I asked where I could buy the iced tea mix and the (very friendly gentleman shared), "it's Lipton with lemons and oranges"....that was a surprise as it tasted wonderful...kind of like a high-end designer tea. We didn't get a chance to get in the pool, but it looked very inviting and clean. If you will have a rental car, be sure to reserve a parking spot at the Bamboo, in advance of your stay. The cost is $25/day. I didn't realize that parking was limited here, thus, due to lack of space, we had to park next store at the Pacific Monarch, which was $20/day. Unfortunately, when directed to the Monarch, I pre-paid for parking for our entire stay... before I actually saw the parking structure. Next time I stay at the Bamboo, and can't get parking on site, I will find parking elsewhere, as the Monarch's parking structure was not optimal. I've heard that the Waikiki Banyan has better parking and it's supposedly cheaper. I think the Wi-Fi was fairly new. The first few days, it slowed down considerably around 6am until about 6 or 7 pm. About the 4th day, it was down (altogether) for some reason. I reported it to the front desk staff, who indicated that the repair person was onsite working on it as we spoke. After that, the Wi-Fi was perfect. Maybe they were just working the bugs out. It was nice having laundry on site. We used it several times and never had to wait. Finally, I loved the location. We were 2 blocks from the beach and 2 blocks from the International Marketplace. In the past, I've stayed at the Aston Waikiki (at the other end of the strip), the Aston Waikiki Sunset and at private residences in Kailua. All in all, I preferred the location of the Bamboo. For the first time, I felt like I was truly experiencing Waikiki. I really enjoyed the Bamboo and would definitely return.

My husband & I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 8 nights in mid-July. We had 2 king beds & a kitchen as we would be having grandchildren stay with us for 4 nights. Having a kitchen was a godsend as my husband is on a restricted diet & we were able to make most of our meals. There is a Safeway & Food Pantry nearby so that also helped. Fortunately we had a room that was off the street which proved to be an advantage as the city was doing road repairs on Kuhio. I won't mark the hotel down for this as this was not within their control. They also made every effort to assist those who were trying to drive into or out of the hotel.We loved the pool area. It was a quiet peaceful area to relax. There were plenty of cushiony lounges as well as adequate tables with umbrellas. They were all wood & not the cheap metal & plastic kind. There was also a more hidden area that had a large cushions lounge with pillows & grass roof where one could take a nice snooze. This hotel is located on Kuhio & is only a short 2 block walk to the beach & the activity of Waikiki. I cannot say enough about the friendliness of the staff. They always greeted us when we left & returned. We did surprise them once when we were brought home in a police car. They breathed a sign of relief when we told them that the police man was Ohana. We all got a laugh out of that. We will be in Honolulu again next July for a family reunion & hope we can book multiple rooms for all of our mainland family. Thank you Aqua Bamboo for a wonderful stay.

We stayed here in the deluxe 1 bedroom suite twice in 12 days.There were 5 of us, so a lot of people, but it was a great space to stretch out in with the futon sofa, the bedroom with 2 beds, kitchenette and the outdoor living area. Even though there is no beach view, unless you look over the left side, being able to relax in the sounds of Waikiki and a view of the hills in the outdoor area during the day or night was really great. It was much better than being stuck on a small balcony, like we would have with other hotels. The kitchenette was small, but better than not having one. There was also a BBQ in the outdoor area. The bathroom was really lovely too. It was a great stay, and we will definitely be back again!

My wife and I stayed here from July 9 - 13, 2013. 8th floor pool view. We had two lanai's and a kitchenette. The room was a bit small but all we did was sleep there so it was fine. Sugar ants one morning but they were promptly taken care of by house cleaning staff and we never saw ants again. Nice friendly staff, great pool area with the added bonus of the managers happy hour once a week. Secure area for our bags upon checking out late. Although not beach front but then it was not beach front rates we found the location to be perfect, close to main beach, close to bus, close to shopping, close to Waikiki. We were very happy with the location. We would stay here again.

My husband, 10 year old son and myself stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in June 2013. Our kitchenette room was big enough for the three of us and handy to prepare meals if we wanted to. The room was very comfortable and clean. The best thing we found about the Bamboo was the friendly and helpful staff that really wanted us to have a Hawaiian experience with our stay, they were fabulous. The pool area was great and the location of the hotel is fantastic. Having a laundry on the property was also a big plus at that stage of our holidays. Great value for money with excellent facilities and staff that are willing to help.We would highly recommend this hotel in Hawaii and would definitely stay here again. Well Done Aqua Bamboo.

Our family of four (2 adults/ 2 teens) enjoyed 4 nights at the Aqua Bamboo. Our room was perfect for us which had a separate bedroom and then two singles in what would normally be the living space. We also had a full kitchen which we did not use (too much to see and do). The bathroom was clean and sufficient. We were on the 7th floor, street side (taking the recommendation to get as high as possible). We could hear some street noise but the quiet humming of the air conditioner made for great white noise. Since we are in the city, we understood that there will be noise from the street but we never heard any from the rooms next to us. Location was an easy walk to one of the most famous beaches, Waikiki. We were also near all the shops and places to dine. Plus, we loved that there were no additional or hidden fees. We made use of the pool, beach chairs and towels daily. Manager Special on Thursday night was a nice treat (drinks, snacks). The concierge was wonderful and so helpful helping us plan our Pearl Harbor visit. Front desk, except for check-in (we were very excited to finally be in HI but the young lady checking us in didn't seem as happy to see us.....more bothered), were friendly and even printed our boarding passes!!!! Great value and location in a very popular vacation destination!

My husband and I loved our stay. Our room had a kitchenette which was perfect for making any meals if we didn't want to eat out. Everything in our room was very clean and in great working order. our room was quite large and we had 2 balconies one had a beach view of Waikiki. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We especially loved ghe managers soecial by the pool once a week , whick consisted of cocktails and nibbles for free. The pool area was lovely , very tropical. We will most definitely stay again. Definite value for money and fantastic location.

We stayed at Aqua Bamboo for 9 nights, our room was clean & very comfortable. Only thing was our room faced the street and between the street noise and the air con I would recommend bringing ear plugs. The hotel is in a great spot, easy walk to the beach and there are bus stops near by, if you have booked a tour the pick up point is only around the corner.The staff are all very friendly and helpful, the pool area is great as is the hot tub. The free beach towel is great to use for the pool/beach.We loved staying at Aqua Bamboo and intend to stay again...

It was a excellent stay. Nice room with enough space und the staff are all very frendly and helpfully. The location of the hotel is very good. I can recommend this place for your stay in Waikiki. If I come back to Hawaii, I'll stay again in this hotel.

We had a two night stay here and for the time we were there it was ok...We booked a partial city view which meant on road and a 24hour busy noisy road. The location is good, two blocks to the beach, walking distance to diamond head and accessible for all the shops or transport you could want.The rooms were clean and smart but as described very very noisy. The wifi is only available on reception which is mildly annoying especially when kids are skyping home on speaker. In room there is wired Internet but who has that these days?!?Would I stay again? Probably not. The price was high for what we had but that seems to be the norm in Waikiki.

This place is excellent! Very good location and room space for the price, and the staff are all very friendly and knowledgeable. If you come to Hawaii, I don't think you'll find a better place for the price!

The entire staff at Aqua Bamboo Waikiki helped to turn around what had started out as a horrible experience moving here. We are a military family on orders and were told there was no availability at the Army lodging, so we were placed in an approved government TLA hotel in downtown Waikiki. The hotel they placed us in was far from meeting even the lowest of Government Standards for military families during an extended stay. After some research I found Aqua Bamboo Waikiki on the Gov. TLA list and thank goodness I did. Nicole, the hotel Manager, was very gracious and accommodating to us during the entire process of switching hotels. We found this hotel to be conveniently located, very clean, quiet and all of the staff extremely friendly. The rooms are very spacious and updated with modern rock/tile flooring and bamboo furniture. We stayed 8 glorious nights in a king suite with a kitchenette with Aqua Bamboo until our on-post house was available. I wish we would have found this hotel sooner and never had the other awful experience. It's sad because our tax money is going to these other less deserving, crappy, run down hotels that have been on the TLA list since the 1980's and probably haven't picked up a paint brush since they got approved. While at Aqua Bamboo we enjoyed the pool, the complimentary towels and chairs for the beach, the free internet and parking for military and the ice cold lemon orange lea in the lobby. We would stay here even if we were not on government TLA we loved this hotel so much, but from one military family to another, we highly recommend staying here during your transition either PCS onto island or off!

We booked on the internet and got a very reasonable price considering the hotel is right in the middle of Waikiki, close to the beach and to all the shopping centers. We asked for a simple room and were upgraded to a high floor one with kitchenette and large bathroom at no charge (we were on our honeymoon). The furniture is bamboo-like, very hawaiian, the people nice and kind, there's a little swimming pool in the back. Nice lobby with beverages and complimentary wi-fi. Would definitely recommend it!

Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Aqua Bamboo.I like boutique hotels, and this one is a gem! Located in the heart of (non beach front) Waikiki but just a quick and easy 2 block walk to Waikiki Beach.We had a studio room.. Two pillow top double beds with a kitchenette and small balcony overlooking Kuhio Ave. The balconies on the sides and back of the hotel were larger.. The front balconies do not have furniture on them. The sides and back did.The kitchenette was perfect.. 2 burner range top, microwave, and dorm sized fridge.. Perfect for making snacks and simple breakfast for the kid traveling with us.Parking is always a challenge in Waikiki, but paid parking $20 / 24 hours with in and out privileges is available next door. There IS on-site parking at the hotel, but it was full for most of our visit so we just parked next door.We found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable. The pool area was very nice (though we didn't use it) The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. Always a smile, and always willing to lend a hand. I would book here again without question.

We just spent three nights at the Bamboo and enjoyed it very much. My husband was working in Honolulu and we stayed at another hotel our first 4 nights and I wish we could have stayed here the entire time. Our room had two double beds and kitchenette and was the perfect size for a family of 4. My kids loved the pool! It was the perfect temperature and the entire pool area is just a nice little place to hang out. I did notice a small apartment complex beside the hotel and there was a rather skiddy tenant who liked to play his music and make weird comments from his balcony, I felt sorry for anyone who had a room facing him, and I would definitely recommend a room facing the pool and NOT the apartment complex, but he is, unfortunately, not the hotels fault. The walk to the beach took less than 5 mins and there are dozens of stores and places to eat all around. The hotel also has an on site designated smoking area, so you don't have to go stand out on the street (like in our other hotel). If you are expecting big rooms, big pools and big amenities, then you should go stay at a big resort. The bamboo is small and quaint with friendly staff. Most days, we had the pool to ourselves, not something you can enjoy at a big resort with yahoos everywhere. My only small problem was that there was not free wifi in the room and to use the computer (to check in for my flight) was $6.95 for 30 minutes, kind of a pain, but then who needs to be constantly surfing the web when on vacation? I would recommend the bamboo to all of my friends!

If you are staying in Waikiki, this is a wonderful place to stay!!! The hotel is an amazing value for the price. Hotel is decorated and designed with Asian decor. Very nice. Hotel staff were all friendly and helpful. Our room was a kitchenette suite. Great for a family with two adults and two children. The kids slept in single beds in the main room with the television while the adults had their own private sleeping area. The kitchen was great for cooking and allowed us to save money rather than eating out every meal. Only downfall was that the outside road was a little bit loud. The pool and surrounding area were a nice size and had comfortable seating areas. The children loved the pool, and it was very family friendly. The hot tub was nice, but very small. It was only barely big enough for 4 adults. That was ok for us, because we had the entire thing to ourselves for most of the stay. Thursday evenings, the hotel hosts a poolside party with complimentary cocktails, juice, snacks, and music. Lots of fun. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

We stayed here because that's where all the other wedding guests were staying and apart from some early glitches with wifi because a new system was being installed, we loved it. Got is early after a long long flight from Perth and we waited 20 minutes until a room was available, at 10.00am!Location is great too, 5 minutes from the beach.

Great Boutique Hotel.Friendly helpful staff.Close walking distance from beach and shops.Rooms where comfy and clean.I just found traffic from the road quite loud at night while trying to sleep.Lobby was great for a free cool lemon drink or cuppa tea.Pool area was nice but pool quite small.Overall I would book here again.(Australia)

Do NOT come here for a honeymoon. You will be so disappointed....The staff is nice but the hotel sucks. Its old as hell, the lobby is done up all nice but the rooms are terrible. You are stuck next to a ghetto apt complex where there are teenagers selling drugs right outside the door on the weekend. Please be smart and stay away from this place. The whole area is run down and terrible. Sucks when you pay in advance and cant go to the other side of the island to get away from this hell hole.

We stayed at this hotel back in October 2011. I think they had recently updated the hotel and were continuing construction on the exterior of the building while we were there so it was a little noisy during the day but we weren't in the room much. As for the location, this hotel is perfect. They have a cute little outdoor oasis that was nice if you wanted to get away for the busy streets of Waikiki. The staff was firendly and accommodating. I wouldn't say that this hotel has all the fancy finishes but if you're looking for a good hotel in Waikiki at a decent price then this would be a good option.

This hotel is a great place to stay and really close to the beach. The room was really spacious clean, the staff were all really nice and helpful. They always have free iced lemon water, lemonade and coffee in the lobby. Free beach towels and chairs. The only downside for us was an aircon noise and street noise during the day . Overall it is a great value for your money and we would definitely stay there again.

Recently stayed for four nights. Wasn't sure what to expect as never had stayed here before. Was pleasantly surpirise with the location, pool and free stuff. Coffee, apples and Wi Fi. Had a room overlooking the pool and was able to get the Wi Fi from the balcony. Easy walk to the beach and other facilities. Will happy stay here again on the visit

This hotel is a great place to stay and really close to the beach. The room was really clean, the staff were all really nice and helpful. The pool is a bit small but really pretty with a small waterfall. They always have iced lemon water, lemonade and coffee in the lobby. The only downside for us was that you had to pay to use their computers in the lobby to print boarding passes,etc. $5 for 30 minutes. Overall it is a great value for your money and we would definitely stay there again.

My husband and I spent 7 nights here and it was perfect for us. Good sized room 2 double beds and kitchenette with coffee refreshed each day. 1 block from places to eat and 2 blocks from the beach they supplied beach towels and chairs also. The reception staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Also the pool area was very clean and relaxing. Would definitely stay there again.

Perfect hotel, clean rooms, short walking distance to Waikiki Beach, very friendly and helpfull staff. Everything you need near by (shops, breakfast, diner, bus, entertainment...). And every day fresh apples, lemon water and newspaper in the lobby. Small kitchenette with microwave. For those who can´t do without internet: Wired internet at the room, WiFi in the lobby and at the pool. WiFi was not always available, but any request or complaint was picked up immediately.

This was my second visit to the Aqua Bamboo and I enjoyed it as much this time as the first. Don’t be fooled by the unassuming exterior because inside there is a tranquil lobby (with free coffee / iced tea etc and free wi-fi), the outside area is a relaxing haven with a small salt water pool and waterfall; the accommodation was comfortable and well equipped. The staff were friendly, efficient and very helpful. The location is great being one block from the beach and easy walking distance to anywhere in Waikiki; for longer journeys there are bus stops close to the hotel. Great value for money.

Stayed here on a friends recommendation expecting a freshly renovated hotel, because when she had stayed about a year ago they were renovating. Was disappointed - the room we got must have missed the Reno. The ceiling over the bed was peeling - obvious water damage, the curtain in the kitchenette zone the backing was off in spots. Had opted for the 1 bedroom with kitchenette. The bedroom had an oversize bed, with a small balcony overlooking a noisy street. The big tv was in here. The lounging area was small, the couch not particularly comfortable, a small tv up in a corner. The kitchenette was "ette" the little hot plate was right next to the sink with almost no bench space. The room didn't have wine glasses, had a coffee maker and toaster. No kettle - seems the Americans only drink coffee. The pool is small but adequate, and the little small nice. Wifi is only available in the lobby and pool side. There is no restaurant.The staff are lovely. Nothing was too much trouble, they were always welcoming and helpful.

Good location ,excellent value for money. We love the free use of beach equipment including towels and beach chairs along with boards if required. No need to take any beach gear.. All the rooms very spacious and the staff were friendly at all times.We enjoyed our stay very much.Thankyou

We stayed here for one week on honeymoon. Upon arrival we received a room upgrade, which was a nice touch from the staff.The noise of the room air conditioning (which is kind of old) might be an issue for some people, but it was ok for us. Also, voices within rooms can be heard from the hallways so soundproofing is not that strong.But overall, the place is good. Handy location just a short walk from the beach and shopping. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was decent and clean.

We stayed in this hotel one last night as we realized at the end of our vacation that we were one night short at the hotel we were staying at...we stumbled upon this cool lil spot. It was small, but the staff was really nice and very helpful. I rented a bodyboard earlier in our stay and was impressed with surfboards, bodyboards, and paddleboards available for guests to use. The room was clean and the air-conditioner was cold. We even had a deck with a partial view of the ocean. I would recommend this hotel...thanks Aqua Bamboo!!

The staff at Aqua Bamboo made our stay enjoyable. The staff was really friendly. Loved that the beach was really close. This hotel was in heart of everything. Walking distance to all the hot spots. The girl trip was successful !! Kudos to Lokahi!!
user_name:
Arlene D
Puyallup, Washington, United States

review_body: I have stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for many yrs. and will continue to do so as the staff are great people to deal with.. They cannot do enough for you to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible.. I enjoy being able to get a free cold drink in the lobby and receive a free apple ea. day in the lobby which no other hotel does as I travel a lot..If you never have stayed at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel I recommend that you try it as you will want to return again and again...It is very clean and the décor is nice too.... In fact I am planning on my next trip.. I just returned staying at the Aqua Bamboo for one month.. I stay at the Aqua Bamboo Spa at least twice a yr. Don't forget to try it.. I would like to hear you comment..Aloha, Madeline Zinno from Ca...

I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki and was very impressed with the hotel staff. I was met by a very helpful and friendly staff at the front as well as was offered a cold beverage and a cool hand towel. I arrived early and my luggage was kept for me and placed in my room later on in the day. The rooms have been refurbished with modern and nice furniture. The rooms are clean and the bed was very comfortable. The swimming pool looked very inviting in the courtyard. The hotel was three blocks from Waikiki Beach and took 5 minutes to walk there. Burger King and Subway were right around the block as well as Denny's. The room had a refrig., a place to cook on as well as plates and silverware. This is ideal if you want to cook in one or two meals a day. If I return to Honolulu this is definitely a place that I would stay again.

I went here on a solo trip to Hawaii for a week. Very happy with my choice.The location was perfect for everything I wanted; less than 2 blocks from the beach, food was within a few blocks, easy access to the highways and the freeways. The staff was super friendly and super helpful. The accommodations were excellent. They kept it very clean. It was everything I wanted and needed and more.Disclaimers: -If you want to make sure you have a place to park, call ahead to reserve a parking space. It will cost $25 extra a day, but it's worth it. Parking is available right next door though for about the same, so if you don't mind that, then no worries.-I found Wi-Fi a little bit spotty in the lobby, but they have a business center for a small charge.

Great location, excellent staff and romantic view of the pool area at night. It was nice to be in such a central location. The staff recommended great restaurants and tours throughout our trip. Parking was available on site and we did not have to wait long for our car to be brought around. The room was in great condition and extremely comfortable. The colors were subdued and very relaxing. We had fresh flowers in the bathroom and on our bed when we checked in. The staff also found out that we were celebrating our anniversary and sent us a beautiful bottle of champagne! It was a wonderful surprise.

We stayed here 3 nights and were treated wonderfully by all of the staff throughout our visit. Rooms are clean, equipped with microwaves, dishes, cups, silverware for those who want to eat some meals in. Also has refrigerator. Pool is very nice with private, covered sitting areas and a hot tub. Lobby offers free lemon water and iced tea or lemonade, coffee and tea. They even allow you to help yourself to beach chairs and umbrellas while you are there. You don't even have to sign them out. Beach towels are provided and exchanged for clean ones any time. It's only a few minutes walk to Wakiki Beach. We asked where we could get a good, juicy hamburger our first night and were referred to Duke's just down the street. We enjoyed this first meal right in front of the beach. I can't say enough about Aqua Bamboo.

We (my children and I) arrived early. Having contacted Nicole ahead of time (one of the managers) the staff was aware we had a couple of things to celebrate. We were quite ahead of check-in time and were told it'd be about 30-45 minutes...but that we could check our bags in (very secure by the way! they literally tagged everything and locked it up!) So we did just that, and set out to Waikiki for a bit. Not knowing where to go, we walked over to the beach and made our way back...not quite enough time, we were told a few more minutes but that we could surely use the pool etc. So, they opened the door that was keeping our luggage safe (I'm telling you, this was secure!) we grabbed our suits and swam for a bit...no more than 5 minutes later...one of the staff (I think he was security, porter and front desk!--I didn't catch names, so sorry about that!) let me know our room was ready....We dried off and got the keys, including the key swap for the towels (you exchange a card for these wonderful fluffy towels!) and headed to the most beautiful room I've ever seen!The staff had left a Mother's day lei and lovely note, a birthday cake for my daughter, some popcorn for my son and plenty of standard goodies (coffee etc) the room was SPECATUCLAR...we were half facing the city, but let me tell you, YOU CAN SEE THE OCEAN!!! (go out on the veranda!) We were technically on the side I suppose.The room was decorated very very tastefully, it was Hawaiian, and Buddhist? but very peaceful and Zen-like...decorated tastefully in beachy colors/earthy colors...lighting was just enough, and I took note of the efficient bulbs and other things that are good for the environment! There was a kitchen that you could literally cook a full meal! pots, pans, plates, glasses...cups...silverware...fridge, stovetop and microwave (knowing this now...I'll be sure to "Upgrade" at the Bamboo and have this kind of kitchen!) because Waikiki food is spendy, it'd be easy to cook some stuff up at this home away from home...The bathroom was amazing, nice big tub...separate shower...great bathroom goodies (body wash, shampoo/conditioner, soap, lotion) ample for the three of us (I made sure I let housekeeping know--more on this amazing woman in a moment!) But the supplies are ample and quality!The coffee in the room is delicious! The water from the tap is fine to drink, I drank a lot of it...no taste or anything (I know in this day and age people are funny about tap water, I am not one of those people and this water was delicious!)Downstairs there was always coffee and chilled filtered water (good for filling up bottles etc!) and lemonade as well as lemon water...one day they made sweetened tea (and I noticed it went faster than the lemonade...maybe i had something to do with that!) There were also apple available all day and there was tea available too!This hotel is central...right there on Kuhio, it's steps to the bus (how we traveled to the further points) and everyone can tell you the fast way of how to get there...(they will mark the short route on a map even!--lifesavers!)At night, there is security out front...we didn't see anything near the hotel of concern...the colorful characters we saw were on the beach (but mostly people just doing things for a tip--making their living) nothing of concern really...and since I had children with me, we didn't venture out much after 930-10...but, the security outside was a nice touch and believe me no one would mess with him :) I'd come downstairs to get on my laptop and he'd pop in and say hello and of course the front desk person always made sure everything was good.When coming and going you'd be greeted like family ("where you off to today?" or they'd recommend a place to eat (coupons etc) or upon returning "Did you have a good time?") etc it was like coming home...The Bamboo felt like home....no, let me repeat that.The Bamboo felt like home.It was the staff that really made this stay...yes, the building and pool/yard was beautiful...but it was the people...On to the housekeeping...the room was IMMACULATE! I believe that service industry people should be acknowledged...it's a tough job, usually underappreciated/underpaid...(maybe I've worked enough of these type of positions to be able to empathize) but, i also recognize EXCELLENCE in work. Housekeeping...she was adorable!! I got to see her the 3rd day, she thanked me for the "gift" (tip) and we had a lovely conversation about our kids (her child's bday was the day before! 4 years old!) and I let her know there was another "gift" waiting for her in the room...upon coming back that night everything was refilled a-plenty and the room was spectacular...with my daughters stuffed animal placed right on the bed :)Again, it's the people.The one and only thing I'd ask of this wonderful hotel would be to provide snacks, a fuller breakfast or something (more food) for those staying under the Bamboo roof...Waikiki food (eating out) is EXPENSIVE...but, again, knowing about the kitchens...next time we will grocery shop and do some of it "at home"...otherwise...I'd change absolutely nothing...The air conditioning was quiet and almost too cold lol...sure, there was some city noise...but you are not only in Honolulu...but in the heart of Waikiki...there's going to be noise...You're not in the countryside somewhere...!!!I wish I'd have caught names of people...perhaps Nicole will respond and fill it in with names...:) But my recommendation to anyone that reads this? (I'd read feedback before booking) Stay nowhere else!!!Bamboo, our heart is still there...You guys made a lifetime memory for us! For that...mahalo isn't enough....so with that I'll simply say...A hui hou/Ke Akua pu a hui houDawn/Kai'Shani/Ja'Bari

My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki Hotel in a studio kitchenette room. Hotel staff was very friendly and efficient. Location was great - close walking distance to the beach and many Waikiki attractions. We took advantage of the free rental beach chairs that are provided to hotel guests. The room was clean and spacious and had all the amenities we needed for a comfortable stay. Although, we did have a city view room, so street noise was a bit loud in the mornings. Overall, for the price and location, this hotel is highly recommended and I would definitely stay here again.

My wife and I stayed here because of trip advisors great reviews. We were not diasppointed. The staff was very friendly, rooms very clean and within walking distance to most popular attractions. They supply everything you need for the beach.........free. The pool area was wonderful. You won't be disappointed.

The hotel itself was very nice, and they upgraded us to a swank room (#903) for my husband's 50th birthday - which was an extra special treat for an extra special day. The staff, though, makes this the place to stay in Waikiki. To say they've gone the extra mile would be an understatement. Thank you, Aqua Bamboo. We'll see you next time we're in Oahu!!!!

My husband and I spent 8 nights at the Aqua Bamboo Hotel in a studio apartment after a cruise of French Polynesia. We caught a shuttle bus to the hotel from the docks. We arrived at the hotel early but we were welcomed with a fresh glass of pineapple juice each and were given early access to our booked studio apartment with a QS bed overlooking the pool but there was a whining noise evident. We contacted the desk. The problem was dealt with promptly and we moved to a front room which had 2 double sized beds and although traffic noise was evident by day at night ear plugs managed to reduce the problem. We were very comfortable. We were close to the Food Paqndtry Supermarket where we bought food supplies and only a block away from Waikiki Beach and the International Food Market. We were close to the Hyatt Regency Hotel where we caught tour buses when required. We were also in Kuhio Avenue with lots of island buses passing by. The hotel was very clean and the staff could not do enough for you. The air conditioner in our room was rusty and noisy and needed to be replaced and although the pool was small it was adequate but was well appointed. It would have been preferable for the pool to have opened at 8am not 9am.

My husband and I spent our first 2 nights of a 2-week Hawaii honeymoon at Aqua Bamboo on 4/29 and 4/30. Overall, we knew we were not going to be spending time at the beach in on Ohau, so we opted to save some money by not staying at a hotel right on the beach. Overall, I thought the hotel location was great and had a retro Hawaii vibe. Just a few blocks walk (about 6 minutes) from the beach and plenty of shopping and restaurants just outside the door. The hotel also provides beach chairs and towels free of charge. The hotel staff is friendly. The pool area is nice and has a tropical feel. When we were there, the pool area was not crowded at all, so it was great. It's a relatively small hotel, so the pool itself isn't very large which was fine for me. As to the room, it was fine. Not really luxurious, but suitable. I honestly was expecting the room to be a big bigger as we booked the "Studio Kitchenette Partial CityView". I wouldn't call it a studio. It just seemed to be a standard sized room with a counter and kitchenette. Our view was a parking lot and balconies of the next-door hotel. The bathroom tub has the fabric shower curtains which I don't prefer as I feel that water gets everywhere, but generally, that's pretty minor. In general, I think Aqua Bamboo was a good choice compared to the hotel prices of the nearby hotels/resorts.

This hotel is situated a block away from waikii beach. Close to all restaurants. The hotel was very clean and staff were exceptional. This was our first time in honolulu and we have every intention of returning. We would definitely stay at aqua bamboo again and highly recommend it to everyone.

Overall the staff were very friendly and helpful. I also found the bed to be very comfortable too. Having a room with a kitchen made it convenient. There was a lot of street and air conditioner noise however, which was at times annoying.

We stayed here on two separate nights - first, when we arrive in Honolulu on our way to the Big Island, and then again on our return before heading to the North Shore.The lobby is quite nice. We had problems with the wifi which is only available in the lobby and was inaccessible for most of our stay. Out the back, the pool area looks lovely but we didn't use it.We couldn't say much positive about the service. It was a bit like amateur hour and the staff seemed disinterested. I think that this hotel also acts as a serviced apartment facility so this might impact on how the staff behave maybe.Our room the first night was in the Moderate room and it was really below par. Pretty crappy looking, extremely tiny and very underwhelming. We were disappointed after reading such great reviews. I've included a pic of the bathroom, which was quite rundown, as an example.The second time we stayed we had a $15 upgrade and the room was SO much better! Heaps of space, room for a family really, with a separate kitchenette. The amenities were much nicer in that room and we had a much more comfortable stay.I would recommend Aqua Bamboo for its affordability and centrality to Waikiki but don't stay in the cheapest room - pay a small amount extra and get an upgrade, it's definitely worth it.

This hotel was in a good location, was clean and had a lovely pool area with palm trees, flowers and a tiki hut among other things. They have a welcome party on Thursday nights with munchies, drinks and a entertainer. Everyday in the lobby they have iced lemon water and they also have either iced tea or lemonade. The rooms had full fridge and stove. It also had dishes, pots and pans, flatware and supplied dish soap and tea towel. The staff was friendly and helpful.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in February for 10 nights and were very satisfied with the service. Our room was upgraded upon arrival and the room we stayed in was very impressive, very clean and had a beautiful balcony space complete with a bamboo hut, large bbq and a dining setting. We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and the location of the Aqua Bamboo was fantastic, only a short walk to attractions like the zoo and aquarium, shopping malls, markets, and restaurants. Would definately reccomend this place to anyone who was looking at staying in the heart of Honolulu.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in mid April 2013 and thought it was great. It's not as flashy as the bigger and newer hotels, but it is in a great centralized location for Honolulu activities. The decor is great, the rooms were super clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

My husband and I stayed here mid-April 2013 by the recommendation of this website and Oahu Revealed travel guide book. We were not disappointed! Very clean, newer remodel and beautiful hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful in booking a last minute shuttle to Aloha Stadium. Also used SpeediShuttle recommended by Aqua Bamboo who were just as wonderful, even early to pick us up to/from airport. We stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the inner courtyard/pool area. Quiet room and great views. Courtyard/pool area an oasis. Newspaper, water and lemonade/tea, apples in lobby. Coffee machine in lobby too, one cup instant brewer was just OK. Coffee place a couple doors down helped. Would DEFINITELY stay here again. Great hotel at an excellent price, cannot be beat in this price range! Even though we couldn't get late check out, we were able to use pool area bathroom to freshen up and change. Complimentary luggage storage and free in-room safe was a life-saver. A couple blocks to beach is perfect location for a short walk before laying in the sun all day! LOVE THIS PLACE!

As others have mentioned in their reviews, the hotel's decor is a bit dated and it lacks the restaurant and stores found inside some of the newer and bigger hotels. However, these are the only negatives about this hotel and they are very minor. Everything else about Aqua Bamboo is great. The pool area is beautiful. The rooms are a good size and feature kitchenettes, which is a great. The hotel itself is very close to the beach and plenty of restaurants and stores. The thing that made our stay so amazing, though, was the staff. Brandon, Michelle, and Nicole at the front desk were all wonderful. No question or request was met with anything but a smile and a helpful attitude. Chris at the concierge desk was also great and gave us a wonderful restaurant recommendation for Uncle Bo's. I would recommend this place to anyone.

W.e booked this hotel for the second time after visiting 3yrs ago. This hotel was recommended by friends. The location is great to beaches, shops and restaurants. Due to our early flight in we asked for early check in which was accomodated.We were located on the 11th floor facing the ocean with three balconies.Again great price, great location, great staff.

We booked this hotel after reading many reviews and comparing. The reviews were spot on. Small place great price close to beaches dining shopping. The daily paper apples iced and hot beverages all very nice. The kitchenettes in the unit make it nice for longer stays. We got in late at night and were on street side tad too noisy asked to be moved next morning and no problem they moved us to backside. The pool reception was nice too. All the staff were very helpful. They do a great job keeping it clean. The only drawback the bed is a little uncomfortable but this is common everywhere. We would definitely stay again

It was clean, loved the orchids on the many towels provided, comfortable beds, excellent rooms for 3to 4 people with a very clean and surprisingly full sized kitchen. The friendly lobby setup with complimentary iced lemon water or coffee/tea, a book exchange, enviro friendly recycling and awesome pool area had me wishing we had time to enjoy it! Parking is additional but assigned, underground & secure. Staff are #1 That makes it.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights and it was one of the best experiences. We got there a little early and everyone was very accommodating. Originally I felt like the room was priced very well and then when we got to our room I realized they had upgraded us and was even more pleased! We were on the top floor (room 1204 I believe) and the room was gigantic. We did not have a room with the ocean view but we had a very nice balcony with a very nice city view and it was even nicer at night. Location is great! Just a few blocks from the beach and tons of shops. The room was very quiet I could not hear any street noise and the beds were extremely comfortable. We had both a bathtub and a separate glass shower. Overall it was a great stay and I would highly recommend them, if we are ever back in the area I know I will stay there again!

We were looking for a smaller hotel with good service for a good price that wasn't a dive, which is exactly what we got. The room was clean and comfortable. It's an older place and the window unit AC is a little noisy, but we didn't spend inordinate amounts of time in our room. I do wish the sliding door had a screen on it as we probably would have slept with the AC off and window open if there had been a screen. The hot and cold water faucets in the shower seemed to operate backwards, but once we figured out which way to turn them, that was not a big deal. We had a mini fridge and kitchenette with dishes and a toaster that we used to do our own breakfast and keep left-overs. The location is very convenient and everything you might want is within walking distance. We loved the pool area and spent a LOT of time there. As others have noted, the pool is not heated, but on a hot day that was not much of a problem. It's a little oasis in the city jungle and was generally very mellow. We never had an issue getting a place to sit. If you are looking for something fancy, this may not be the place for you and you might be happier to spend the extra $$ to go to one of the mega hotels on the beach. If you want a nice place with friendly staff for a decent price and can deal with minor imperfections, this was a great place and we'd gladly stay again.

We stayed 2 nights and were very pleased overall with the hotel and the staff.Close to waikiki beach and central for restaurants and shops. Very comfortable beds and very clean rooms and reception area and pool. Pool area quite small but had loungers, tables hot tub and lovely waterfall couldn't find the sauna. Only the noise let the place down. If the room on the front of the hotel the noise from the road is loud almost like we had a window open all night. the air conditioning unit quite loud too but can be switched off. Side room wasn't so noisy.
user_name:
jooles2005
Great Wyrley, England, United Kingdom

review_body: i loved this hotel. it was lovely and clean and the staff were so helpful and friendly. The service was great. the rooms were cleaned each day. the beds were really comfortable. aircnditioner a little noisy but i slept well. pool area was very suitable considering you are only 3 min walk to beach. hotel let you borrow blow up beach toys and boogy boards. Kitchenette well equiped. coffee on tap free and place to refill water bottle. would stay there again!

We just got back from 8 nights at this hotel. I booked this hotel because I was looking for a 1 bedroom suite which offered 3 beds (all queen), close to the beach, with a pool, at an affordable price. Aqua Bamboo Waikiki offered all of that and had great reviews. When we arrived, we were quite shocked at how small the room was. By using the sofa futon as our 3rd bed, there really was no "living" area and the kitchenette was tiny. Also, we were on the 10th floor and the traffic was extremely noisy. Those were the only negatives. The positives made up for everything and I would recommend this hotel to people looking for good value. The room was very clean, the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was quite large (2 sinks, bathtub and separate shower). The patio was tiny and you had to climb over the bed to access the patio, but we got used to that after a while. The pool area was very quaint and quiet. Most of the time, we had the entire area to ourselves. It was very convenient to grill up dinner (nice bbq beside the pool) while the kids were swimming.
