Then we would have a nice candlelit dinner beside the pool. The staff were exceptionally nice. One of the staffmembers even tried to refuse a tip. The hotel offers beach towels, beach chairs and boogie boards....which was a huge convenience. Also, the hotel offers lemon water, iced tea and a water filtration system. We refilled our water bottles everyday.....another huge convenience! The location of the hotel is great as well. Only 2 short blocks to the beach, 1 short block to the best-priced surf rental shop, very close to the main strip, but just far enough away from it. The Koren BBQ (across the street) and Ruffage (half a blk away) were 2 great food finds....inexpensive, healthy, and great quality. If you're not looking for frills and just good value at a great location, then I would recommend this hotel!

The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. Pretty little pool area, but water was cold. The room was not large, but adequate. The studio with kitchenette has a small refrigerator with an ice tray - plenty of room to keep our breakfast foods. Also had a toaster, microwave, small stove, and coffee maker and coffee packages. Basically, it had all the things you would need to eat a meal in your hotel room. The bathroom was small but clean and the towels were in good condition. The bed was comfortable with good sheets. Staff provided us with free beach chairs, beach towels, and a free umbrella when it rained. Parking was expensive - we saved some money by parking in another lot.In other words - the room offered everything you need for a comfortable vacation. If you want luxury, spaciousness and a gorgeous view, go ahead and spend a lot more money somewhere else. This was a good location with a short 2 block walk to the beach, a wonderfully friendly staff, and a decent price, by Waikiki standards.

We stayed for a week in March 2013. Yes, the building is older, but we were quite pleased with the room size, kitchenette, relaxing pool area, and friendly staff. There is a lot of street noise that leaks through to the rooms, but we kept the AC fan on at night and it was no problem. I really like the location, only a couple of blocks to Kuhio beach, and lots of restaurant choices nearby. I would stay there again. However, we paid $217/nt which I feel is is too much for what you get. We didnt use WIFI but the wired connection in the room worked okay. My only real complaint is that the spa owner is a high pressure sales type. Had a nice massage, and might have had another, but according to him I needed another $1,000 worth of treatments. Nah.

We stayed here because it offered two rooms and we had 4 people staying together. The condition of the rooms were fine, we sleep with fans so the AC to us was not loud, though to others, it may be. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were small though we normally were enjoying the beach rather than staying in our room. The biggest problem I had with this place was the noise.. you can hear everything on the main street. (We had a street view room) This kept two of our family awake a lot during the night and forced me to use ear plugs to drown out the road sound. Fixing this problem should be a major concern for this hotel since its not that hard to put more sound-proof glass on the doors and seal the area around each of the AC units. Glad to hear they are getting WiFi in the rooms. The pool was nice but very cold; the hot tub was used way more than the pool during our stay. The staff was amazing, always friendly, and always helpful. I would not stay here again though due to the loudness of the rooms. If this was fixed I would happily stay again.

Just returned from a week long stay at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki and I am already missing our assigned room, 1003. A lot of time was invested in researching different hotels and ultimately, I selected this one based on the attractive accommodations, location, and price. Not to mention, I waited until Cyber Monday rolled around so I could take advantage of the discount code, which saved me good chunk of change and made this hotel even more budget-friendly. When finalizing my reservation for a one-bedroom suite with a kitchenette, I requested a room above the pool (based on previous suggestions) and asked for two queen beds so it would comfortably fit a family of four. Although that particular accommodation was unavailable above the pool, the staff was able to provide an amazing room that was high enough to escape the noisy streets. Room 1003 was immaculate. It included two queen beds, a single futon, two televisions, a DVD player, two mini-fridges, a small dining area, and a large bathroom (with two separate showers). Yes, my jaw dropped when I walked into the room for the first time; in fact, I am still stunned by the room and I didn't find any problems like previous guests. The A/C was quiet, the room was spacious, and nothing appeared outdated. An outstanding element to our stay was the hotel staff. The employees were very friendly, helpful, and exuded such warmth--it was obvious they really put their guests first.Aside from the room and hotel staff, the available services and amenities were viewed as perks; for instance, the free beach towels and chairs were perfect for toting around Hanauma Bay. Plus, I would occasionally fill my reusable water bottle with the chilled lemonade and iced tea situated in the lobby. The hotel itself was in a prime location, it was right across the street from the bus stop, a couple blocks from the beach, and near two cheap garages (Waikiki Banyan, $12/day & Pacific Monarch, $20/day). Overall, I am more than satisfied with all this hotel has to offer and I would stay here again. Never have I experienced such a sentimental attachment with a hotel--Thank you, Aqua Bamboo.

The place is a little old and run down. The wood trim that runs across the ceiling, starts and ends abruptly. Lack of, simple attention to detail. It's like the room was unfinished.The washroom is a bit on the older side. No fan for ventilation. There's simply a hole in the wall with a grill and mesh for air to travel in/out of the washroom to allow air to flow. The problem is, noise also flowed freely. Which means, you can hear buses go by, people screaming, the garbage truck picking up the trash. If you're from a newer trendier city, this washroom would be considered clean but you would only find a similar one in a trashy neighborhood.The rooms all have a more traditional hold in the wall air conditioner. They are constantly on and the problem is they are located right above and beside the bed. The hole in the wall for the air conditioner also allowed noise from the busy street to flow into the room. So not only do you enjoy the noisy streets in the washroom; you also get to enjoy it all while in bed as well.The better?- Location is not bad. It's relatively close to the beach and close to the shopping.- Pool is decently modern. Has a hot tub. It's also very small though.- Parking was only $25 if you parked with them. $20 if you parked in the building to the right of them.- They have a kitchen in the one bedroom with a small beer fridge. Although, pictures we saw had a picture of a full size fridge.- Room was clean.- Staff was decent. They reminded us that we would not get our money back because we booked our stay as a package when we left midway through our stay. Felt a bit like being locked into a cell phone contract but it was either that or suffer through lack of sleep for the rest of the vacation.Cons:- You may not be able to sleep through the night- It's a little run-down even though it's gone through renovation (which I'm only aware of because I've read the other reviews)- Somethings you just can't renovate to make it newer. The building is just older. The rooms are just older, the air conditioning is the type that will be loud.- Internet in the room is wired only. Apparently, it's high speed internet. In this day and age, where you can get a wireless router for $60, needing a wired connection is just strange. Most tablets are not wired. If you had a MacBook Air for instance, you can connect to a wired connection without an adapter. Phones are mini computers these days (surf the web, check your email, ...) and they don't connect to a wired connection. Really, you'll need to bring your own wireless router with you to be able to connect all your wireless devices. There are many travel routers you can bring with you. It's just that, you shouldn't be expected to bring one with you in this day and age.- It wasn't priced as a budget hotel but better hotels on the beach were not that much more expensive if you shop around a bit. Got a better hotel through a walk-in special deal for roughly the same price per night.- The one bedroom unit only offers a TV in the main living room area. The bedroom itself has no TV. Which is usually not the norm since a budget TV can be around $400 - $500 these days.

Stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 2 weeks on a holiday with a friend.We asked for separate beds which they accommodated and it was really handing having a small kitchenette allowing us to make our own breakfasts.Hotel is clean, cozy and comfortable. The staff are friendly, helpful and is located back from the beach but close to 24hr restaurants as well as all the cool bars and restaurants in Waikiki.Free Wifi is available in the lobby and by the pool, unfortunately it doesn't reach the rooms however they had cables available for me to borrow to enable me to connect my laptop to the free internet in the rooms.Having the option to lounge by the pool was great and i really enjoy the free Lai making & Hotel get together every Thursday.I prefer to stay in smaller boutique hotels rather than the big flashy resorts and Aqua Bamboo didn't disappoint.Thankyou to all the staff who make our trip an enjoyable one!

Exellent Hotel,good location,Helpfull friendly staff.Kitchen area,Brilliant-Orchids/Bath robes/welcoming glass of Pineapple juice and Farewell gift=Exellent Touches ,Restaraunt Meals and Drinks outside-Very Expensive!!!(but not hotel's fault)

We stayed from March 13 to 22, 2013.Here are some comments:- free ice tea and lemonade in lobby very good but, free coffee is weak- pool area is nicely designed- staff are very helpful and friendly- internet service is intermittent and slow- our room had ants and flies- daily room service does not wash dishes- A/C is wall mounted and very noisy- only 1 ice machine available near pool- beds are comfortable- hotel and rooms are dated

My husband and I stayed at Aqua Bamboo for one night in January before heading back to NY. It was the last night of our honeymoon. We felt that our stay at this hotel was about average. The property itself is a little rundown and outdated. Could definitely benefit from some modern touches and new linens/furniture in guest rooms. Our room was quite large, big enough to sleep 4 people, but the layout was very strange. Two refrigerators? We didn't get it. This would probably be a great hotel if you are planning on staying in the area for several days or weeks and want a mini apartment. It was not so great as an end to a long romantic honeymoon. The pros of this hotel include it's decent location and friendly staff who let us hang out in their lobby for several hours while we waited for our flight. Oh, and their pens are great! I am still using mine at work two months later!

My husband and I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in room 402 (studio kitchenette) for 3 nights in March. The room was on the side of the building with a view of another building. We could hear the cars on Kuhio Ave., but it wasn't loud enough to keep us awake. There were 2 double beds in this room. We slept in one bed and used the other bed for our stuff. The location was great. We felt this hotel was a good deal for the money we paid. We enjoyed the pool, which was not too crowded when we were there. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. I also liked that they use lavender scented oils or candles in the lobby. They offer surfboard storage at the hotel, and there were a few places to rent surfboards close by.

Aqua Bamboo Waikiki was our Honolulu stay for 2 nights in February. We'd read the reviews and knew the property was older and a couple of blocks off the beach. We booked directly with the hotel and stayed in a 1 bedroom unit, 707 with a full kitchen. Well, so it said but actually we had 2 rooms and 1 bath, and a full size stove and fridge and kitchen sink squished in. The bedroom had a queen bed, closet and dresser. The main room had 2 very small singles, a TV and those gigantic appliances. Every room is quite different from another. There was no option to have a 1 bedroom facing the pool. CONS:There was no room to do anything but sleep! Tiny roomVery noisy, street traffic is pretty much 24/7 and not muffled at all.A/C also noisy but keeping it on helped drown out street noise at nightFree Wifi only available in the lobby and complicated to connect toPROSgreat staff, all of them.Nicole at the front desk is awesomeLobby has all-day free and fresh lemonade, water, coffee and tea(Another review said these are $1 but that is only if you want cappucino/speciality coffees)pool area is nice, lots of chairs and loungesrooms and common areas cleanthere's a weekly (Thursday) happy hour with complimentary beverages, their signature cocktail and snacks (pupu's)Front desk will provide complimentary beach equipment, chairs and boogies boards for your usegood location in Waikiki, 2 blocks to the beach and 2 blocks to International Market PlaceWe enjoyed hanging around the pool, but other than sleeping we spent all our time outside the room and generally off the property. This hotel would probably be better suited to young couple or single traveller because of the small room size and space. It wasn't a bargain price but felt like a bargain hotel with friendly staff in a convenient location.

We stayed here in March to attend a wedding in Waikiki and booked the "Snooze n Cruise" package which included parking and a rental car. By booking this package, we were able to save a few hundred as compared to booking the rental car separately. The hotel was very easy to find and is just a block or so from the beach. Upon arrival, we were greeted with smiles all around and pleasantly surprised to find out that our studio kitchenette had been upgraded to a 1BR suite with kitchen!!! Room 1204 was absolutely gorgeous and a few feet from the laundry machines. It also came with two balconies (lots of sunshine and not bad on the noise levels), kitchenette (equipped with microwave, stove, sink, appliances, silverware and fridge), a futon, minibar, 2 televisions (albeit one is very tiny), spacious bathroom and comfortable "living room" area. It almost felt like we were living in our very own apartment. Aqua Bamboo location could not be beat. We walked a block to the beach and about 5 minutes to International Marketplace and several other restaurants and shopping locations. Compared to many of the beachfront accommodations, I actually liked being a little bit away from the main strip where it was much quieter and less crowded. Getting to/from the freeway to explore the rest of the island was also more convenient away from the crowds.The service was perfect. Our room was always cleaned spotless with several orchids placed on towels and pillows. Every time we saw anyone from the hotel, we were met with smiles and 'Aloha's'. There was also a small reception by the pool on Thursday evenings where snacks and drinks are served. Aqua Bamboo also lets guests borrow beach towels and chairs free of charge which was also a nice touch. All in all, a great and pleasant stay at a cute hotel. My husband and I spent most of our vacation island exploring, on the beach or doing water sports, so all we were looking for in our hotel experience was a nice place to come home to in a great location within our price range. Aqua Bamboo fit the bill for that. My only recommendation would be to call and reserve parking because the garage is quite small (fits about 10-12 cars) and the uphill driveway to get out can be a bit scary since you have to look out for pedestrians and can't quite see over the driveway.
user_name:
Julie T
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: Having seen rave reviews and compliments to this hotel, I was expecting quite an impressive boutique hotel. I was checked into room 1105 and was immediately disappointed with the size of the tiny room. Not much space to hold our luggage or walk around. We also had an outdated bathroom. It was as if they remodeled everything else and forgot the bathroom. The vanity and the tubs looked like they were from two decades ago with rust stains. I am beginning to think that the inconsistent reviews stem from all rooms not being renovated to the same level of completion. On the positive side, it was a great location. The staff were very courteous, helpful and professional. I was happy to have free drinks, including lemon infused water and iced tea in the lobby that varied from day to day. Coffee and tea in the lobby required $1 vending machine payment and lobby internet station also required payment (but was free at Aqua Waikiki Pearl when I stayed at its sister hotel 6 months ago). Laundry on the other hand is very affordable at this property.

Was a little worried when I first booked the hotel due to the price. When we arrived I was pleasently surprised. My daughter and I spent one week here in December 2012 and then a few nights on the way home from Washington State in January. Lovely hotel, wonderful Staff and perfect location. We were given a room on the 10th Floor which had ocean views, a nice little balcony and lots of room for my daughter and I. We made great use of the loan beach towels and my daughter love being able to borrow the bucket and spade each day. The only thing that I would like to change is the temp of the pool and hot tub. Pool was very cold and hot tub way too hot... I know I sound like goldielocks! =)The Staff would have to been one of the best assets of the Hotel. They were very helpful, always happy to see us and took the time to make sure we were having a great holiday. Found the washing machine and dryer very handy especially with a toddler who seemed to get icecream all over her clothes everyday. Rooms were very clean and had everything we needed. The hotel is close to the beach, you can walk to the Zoo, Beach, shops, and has Bus stops just near the front door. We really enjoyed theThursday night cocktail party, such a nice idea. Would love to go back very soon.

My partner and I stayed in the Aqua Bamboo for 9 nights at the beginning of February 2013 and we were really impressed. We emailed before we arrived to ask if there was any possibility of a 'nice' room as it was a special trip for my 50th birthday. We did indeed have a 'nice' room. It was 1006 and it was at the back of the hotel with views of the pool and the sea. It also had a little balcony at the side with a table and two chairs. I think the rooms that end 001 and 006 are the best rooms and the higher up you are the better the views. The little kitchen was great although we didn't cook a thing!We used the (free) hotel beach towels and beach chairs every day that we went to the beach and these saved a small fortune because on the first day we discovered that if you wanted to hire two sunbeds and an umbrella for the day it was $25!! crazy prices. The hotel concierge booked all of our trips for us and they were all BRILLIANT. Pearl Harbour, Turtle tour, Polynesian Cultural Centre.We really had an amazing time and the Aqua Bamboo was the perfect place to stay.

My friend and I spent two weeks here. The staff are wonderful and provide the upmost in customer service. Pool area is wonderfully relaxing. Great lobby area with lemon water, ice tea, apples and newspapers which are nice touches. Room was well cleaned each and every day. We had a one bedroom full kitchen and enjoyed breakfast, lunches and some dinners in our room. This hotel is close to everything so it is very convenient. It is small so staff get to know you and you get the pleasure of getting to know other guests. The only compliant I would have is that I am very noise sensitive and we ended up with a room facing a a very busy street and the staff were unable to move us for our whole stay as it was booked. All in all a great place and good value. I will most certainly stay here again

this is our second year here. we were there for 1 month. we have already booked for next year.the gardens are really nice and relaxing. we read our paper outside in the garden every morning at 730 and had coffee. it was most enjoyable. the staff were very friendly and helpful.we were close enough to the beach

We wanted to spend our final night on Oahu in Waikiki but didn't want the high priced "resort" type hotel experience. We were looking for something a little more local (show your slippers...not bedroom slippers...thongs for you malihinis...for 10% off your room rate) off the "main drag". When we arrived we were really pleased that, on their own, the hotel had upgraded us to a suite on the 10th floor! Why? We don't know, but we were VERY thankful! The suite was beautiful with stone floors, a pebble floor walk in shower and huge tub in the Bathroom, kitchenette, more electronic entertainment options (there was a whole drawer full of remotes) than you could possibly use...unless you were staying a week...a sitting room, huge bedroom (the only down side was that you had to climb over one bed to get out onto the lanai!). The property has a sweet little pool and lounge area and it so happened that we were there on a Thursday night when they have snacks, cocktails, and entertainment for everyone staying there. That was a nice social experience! The property is mixed hotel and owners who have units there that they use either for vacation or live there year-round, so it doesn't have the feel of a "resort", more like a small neighborhood. Of course, wherever you stay in Waikiki, you are close to everything (don't miss Leonard's Bakery on Kapahulu Avenue a bit east of the Zoo).

Only two blocks from the beach and just around the corner from the Hyatt a common pick up point for Tourist attractions. Vey good place to stay small but very comfortable, had too switch rooms to a higher floor because of the street traffic but staff were very acommadating. There is free old fashioned lemonade on offer as well as nice pool area. The sea was much warmer though. ABC stores are everywhere so you can buy breakfast provisions very cheap.Would stay here again coming back in a couple of years.

We stayed 9 days at the Bamboo and we were very happy with the hotel. Though a smaller and older building it's well maintained and a convenient location just being 2 blocks off the Main Street and ocean (5 minute walk). When we arrived we didn't have a great room and were easily upgraded. Both rooms had kitchenettes which were adequate for our needs. The hotel has a barbecue (immaculately clean) so you can do nice meals. The pool was cool and the hot tub, while small - the perfect temperature. We had no problems getting the wifi at poolside (and lobby, which had comfy sitting areas with fresh ice tea, lemon aid or lemon water daily as well as coffee and filtered water). Of no fault of the hotel, there was construction out front - everyday and the weather was windy and wet. Regardless, we had a great time and the staff were simply awesome. (Particularly Nicole and Michelle). Thanks Bamboo staff!

Normally stay in apartments but for 3 days we chose this hotel as we wanted tocheck out the area of being right in the core of the busy Waikiki strip. The pricewas right, along with the great staff, location, etc. The happy hour hula show onthe Thursday nite was a bonus.

Very clean, hotel staff extremely helpful, good location: just a few minutes walk to the beach and popular restaurants. Free wifi for guests in the lobby and a decent pool area for the price/size of the hotel. Street noise at night slightly annoying but somewhat expected given the busy nature of the location. Bathrooms could be modernized slightly, however bedrooms were extremely clean and modern with a very generously sized kitchenette. Highly recommended if you go to Waikiki with the intention of spending all day at the beach/shops.

I do not usually spend this much for a hotel room but decided to check it out. This is considered a boutique hotel I guess because of its size. The rooms were redone but I noticed the paint job was bad in the bathroom where the fixtures are old in the tub/shower and the sink has a spout that is too big for it. The tiny kitchenette was useable and sufficiently stocked with utensils. The bed was comfortable, furnishings tasteful. The noise in the room was bad from outside traffic on Kuio Avenue. I ran the fan all night to try and mask the trucks and buses. Staff was pleasant but no complimentary printing of boarding passes, you have to pay for internet access and the cost of printing. Tiny pool opens at 9 AM as does the tiny hot tub. The elevators and hallway floors are old and scruffy. There are better places for less money.

Thanks to all the staff at the Aqua Bamboo for a wonderful stay at this Boutique Hotel in Waikiki. Friendly and helpful faces everyday along with their Thursday night Bamboozle always makes our stay most pleasurable. Really enjoy the daily beverages available in the lounge, Ice tea or Lemonade as well as lemon water. We hope to see you again.

We stayed here for three nights in Feb 2013. On the positive side this hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Waikiki beach, but on the negative side the rooms are very small and could use an update - especially the bathroom. We had to change room since the first room we got had a very bad smell and suspicious black spots in the ceiling. There was a lot of noise from the street which made it difficult to sleep, so would recommend to avoid a room facing towards the street if possible. The personnel was very service-oriented, but overall the hotel didn't live up to the three stars or prices.

Pros: helpful service, complimentary treats in the lobby like iced tea and apples, clean rooms with kitchenettes, perfect little pool and hot tub, two blocks from the beach, close to restaurants, great walking and bus access around town, can't beat the price!Cons: some noise from city traffic, loud air conditioner, small hotel front which makes drops offs a little trickyWill happily stay here again, thanks Aqua Bamboo!

This review may be a little after we stayed but it's the first chance I've had to write.We arrived very late (1.30am) and well after check in due to a delayed flight. The guy on reception was a little grumpy BUT THIS WAS THE ONLY TIME WE HAD DODGY SERVICE!! Aqua Bamboo is not a 4 star but a VERY GOOD 3 star if you are comparing to US standards.The beds are double beds, not queens or kings. The rooms are on a par with UK hotel rooms in size BUT fabulous little kitchenette if you want to make lights snacks, teas, coffees etc. Also coffee, teas etc free in reception. No WIFI but you do get free internet via wire connection (wire supplied by reception to fit laptop free of charge). The pool is FABULOUS! Small but beautiful. Warm, clean and private (if you don't mind being overlooked by skyscrapers on 2 sides BUT didn't bother me!!). It is only 5 mins from Waikiki beach and the main street with all of the designer shops and restaurants. Get the bus if you can. Get to see the real island. ALSO GO TO THE POLYNESIAN CENTRE!!!! AMAZING DAY!! You get to experience ALL of the differing cultures of Polynesia. We also took a day trip to the Big Island by plane (Hawaii) - not cheap, around £300 each BUT well worth it. Also took a 1 hour helicopter tour over Maui, amazing sights and well worth the money. I would really recommend this hotel as value for money. If you stay on the main street you will be charged at least £250 to £500 per night for a hotel and you're never in the room because it is such a beatiful place.
user_name:
KarenL699
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed at Aqua Bamboo for 2 weeks in January and part of February. The room was very nice but with the sirens most nights, we did find it noisy. (We suspect the area overlooking the pool would be quieter). The room itself was very clean and we thank Cathyleen for her industrious efforts to make our stay pleasant. The hotel is very well located - 5 min. walk to Waikiki and for those who prefer a pool, the hotel pool is secluded and very well kept. We utilized the kitchenette on occasion and found the local Food Pantry very conveniently located. There are eateries everywhere but they are definitely not cheap in most instances. When we arrived there was a problem with closing our door and a maintenance person was sent immediately to repair the door which never gave us trouble again. There was also an issue with the slippery bathtub which also was remedied immediately. The Staff at Reception were very polite and helpful at all times. Would recommend the place to anyone and would definitely stay there again.

Perfect hotel right in the heart of Waikiki......this hotel is a few blocks from the beach, but for the price it cannot be beat. We elected one of the rooms with a queen bed and kitchenette...the room had two balconies and plenty of room.We were impressed with the housekeeping services as the room was completely spotless and very well maintained. Technically, we could see the ocean from our room, but the best view was of the pool area below.....a beautiful oasis in the middle of a very busy city. Parking was quite reasonbly priced, and although we elected to self-park in the public garage next door, the hotel charge was only $5 more.Two things really impressed us about this property. First, we had a couple of minor problems with the clock and phone in our room which were promptly corrected by the front desk.....we were delighted with their responsiveness. Second, the Aqua company seems to specialize in renovating existing properties - something we value greatly. Instead of demolishing a perfectly good building, Aqua renovates the property to current standards while still retaining the charm of an older hotel.Overall we loved staying here, loved the room, and found the front desk personnel to be extremely helpful and welcoming. Highly recommend, and we definitely look forward to staying here again!

My wife, daughter and I spent 2 weeks at the Aqua Bamboo in Feb 2013.Location = excellent located on Kuhio Ave just a 5 min walk to Waikiki.Valet parking was $25/nightWe had a room with two double beds and a kitchenette. We requested a room facing the pool (cost involved), but there wasn't one available... so we ended up facing a hotel view to the side of the building. As other reviewers have pointed out, the noise is definitely an issue. We slept with the balcony door shut and the noisy air conditioner on all night to block out the street noise which is at its worst at around 6am.The decor is a little dated. The room had a microwave, hotplates, large bar fridge, crockery and cutlery. Shower over bath. Beds were comfortable.There is a coin operated washing machine and dryer for guests.The pool area, though not large is relaxing and shaded.We would stay again

We have stayed at this hotel on 2 occasions within a space of 2 weeks. My husband and I travelled with our 2 almost adult daughters, and I have booked 1 bedroom apartment so that the girls could sleep on a fold out sofa, although this hotel offers 2 single beds in the lounge room in some of the suites. The staff at this hotel are outstanding - you feel as though you are staying in a small B&B and not a multi-storey hotel, they are real people who can reply to a joke with joke.The hotel is located 2 blocks from the beach on the street that has the buses which can take you to Honolulu, shopping etc. it also seemed to be right in the heart of Waikiki as when walked out to the beach and turn left there is a wondreful boardwalk along the beach, and casual eating places across the road; and if you turn right that's were all the big hotels along the beach and all the haute couture shops are, with many restaurants.On our first stay of 4 days were actually upgraded to a 2 bedroom penthouse which was huge with 360 views. Even though we were on the 15th floor I would highly recommend earplugs as the traffic noise still reaches up there. The second stay was just for one night and we 1st got the suite withsofa bed, but asked if the had one with the twin beds and they moved us as the beds are more comfortable than a sofa bed. The hotel is really showing signs of age in everything, but is very clean.The pool are is lovely however it is surrounded by tall buildings and palm trees so there is only certain amount of time when you get direct sun.This hotel was good value at the location that it has.

We have been staying a Aqua Bamboo for almost a week and would like to report that we have had a most pleasant experience. The whole staff has been very friendly and accommodating. I have to do business while I am holiday and I found Michelle and Zenie to be very helpful in assisting me with my internet needs. This is a great little oasis in Waikiki, with easy access to the beach and groceries. We prepared all our meals here at the hotel and enjoyed them on the deck by the pool. The grill was a great asset.

Comfortable - Clean - Relaxing and Excellent Service!We stayed for 8 nights and thoroughly enjoyed every moment. No complaints except for the street side is a tad noisey if you like to keep your windows or doors open to enjoy the fresh air. Next time I would ask for pool side instead. The staff were wonderful and very accomodating. Really enjoyed the fresh lemon water, lemon aid, coffee or tea 24/7 in the lounge area as well as the access to beach chairs to take to the beach at no cost.

The Aqua Bamboo lives up to all the good posted in these reviews and then some. The hotel staff is amazingly friendly and helpful, definitely demonstrating the Aloha spirit. Our room on the 8th floor, had everything we needed, as promised. A king bed, a desk, a table, several chairs, a mini-kitchen and a small balcony with a couple of chairs. Although our room was near the balcony on which the washer and dryer were located, we never heard it. We also were not far from the elevator and never heard any noise from there either. In fact, we pretty much didn’t hear anything the entire time we were there except for twice when we heard police/ambulance sirens, which you would probably heard anywhere you were, except maybe a soundproof vault. (They run those sirens really loud!)The lanai (balcony) was small and didn’t overlook anything particularly interesting, but we really didn’t have any time to sit around there anyway, since we were quite busy.The kitchenette area includes a microwave, a small fridge, a sink, two burners, a coffee maker, and several cabinets and drawers. It was stocked with various cookware and dishes. We didn’t have need for any of them except the glasses and one sharp knife, but if you need them, they are available.There was daily maid service, though it usually took place later in the day (I suspect they first clean the rooms of guests who have left so that they can be available as early as possible for newly arriving guests.) The beds were made, the room was cleaned, the towels were replaced (including the little one for the kitchen), the soaps and shampoos were replaced/supplemented, as were the tissues and toilet paper. Just what you would expect from a good hotel.The king bed was comfortable. The bathroom was an acceptable size and the water pressure was adequate.Check-in was very quick and efficient. They have a cart for piling up your luggage. The elevators are smallish, but we were able to get all of our luggage, which was on the cart, and ourselves, in at one time. The elevators were fairly efficient and we never waited long for the elevator.The L-shaped lobby with Bamboo theme has free cold filtered water (lemon water)(the water in the room is fine for drinking too, by the way), brewed coffee (regular only), hot water with a selection of teas, apples and local newspapers.Although the hotel is not “on the beach”, it is a mere 2.5 blocks from the beach. Now, one needs to understand what a block is in this case to have the appropriate perspective. In Manhattan, there are long blocks and short blocks. These blocks in Waikiki are shorter than the short blocks in Manhattan. In other words, the two blocks are really short. Another way to look at it is that it took us longer to walk to the beach at the Hilton Hawaiian Resort from that hotel’s front (when we went to the Atlantis Submarine Ride), which is “on the beach”, than it did to walk to the beach from the Aqua Bamboo. The Aqua Bamboo has a collection of “left behind” beach equipment they are happy to lend you. They also give you beach towel cards which you can exchange for beach towels each day. For my wife and myself we got 3 cards, one for each of us to dry off with and the third to sit on at the beach.Note, too, that the Aqua Bamboo is very close to that part of the beach where the “Duke” statue is and also to the area where the free hula shows are held on Thursday, Saturday and Sunday. (Get there early for a good seat.) It is also around the corner (1 short block) from the King’s Village, where they do a changing of the guards/flag lowering ceremony. There is plenty of shopping in the area, since the Bamboo is located in the heart of Waikiki.One area that can use improvement is the parking situation. The parking is in the basement and there are very few spots for $25 per day now. If you want a spot, you should reserve it in advance. The spots are very tight, it is difficult to maneuver you car, and the ceiling is low or has low pipes in various spots. On the bright side, they valet park and retrieve your car between 8 AM and 10 PM. However, if you have to park it yourself or retrieve it yourself, it is a pain. The friendly staff did help me a couple of times outside of regular hours when the regular valet had left.The concierges were quite knowledgeable, in particular pointing us to Queen Emma’s Summer Palace, which is on the way to the Paali Lookout, Byodo-In Temple and the Polynesian Cultural Center (all of which we did in one day) and to the “easy, new” fork up the final stretch of Diamond Head. The front desk staff was excellent and they were also very helpful at directing us.On our last night we went to the hotel’s pool and Jacuzzi. Although the pool is smallish, it is appropriately sized for a boutique hotel, and the pool area is very nice. There is also bar-b-que equipment available for use.As for Internet, I brought a short cable with me and used the wired internet in the room. It was quite adequate. I’ve read that they have Wi-Fi in the lobby and pool area, but I didn’t test it myself.We’d like to give a shout out to P.T. at the Island Colony Hotel (a sister hotel to the Bamboo), a wonderful warm and caring person who helped us select the right hotel from the Aqua family of hotels.The Aqua Bamboo was very conscious of the fact that this was a trip to celebrate our 25th anniversary trip and they helped to make it a very special trip that we will remember for the rest of our lives.

My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Bamboo,staff always friendly and very helpful.This was our first trip to Waikiki but not the last! This hotel has a very warm atmosphere and I would not hesitate to stay here again.Thank you so much for making this a great holiday,we returned home to minus 35 temp. we are missing the warm weather!

My now husband and I plus some family all stayed here October 5 - 9, 2011. We got married on October 8th and went on to Kauai for our honeymoon. It was a great place to stay and met our requirements and budget. We weren't planning on being in the hotel that much while we were there and it was in the perfect location to get to the beach, restaurants and shopping. I had read all of the reviews on here before booking. I liked that it wasn't some huge hotel. The whole staff was very friendly, check in was easy and our room was clean. I had my bouquet included in the package we had bought separately for the wedding, otherwise I would have had the lady at the front desk do mine. I heard from others she is really good at that and she also had offered. On our wedding night they surprised us with flower petals in the shape of a heart on our bed, a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts and a bottle of champagne. The pool was great after long days out when we didn't want to be around crowds. We didn't have any problem with noise the whole time we were there and they were actually doing work to the outside of the hotel that week. I would definitely go back. In fact, my husband and I are planning on a detour to Kauai just to stay there for our 2nd anniversary this year.

See other reviews for the pros. One potential con is renting a big 4 wheel drive vehicle and attempting to park it in the basement parking area. The roof rack hit a low hanging pipe. Exercise caution.

We have been here 12 nights 2 more to go! Nice room. Probably paid way too much for the 14 nights $4500 Aus dollars! I booked at the last minute! Had i booked months ago it would have probably been half that price! Anyway pros and cons PROS very close to the beach and waikiki main strip plus food pantry and abc shops to grab quick on the go meals water snacks ect ! Free lemon water lemonade or iced tea coffee tea machine in the lobby as you go out to pool which is also lovely! Free apples as you walk in to go in the lift! Free wifi in the lobby and pool only! Staff were friendly! Special mention to GREG always smiling opened the door for us to front entrance and the lift when we came in with shopping hands full! Always chatted with us about our day! He also recommended where to go and what to eat! Great job GREG! Well done on your excellent customer service! Was totally impressed! The cleaning ladies also left us enough towels tissues to use everyday! They did a basic room service bathroom clean and tidy beds! But they were always friendly smiling obliging to our needs at all times. CONS too noisy!!! On the main road where the bus stop is across the road! The construction work seemed to go on forever nearby with jackhammers! Our room faced the street so sleep was a major issue because the doors to open the balcony were extremely hard to open! We requested someone to come and look at it but no one came! We couldn't stand the air con too noisy DIDNT work properly the one in the next room that the people were using was left on all day and night and it felt like it was in our room so noisy! No soundproofing! We ended up using both hands full force to open both the doors then got a beautiful breeze but unfortunately the noise was just too much plus leaving the door open we got birds coming into our room! I don't think I will stay here again! TIP book 3-6 months in advance for any hotel or condo in waikiki and it will be more reasonable, i cant believe how much the price hikes up when you book weeks before going! learnt the hard way when I wanted to book the trump 6 months earlier the room that we wanted was $5100 for 5 stars with kitchenette 2 queens but before booking the bamboo week before coming the price jumped to $12,000 for the same room more than double so I def won't be doing that again! Thanks once again to GREG for making our stay so pleasant nevertheless! That made it all worthwhile for us!

Stayed 4 days / 3 nights. I found the hotel to be very well located, a very short walk to the beach, yet much cheaper than the beachfront hotels (though not cheap, nothing there is). They provide beach towels and beach chairs that you can take where you're going.The rooms were very clean. We switched rooms from a 1 to a 2 bedroom after one night only because of girlfriend issues, not because of the room (that's why I said rooms in plural). They were very accommodating with this switch and we could move from one room to another directly, no need to pack everything out and wait.Beware that on the 2nd floor is their laundry and maintenance area, and it can be noisy, all the housekeeping carts move through there, so I suggest avoiding the 2nd floor.The pool and pool area are small but well maintained and very inviting.The parking lot is very small and somewhat inconvenient to get in and out, and its an extra 25 per day.The staff was always nice, fast and accurate. We called for an extra blanket and it was delivered to our room in about 30 seconds (I was surprised).

My husband and I took a very brief trip and booked Aqua Bamboo on a whim. As stated in many of the reviews, the hotel was listed as nice and comfortable with a little/lot more noise than desired. That is exactly what we experienced. We loved that our room had 3 balconies and we could see two different directions.*I recommend 11th floor facing the pool. (great view of the ocean from there)We really appreciate the front desk's friendliness and advice. The concierge service was very helpful. One gentleman in particular, name starts with Bram..., he was helpful and did not come across as pushy for his company,expedia. Probably why we booked so many events with him. The housekeeping did a great job too! We do not recommend the speedishuttle. Made us wait an hour while they let non-reservation clients take shuttle after shuttle while those who prebooked waited. just FYI!

The Aqua Bamboo is nothing too fancy, but fairly comfortable and close to the beach, shops, restaurants and other hotels. The staff was very nice and the lobby was comfortable. The free coffee, lemon water and apples were a nice touch. The beds were sort of hard and the pillows a little flat, but probably the worst thing was we were in a room facing the street so it was VERY noisy. It seemed the glass on the sliding door was paper thin, we could hear all the outside sounds during the night. I'm not a light sleeper so it did not matter too much, but upon waking, it was very loud with people and traffic noise. If I stayed again, I'd request a room facing inward so the traffic noise would be less. Great if you are traveling on a budget and don't need too much luxury.

My wife and I found this hotel decent but a bit overpriced. The entrance and lobby are tiki-themed, and charming enough though a bit dated; the pool area, though we didn’t use it, looked really nice. The room was very nice. Upon arriving, we were given a room with two twin beds but after a bit of complaining, were moved to a room with a queen-size bed, which also had a better (as in existent) view. There was a New Year’s Eve social at the pool with free champagne, snacks, and party fare, which was a nice touch. Overall, not a bad experience for the money, which we understand was much less than many of the hotels in the area.

During our stay we had a terrific interaction with all of your hotel staff. A special thank you to Fei for the beautiful flower arrangements for my wife’s birthday. And I would like to say that Greg, embodied the aloha spirit and was always happy and cheerful. If only more people in the world gave off such a positive feeling, like Greg does, the world would be a much happier place.

We have been here for weeks and still 2 weeks to go,me and the wife love this hotel great. Rooms,are extra clean,they have free high speed internet in the room,and internet on the main floor,free local calling,free calling card,with free coffee in the rooms as well as downstairs,The staff here is very friendly and will help with any questions.Wait to go bamboo staff,the best team work i have ever seen,this staff goes out of there way to please you.The beach is like a 4 minute walk,with the bus stop right across the street from the hotel.Bamboo Spa has every thursday in the pool area greetings with appetizers and live entertainment.Also can't forget they also have ever morning newspapers and a basket full of apples for the guests,and a bq for you to cook your food.I would recommend this hotel very highly.

We spent ages reviewing properties on tripadvisor before booking and are so glad we chose Aqua Bamboo. Had a lovely room on the 10th floor with a sea view, and fully enjoyed our stay. Very nice, hospitable staff, wonderful pool area (might turn the heat up a notch but otherwise nice) and perfect location. Would stay again

Arrived early morning from an overnight flt. The lady at the desk was more than happy to check us in early since they had a clean room available. Room was a perfect little studio complete with kitchenette, dishes, cookware etc. nice touches like morning papers in the lobby as well as complimentary hot an cold beverages. Pool area was very quaint and well maintained though the sun really didnt find it's way there till after noon. Staff were all extremely pleasant and location in very close proximity to everything Waikiki plus several bus stops within a block of the hotel. Seaside grill about two blks south of the hotel on the other side of Kuhio Ave had a great inexpensive breakfast. If you don't mind spending a buck and want a beautiful mature setting for cocktails head over to the beach bar at the westin surf rider excellent Mai-tais ($12)

Our family stayed here after our Hawaiian cruise for my parent's wedding anniversary. We had previously booked at a shabby hotel down the way, but quickly sought refuge at Aqua Bamboo. The front desk and bell staff (Michelle, Gregg and crew) were incredibly kind, helpful and accommodating. Our room was clean and adorned with orchids when we arrived. Once the staff found out it was my parent's anniversary celebration, they surprised us with champagne and chocolates in our room! The pool and hot tub area was fantastic - very tropical and protected from the surrounding buildings. We were pleasantly surprised that they even had a sauna. The location is prime, just two block from the beach, and the price was great for the service provided. We will definitely be staying at the Bamboo and other Aqua Hotels upon our next visit!

We have spent 1 week so far at Aqua Bamboo and it has been very comfortable. The staff are very accommodating and friendly. We had a good sized, well kept, self catering room. There is a supermarket nearby. The pool area made for a relaxing time, especially at night. Recommend you try it !

For a quick 2 block walk to the beach this hotel was very affordable. It was clean and the pool area is a delight, especially the hot spa. However, make sure you book a room on the quiet side of the building, that is, overlooking the pool. We had 2 adults and 2 teens so needed a one bedroom apartment. Nice enough room with right bed configuration and kitchen BUT the noise from the main road (Kuhio Ave) kept us awake every night. It didn't help that the doors didn't seal properly so sounded as though they were open nor the old aircon that rattled and rasped to the point we turned it off. Its a shame as they seemed to be doing everything else right.

A good but VERY budget option. Small rooms but very neat and clean. Full size fridge and cooking facilities in one bedroom rooms. Hallways and lift a bit dated and worn, pool area is quite pretty. Staff are great. Area is in the heart of Waikiki. If you are on a budget go here - if not - spend a little more for the facilities and feel of a beach front hotel. Parking is $20. If they at full you have to park next door which is a little dodgy.

We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights over Christmas and NewYear 2012/2013.We had 2 adults and 2 teenagers in our party so the one bedroom apartment was perfect for our needs with a separate bedroom for parents and 2 single beds for kids in the main room.kitchen was handy with full fridge,oven and microwave,although very basic and limited crockery and equipment.All staff were obliging,friendly and all requests handled quickly.free beach towels and chairs a nice touch as well as unlimited crunchy apples,cold filtered water and free coffee in foyer.The hotel is handy to beach,supermarket and bus and shuttle runs along the street.Only drawback is the street noise as all the one bedroom apartments are situated on street side of Kuhio ave which is a main traffic thoroughfare with a bus stop across the road.just take ear plugs and you will be fine.Would definitely stay here again,special thanks to Greg who always had a huge smile and jumped to open door for us when we came home laden with shopping bags.maholo

The experience we recieved at this hotel can not compare. I work in Customer Service and I was so impressed with how all of the employees of this hotel went above and beyond. I took my 2 aunts to Hawaii for the first time and probably their only. Thank you for making it more than perfect. I came to visit the hotel ahead of time to make sure it was what we were looking for. On arrival, I asked the front desk if anything had changed as it didn't look like the room I had seen. I had been shown a larger room and that is the one I thought I had reserved. I assumed it was my error and thanked the desk, so happy to be on holidays it didn't matter. The following morning while walking in lobby the Gentleman at the desk (I believe his name was Dan - works nights) advised me they had another room for us. I told him we were ok and no need to fuss but he insisted. Once he gave us the keys and we arrived in our new room we were so touched. It was perfect and beautiful and we couldn't have dreamed of a more beautiful room. This vacation is a once in a lifetime for my family and I could not have chosen a better hotel. Our experience with the Conceirge - Younger man was amazing! He drew us maps and gave us great meal trips and gave us coupons. The whole experience was amazing. I work in the Travel industry and I RAVE about this hotel. I have never felt like my hard earned money meant so much to a hotel. The pool is also lovely as it is smaller and less busy. Very relaxing. The location of the hotel is perfect.Thank you, Thank you. We felt like little princesses for the week! I will be back next year with my husband and I can't wait.

This was our second time staying at the Aqua Bamboo (4 weeks total now).The staff was very helpful and accommodating to our needs. The room are nice and clean (wife liked!) Felt safe & secure. Beautiful pool / hot tub. All in all great value. We booked a packed with Expedia and saved even more $$$. In today's economy it's important with a family of five, and helped to make it affordable. Thanks Aqua Bamboo!
user_name:
Peter N
Bolingbrook, Illinois, United States

review_body: The staff were wonderful, especially Dan the night manager. It had taken us 24 hours to get there from London and we were tired. We had a free upgrade and what a beautful room, it was like an apartment.The rooms are well decorated, and the facilites in the room were excellent, clean and quite new.The pool is small but just right as are the relaxing places to sit in the shade. Its in a perfect location and all staff were friendly helpful and really welcoming.We want to go bak!!Mahalo for making our first visit to Hawaii a wonderful experince.

A fantastic little hotel, rooms are clean and cosy, the kitchenette is a welcome addition.No kettle though, which i thought was strange. Bathroom, while not luxurious, is quite adequate, always kept clean, lots of fresh towels daily.Lovely little pool, cold and hot water available in the lobby, although free coffee was pretty awful (but then again, we in Australia are spoilt for choice there). Beach towels and chairs are available for free.The location is fantastic, 3 minutes walk to the beach. The only one thing I had an issue with was free wifi internet... which is supposed to be available in the lobby and by the poolside only. While the reception seemed fine, i was only able to connect occasionally. The staff had to constantly reboot the router in order for me to do so. We had 3 different devices between the two of us, and it was happening on all of them. Other customers had issues also.Come on guys, in this day and age, wifi internet should be available in all the rooms. I would be happy to pay a small additional fee for that, as long as it was reliable. As someone who visits Hawaii at least once a year, I need internet to connect to my family and friends back home in Oz. International roaming is still expensive, so internet is not luxury really. I know there is an ethernet cable in the rooms, but who is travelling with their laptops these days? Phones and tablets are everywhere, so wifi is a necessity.Please fix this, and I will be back in a heartbeat!

Spent twelve days here over christmas, when we checked in we were upgraded to third floor room 310 overlooking the pool. Room was big two beds,seperate kitchen,bathroom and three balconies. We got to enjoy free wi-fi and fresh lemonade while hanging out by the pool. It is a smaller boutique hotel which I much prefer and only a five min walk to beach and restaurants. The staff here are very special and what make this hotel a real gem to visit, Nicole,Fe,Zennie and Raymond. Mahalo for making our holiday beautiful memories we will be back

For our 40th anniversary we were privileged and excited to take a trip to Hawaii since our last vacation was for our 25th. We were looking for a good hotel hopefully with some character, at a reasonable price. The Bamboo seemed to fit the bill. The staff was very helpful in answering our questions when we were making reservations. We had read some reviews about problems on certain floors but great reviews on others. We requested the recommended floors and prayed we would get a good assignment as nothing comes with a guarantee. We arrived late and exhausted to find a friendly staff awaiting us. We were delighted at the quaint character of the hotel. Our corner room on the 10th floor, was clean and inviting with a great view, the little kitchen nook was perfect! We loved it !! We were very thankful to be blessed with these serene surroundings and hope to visit again some day. If you choose to stay at the Bamboo make sure to visit our favorite hangout, the 'Hawaiian Crown Plantation' just down the street for the sweetest pineapples ever!

With so many hotels in Honolulu, I was a little overwhelmed. I didn't want a big chain hotel right on the beach. This was the perfect place for us! It was smaller and only a few blocks away from the beach. We were on the 3rd floor overlooking the pool. The room was big, clean, and quiet. We loved the full kitchen and enjoyed breakfasts on the balcony. The free beach towels and chairs were very nice. Parking is limited, but with valet service it wasn't a problem.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo before and after a cruise, for a total of 5 nights. For the first stay we were upgraded from a standard room to one with a small kitchen, two balconies and a peek-a-boo view of the ocean. The room was quite small, with a queen bed and futon taking up a fair amount of space.The second stay we had a regular room, with a great view towards the ocean, though a huge patio door which was quite dirty and did not open even though there was a railing. The balcony that we had access to had a view into the apartments of the building directly in front.The pool area is wonderful for relaxing after touring around. Internet access is free, but only available in the pool and lobby areas - Aqua Please consider providing access in the rooms which would be more convenient.

Stayed here for one night before renting a condo in the same area. Overall, pretty good choice. Would I stay here again- depends on the pricing and location of our room.We were assigned room on 2nd floor - facing the next door property - no view at all and really the room was very dark. So for one night OK< but for a week - I don't think so.The staff was great and very friendly. The pool/spa area is very nice and we enjoyed that. I think it is open until 10pm.Location is great. Easy walk to everywhere - just 2 blocks to the Duke's beach and the statute of King K. Nice!Room has some great amenities such as a full stove top and fridge, micro,sink, etc. Apparently this is a condo hotel where units are owned indivudally so may be some variance, not sure. We had 2 double beds, instead of a queen, but they were OK. Some upgrades in the room, but a bit "cheap" on the re-do. All in all, certainly OK, but again, just for one night, so no complaints.Price and staff were great. Place was clean. ON the 2nd floor you c ertainly heard some street noise in the morning.

The hotel was centrally located. I liked being in a clean boutique hotel which had all required amenities. The hotel was serviced daily, and we had a double room with a kitchenette so we could do basic breakfasts with toast, microwave, and store items in fridge. The beds were comfortable The WiFi did not work efficiently for my friend's use. We had a hotel that overlooked the courtyard and pool. I used the hot tub. We had the air conditioning on at night or it would have been a bit noisy.

We had no idea what this hotel would be like but from the moment we arrived we were greeted and welcomed as if we had been coming here for years. We were in Hawaii for our sons retirement after 30 years in the Navy and also our anniversary. The hotel is very clean and well kept. The pool area is a calm serene place to relax. Any thing that we asked for and about they had the ability to find us when we got lost and made sure that our car was right there at all times since we have a handicap .I really wish we were still there . Our small town has been hit by a very sad shooting the day after we arrived home. Some of the teachers we know were killed and the beautiful children who lost their lives. So I really wish that we were back in Hawaii. We will return to this special hotel that made us feel like family.

The location of the hotel is very good when staying in Waikiki. The beach is just a 3 min walk away and is the part where you will find the famous Duke statue and where free music performance and hula dance take place. On of the best and largest supermarkets in the area is just a few hundred meters away and a bus stop is just across the street. The hotel is well managed, well maintained and cleaned to a good standard. The rooms are good sized with most amenities you would need (fridge, micro oven, safe, aircon, iron, balcony etc.). Staff is very helpful and you get really good value for your dollar in comparison with other hotels in the area. Had two stays here for a total of 3 weeks during, why I have a good knowledge of the hotel and the area. Beds are comfortable and the pool area including furniture and plants is kept very clean and in good order. The area feels very safe and every attraction, restaurant and shop is within walking distance.

The Aqua Bamboo hotel is centrally located in Waikiki. It is a small hotel and offers many amenities. The rooms are small but clean. Each room has a small fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. Plates, cups, and utensils are also included. I used the island grocery delivery service to preorder grocery items so that they were stocked and waiting for me upon my arrival. The hotel also offers free internet, which is a plus. The pool area is small and has a hot tub. There are lounge chairs and tables to enjoy the warm island air.

We chose this hotel based upon Tripadvisor reviews. It turned out to be a great choice as we loved this hotel. The location is perfect, right in the center of Waikiki, but off the main strip in a quieter area.Our room was great. It was on a high floor, facing the pool area. We had a great view of the ocean from our balcony. We would sit there everyday and watch the sun set with a glass of wine.The pool area is a tropical oasis in the center of Waikiki. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. This hotel is a fantastic value for the money.Would definitely stay here again!

Booked a room at the Aqua Bamboo based on Tripadvisor reviews for 1 night prior to boarding a cruise ship. Upon check-in, was surprised and pleased to be upgraded to a suite. Front desk was friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Hotel is convenient to the beach. Our only complaint is that the room was on the front of the hotel, and there is a lot of road noise as the hotel fronts a busy street.

I have stayed at the Bamboo twice and will definitely go back! It's the perfect home-base. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. The pool area is a little oasis of serenity. The rooms are very comfortable with useful little extras, like: big dressers, safes, iron/board, and kitchenettes which make life that much easier. A trend that is continued throughout the hotel! It seems like the rooms vary a bit, or perhaps they changed between my two visits. I have been happy both times, but I see where another review says they will happily move you if you don't love your room. Pretty cool. As with the rooms, it's all the little extras that make this hotel the best base. I love the fresh lemonade or fresh fruit iced tea and the iced lemon water that are provided daily. It is perfect to fill the water bottle with before heading off for a fun day in the sand and sun! But that's just the beginning of the connivence... they also supply fresh beach towels at the front desk, along with beach chairs or bamboo mats, and even floaty toys for the kids, ...all the stuff you don't want to weigh your suitcase down with, but really need once you get there! Oh, and the poolside "happy hour" on Thursday evening really topped off the whole hospitality feeling nicely! They had complimentary snacks and mai tai drinks, accompanied by ukulele music, plus short sample massages from the spa staff! Yes, please and thank you!!! ...and just like that I was in a vacation paradise. :-)
user_name:
Randi S
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights the week of Thanksgiving. Loved the kitchen.The front desk was always helpful. They provide towels and beach chairs at no charge! Parking is $25 a day but in and out access is a breeze. There is a large bowl of apples right by the elevator along with complimentary lemonade and lemon water. Everything is in walking distance. If you are looking for a tropical stay this is not it. It is a great hotel for those that want a comfortable base. Can't say enough about the staff. Friendly and helpful.

I have stayed here numerous times and it's a great place! Small and boutique. The rooms vary! You can always switch- every stay has had a different lay out! Some rooms facing street is loud over pool is better. I love this place- staff is always friendly and accomodating!! If you don't like your room they will change if available. I love the pool area and relaxing surrounding! Great location don't need a car! Beds are comfortable- Everything is in walking distance. Safe in all rooms- staff is just great! Manager's reception on Thur 4:30- entertainment- snacks, free mai tai's in pool area. Nice and cozy!! Will always stay here-

This hotel has the little touches that make a big difference. We stayed for two nights Nov. 3-5th, 2012. We had requested a room overlooking the pool ( quieter that way ) and upon check in they told us we would be upgraded to their studio. This unit has dishes, fridge, stove top. Very nice! They give pool towels at the front desk, but the best part is they also have beach chairs, water toys, and I even say surf boards, that you can borrow, and return to take to the beach. Very nice touch. In the lobby, they also have water, and iced tea or lemoade available all day. The only complaint is there is no wireless in the rooms, but you can take your laptop to the lobby, and there is wireless there. All in all, an old hotel that has been updated, and also has a safe in the room, where you put in your own passcode. Would have no problem staying here again. One block from Waikiki Beach!

My family have travelled numerous times to Honolulu, having stayed at all the 5* hotels (I am an oz travel agent). Without a doubt, the AQUA BAMBOO & SPA is the best little oasis in Honolulu.The staff, from the front desk (Zenie and Nicole) to the cleaners/room service, there was always a smile and friendly face. Nothing was a problem for any request we had (exrtra towels, more coffee packs). The rooms are all a good size, comfortable and the kitchen is a real bonus for those that wish to having a toast and vegie, instant noodles or cooking a meal.The pool area is the Oasis, cool, shady trees, plenty of lounges and chairs and the BBQ, well, everyone loves a BBQ don't they?I am already organising next years 2013 return (it will be our 9th time at AQUA BAMBOO).If you are thinking of travelling to Honolulu, either as a couple or with a family, there is only one place to stay, AQUA BAMBOO & SPA.

I booked this hotel on the sole basis of previous reviews and price - I was not disappointed!! This is a great little hotel with a heart - the heart being the staff!! The staff really are the key here - helpful, genuine, willing to go that extra mile and with great recommendations!! I was sorry i didnt take more care to remember their names. If you have the opportunity to go to the Managers Reception - Go!! Its a lovely way to connect with the staff and enjoy some nice entertainment and a tasty wee cocktail. The hotel itself has a great location, minutes walk to Waikiki beach, shops, restaurants and the bus stop is right across the road. One of my fav aspects was that the hotel provided beach towels so no need to buy and fresh filtered water/coffee/tea in reception. Our room was great - maybe in need of an upgrade although the furniture appears alot newer than the room itself - bed was very comfy, basic kitchen with everything we needed - for the money it was more than what I expected - the only down side was the view, which was an apartment block with very colourful inhabitants literally 3 meters from our balcony - they weren't noisy just very colourful :) If you're planning a trip to Diamond Head using the bus you maybe lucky to get an offer you can't refuse from a taxi driver or shuttle van driver :) Check hotel website for deals before booking - I saved $100 doing just that!

We stayed here Nov.2-10 and absolutely love the Bamboo! It was our second time staying here and we will be back whenever we return to Waikiki! It is steps away from beaches and restaraunts. The rooms are comfortable and perfect. We stayed in a Kitchenette suite (room 810) and saved alot of money making breakfast and lunch and some dinners in our room. You can't beat having the Food Pantry a few blocks away and the fresh fish they have! The Aqua Bamboo is clean, the staff are friendly, and the pool sanctaury area is awesome. Also a nice touch is the lemon water and iced tea in the lobby at all times. The only thing I wish was that the rooms offered a full coffee maker to enjoy the fine Kona Coffee! They have those single server pod coffee makers. We ended up going to Don Quijote and purchasing one for 19.99 and just left it in the room for the next guest. So it was fine. Anyway, I highly recommend this hotel, it is a gem in busy Waikiki!! Mahalo to the staff for making our stay awesome!!

I used to be a travel agent and have seen many Hotels/Condos in Waikiki.This one is very clean w/ large rooms. We love the fact that we can walk anywhere.We just happened to stumble on this property by staying somewhere else that didn't have a pool The Bamboo let us use theirs and then the next time we traveled we stayed there.The pool gets shaded in the afternoon by the trees but that works out really well because you are usually at the beach all day and need a break from the sun.They have tea and a small breakfast in the lobby every morning.We had a complimentary massage and drinks in the lobby one night.What a fun place.....you will not find another as nice for the priceI've always felt very relaxed and welcomed at this place. Never crowded.

This is a good hotel in the middle of busy waikiki. Loved the boutique feel and the pool area. An oasis of tranquility, yet you could walk almost anywhere. We stayed 16 nights. We travel to Hawaii every year and usually stay at the five star hotels. While this is not a 5 star hotel, there were lots of little extras to make up for that. The staff was very friendly, beach chairs, rafts, and towels were provided, coffee, water, and lemonade in the lobby were a nice treat. Thursday night manager cocktail reception with live music was also a nice treat. Very clean everywhere! If there was any problem, it was corrected immediately. The only negative thing I have to say is that the pool was freezing which was odd. When I asked about this I was told that the pool does not get enough hours of sunlight. I would imagine this to be less of an issue in the summer. The other issue which was really the most important has to do with a foul odor in the room which came and went. In all fairness to the Aqua Bamboo, the sewage problem is a city problem and something that is being worked on in several locations. During our stay, several areas near the hotel were having new pipes installed under the sidewalk. Therefore, this may have been a problem for us due to the location of our room. I would stay at the Aqua Bamboo again.

This is a good hotel in the heart of Waikiki, just a couple of blocks from the beach. A couple of minutes walk and you're on the beautiful Waikiki beach. We stayed here for two separate nights before and after a cruise. Both rooms we had were great. They were very big with a king size bed, good bathrooms, kitchen and sitting areas. The beds were quite soft though. The staff were great and helped in any way they could. I recommend this hotel and if we return to Hawaii we would definitely stay here.

Great Hotel.  I was staying for 5 nights in this hotel on part of my Honeymoon. When we got there, our room had two double beds so we went down and explained that we were on our Honeymoon, the lady was very nice and said she'll move stuff about and get us a room with just a king size bed in it. It only took them about 20 mins. When we got in our the new room, they had left champagne chocolates and put fresh flowers all out for us a round the room, which was very nice of them. We also had a good view from the room.It doesn't hurt to ask :-) The Hotel was very clean, and all the staff in this hotel were very nice and friendly with us. Booking trips was really easy in this hotel as well. We didn't feel pressured or rushed into anything. They were also good at letting us know which place's are really nice to eat at, for a quick snack to a sit down meal.  The location of the Aqua Bamboo is great as well. 5 mins from the beach if that. Shops and Restaurants around the corner, and the bus stop just across the road, which is very handy. The Pool Area is very nice too, with a nice lay out, and very well done. The Aqua Bamboo is a very nice, friendly, cheap place to stay for Hawaii, and in a great location. It may not be on the beach but, for a cheap nice friendly Vacation to visit Waikiki in Hawaii, i would say stay here.

Lovely hotel. Rooms are spacious with small kitchenette. Very Clean. Staff very helpful.One Block back from beach. As friend booked this hotel I was initially disapointed we where not staying beachside but after spending five days here I was very happy.Close to everything in Waikiki. Would definately stay there again.

I basically wanted a decent place to sleep and shower and be a base for tourism, rather than somewhere to hang out extensively. The Aqua Bamboo's just fine for that. It's got a bit of a mediocre air -- narrow corridors, some fixtures kinda careworn -- but everything worked and the staff were pleasant. Bed nicely firm but not stiff. The housekeeping staff did a great job on my room even though I'm a terrible slob. The AC was way loud, so I just let it run during the day and the room was then cooled off enough to last me through the night. My room faced the busy street, but the noise didn't seem all that bad. Most of the city bus routes a tourist might want to take stop within a block.

There are a number of great things about this hotel. First and foremost, the location. Dining, shopping, the beach, and the heart of Waikiki are all in easy walking distance. The bus stop was right across the street, too. Staff members we encountered were nice and helpful. The room was clean, our small kitchenette was nice to have, with a mini refrigerator to store leftovers. There were refreshments and fresh fruit available in the lobby lounge area. This was nice to grab after a day at the beach or on the way out to a hike.I had a couple questions prior to our arrival. I emailed the guest services manager, who responded quickly, kindly, and with care that I received the information I was looking for. This was very appreciated. We were there during the tsunami scare and we felt that the staff handled it professionally. They called our room to be sure we were aware of the situation and to let us know where we could get help or answers to any questions. On the other hand, the air conditioner was insanely loud. We had to raise the tv volume up loud enough to hear over the a/c, and we were concerned about disturbing our neighbors. It was even louder if you went to sit on the lanai. We had to keep the a/c going most of the time because the room was incredibly humid. The room appeared a little banged up in places. The somewhat tight quarters and the design of the bed legs left us both stubbing our toes repeatedly!What I felt was needed more than anything was some kind of fan in the bathroom. There appeared to be mold spots on the ceiling (I'm assuming that's what it was?) Clearing out steam after a shower took forever. Towels wouldn't dry, let alone things from the beach. Speaking of which, a clothesline in the shower would have also been very helpful. The room smelled a bit like a musty basement. Even understanding the proximity to the beach and island climate, it was just a bit much sometimes. It was nice to have a private lanai, though people kept smoking on theirs (I thought this was illegal?), which would waft into our room. We could see the city and mountains in the distance, but mostly our view was the rooftop of the building next door. We were able to pay to extend our stay later in the day since our return flight was not until later in the evening. This was very helpful. We were not able to get an answer about whether or not this was a possibility until the day of, which was a bit inconvenient. Hard to plan ahead without knowing if we had to check out in the morning or could stay most of the day. We were able to book this ahead of time at the Ilikai. Reading other recent reviews during the same dates as our stay, it sounds like other people got some nice automatic upgrades and anniversary perks. We saw that the person who took our reservation had made a note of our anniversary. The gentleman who checked us in only noticed it at the last minute and mentioned "Happy Anniversary". No upgrades or anything or champagne like others received (maybe they paid for it? no idea.). Not that we expected it, but having read other reviews, now I'm kinda bummed! We've had good experience with Aqua and the nice people they employ. Again, the location was wonderful. I just doubt we would go for this hotel again. We preferred our previous stay at the Aqua Ilikai.

Stayed here with my husband for a short spur of the moment visit to Oahu.
