After diligently searching all sorts of travel search engines and seeing Aqua Bamboo come up in every search, we decided to give it a try. Great value for price. We immediately received an upgraded suite upon our arrival. Contemporary with an "old school" Hawaiian flare, Spacious suite with kitchenette, bathroom with separate shower and tub, large sitting area with large windows and TV. The King size bed was comfy with tons of cloud like pillows, the bed was also "sectioned" off from the sitting area, for privacy if traveling with a group. This opened up to a small balcony looking at the city. Front desk was friendly. The only downside was that parking was full and had to park at a garage in the next building. I really loved the free beach towels, you get a rental card for the towel, just turn in your dirty towel and get another rental card until you end your visit. There's also free beach gear..pretty cool =)The back side of the hotel was super cute, great pool, cool looking lanai's. We didn't take advantage of the free activities that the hotel provided but there is a long list, early AM beach yoga, breakfast buffet, etc. It was conveniently located about a block and a half from the main strip in Waikiki, super close to eateries and shopping. It was a comfortable stay at Aqua Bamboo especially if you're looking to travel on a budget and want a comfy place to sleep at night.

Good location for a first time visit to Oahu. We had a very short walk to the beach. Don't forget to ask to borrow beach toys & chairs. Off site parking was at first confusing. Staff was mostly friendly. Nice but small pool. Kitchenette in the room was a convenience.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for our first visit to Waikiki. This is a great hotel. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are very modern. We were upgraded to a bigger room with a pool view- Thank You!!! I love the pool area- very clean and quiet and I felt I was in an oasis. For a small hotel there is a lot of staff and they kept it immaculate. The location is excellent and only about 5 minute walk to the beach. It's in central Waikiki so everything is in walking distance. Free Wi-FI in common areas and free coffee and ice tea in the lobby. I would definitely come back to the Bamboo for my next visit. Thank You.

My Partner booked this hotel for our five days stay in Oahu. I wasn't too sure what to expect and after a 22 hour journey to Hawaii I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. As soon as we arrived the hotel staff were more than friendly, they were very informative and took time out to assist us. Our room was very clean. After we checked into our room, i realised that my best friend had been in contact with the hotel and informed them that we were on our anniversary, it was evident that we were upgraded and we were provided with a bottle of champagne and some chocolates. I thought this was a lovely touch and I was overwhelmed...thank you. My only gripe with the hotel is that it would be great to have some ventilation in the bathroom. The hotel itself is in a great location, it's in walking distance to everything in waikiki. The hotel have nice touches like providing beach towels. They also have complimentary ice tea or lemon water which is so refreshing after being in the gruelling heat outside. For the price we paid for the hotel, we cannot complain.I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you want a lovely hotel and are on a budget.

I stayed here for 13 nights with my wife and two small children (3 years, 5 months) in early October. I am not in the habit of writing negative or critical reviews, but in the end we had more issues with Aqua Bamboo than we’d like. We were also considering the Outrigger Launa (similar price and amenities) and we would try that next time.Price: We booked via Expedia and paid ~$280/night for the hotel (1 Bedroom + Full Kitchen) and a full size rental car. Before we arrived – Crib Request: I emailed the hotel a week prior to our arrival to request a crib be put in our room before we get there, as we would be arriving late. They responded promptly letting me know it wouldn’t be an issue, and reminding me of the $30/day charge. I was floored - cribs have been offered for free in every other hotel we have ever stayed at! I checked their website and Expedia, and the charge is listed, so they weren’t making it up. I called them, and (very politely) enquired about the fee - surely it must be $30/stay, not $30/day - that would be well over $400. When told it was in fact $30/day, I asked if they thought that was reasonable. "Well, that's what we charge..." I asked to speak with a manager, who was not available at the time, so we arranged to have one call me back. Nicole called me two days later and offered to charge me $15/day, and when I protested she offered to waive the charge. I am glad she called me back and took care of it, but it was a hassle as I started looking into alternatives such as taking or buying a Pack N Play. Wait until you see the picture of the crib…Check In: We arrived around 11pm after a long flight and short (20 min) drive from the Airport. I was disappointed to find out I couldn’t park at the Aqua for the first two nights of our stay, and that I would have to park next door at the Pacific Monarch – the price is the same ($20/day) but they apparently are very strict and required me to sign a waver. Strange. Anyway, we were given room 504 and I was surprised to find it was 1-Bedroom with Kitchenette vs. the Full Kitchen week had booked. I went downstairs to ask to be moved into the type of room we had booked, and the woman at the front desk didn’t know that our room did not have a Full Kitchen - she even asked me if I looked everywhere for it (the room is only ~600 sq ft large). She did not want to reassign me because she wasn’t sure which rooms have Full Kitchens, and then she decided they were all occupied, so I would have to be moved the next day. I expressed my disappointment that they did not have the room I had booked months ago ready, and let them know that being moved the next day would be a major inconvenience given we had two small children with us and a tonne of luggage. I also let them know that I planned to grocery shop for our two week stay the next morning and that not having the full size fridge available would be a problem. They tried to blame the problem on Expedia (they mess up room types) and then on me (I should have booked directly with the hotel.) I told them that this was getting off on the wrong foot, I parked in the garage next door, which ended up being a four-story walk-up (no elevator!) and went back to the room annoyed, to find my wife and the kids in a room booked for four that only had towels and bedding for two. I called the front desk and additional linen quickly arrived, along with the promise to move us to a room on the 8th Floor the next day. The next day we got up and went shopping, and were allowed to put our groceries in the refrigerator in the new room (807) while it was being cleaned. By 4pm the next day we were finally situated. Not a great start. Location: The location is great on Kuhio Ave, just two blocks from the beach. Lots of places to eat nearby, as well as a Food Pantry store. The International Marketplace is just a couple of blocks away, as well as all of the shopping and action on Kalahaua. Coffee: Both the coffee in the room, and the coffee available in the lobby, was weak and terrible. They didn’t have a normal coffee maker in our room (it was a single serve one that takes packets instead) so we couldn’t buy coffee and make our own. Strange, as we had heard coffee is Hawaii is great. Parking: $20/night. When we did park inside we found a very small (very old) garage with room for around a dozen cars. It’s really tight down there; we had a full size car and had to be careful parking. I would contact the hotel in advance if you require parking during your stay. Room: Our room was as expected given the photos available on Trip Advisor. We had two twin beds in the main living area with a flat screen TV, office table and chair, and small breakfast table with chairs for two. There was a full size stove and fridge, microwave, single use coffee maker, and stocked kitchen. We had to request wine glasses and a cork screw from the front desk. The bathroom and bedroom had everything you would expect, as well as a safe in the closet big enough for a laptop. There was only 1 dresser for the four of us, so we had to request additional clothing hangars from the front desk as only 5 were provided. Our room was north facing on Kuhio so we did have some traffic noise (especially the bus) which was somewhat offset by the very loud air conditioners in each room. Although we had sliding glass doors to get outside, the balcony was very small and had no furniture. Internet: Wireless in the lobby and pool area, but wired in the room. I knew this in advance and was prepared, but could see it being a hassle for those traveling with ipads. I even found being wired to be inconvenient after the first couple days. Sanctuary / Pool Area: This is the best part of the hotel. A nice-sized salt water pool (no chlorine smell) and small 4 person hot tub, in a well shaded area with palm trees and other plants. There are lots of loungers and a few day beds, as well as tables for people who bring food and drinks. There is a BBQ Grill for guest use, as well as a sink. Bathrooms on the pool deck are always locked, presumably for security reasons, but running to the front desk to get the key for my toddler every 20 minutes wasn’t fun. Manager’s Reception: We attended the first Thursday and had a few Bamboozles and some snacks. The music was nice, and it was the busiest the pool area was our whole stay. It was a fun thing to do before heading out to watch the sunset and have dinner. Beach Stuff: They provide cards for beach towels available at the front desk (lost cards = $15). They also have lightweight beach chairs and boogie boards/floating toys for people to take to the beach. Smoking: The hotel is non-smoking (most are in Waikiki), and they require you to sign a contract on check in that says there is a $350 cleaning charge if you smoke. Unfortunately the guy in the room next to us for ~5 days either didn’t care, and was heavily smoking marijuana at all hours in his room or on his balcony. The smell was so strong it was like someone was smoking in our room. We complained each time we could smell it (4 or 5 times) and they didn’t really do anything about it. They told us he had been charged the cleaning fee twice, and the last time we complained they offered to move us to a different room. I flatly declined the offer as we were not the ones breaking the rules (and law) and that moving would be a major issue given the amount of stuff we had unpacked. They called the room later saying they had threatened to call the police if he did it again. Service: Overall the service just wasn’t great. I sent a case of beer to my parent’s room before they checked in, and asked that it be put in their fridge so it would be cold when they arrived. They found the case sitting on the floor in front of their fridge, and had to go to the store for cold beer. On another occasion I dropped my credit card in the elevator and it fell down the shaft. I alerted the front desk and they told me to cancel the card as it cost $350/hour to have the elevator technician come and retrieve it. I tried again the next day (it was a different lady) and she had the card for us no problem an hour later. Strange. Check Out: I requested late check out at 4pm (our flight was not until 6:30pm) and was told I could only stay until 2pm, although there was no extra change. When I did check out it was quick and easy, the only charges were for parking ($20/day for 11 nights.)

We returned to the Aqua Bamboo for a quick overnight visit to Oahu and found the whole experience WONDERFUL. From the moment we checked in to the check out the next morning all expectations were met. The front desk and valet staff are exceptional. My wife and I do a lot of traveling and the service is equal to that of five star resorts. I especially enjoyed the complementary coffee iced tea and lemon water, very refreshing after a long walk around Waikiki. The location of this hotel is perfect for shopping the beach and dining. My final comment on this property is the cost. The old saying that you get what you pay for does not apply to this property, you get a whole lot more. This is a great hotel with reasonable rates.
user_name:
Randy D
Wailuku, Hawaii, United States

review_body: This was our main stay in waikiki and we found it to be a great option. Clean room with good air con and decent size bathroom. Staff were very helpful and there is free wi-fi in the lobby.Only extra comment would be that Lonely Planet states that the aqua hotels include breakfast in the price - according to the staff they stopped doing this in 2010.

I needed a trip on the cheap. I opted for the least expensive hotel that would accommodate 3 to a room (I had options on Orbitz). I was a little worried of what we'd find. Upon arrival we were immediately relieved. It's a very nice looking hotel from the exterior, the staff in the lobby were very friendly, quick and helpful. So nice to have the lemon water and lemonade offered all day. The room was actually spacious, comfortable and clean. Only downside was the noise from traffic, although it didn't keep me up after the first night. The pool area is lovely, everything is walking distance. I would not rent a car for the entire trip next time. I would take a shuttle in and rent for the day if we opted to cruise the Island. The Bamboo is a great value! Very pleasantly surprised!

Stayed here for 5 days in October and loved every minute. The room was terrific, the staff was welcoming and helpful. The price was certainly right. You could pay much more and be right on the beach but Aqua Bamboo is just a few minutes from anywhere in Waikiki, and when you're in your room, you'll feel like you've got it all :) I did miss the continental breakfast -, not because it saved me a lot on breakfast, but because the breakfast brought the other guests together and created that sense of community that I appreciated on previous stays at Bamboo. Mind you - there's still the Thursday managers reception to bring guests together. I can't tell you how much I loved our stay there and I would rebook in a heartbeat !

From the moment u arrive fe n Raymond the hotel agents greet u w cold towel n lemonade. The staff is wonderful n informative. The room is clean n comfortable n kitchen is useful. The pool area make u feel like u are not in a Hotel n there is no traffic noise from room 301. A couple blocks from wakaki beach n tons of restaurants off kuhio. Starbucks is two blocks away. The parking is tight but I believe all hotel parking is tight. $20 a day is industy standard so I was ok w it. No hidden charges or fees. I would come back here n have all my friends stay here. Only 150 a night greet value. Also had a grill which I made food here. N the evening staff was great also sorry forgot ur names. But the place to stayRobert hRivieria casino n hotel

My husband and I spent 4 nights in Waikiki during our honeymoon and selected the Aqua Bamboo because of its good rating on tripadvisor and because it was recommended in the Lonely Planet guide. We were impressed with the common areas (lobby, pool) and the friendly service, but the room itself (studio kitchenette) was average. The "city view" was really the view of an alley, so having a balcony wasn't a enjoyable feature. The bathroom faucet was way too big for the sink (it looked like a kitchen faucet) and the water pressure wasn't set correctly so water sprayed everywhere when you turned it on. Overall it was a great deal for the price, but we might save up for nicer accommodations next time.

We loved this hotel and we got more than we were expecting having stayed in Waikiki three times previously. We just booked a basic room, most rooms in Waikiki are small - but this one was the best we have ever had. The staff were so lovely and helpful. Fresh cold water in reception, plus tea and coffee all free of charge ($1 extra if you wanted a special coffee), newspapers and apples....Free use of beach mats, towels and chairs or a lovely pool to lounge by if the beach was too hot. Loads of storeage room in the bathroom and bedroom for cases. This hotel really helped me enjoy my stay in Waikiki and we are definitely going to book next time we go back - thank you so much to all the team.

Short walk to Waikiki, grocery store across the street, excellent customer service! Our room was good sized with 2 beds, Kitchennette and 3 balconies. Only complaint was the AC is loud, but it did drown out the noise of the city and worked well. The BBQ by the pool was a bonus to help us eat healthier and on a budget. They had beach chairs and floaties to borrow. Coffee, tea, lemon water and iced tea or lemonade was always available. I'd happily stay there again.

Convently located close to Waikiki beach. 5 minute stroll to shops and beach. Extremely helpful and friendly staff - nothing too much trouble! Nice lagoon type pool with loungers conveniently placed.During our stay of one week one family with three young girls checked out to continue their holiday at another hotel. Within two days they had returned telling us that the Aqua Bamboo was so good that they just had to spend the rest of their holiday at the Aqua Bamboo!!!On our anniversary the hotel staff left us chocolates, orchids and a small bottle of champagne on a try in our room,with compliments from the Aqua Hotel. Queen bed very comfortable and the room was spotless.

Stayed there for a couple of days the hotel is conveniently located in Waikiki it has a nice swimming pool. Every thursday from 4;30 to 5:30 it as a free pool party for its guests. The staff was very helpful and friendly

This hotel was in a great location with a very friendly staff. From the General Manager to the valets, all were helpful with the aloha spirit. It was so close to Waikiki, just a few minutes walk. I am definitely staying here again.
user_name:
Neill C
Phoenix, Oregon, United States

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed there during our visit in July. Wasn't sure what to expect because I had seen a couple mixed reviews. I have to say, this place was great! We arrived in late and they were super friendly and accommodating. The first night we went to our room and had a couple concerns. we had got one of the older, pre-renovation rooms and had a few issues. I can see where some of the bad reviews about not liking the room came from. If you got one of those rooms, I could understand as there was a lot of the issues people had mentioned in other reviews. The next morning we complained at the front desk and they were extremely helpful and accommodating. They resolved the problem and provided us with a newly renovated deluxe room instead! We were so happy! Just as a note, i believe there are renovating all the rooms, so if you going now you might be ok. Our new room, was amazing! Overlooked the pool and everything. We could even get a hint of the lobby wifi. The location was great. Within a short walking distance of Waikiki beach and all the shops and restaurants. The front staff were knowledgeable in the area and helped us arrange transportation to the airport for our island hopping and some activities we planned. I really liked this was a smaller boutique hotel because it felt more cozy and you could tell they spent the extra care with their guests. Things like always having lemonade or water available in the lobby to always be greeted with a "good morning" or asking about your day, goes the extra mile. Would definitely go back!

We stayed here for a week at the end of a world trip. A stroll from the beach, the shops, the nightlife and the market. A quiet oasis within the bustle of Waikiki. It isn't 5 star, but neither is the price. What it is is clean, friendly and good value for money... We compared many of the local hotels and went home knowing we made the right decision to stay here...

My boyfriend and I spent a week here and what a great little place! Clean, great location, most helpful staff and oh that pool area! The location was great with the beach being a 5 minute walk, lots of places to eat, and right across from the bus line. We enjoyed ever minute of our time there and know you will too. This is our new Hawaiian home! Can't wait for the next time!

We booked this hotel because it is in the middle of Waikiki and offered good prices for our weeks stay. But this hotel was so much more than what we had expected.The room was beautiful and clean, great views, the staff was friendly and helpful. There was free water, tea, coffee and newspapers at the reception every day. Beach / Pool towels, fresh every day. And everything is in walking distance.We cant wait to come back and stay there again!

The hotel is close to Wakiki Beach. We stayed there for 6 nights. Friendly and helpful staff, free internet, nice pool area, however, Friday and Saturday was dominated by a family of about 35 children and adults who violated all rules of behavior without the hotel staff intervened. They had food and bottles in the pool, urinated behind the fence, respekterde not no smoking policy. It was impossible for others to use poole area, the two days they were at the hotel. The rooms were small but clean and neat. Small balcony, close to the neighboring house. Parking in public parking house near the hotel. 20 $ day

We were to Hawaii in april 2012 for a wedding. We booked three rooms and were very happy with our rooms. The staff was accommodating and helpful. We are coming back in november and booking four rooms for a family holiday. The location was good, we enjoyed the korean cafe just around the corner for a quick meal. I would recommend this hotel for familys.

We stayed in the Aqua Bamboo for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. When I was having some trouble with a tour I had booked they helped me to contact the company and gave me directions to the pick up point. There was free tea/coffee/ lemon water in the reception at all times and papers and apples in the morning. The rooms were clean, comfortable and plenty big enough for two. Having the use of large towels to take to the beach was great. It was easy to pick them up from reception and drop them in the hamper when done.The bed was comfortable and the room although at the front of the hotel was reasonably quiet. As we were not there for long we did not use the pool. It is a small pool but to be honest you have Waikkii beach and the pacific ocean a five minute walk away. There seemed to be plenty of sun loungers and tables. The hotel is far enough away from the beach area to be quiet but close enough for it not to be a problem. There are plenty of shops and resturants around the hotel, along with a food store. We bought cereal and milk, water and cold drinks from the store as we had a room with a fridge and cooking facilities. This saved us a quite a bit of money. Free wifi in the rooms would have been a bonus but was not a problem. We had a car and the parking was quite expensive but we expected that so had budgeted for it. We would happily stay at this hotel again.

Great fun atmosphere. Helpful polite staff. Not rushed or hectic. No poncy pretentious attitudes. Quick walk to the beach, >3min, and they have lots of beach/pool stuff to use free (chairs, floaty rafts and tubes). Would stay here again for sure.

Well after reading reviews I was starting to second guess myself booking at the bamboo, im glad I didnt change. Everything was very clean, everyone was super friendly, even the guests. The hotel was not "perfect" but that's not what I was expecting. When we first got there the hot tub was stuck on boiling hot, then it was normal. It got hot again later in the week but since we saw how the maintenance person fixed it we just did it ourselves (lol)The staff were extremely wonderful and helpful, in any and all questions we had. They went above and beyond to make the stay wonderful. the guest services manager was so nice and wasent "hiding away" in an office, almost everyday we saw her at least once. The only thing that wasent perfect in the room was a bit of paint peeling right above the AC (Which is kind of understandable) they were also in the process of changing out the older AC like ours. Any complaints you hear about loud AC must be from people who have never been around the "in the window" type AC, it was not any louder than mine at home. Its like a fan blowing air. I would most definitely stay at this hotel again. The guests were very nice and were just there to have a nice vacation, no one was "stuck up" like a lot of the hotels in the area. Just as an FYI there was a family that was staying at the bamboo for part of their trip and then staying at a different one for the other half, they left for the other hotel only to come back to the bamboo. All of the guests that I talked to LOVED the hotel.If your expecting the Ritz Carlton for the (proverbial) best western price, then this is not it. They are an inexpensive hotel with great amenities, great staff, great guests, great rooms, and overall really good vibe!Thanks for making our hotel awesome!

Stayed five nights at the Aqua Bamboo. We were pleasantly surprised. Clean, great location, friendly staff. Kitchenette saved us a LOT OF MONEY. I only wish they had free wifi in all their suites, and if not its own facility Aqua should strike a deal with a local gym so that their guests don't have to pay exorbitant pay per use charges. Highly recommended.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 7 nights at the end of August and from the moment we arrived we felt welcome. We had a room with a kitchenette which was a definite plus, and all of the staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms are all updated and very clean, also the bed was incredibly comfortable. The outdoor oasis area is fantastic. Great pool and hot tub and plenty of loungers and tables for all guests to enjoy. This is also where the sauna and spa is located. Walk to the beach takes 5 minutes and there are plenty of great restaurants within walking distance as well. There also a grocery store a 2 minute walk down the street and local buses stop right across the street. Overall we had a fantastic stay at the Aqua Bamboo and we can't wait to come back!!!

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in mid August 2012 for two nights. I concur with the other reviews that give high praise to the location, pool area (a little oasis) and the staff. There were 5 of us from 21 to 81 years old. We had two rooms. The staff were hugely accommodating, friendly and knowledgable. We had a missing walker for my mom after our flight, subsequently required a wheelchair and then needed the right transportation to get all of us to the cruise port. Front desk staff helped with all of this. They knew a taxi driver who had a large enough vehicle to take all of us with luggage, a wheelchair and a walker and they ordered it. Both of our rooms were updated with only the windows and a/c being a little tired. Our room was a perfect set-up for a family travelling with any age children. There was a bedroom with queen bed and then two single beds in the open area. Even with four adults plus luggage, I didn't feel cramped. A pool side room would have been great both for view and less street noise though no one in our group was bothered by the street sounds. There is a view of the ocean from the upper pool side rooms and it would have been lovely to sit on the balcony and enjoy this view.Thank you to the staff at the Aqua Bamboo for a lovely stay!!Linda

The Aqua Bamboo Waikiki took me by surprise from the moment I arrived. Walking through the door the calming smell of mint fills the lobby. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Be sure to pick up an Ethernet cable if you have your laptop with you. The rooms are basic and the kitchenette can be a little on the small side, but well stocked. The beds are comfortable, and the showers are great if you are a taller person. There is great looking grotto area where the pool is located. As well as surf boards you access to as well as a bbq. My favorite is the complimentary coffee, lemonade, and ice tea that are available daily in the lobby, as well as free wifi in the lobby.I would go back to this property.

we stayed for 10 days and found the staff and all facilities just perfect, all the staff were most helpful and nothing was to much trouble for them, Its only a 5 min. walk to the beach and local bus services are right out the front door. The lobby and pool area are spacious and well furnished and the BBQ for guests use was spotlessly clean, all in all Happy Days

Waikiki is many things.You may choose a fortress and 25 floors and towers and spend more time in the chorine infinity pool and elevators, or... stay here with a very interesting mix of friendly world visitors and thoughtful staff .and really experience the island.Walk to Diamond Head,visit the International Market.Rise early and swim the calm waters ,lots of colorful fish along the rocks,The room is serene,The surrounds are city and the noise is not unlike the ocean tides two blocks away ,ebb and surge.I enjoyed the tranquil rock waterfall by the pool,beautiful service of iced beverages and coffee in a wonderful comfy lobby area.Nice room safe for my laptop and phone while i solo visit the waterworld.Great for a solo traveler ,bus is across the street to everywhere ,and several great food markets as well as take outs on Kuhio.Visitors are so outgoing in this place,I talked with wonderful people from several countries and all ages and it is because this place has ...yep,aloha....

When we first arrived, we had quite high expectations from the initial reviews on Trip Advisor, particularly as we were on our honeymoon and had heard so much about the 'Aloha service'. I have to say that we were disappointed, nothing was done for us to make us feel special despite other reviews on here!The receptionist was a little frosty and we didn't feel overly welcome to begin with. We were a bit disappointed with our room, which I think was 1212. It was small, the bathroom tap didn't work properly and the air con was very loud. We asked for an upgrade the following day and paid for the privilege. We moved to room 810 which was much better. We overlooked the swimming pool and were much happier and were given a reduced rate by the manager who was quite professional. The front desk were much more attentive than before and the Thursday lunchtime gathering organised at the pool was very pleasant. The hotel location is superb, only two short blocks to the beach. The facilities are good, the water in the lobby all day is a really nice touch and saves you a fortune at ABC!We were sad to leave the Aqua Bamboo in the end and would definitely stay there again as for the money, I'm not sure it can be beaten!

We stayed here for 6 nights, we had booked a standard room but where upgraded when we got there! Room was very clean and pool area and lobby nice. The staff are very friendly and happy to help with anything. The only things that was a bit of a down point was the noisy air-con and the traffic noise (we were at the front of the hotel). All in all this is a great place to stay :)
user_name:
Kristen A
Merimbula, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We rented the one bedroom suite with the kitchenette. Our room had a king sized bed in one room and a pull out futon in the other. Our kitchenette was well-equipped with a countertop two burner glass top stove. The bathroom had a huge garden size tub with a separate shower. The room was well decorated, very clean and had a fresh smell. There is also complimentary high speed internet in your room. The ethernet cable is provided in the room to connect to your laptop. We also enjoyed nice dinners on our patio overlooking the city. The city noise was not loud, so no ear plugs required. Also, if you decide not to cook dinner in your room, there are plenty of restaurants in walking distance. Hopefully, you are a sushi lover because that is the poplar dish in Honolulu. Thanks! Harbor Town Fly Fishing

I stayed at this property for four nights. Here's my experience in a nutshell....When I arrived, I was informed by the desk clerk that the hotel was out of parking spaces on-site, and I would have to park in the parking structure of the hotel next door. The price was the same, $20/night. So, after dropping my bags off in my room, I had to drive to the hotel next door, park outside in their driveway and go inside to have someone open the security gate which closes at 10 pm (guests of that hotel are able to use their room key card to open this gate - but guests of the Aqua Bamboo have to get this assistance). I parked on the third level and walked down the parking ramps, eventually exiting by way of an emergency exit since my key card wouldn't get me access to the normal stairwell.As for my room, #1002, it was extremely small, but clean. The problem I had with the room was with the air conditioner. It vibrated terribly and I didn't get much sleep. At one point, I even tried stuffing a shoe between the air conditioner and the wall to try and stop the vibrating, but that didn't work. I tried calling the front desk to complain about it, but didn't get an answer, and being tired from a 5 1/2 hour flight over and a long day prior to the flight, I decided to tough it out for the night and address the issue in the morning.I spoke with the desk clerk the next morning and she advised that she would get me moved to another room by the afternoon. I left for work, and when I returned at 5 pm, I was given the keys to room #710. THIS IS THE ROOM YOU WANT TO STAY IN AT THIS HOTEL! It was a suite with a full kitchen. Very nicely appointed. The hotel staff had moved all of my personal effects to the room while I was out.... right down to the bottle of water I had left in the mini-fridge. The room also had THREE balconies...one which faced the swimming pool with chairs and a table for relaxing. This room was perfect for my stay, and made my experience a very good one.The room did lack wi-fi, however there was a cable in the room to plug into your laptop for internet. Unfortunately, I travel with an i-Pad, and there is no way to connect. There's free wi-fi in the lobby, but for some reason, I never was able to connect to it. I ended up going to the Mac 24/7 restaurant in the Hilton down the street where they offer complimentary wi-fi. Luckily my smart phone brought me all of the email and essential internet service i needed while in the hotel.The pool area is nice, with plenty of lounge chairs. There's also a hot tub. The trees and greenery give the pool area a "tropical garden" feel.The lobby is nicely furnished, but a bit dated. This is a older hotel, but they've done a good job of maintaining the public areas. From the lobby, to the narrow hallways, to my room(s), EVERYTHING was clean.The staff at the hotel are very courteous and attentive. I appreciated to smiles and welcome I received in the morning on my way out, and upon returning from a hard day's work. A+The hotel sits on the outer edge of the tourist areas so the glamour that is prevalent a few blocks away is somewhat absent, but even so, it's a nice little hotel, with great staff.

First: we arrived at 10am to check in cause we got off the cruise ship and didn't want to have all our bags with us all day. They put our bags onto a cart and left it in the lobby for anyone to go through and take whatever they wanted. Check in was at 3pm and we were left sitting waiting in the lobby cause they couldn't even be bothered to let us know or rooms were ready. We finally grew tired of waiting and asked them when our rooms would be ready and they responded that our rooms were ready a few hours ago.....yet they didn't bother letting us know when we're just sitting in the lobby waiting for our rooms. We get to our rooms and aesthetically, it looked nice. The beds were lumpy. the sheets were rough. The kitchen stove and fridge were not leveled and would rock back and forth if you bumped into it. The cabinets would not close properly either. The pool was dirty looking. The water looked cloudy and the pool deck was very dirty. I didn't want to talk around barefoot. The one thing I really enjoyed was they have free internet in your room. You just need an ethernet cable to plug into your laptop and the speed was pretty decent. Would I go back to this hotel? Probably not.

Excelent service, very friendly reception desk and personnel. At Thursdays, by 5 pm, there's a welcome reception, with drinks, snacks and a singer (and ukelele player) that really rocks. If you're lucky, Nicole will dance a fantastic hula by the pool. Amazing. There's free wi-fi at the lobby area, free coffee, lemonade and fresh water. There's no free parking (it costs US$ 20/day) and the real con was the room # 1202. Although well equipped with safe box, flat TV, fridge and even one microwave, it was tiny (I put my luggage at the aisle, in front of the closet) and had a very old air conditioner. It was old and noisy, specially at night. It was so loud that I woke up 2-3 times just for the noise. From the balcony you may see part of the sea and laundry machine is available at the same floor at the end of the corridor. After my complain about this, I was told I could be moved to another room, but that was my last day so maybe i was late on telling it. They told me that there are two new refurbished floors (try to stay at one of these) and they intend to change all the old a/c for new ones. Waikiki beach is just 3 blocks away and there's a rental car place 2 blocks away that may help you if you couldn't get a car at the airport (that happened to me). You can get free beach towels and chairs at the reception desk.

Mr Craig Matura and Mr Tam were visiting to check our balcony. They were very kind and helpful to us. I feel very safe and comfortable in this room.The people at the front desk were also very friendly and kind. Just one thing, the room charge is expensive through Japanese Company.

Honolulu is NOT an inexpensive city -- especially for hotels! We found the Aqua Bamboo by searching TripAdvisor and were attracted by the price and the good reviews. We were pleasantly surprised in many ways! The location was perfect for us. We were able to take a city bus directy from the airport that stopped on Kuhio Avenue near the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, the check-in staff presented us with chilled towels and cold pineapple juice. The lobby is spacious and relaxing -- with cold water, ice-tea, and lemonade next to the publicly available computers. Our room was very nice (although next time we'll probably spring for the small suite -- my sister's was incredible!). During our 3-night stay, the staff was very helpful and friendly. We took advantage of the pool and hot-tub (both in the lovely garden behind the hotel). We also appreciated the convenient washer & dryer. Another reviewer mentioned the lack of WiFi, but there is wired Internet in the rooms -- and Ethernet cables are available at the front desk. (I personally prefer a fast and secure wired connection to the often spotty wireless connections in many hotels.) This isn't a 5-star luxury hotel -- but it's a great value in a great location with great service!

We have stayed at Aqua Bamboo and Spa 4 times in the past few years, we have never been dissapointed. The staff are so helpful and friendly (even when we had our toddler with us, they were always willing to help out, and one of the ladies who cleaned our room even bought a kettle from her own as there was not one located in our room - so i could have sterile water in my babies bottle). It was always clean, and whenever we decided to go for a swim, or to the beach the room was always spotless when we returned. The staff at reception would always great us with a warm smile. We arrived quite early before check in, and we were given a room straight away. The hotel is close to the main strip (walking distance), has a supermarket (which is very reasonably price for a tourist area just across the road). and the shuttle that takes you around the island is only across the road...I dont have anything negative to say about this hotel, we have stayed in a lot more pricey accomodation in Hawaii, and by far this one is the best, i would never go back to the more expensive hotels ever again.

Our first time in Hawaii, we couldn't have picked a better place that suited our needs. The staff were so friendly, our room was wonderful and cleaned every day, the bed was so cozy, we were close to everything, and we felt so comfortable and welcome:) We were sad to leave and hope to return again soon:)

Rented a condo from this hotel, although we dealt mainly with the owner, Norman! A really nice individual who went out of his way for us on our first night by walking us to the Food Court in the International Market Place! This was our first time in Honolulu. He was very courteous and gave us valuable info on the surroundings around Bamboo Waikiki.The room itself had three beds (Double and 2 twins) which was perfect for our party of 4! Had a flat screen, kitchenette, two lanai, table and desk and of course, air conditioning! It also had a nice pool although we didn't use it and the hotel itself had no restaurant but didn't need one.This hotel was in a great location! 2 blocks from the beach! and scores of restaurants in the area, both chain and locally owned!! The staff was good although one time we had a problem with a fuse being tripped, they wouldn't reset it unless we called the owner and had him call the hotel himself...go figure. We also asked the hotel if we could take 2 loaner beach chairs to use on the beach but the front desk said we couldn't because we didnt book a room directly with the hotel...oh well...That wasn't a biggie but that policy didn't make sense because they had plenty of beach chairs available...Nevertheless, all in all we had a good stay and again, the location was great!! Kudos to Norman for making our stay very comfortable!!!

There was excellent service here. The manager actually went out and purchased a converter for my Mac to use the Internet. The fact that there is no wi-fi is pretty ridiculous for someone on business, but the staff's attitude and helpfulness more than made up for the lack of modern amenities.

We had a small family reunion here for a week and enjoyed it tremendously. The room was clean, the bedding very comfortable, and the staff relaxed and welcoming. The beach was two blocks down, and the parking convenient (we could have parked at the hotel, but decided to park next door so we would not have to deal with the valet parking). The lobby was large and comfortable, perfect for meeting with family before dinner. Many shops and restaurants within walking distance. Waikiki Beach is very crowded, but some days we drove to more remote places with the rental car.

The hotel was very convenient - valet parking for the car, clean towels for the beach or the swimming pool, toys / chairs to bring to the beach which was only 2 minutes walk - all for no extra cost (apart from $20 per day for parking).Drinks and apples in the lobby was a nice touch and the staff was always very helpful. There was also a handy reminder in the lift which listed all the free activities available in Waikiki, as well as a local paper with key events for the week.We were very happy to have chosen the Aqua Bamboo - bed very comfortable, free internet in the room worked a treat for our 14 year old son. The pool was an oasis of tranquility (given Honolulu itself is a quite busy town) and we had so many restaurants to chose from within a minute walk. We did cook (OK only once for the whole stay but this was only because the restaurants had to be sampled!) and the equipment was adequate. Had I wanted to cook more, the kit was a bit light but, with a local supermarket across the road, the microwave is really all you need. It would have been handy to have an oven (not everything can go in the microwave) but to be honest you don't go to Hawaii to cook a roast.Only downside I can think of was the aircon unit which I found a bit loud - however it brought the room temperature down very quickly and the weather was not that hot so, in the end, we didn't switch on at night.I would recommend this hotel to anyone - I think this was definitely good value for money.

When I decided to do a short stay-cation on Oahu I tried to look for a reasonably priced hotel that was situated in a good location. Aqua Bamboo Waikiki had everything I was looking for: good price and good location. The room was clean and comfortable. The small kitchenette was ideal and helped me save money on food while staying in Waikiki. The staff was friendly and polite.The only reason why I didn't give this location an 'excellent' is based on the parking factor. One thing to take into consideration when booking the hotel is that parking will cost you $20.00 per day, whether it be in the limited parking spaces at the hotel or in the unit next door. In the end the money I saved on food was used to park my car. Still overall it was a great hotel, maybe next time since I live on Oahu I'll just catch The Bus and save on the parking fees.

We are a family of 4 who stayed 7 nights in one of the one-bedroom apartments. There are both pros and cons to Aqua Bamboo Waikiki.On the positive side, the staff are very friendly and helpful. It is in a good location in the middle of Waikiki ,only a couple of blocks back from the beach. If you want to self-cater the nearby Food Pantry is handy. There is valet parking on-site at $20 per day. The outdoor pool area and garden is an attractive setting. Whilst the pool is not large, it is adequate and our children enjoyed it. There is free wifi in the lobby and pool areas.The one bedroom apartment that we stayed in was comfortable and adequate for a family of 4 - one double bed in the bedroom and 2 single beds in the main room where the TV is. There was lots of cupboard space. The kitchen was user-friendly and had a huge fridge.Now for the negatives. The bathroom in the apartment that we had was quite small and old. The tap in the sink leaked at the base and the plug in the bath did not function at all (it was clogged with hair and broken - yuck!!!).The wall-mounted air conditioning unit in the bedroom was very noisy (which was particularly noticeable at night) and there was also a lot of street noise.So there you have it. This place offers reasonable value, but there may be some downsides. Maybe we had one of the poorer apartments, I do not know. Good luck.

This was mine and my sister's first time to the Hawaiian Islands, as we were there for my brother's wedding. We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa Resort in Ohau on Waikiki Beach at my parent request. My parents always stay there each time there in Ohau. The rooms were clean and cozy and we never had any problems. You wouldnt know if you had neighbors next to you as it was always so quite. The beds were comfortable and we had all the amenities that come with any other upscale resort. Our room faced Kuhio Ave and in the evening we walked out on our balcony and watched all the people walking by. Kuhio Ave is lined with shops to purchase sovenirs and there was even a liquor store on the corner (which we enjoyed). The pool had a waterfall and we watched the birds drink from it, it made a great picture spot. The plant life there at the pool area was beautiful and keep clean and so colorful. The best part was Waikiki beach was only a block and 1/2 away, walking distance. Everyone that worked there was so nice. Weather your leaving the resort or returning from sight seeing, someone was always there to open the door for you. The lobby was always clean and comfortable just to relax in. Sure, I could of stayed in 5 star resort, but than I wouldnt of had all that extra money to spend while in Hawaii. I will certainly stay there again when we go back in 2013!
Totally enjoyed our stay. Awesome room and service. Will definately return and recommend the Bamboo to freinds and family.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and at first was surprised at how dated the whole area looked. But we thoroughly enjoyed our trip and our stay at the Aqua Bamboo, and fell in love with Hawaii. We had plenty of room for 3 people, and though the room was not 5 star, we didn't pay for 5 star. Absolutely everyone who worked at the Aqua Bamboo was friendly and helpful. I booked directly with the hotel. We had originally planned for 5 people & would not have expected to fit in one room in Hawaii. If you do your homework, you would realize rooms are small for more than 3 people. Our room was on the 3rd floor and faced the street, but the street noise was not a bother. We did not come to sit in a room, so a view and a perfect room was not a priorty. The beds were very clean & very comfortable. The beach was a block & a half walk and everything you could need was nearby. The pool & pool area were great.The tea & lemon water always available in the lobby was a nice treat. The only thing that I would suggest to make the stay perfect, would be to add a complimentary breakfast. Make your own waffles, cereal, fruit, coffee, juice..I usually chose hotels that offer this. It's a big help to make a vacation more affordable. I looked a lot of hotels and this would have swayed my decision.

After just completing our 25 visit to Hawaii, this was our 10th stay at the AQUA BAMBOO & SPA.As an Australian Travel Agent, I have stayed at all the 5* properties, Sheratons, Outriggers etc, but for that true Hawaiian Aloha feeling and atmosphere, the BAMBOO is the place to stay. The staff, from the 'boss' Kahlea, to front desk 'angels' Zenie and Nicole and valet-do anything for you Puna, nothing is a problem. The rooms are cosy and adequate (and most same size as Hyatt and Sheraton Waikiki, believe me) but the kitchen appliances are a bonus for making a cuppa, bowl of noodles or just morning toast and jam to save $$$s for that evening meal at the Cheesecake Factory- a must for any visitor to Honolulu.I am now just organising my diary and work commitments for my next R&R to the AQUA BAMBOO, CAN'T WAIT.

They were very rude to us. The service is crap! Customer service is crap! We book our room in advance (6 months before going on vaction). Nine of us were going to stay in a 2 bedrooms with queens and a roll away bed for the 9th person. We got there and they told us that we could not have 5 people in one of the rooms when they had charged us a roll away for the extra person. So they wanted us to pay for the extra room for the extra person. We have book our room 6 months in advance! WE paid a lot of money to stay there and they did not even have the courtesy to give us the other room for have the price or accommodate us! Why should have to pay more! If you go to a restaurant and you find a fly in your food you get a new plate at no charge or its free! Its customer service!!!  They told us it was a fire hazard to have 5 in a room but yet they had given us the roll away anyway!!!! They totally disrespected us and down graded us to a 3 bed room suite! We had paid for two extra beds!! They did not refund our money or apologize formally!!  Two days later they send us a fruit basket but that didn't help. We end up having to share one shower vs the two showers we had paid for! We also had to pay for breakfast! We're  supposed to get free complementary breakfast everyday of our stay and we end up having to pay for it!!! They caused us a huge inconvenience and made our arrival very unpleasant! Overall its a nice hotel but their service is crap!

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in late May 2012, when we arrived we were assigned an upgraded room with a kitchenette and we were happy to take it but when we looked at it all we could see from the balcony was a brick wall, the front desk staff we very helpful and we were moved to a smaller room with a great view of the mountains and the city and we were quite happy with it ( I didn't come to Hawaii from Australia to look at a brick wall) the bathroom was spacious and clean and the bed was very comfortable. Drinks in the foyer a nice touch, Thursday evening drinks and snacks by the pool great, loved the Uke playing too.The staff very friendly and helpfullWould recommend a stay here.

Have just completed my 3rd stay at Aqua bamboo and have loved it every time. It is a wonderful oasis in the bustle of waikiki. Bamboo is close to many amenities and the beach. The bus stop is a 1 minute walk, as is the closest convenience store. No restuarnt is on site however there are many places to eat and drink in the surrounding neighborhood. The staff are always helpful and friendly. Some of the interiors are now a little dated however the rooms have always been clean and the bamboo provides great value for money. The pool area is delightful and provides a perfect place to relax. "Bamboozle" (managers reception) each thursday is a wonderful initiative and allows the guests to mingle and chat to each other in a lovely relaxed atmosphere. I am already booked into the bamboo for my 4th visit and looking forwrad to returning over New year 2012/2013.

My wife and I spent 6 nights in room 1102, sea view from the balcony, which we did not expect. The staff were excellent, very helpful and friendly, the hotel was small, just what we wanted. The room was kept clean and the towels in the bathroom were changed every day which we thought was not necessary. All in all a very enjoyable stay.Peter and Rita Watson, Sydney, Australia

We stayed here for 15 days in June 2012 & I must say that it was all I expected and so much more. The staff treated us like we were family. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Everything was just as I had seen on their website. The accomodation was clean & very well kept. All the guests we spoke to loved staying there and had nothing but praise for the staff. We will definately return to stay here again & again. Do yourself a favour & book to stay at the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki.
user_name:
Di P
Alstonville, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We read all the reviews and shopped around. Based on the photos we booked here for 3 weeks. When we arrived the room was not as we expected...beds were nice, we asked for high floor to combat road noise, but even on 7th floor, it was loud. The room is dated and needs remodeling. Since my mom who was with me was a nurse, she is used to things being hospital clean and this room needed some attention. The service however from the front desk (Puna) and the bell hop with our luggage was OUTSTANDING...they even refunded our deposit when we decided after check in to go to another hotel. The service is wonderful and the need for remodeling is out of their control...management/owners need to look into this. The outside was finishing up remodeling and looked great. The inside of rooms needs updated bathrooms and the carpet was frayed. The closet doors were not cleaned well and the kitchen refridg either had food or bugs in it.

My spouse and I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for five nights in June. I personally like the fact that the hotel is smaller than many of the other hotels in Waikiki. It's only a five minute walk from the beach.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The weekly "Bamboozled" event at the pool area was fun - free drinks and appetizers plus a good ukelele player.Construction hadn't finished yet so we were not able to access the balcony from our first room (we changed rooms because we found the layout to be uncomfortable - very long and narrow room with the TV in an awkward location). I found that the room wasn't in perfect condition (i.e., knicked furniture, a few small stains). Overall, this hotel is an excellent value for the price, the size of the room and location.

We had a great stay at the Aqua Bamboo in Hawaii. We like the fact that it was a small hotel and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Yes it is on the old side but clean and comfortable. The pool area was one of the reasons we decided to stay there and it was great. The kids had a ball. The kitchen was good but lacked oven trays and microwave safe dishes. Rooms would have been better configured is the single beds could have been in the seperate bedroom and queen in the main area, easier to put children to bed and sleep.My biggest suggestion would be to double glaze the windows of the rooms on the main road. We were on the 6th floor and it sounded like the traffic was right out the window as if we were on the ground floor.

It could be said that this hotel is in the heart of Waikiki, but from our experience this hotel is THE HEART OF WAIKIKI. The staff was awesome and catered to ones every need. The pool area was like a oasis in the middle of the Waikiki Jungle. The location is awesome everything you would need or want is within walking distance. I doubt that I would stay anywhere else on Oahu, unless it was free, and that is very unlikely.
user_name:
Randy D
Wailuku, Hawaii, United States

review_body: The room we had was great, I immediately felt at home. Kitchen was well equipped and a nice balcony to sit out on. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The pool area is very well designed and tranquil. Really loved this place, and very convient location,

When I first arrived at this hotel, I didnt know what to expect, all I knew was that the building looked really old. I've stayed at many hotels as I do travel often for work and pleasure. I didnt know what to expect. But dont let the outside of the hotel deceive your opinion. The staff was great, very helpful and friendly. And once I got to my room, I was delighted with how big the kitchen was. It was equipped with a FULL kitchen complete with a full size range and refrigerator, not to mention a microwave and dishes as well. There was macadamia nut chocolates on my bed and the way they set up the towels in the bathroom was so cute, decorated with real orchids! Needless to say I was very pleased with the service that I will be going back there in the near future. The staff is full of Aloha and being a local from another island, I say that is hard to come by. Most hotels now try to maintain that aloha feeling however, I can just feel it is not genuine as the staff at the Aqua Bamboo. For the price and location, this was a great bargain. I'd definitely recommend this place to everyone!

We spent six nights at Aqua Bamboo and it was perfect for our purposes. We had a good sized, well kept, self catering room which suited our budget with a supermarket nearby. The staff were all great to deal with and the pool area made for a relaxing time when not out exploring Oahu.
user_name:
Trish C
Wellington, Wellington, New Zealand

review_body: The rooms were great, clean and quiet. I never heard any noises, even though they said construction was happening. The pool area was awesome and the hotel is close to the beach and many restaurants. I can't wait to return to Hawaii!

Just came back from our vacation in Hawaii. We stayed 4 nights at the Aqua Bamboo and had a pleasant time. I've reserved a Studio Kitchenette, but upon arrival, learned we have been upgraded to a One Bedroom Kitchenette - very much appreciated!! Location was great - 5 minutes walk to the Waikiki Beach, to the International Market Place, etc. Lots of restaurants nearby. Pool was ok, it was closed for one day while we were there but the beach is 5 minutes walk so didn't really matter. Hotel also has beach supplies which we can borrow (chairs, board, etc.). Would love to go back again!

My husband and I and 2 kids stayed at the this hotel for 21 nights...we had the 1 deluxe bedroom unit and it just made our 3 weeks stay...very enjoyable and memorable..and funny enough we didnt feel the need to move to another hotel...coz normally if you stayed at 1 hotel for that long you get a bit bored with the surrounding etc...but the Aqua bamboo...it was the perfect locations for everything...and to top it all off the staff made our stay very welcoming and comfortable with there above expectation services...plus our Lanai was the bomp diggerty with our own little beach fale and sun loungers and bar table and stools and of course a BBQ for and all day entertainment if you get sick of the beach that is...the trade wind thru that Lanai was so refreshing that we didnt ever use our aircon most of the time...we love love love it here and will be back next year for another long vacations...thank Nicole and all her staff at the Aqua Bamboo for going the extra miles every time...AAA rate from us here in NZ.
user_location: Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand
user_name:
MikeL935
Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand

review_body: Mid May 2012 I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo with four friends. Three of us shared a one bedroom with full kitchen.The Aqua Bamboo was finishing up with their renovations(which we were warned about on their website) so it was still a bit messy in back and scaffolding was still in place. However, our room was great, not huge, but enough room. The balcony was small, but still possible to stand outside. The staff was friendly and helpful. And the pool area is a little gem. The pool is saltwater and small, but it has a waterfall and is very peaceful. There are plenty of chaise lounges and tables with chairs. Bamboo trees are growing throughout. My favorite thing to do was take a book and lounge in one of two cabanas in the afternoon. My reading usually led to a short nap, but so peaceful. I awoke refreshed and ready to head to the next Happy Hour.If you want to be in the excitement all of the time, then stay in one of the huge hotels. If you want to be a short distance from the beach and the excitement at night and still want a peaceful setting...then stay at the Aqua Bamboo. A couple of other perks are free daily newspaper and complimentary lemon ice water, lemonade and coffee all day.Who could ask for more? A great experience and yes, I would stay there again.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo from March 15-22. I am glad I chose the Aqua Bamboo and would highly recommend it as an economical yet wonderful hotel to stay at. As a single mom traveling with my teen-aged daughter it was great to be at a smaller hotel where we felt very safe. The hotel had an amazing pool area. It was small but never crowded and very peaceful. The beautiful trees and foliage surrounding it blocked out traffic noise and when we were at the pool it was hard to believe there was a busy road close by. I found it to be very quiet in our room as well. I’ve stayed at other hotels where you can hear people showering or walking around above you or in the hallway. At the Aqua Bamboo we never heard the other hotel guests when we were in our room. The hotel was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable! It was great to have the kitchenette to make snacks and bring them to the pool area to eat. The location was great too. Only a couple of blocks from the Food Pantry or the beach and the zoo plus of course lots of other shopping and restaurants. We walked everywhere.There was coffee, water and either iced tea or lemonade always available in the lobby. The only negative was that they are still doing renovations on the outside of the building. When we booked our vacation we were told the renovations would be completed by the time we were there but that wasn't the case. As a result we could not open our sliding doors or go onto our balcony. Also they lend out chairs to take to the beach which would have been great but no one told us so we didn't find out until our last evening there when it was too late. Mostly it was a good experience and we would love to go back again.

My husband and I recently stayed for 4 nights at the Aqua Bamboo. The facilities are a bit rundown, but for the convenience, location, and price, you can't beat it. The studio kitchenette we had was huge, clean, and very quiet. Even though they were performing construction, we were never inconvenienced. I also never heard any guests in neighboring rooms, which can be a problem in a lot of hotels. The staff was very helpful -- whether we needed beach towels, a cab, or public bus directions, they were always accommodating and friendly. The proximity to Kuhio State Beach is also a huge plus. If you're looking to stay at a smaller hotel in the Waikiki area, I would wholeheartedly recommend the Aqua Bamboo. We would not hesitate to stay at the Aqua Bamboo again.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 7 nights during our honeymoon. It had everything you needed. The pool area, spa and cabanas were fantastic! They have a Managers reception every Thursday afternoon with free drinks, nibbles and entertainment which was great. They also have internet in the foyer with fresh drinks to help yourself to anytime. The service was friendly and the housekeeping were great.

This is a WONDERFUL place to stay, and compared to other Waikiki prices it is a terrific value! All of the workers are so friendly and seem to genuinely care. Me and my husband were staying here to get married and once the workers saw me in my dress they left us champagne, chocolates, and toasting glasses when we were looking to stay in some of the typical honeymoon hotels, the Ko Olina, Turtle bay etc they treated us as "o another wedding" where as the Bamboo went out of their way to do something for us. Every Thursday they have free live music, drinks, snacks, the workers hula dance, and they have a portrait drawer who is free but accepts tips and if you get your portrait drawn you will WANT to tip! They are fantastic! The only thing that could have been a bit better would be the cleanliness, our sheets were not fresh when we got there, and there was some mold spots on the ceiling, also our house keeper washed our dishes for us (which i didnt expect) but they were all REALLY dirty. So I would suggest checking your dishes when you arrive, but any issues they were more than happy to fix. Also Waikiki is not the easiest place to park, and we were not able to park in their garage for most of our trip because it was full so we had to park in the hotel next door which is REALLY steep, and has no elevator or any easy way to get up/down if you are not staying in that hotel. So I would advise reserving your parking space ahead of time.
user_name:
AlexZaundria F
Grand Junction, Colorado, United States

review_body: The Aqua Bamboo was a clean, comfortable urban hotel located a few blocks from Wikiki beach. We stayed in a suite. During the day the room was noisy , but we had no problem sleeping in their comfortable beds at night. The kitchen was TINY. There was barely enough room for two to sit down. Also, the room did not have wi fi, only a cable Internet connection. The small pool area was attractive and relaxing. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

The hotel is good but not excellent. Good value for the price they charge. It does have everything you need and is comfortable. I had a kitchinette room, which was good to have breakfast and not spend money/time eating out. I do reccomend staying here. Downside is the pool. which is not very big and expensive parking lot. Hawaii is great, so the hotel is not very important! This property is well located and walking distance to Waikiki and good restaurants around.

It was an amazing trip to Hawaii. The hotel is close to everything, restaurants, ABC stores, International Marketplace, Waikiki Beach and Waikiki Strip. My family enjoyed walking every night to the waikiki strip. Staff was always helpful and accomodating. I also loved the free drinks at the lobby, I brought a water bottle for our trip and was very useful, as we fill it up with lemonade or iced tea and bring it with us to the beach. I also enjoyed the weekly manager's reception held during thursday's. Overall, I would reccomend this hotel to family and friends.

Arrival:Stayed here end of April/ begining of May. When we arrived as someone previously said we were greated very warmly, I was expected at least an "Aloha, welcome to Hawaii type thing" with maybe some conversation of if this was our first trip, blah blah but that didn't happen however we were checked in promptly. Room:We stayed on 8th floor facing the street and this was fine. But if you stay there and the construction is done on the pool side i would recommend a room facing that. I was really nervous coming here because of the previous two reviews about cockroaches, so when i got there i was sure to scope out our room. To my dismay I did see one cockroach under the bedside table that was dead. I called front desk and they sent someone up to get it, im really afraid of bugs so didn't want to deal with that. After seeing that I was a bit uncomfertable the rest of the days expecting to see more but thankfully we did not! The room was ok, from a quick look it looked pretty, but generally it was pretty tiny (had to get really organized to lay suitcases out because there wasn't much room). We had a small kitchentte that would have been ample to make food in the room (you can ask front desk for items like toasters, frying pans, etc.). We dirtied only a plate and knife two days and each time housekeeping cleaned those up. The bed sheets had some stains which was kind of gross, my feeling is if theres a stain that won't come out then the sheets should be tossed. There was a large closet with a safe that was nice. The balcony was ok, we didn't go out there really becasue there wasn't any chairs to sit on. We also weren't bothered by the noise from the street too much.The bathroom was also just ok. I guess in general this place looks ok on the surface until you acutally get in a room and then you start to notice the imperfections (stains here or there on walls and/or sheets, a dead bug under your nightstand, a dirty mirror, an outdated shower...). Lobby/pool area:Lounge was nice, couldn't get wifi in rooms only in lobby/ pool area. Only could get connected if you had laptop and ethernet cable. Just ask front desk right away because you need to connect to their wifi then go to a website and create a temporary account for logging onto wifi. The lobby had apples and 2 different types of refreshments (iced tea, lemon water, lemonade, etc.) each day. There was a coffee machine but it wasn't great at all. They also had a computer which seemed pretty expensive to use. The pool area was lovely. Nice lounge chairs and places to sit and eat a meal or suntan. Clean pool and little hot tub. There was a place for getting massages. The only bad thing was there was construction going on, on the balconies facing the pool so there was some noise from this from 9am - 5pm daily...it was definately not that quiet but for some reason it didn't distract me from relaxing at the pool and im pretty senstivite to noise like that...Towels/ Beach chairs:No designated spot on beach for this hotel, but they do offer towels or beach chairs at the hotel which you can bring to the beach yourself. The chairs aren't big or heavy as they aren't the full lay down ones, just little seats. The beach is so short of a walk it isn't a big deal at all like 2 blocks thats it. Service:Generally I found the men that worked there to go above and beyond to treat you well and take care of you. The women were nice but jsut didn't seem as friendly. There is luggage storage and they will even call a cab for you. Note we jsut took genearl taxis to and from the airport, a private fixed rate taxi for 30$ each way would have been our best best as taxis cost more with the amount of traffic you have to wait in. In general I think what this place really needs is a good deep cleaning with touch ups and or replacements of ratty stuff, but the location is great within easy walking to lost of shops, restaurants and the beach. I did not feel this was at all in anyway in a worse location than any other hotel on waikiki that isn't directly on the beach. This is a city so remember you will see some homeless people no matter where on waikiki you go. But the crime rate here is very low and I would not be worried about walking around here day or night really. Of course if walking in the night you employe the same caution as you would in any other city. The pool area is really nice and is enjoyable if your not wanting to get full of sand that day!Oh and FYI they have a weekly managers gathering on Thursdays from 4:30 - 5:30 pm where they ofter their signature cocktail and some light snacks for hotel guests.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week just last week. We stayed on the second floor. When we first arrived to our Hotel it was already dark out so walking around the area the hotel was at this time looked shady so it seemed like the hotel was in a shady place too as their was a guy who looked to be trying to call someone down from the apartment beside the hotel looking for drugs. But during the day it didn't seem that way. Unfortunely our view was on the side looking out into the rooms of other places of the apartment beside us. Balcony to Balcony and when there TV was on next door, you could hear it. But we never complained because we were only in that room to change, sleep as we were out at the beach or out on the town during the other times. First night we arrived though, settled in and Everything work. We took a walk around Waikiki after we checked in. Came back and some of the lights and TV were not working.. One of the workers came up and attempted to fix it but was unsuccessful. They offered us to move to another room but we had already unpacked and were tired so we said No and we would wait for the AM for someone to come again. The next morning everything worked. There was construction that started at 9am but It didn't bother us and we were out the rest of the day. Staff was friendly. No bugs noticed but they did spray the rooms anyways during our stay. The maids came early sometimes, one time at 830. But if we said We were ready to have a room right then then they would come back later as we were out. The pool was cute but stayed at the beach 6 times out of 7. Kids were always at the pool. When leaving we were catching a night flight so they kept out bags in storage and pre organized a cab for us for that evening for when we were ready to leave. Been to Hawaii twice and I am Hawaii'd out but I would stay here again if I were to return. My boyfriend said he would rather way the extra money to stay some where on the strip!

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in April 2012. It was very clean and there was plenty of room. The hotel overall is a little dated and doesn't feel very 'Hawaiian'. Staff did not acknowledge us upon our arrival but were very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. The rooms are a little tired and the noise of the jack hammer being used on their renovations was a little annoying. The rooms are very quiet and the location of the hotel is great. A great place for people on a budget.

Nice rooms with lots of space and nice pool. Great location near restaurants and close to the beach. We would go and stay there again. Great rates also. All the employees were friendly and helpful.Gayle T.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. We had a double room on the 4th floor which was clean and quiet. (I never saw a cockroach the entire time we stayed at the hotel). The service was good and reception staff friendly and helpful, even ringing up a few tour operators for me and recommending restaurants. They also arranged our taxi back to the airport. The pool area is lovely, although they are doing renovations at the moment, which I believe will be finished soon. There is free tea, coffee lemonade and chilled water available from the lobby area to take out to the pool area with you which is a nice tough and plenty of recliner chairs.The hotel really is just around the corner from Waikiki beach which means it is not too noisy at night. Overall a very pleasant stay

Clean, recently renovated. I think this must be an older hotel, but it has been updated. It is beautiful. The room we were in was small, but had everything we needed, and was very clean, attractively decorated, and perfectly comfortable and modern. The staff could not be nicer, and there is recycling on every floor. Laundry facilities available on several floors, very nice grill out by the pool if you do not have one on your lania. The pool is small but very nice, and the area around the pool is really beautiful. The lobby has comfortable seating, computers (fees apply for internet access there or is free in your room), complimentary iced tea, lemon water, and apples. Wonderful valet service for your rental car (reasonable rates) - but within walking distance of everything you need, just a couple of blocks from the beach (the hotel loans complimentary beach towels and body boards, etc...), dining (can be pricey, so we opted to use our in room kitchen and the grill at the pool to save money!), convenience stores, shopping, etc....

2 blocks from the only real grocery store in Waikiki, another 2 blocks in the other direction to a warm-water, protected beach (near the Duke statue). The bus stop is right across the street and we made good use of it. The street noise didn't bother us much; we were able to tune it out.If you want to spend the big bucks to stay in a large resort beachside, go ahead. But this was perfect for us. Just a few steps from our room to the elevator, and from the elevator to the pool and hot tub.We found a great little Korean takeout (Me's) right around the corner.Much appreciated: the free coffee, cold drinks, and newspapers in the lobby. (How many hotels do this? Not many.) The free use of boogie boards, rafts and beach chairs, which we could take to the beach. The clean room with new appliances. The serenity of the small, quiet pool area (where I would often sit on a lounge chair and read a book after dark). I could tell this hotel really cares about its guests. Highly recommended.

My wife and I have been long time Aqua hotel customers, even going so far as to host our entire wedding party at the Aqua Aloha Surf when we had our wedding a few years ago. We arranged a last minute trip to Hawaii for our wedding anniversary, and I booked the Aqua bamboo luxury one-bedroom suite. As soon as we got up to our room it was love at first sight; you would be hard pressed to tell which has more square feet, the Lanai or the room; honestly the lanai is huge. The hotel staff, who I had advised of our wedding anniversary when I booked the room, had a bottle of chilled champagne and chocolates waiting for us on arrival; a really nice touch, and the reason we keep choosing bamboo properties. We enjoyed both on the lounge chairs of the lanai. The lanai included a BBQ grill, and enough seating for about a dozen people; it would be a great place to entertain. On the topic of entertaining, there is a small kitchenette (2 burners, microwave, small fridge) and a wet bar on the other side of the room with another fridge, stereo, TV, iPod dock, and DVD player. Across the street and one block west there is a large grocery store, where I was able to buy everything we needed for a few nights of grilling food and enjoying cold beer out on the lanai. It was truly a home away from home.
