Next time we go we'll have to bring some friends with us so we can make better use of the entertainment space.On the topic of construction, yes they are refurbishing the exterior and yes it is loud during the week from the hours of 9AM to 5PM. It is a good motivator to get out of the room and get moving; you didn't come to Hawaii to sleep, right? If you need to get away from the noise, the lanai is almost completely immune, so a nice cat nap in the sun will make you forget all about the construction. Other reviews mentioned roaches, we didn't see any during our stay; I saw one outside, but I'd say that doesn't count. The location of the hotel is great, right in the heart of Waikiki without being right on the strip; Kuhio Ave can get noisy at times, between street traffic and people partying on the weekends; I only noticed it during our stay on Saturday night. We're already planning our trip back :)

I recently needed a relaxing overnight stay and came across the Aqua Bamboo when looking for a hotel with kamaaina rates in Waikiki. Being from the area and walking by daily never would I have suspected such a relaxing atmosphere from the room to the pool area, indeed an oasis on Kuhio avenue. My reservations were for a standard room and was pleasantly suprised by the updated furnishings and cleanliness all around. Giving it a spa like feel from cozy robes hanging in the closet, orchids around the bathroom, to hot and cold tea, lemonade and coffee in the lobby at your 24 hour disposal made it just that extra special. I will certainly be recommending it and returning my self! Mahalo nui loa from this kamaaina!

We had a room with 2 double-beds. It was fine but nothing special. Our room faced Kuhio avenue, which has a lot of traffic noise, even at night.The hotel is still under construction. During the day the hotel balconies were being jack-hammered so the entire building vibrated. The hotel limited construction to daytime hours - 9am to 5pm, in the hope that most guests would be out during the noise. Since we have a small child we spent a fair amount of time at our hotel during the day.Only stayed for 2 nights and then the hotel staff moved us to a sister property - Aqua Surf - which is on a side street and not under construction and so much quieter.Also the room at the Bamboo felt cramped. The same price room at the Aqua Surf was bigger and had a better layout.

We enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were clean, ours was a bit noisy since it overlooked a main road. The air conditioner squeaked so we had to leave the window open at night and it was loud outside. They had a party by the pool one evening that was nice. The flowers in the room were a nice touch. The parking garage was small and crowded.

My wife and I rate Aqua Bamboo highly because it is small and not one of the giant Waikiki hotels. It even smells good with the scent of mint in the lobby. You can get on the elevator alone most of the time and not fight a crowd. All the staff were pleasant and helpful. Two down sides include lack of decent parking and the 12th-floor laundry which is on a small balcony with very little room to walk around on.

This was our second stay at Aqua Bamboo. Once again Aqua Bamboo exceeded our expectations! We were upgraded to a one bedroom, with full kitchen, and two lanais overlooking Kuhio Ave. The street noise and renovations were not an issue. The hotel is spotless, and in a convenient location. The staff are amazing - friendly, respectful, knowledgeable, and show great pride in their work. We will definitely return.

A bit rough around the edges but pretty good and we were happy we stayed there. Our first room didn't have the internet so we got upgrade to a nicer room that was bigger and had a kitchenette. Our original booking was for the cheapest room type but did say it had wired internet so switching us made sense. If we stayed in that original small room on the 11th floor then this review would not be so great (the hallway of that floor also had a bad smell to it). The free apples, beach chairs, boogie boards and ice tea/lemonade were nice touches. Also, the BBQ was nice to use and the pool area was relaxing. However, I didn't try the sauna and the hot tub wasn't hot and the pool was cold. A few minor things were annoying - the stove burners didn't seem to work with the pan they gave us. Also, the bathroom sink had the most annoying faucet placement. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location combined with the price made it a good fit for us. We took the bus around (bus stops just outside the door) and were able to walk to several spots of interest.The construction noise didn't bother us as we were out in the day, also it was a good motivator to get out of our room and enjoy the sun.

We've stayed at the Aqua Bamboo many times over the past three years, having stayed at a number of other hotels prior to that. Found it by accident - the place we were staying at overlooked the Aqua Bamboo garden and pool. We made enquiries, and always come back here now because it's truly wonderful. Friendly and helpful staff, clean functional rooms, kitchens, serene poolside area, fresh lemonade and iced tea all day, wonderful spa and massage, crisp white sheets, the Thursday night get-togethers by the pool, the number of return guests, the location and so on. Lots of aloha, and mahalo from us!

We stayed at Aqua when they were upgrading renovations around the hotel. We were upgraded to a nice room , however this meant we had no balcony which was a real pain as there was no fresh air in the room and you could not spend time looking out. There is a pool that is quite nice for a hig rise complex- not to much sun gets through but it is still nice. Beds were comfy and staff friendly, Good value for money and cheap brekkie available at the Ohana East for $3.95. We also hired a car around the corner which was handy, Would stay here again am sure it would be much better once renos finished

Very clean hotel rooms, pool area, and lobby. Nice and friendly staff. Fresh fruit provided every day. Coffee, water, and tea provided also. Small but effective kitchen with full size refrigerator. Comfortable bed and futon. Wish the TVs were more centrally located. Lanai maitenance did not bother us. Centrally located, so easy to walk anywhere in Waikiki. Parking cost is expensive, $20/day, so try and find a better parking option.

We checked in March 16th & things looked nice - then we noticed the cockroaches crawling on the ceiling, the counters, the light fixtures - they were everywhere. We had only been in the room 5 minutes. We let the front desk know & they said they would have our room sprayed. A man came with a can of raid and just sprayed behind the fridge. We left to get groceries but when we came back there seemed to be more. They offered to move us to a different room but I doubt cockroaches are selective. We ended up moving to the Aqua Wave property where things were much better - no cockroaches.

Stayed at this hotel for location and price value for three days last week. I was in town on business. The front desk staff is super helpful and freindly. Quiet at night and clean! Very close to beach, a variety of dining options and stores. I felt comfortable and safe - as a woman traveling alone safety is of high importance to me. Would stay again.
user_name:
Alexis C
Berlin, Maryland, United States

review_body: Our first tropical vacation was in Waikiki, at Aqua Bamboo, for 10 nights in January. We chose it based on TripAdvisor reviews. Upon arrival, our room was on the renovation side, but we were moved the next day. Great, friendly staff. Clean hotel. Super convenient. We loved it so much we're headed back for another visit in April.

Just what we wanted -- a bit quieter part of Waikiki but really just a block away from the main drag & the beach. Our room had a beautiful big lanai and was a lovely place to hang out over the morning coffee. Room was spotless, appeared to be recently re-done. It isn't a four or five start hotel, but given the price Aqua Bamboo far exceeded my expectations. Would definitely stay there again.

This was our first stay at the Aqua Bamboo. It is a smaller hotel which made it feel very homey and comfortable. I loved the quiet pool area with the trees, plants, and waterfall. A great place to relax.....and you could take your own food and drinks there which was awesome. IT is quite close to the beach and close to the action as well. The street tends to be noisey but it didn't bother me after the fist night. Very friendly and helpful staff.
user_name:
Faye R
Swift Current, Saskatchewan, Canada

review_body: Our stay at the Bamboo started out wonderful, nice staff, beautiful room... but it went downhill from there. We had to kill more than 10 cockroaches in about 30 minutes. I know in a tropical area its common, but the hotel we had transferred from (Ohana West: wanted a nicer room for our romantic getaway) had no signs of roaches. When we went to front desk they said they'd send someone to spray, so we went for a walk. When we came back it was obvious nobody had done anything (we had wedged a towel under the bathroom door in an attempt to barricade ourselves from roaches). I also want to mention that Raveena on front desk, as much as she was friendly at first, when we came to her with our problem she seemed apathetic and not very helpful at all. She had an attitude like it was our fault, and that we should feel bad for bringing our problem to her (I actually hesitated going to front desk because she might be there) Needless to say, I had to call again and someone came up. Then we killed many more and decided this was not a relaxing place to stay. Dan at front desk offered us the Deluxe Luxury Suite for free, but we just wanted out of the hotel. He accommodated us by sending us to the Aqua Aloha Surf where we were lucky to receive a free upgrade to a deluxe suite. Overall, it was a pretty hotel, but I can't recommend a hotel where you have to kill a roach every 10 minutes. It was also a loss because we lost our beautiful ocean view, but at least we couldn't find evidence of roaches at the other hotel.

If you are looking for a clean place at a reasonable price for Honolulu, this is an acceptable place. It's certainly not a 3 or 4 star hotel. It's very average.The rooms are clean but the furniture is old and beat up. Literally every piece of furniture is chipped, scuffed or the paint has rubbed off. The rooms are small and the ceilings are 8 foot. The rooms are very "cave like" in some respects, although they do have balconies with sliding glass doors with helps. There is no central air conditioning, only window units.That being said, the location is good -- only a few blocks from Waikiki Beach and from all the shops. The rooms are clean and they have all the basics. In fact, each of our rooms (we were traveling with my in laws) had a small kitchenette. The price is also good, considering it is Hawaii.This is a place to stay if you are on a budget and don't really care about being in a first class hotel.

Firstly, we booked an average room over the internet and were immediately upgraded to a room up with a kithen-ette. A few days later we complained about noise from work that had started on our building side. The next day we were moved to a room on the upper floor with three balconies, a king size bed, seperate kitchen and water views.What service! A word of caution though, the average priced rooms are small and probably akin to a $60 motel in Australia. If this doesn't worry you, then I can say the rooms are very clean and tidy with a maid that cleans them and replaces soaps, shampoo, towels and fresh flowers etc. All rooms have a digital safe, which is handy. There are free newspapers in the foyer, coffee, iced teas and other fresh drinks. We were given free beach towels and beach chairs every day when requested. On Thursdays there is free live music by the pool and free food and drinks, including Mai Tais. The pool is only small and probably the same size and an average Australian home pool, but it is adequate - anyway, why swim at the pool with Waikiki Beach around the corner. The staff are friendly and helpful and will assist with all needs. The best part is the location, which is a short stroll to Waikiki Beach - probably 2 blocks. It is also a short walk to the main strip, shops and markets.

My husband and I are planning our next trip back to Waikiki later this spring and will probably stay for a few nights at Aqua bamboo again. We stayed here for a few nights in January, in addition to some time on the north shore. Although not perfect, it was well worth the price and had a cozier feel which we prefer (vs. some of the absolutely massive hotels). There were a few complaints about the renovations but this wasn’t an issue for us at all. We stayed on one of the higher floors, and the hot tub was great!.. as was the close proximity to the beach and other conveniences in Waikiki. I think this is an especially good choice for first time visitors to Waikiki as well.

I read the reviews on this hotel before booking it majority were bang on. There is nothing real fancy about it but it is clean which is what is most important to us. The staff are friendly and most helpful anytime. Our first room 305 faced Kuhio and that street was busy busy busy the room also was very musty smelling and I am alergic the next day we asked to be moved and no problem moved to 603 not a great view , but with the cost of property not a biggy for us could still see the street a bit We really enjoyed having the BBQ at the pool we used it all the time and it saved us a lot of money and it was relaxing start to the evening. It is only 1 1/2 blocks to the grocery store,2 blocks to the beach and 2 blocks to any number of stores,international market etc. They even let us stay 1 hr past check out time. Enjoyed our stay here very much March 4-15th 2012. we had a studio with kitchenette only a couple of recommendations for the room and they are a drain board for the kitchen sink and a paring knife and big knife for cutting pineapple etc.

Excellent staff.Great location at a lower rate. Our 7th floor east room was bad. noisey airconditioner,could not open patio door.<LEGAL?> We upgraded to tenth floor overlooking pool. Much better! Could even see the ocean.Our new room had 3 belconies,nice functional kitchen,well equiped. Never had to use the aircondx with nice cross breeze. Room was well looked after by nice staff. The ceiling of one belcony needed a good scrape and paint,simple fix that would make a huge improvement,and maybe this will all happen as they are working on the outside. WE were out all day,no problem with noise of construction but garbage trucks can be noisey at night.I would recommend the pool side upper floors and when work complete I think this will be a great value hotel.

We stayed here for 2 nights in Feb.12. (wanted 3 more, but sadly for us they where sold out). The studio room we had on 8th floor was just great! Big bed in a big bedroom, big bathroom, kitchenette and a living-room(!). 2 min walk to waikiki beach and a friendly staff. What else can you ask for? Maybe its starting to get a little worn, but anyway - I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone.

My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights at the beginning of March and it was great. We were slightly apprehensive due to the comments about the daytime work but it didn't affect us at all. We were located on the 9th floor and there wasn't any work being done on our side of the building (plus its done during the day when typically you aren't in your room anyways).The location was wonderful - a 3 minute walk to the beach (of which Bamboo provides the towels, beachmats, beach chairs free of charge). The restaurants are numerous around the hotel, all in walking vicinity. The weather wasn't the best so we didn't use the pool but it did look very nice. There were some people using it.The Thursday night evening was wonderful. They provided a welcome drink and veggies, etc with music and sketch artist.All in all, this was a great hotel. Although this is not a five star it is a hotel that I would recommend. Very clean and the service was wonderful. The only negative, but in reality it is similar to all the hotels in the area, there are busy streets around which you may hear. But, close your sliding glass doors and enjoy your room. We also had a kitchenette which was great to warm up our leftovers and make popcorn.Thanks again Aqua Bamboo....

We are a couple in early 60's traveling for pleasure. Stayed here 5 nights pre cruise and 4 nights post cruise. We found things very much as described by others. The location is very convenient to beach and center of Waikiki and we walked most places, The courtyard is very pleasant and has a small hot tub,4 person max to be comfortable, water temperature was hot but not too hot and the staff kept it filled or quickly responded if asked. There used to be a spa in the courtyard but it is closed and I meant to ask if the hotel was planning to use the space for something else such as a small gym room which would be a great idea. I enjoyed the ice tea, lemonade, lemon water and coffee available in the lobby plus the large bowl of apples . The staff was generally very friendly and always responded quickly to any requests. The Thursday night get together was a nice touch.We had two different rooms on the 9th floor facing the courtyard with a little view of the ocean. One of the balconies was closed in one room due to repairs but it was not the one facing the courtyard with furniture and we were gone during the day so did not hear any noise. Each room was a little different with its own good and bad points but both were very clean . There was a bit of wear on some furniture or loose plaster on some areas near air conditioner or patio door but nothing terrible. Beds in both rooms were very comfortable, sheets nice and the towels were very good. Both had single cup coffee makers with pod type grounds supplied daily. The wait between cups was a little irritating. The layouts of the two rooms were different. One had the kitchenette and desk areas in a different small room from the bed area , had a smaller bathroom counter but did have a wall cabinet which was nice. The bathroom sink seemed too small for the fixture and usually oversprayed a bit. This room had two nightstands and lamps which were appreciated. Both rooms included robes which were terry lined and a bit too warm some of the time but appreciated. The other room had the desk, kitchenette and bed all in one room. The kitchen area was nicer than the first, more counter space,larger sink and cabinets but the microwave was on a shelf which I would deem too high. The bathroom had been updated with a nice counter which extended over the toilet for storage but no separate wall cabinet. The sink in this room was a good size for the fixture which was bamboo shaped. The bed was placed right next to the lanai so access was not as easy and there was only one night stand which did not make one person happy.The sheer curtain in this room had a small hole and little tear that I noticed but this was no big deal. We could hear street noise even on the 9th floor but that was mostly sirens. I don't know if having double pane glass would help as somebody suggested but you are in the middle of a city so expect some noise. Some of the floor tiles in the hallway were cracked or missing a piece but this is an older hotel which has been pretty well maintained. We were very happy in general and would return. I have tried to be factual about this report as I felt that I had a good idea of what to expect by reading reviews and feel realistic expectations can only improve an experience.

This hotel has a great location and staff. You are only 2 blocks from where many tour buses meet and about 4 blocks from beautiful Waikiki beach and lots of action. Then when you come back to the hotel it is a nice peaceful haven to relax.

I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights as part of a holiday to Hawaii. The staff were helpful and friendly throughout the visit. I was travelling on my own, but the staff and hotel allowed me to feel safe and comfortable at all times.I stayed in 2 rooms over the 4 nights, one which was facing onto a busy road which was noisy, but not overly. The second room I was given was higher and facing a quieter street (with ocean glimpses), I had asked for a higher level room when booking and they accommodated this request.Location was good, easy walk to the beaches, bus stops, shops and restaurants.I didn't notice the renovation noise at all, although my first room's balcony was locked as part of the renovation process.I would recommend this place to others travelling to Waikiki

I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in 2011 & 2012. On both occasions, my experience was terrific. The hotel is clean, well appointed, staff are very friendly, helpful and accomodating. The amenities are terrific, pool & spa, complimentary iced tea. The hotel is located close to shops, car hire outlets, tour agents, a bus service right out front, short walk to Waikiki beach. The rooms have a small kitchen which was most suitable for my family needs, though we were so close to all the well known restaurants, we had the choice to eat out or stay in and self cater. I have no hesitation in recommending the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki to any prospective holiday maker - singles, couples or families. The location is terrific! I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did. We WILL be returning to the Aqua Bamboo on our next Hawaii holiday.

My husband and I stayed at the aqua bamboo for our honeymoon travelling from Australia. Great location close to the beach and shops. The pool was great after an afternoon of shopping just for a relax. Rooms clean and staff wonderful....I say this about the staff as on the 7th day of my honeymoon I had an unfortunate accident at Waimea Bay and was dumped by a wave that resulted in a broken back. The staff at aqua bamboo accommodated my husband even though though they were booked out at the time and also my family who travelled over while I was in hospital. One staff member visited me in hopital on behalf of the hotel with fruit, flowers and a card signed by all the staff. Nicole the hotel manager sent food baskets to my husband and family in their room. I can't thank them enough for their support and kindness during this most terrible time. I'm looking forward to one day going back to aqua bamboo and spa to see the people that helped me through a terrible time.I Also enjoyed the Thursday night cocktail evening around the pool where we had free cocktails and met people from home and around the world! Love Hawaii and once I'm better I hope to save up and return! (avoiding waimea bay of course ;-)

I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo for 3 weeks during February. I was most impressed with the hotel staff who were so friendly and helpful. The first room I stayed in was rather noisy because of the renos but they very kindly moved me when space became available. I ended up staying on the 10th floor facing the pool and it was glorious. Nicole and Puna were particularly kind and helpful and I was very grateful for their commitment to finding a suitable room for the rest of my stay. I would highly recommend this hotel as it is very close to the beach but mostly because it felt like a home away from home!

Fantastical location, room quality and staff. We stayed for 11 nights and loved every minute. By the way the ongoing construction was a nonfactor as it is only during the day on weekdays. In fact we had a small baby with us who naped often during the day and was never woken from the construction. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. Best value in Waikiki!

Booked this hotel on their website and agreed to their reservation policy (must cancel 3 days prior to check-in), paid by credit card. At 2:30pm on the day I am flying to Hawaii I receive an email from this hotel saying they are looking forward to my stay and that I should also know that there is construction and renovations going on during the time of my stay. Too late to cancel or make changes to the reservation as I had to be at the airport in about 1 hour so this notice is WAY TOO LATE! I also received 2 previous emails from this hotel (1 when I booked room and then 2 days before my check-in time) that discussed my reservation and upcoming stay but neither one said anything about construction going on during my stay. I feel that charging your credit card 3 days before you arrive, with no possibility of cancellation, and then informing you of construction at the site on the same day you are arriving at the hotel is very deceptive and an unethical business policy.I arrive at the hotel hoping the construction will not be too disruptive as I have no chance to make other arrangements at this late time. I awake the next morning to ear-splitting jackhammer noise on the wall outside my hotel room (at least they didn't start until 9am, but I got in late so needed to sleep in a bit). This noise went on all day long and because the noise was so loud I couldn't stay in the room at all. Couldn't hear the Television even when the volume was turned up all the way. It was driving me nuts. I went down to the front desk and complained about the racket, told them it was forcing me to stay out of my room all day and then asked to speak with the Manager about having to guarantee my stay 3 days ahead but only notifying me of construction on the day I was checking in, leaving me no options whatsoever. They told me the Manager wasn't there so I asked them to have the Manager contact me as soon as possible. I never heard from the Manager during my 1.5 days at this hotel. The noise continued the next morning as well so I just checked out early and left. And please make note of what other reviewers have said in their reviews as well - the street noise at night and early in the mornings (5am garbage trucks!) is very loud and the windows/walls do nothing to keep the noise out of the room. I tried opening the sliding door to see how much louder it was with it open and while it was a little bit louder, closing the doors did very little to dampen the street noise.Overall a disastrous stay. I will never book a room at this hotel again and I will probably not book a stay at any other Aqua properties either. This kind of unethical business practice shows what poor customer service this company shows to its guests. There are many hotels in Waikiki that will do everything they can to make your stay a memorable and very positive experience. My stay at the Bamboo was memorable but there was nothing positive about it.

Aloha!The Aqua Bamboo was good value for our money, smaller than nearby hotels with more personal service, which we liked. We`d highly recommend it for future stays. Great location, close to Waikiki Beach, on main bus route. Street can be noisy so request a higher floor (7 or higher) & pool view or Pacific Monarch side. We had 3 rooms for 6 people: 2 had coffee maker, mini fridge & microwave; 1 had kitchenette. Hotel staff were great, including front desk & housekeeping staff (kudos to Cathy!). They were friendly & courteous & went out of their way to be helpful (with bus schedules, restaurant suggestions, directions, etc). The outer sanctuary, with salt water pool & hot tub, was wonderful. Some guests used the gas BBQ. There was free coffee, lemon water, ice tea or lemonade 24/7 & we read our complimentary newspapers pool-side every morning. The free WiFi was great for researching day trips, booking seats home, etc. We really enjoyed the weekly managers reception, with signature "Bamboozle" drink, snacks, & live Hawaiian entertainment. Do sample the gourmet shortbread at the Honolulu Cookie Company, eat at the Seaside Bar & Grill & Cheeseburgers in Paradise (both have breakfast specials, do try the signature cheeseburger), order in from Round Table Pizza (great pizza!), try take-out from the grocery stores & the $1.39 hot dogs at the ABC stores, & the Longboard beer. Do travel by “TheBus” ($2.50 cash per ticket gets you 1 transfer, good for 2 hrs). Visit Pearl Harbor (including the USS Arizona & Mighty Mo, USS Bowfin, & Aviation Museum), Punchbowl, & Army Museum (free). Choose the Polynesian Cultural Center over Paradise Cove, choose the Day Experience & skip the dinner/evening show to save $$$. Try the North Shore & South Shore routes on TheBus, go to the Byodo-In Temple, Iolani Palace, Kawaiahaʻo Church & Mission Houses. A great first trip to Hawaii! Mahalo!

This was our third stay at the Aqua Bamboo and each time was terrific. Fantastic location close to shops, a short walk to the beach and great restaurants. The complimentary coffee, ice water, lemonade & ice tea are a nice touch. The staff provides outstanding service with smiles galore. We especially enjoy the pool area with it's natural vegetation, privacy and a very relaxing atmosphere. The Bamboozal hour on Thursday afternoons with it's entertainment and refreshments shows great hospitality. The rooms were clean and refurbished. The hotel's award winning "green" moto shows well with all the natural products used. We find this hotel to be good value and definitely have it circled for our next visit. Can't wait!!Darryl W.

As 1st. timer's we were delighted to see that value of a green environment was also adapted by this hotel. The short walk to the beach and all the shopping was a pleasure.The staff were very efficent,professional,friendly and worked together as a team. I will definetly recomend the hotel to all of my colleques and friends. We hope to return asap. The Aqu Bamboo receives 5 out of 5.

We had another great vacation at our favorite boutique hotel. The pool area is a winning part of the combination of a small, friendly and personable hotel along with Bamboozal Thursdays where they serve their signature drink complete with orchid on the rim and have some tasty snacks along with entertainment. Smiles all around from all the guests.We will be back.

We were at the hotel from Jan 31-Feb 9 2012. We found it a very pleasant hotel ,reasonably priced situated 3 blocks from Waikiki beach, on a main public bus line. It was close to shops, restaurants and beach. Rooms are newly redecorated and have either a kitchen or a microwave,toaster and small frig. We could see the beach from our 11th floor room. Pool /hot tub area were a private oasis after a long day being a tourist. (Although the pool and ocean were both cold) Some of the outside balconies were being refinished but workers were only there 830-4pm daily and we were out all day so they did not bother us at all. Workers were not there on weekends. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Would definately stay there again. Apples, coffee,tea,lemonade and newspapers always available in the lobby. Managers welcome party was well attended. Air conditioners were noisy but we just used the fan and that was cool enough and quieter. Lots of sirens at night but not the hotels fault.

This property is in an excellent location. The hotel is just 3 short blocks from central Waikiki Beach and has very nice rooms for a very reasonable price. I like the convenience of the small kitchenette, the staff were very friendly and professional. The two drawbacks are the pool and the street noise. The pool is small and it is COLD!!!! and the rooms have only single glazed windows so you get street noise if your room faces Kuhio Street. I hope they get to double glazing the windows to save energy and reduce the noise and pool is a little better heated so that the next time I go to Hawaii; I can give the Aqua Bamboo 5 out of 5.

I stayed here for 2 weeks during Christmas & New Years. What can I say - I like going to the beach on Christmas Day (it sure beats the cold weather on the mainland). I usually go to Waikiki every two to three years and from the reviews I read online beforehand, I decided to try the Bamboo for this recent trip. Of all the hotels I've stayed at in Waikiki over the years, this has so far been the best. I did pay a bit more this time for the room than I usually do, but it was worth it. The hotel is 2 short blocks to the beach, walking distance to everything, and the rooms are updated, compared to a number of other hotels in Waikiki. I was given a room on the 9th floor (and in Waikiki, the higher the floor, the better, due to the noise at street level). The room had an ocean view, which I wasn't expecting, due to it being behind the Hyatt. I originally figured the Hyatt would have blocked the ocean view, but I had a good ocean view on either side of the Hyatt's eastern tower. The staff were excellent on all work shifts. On Thursdays, at 4:30 PM, the hotel holds an informal gathering for interested guests, which included a couple of drinks and a magic show at poolside. For those days when you are trying to avoid the sun for a few hours, the TV channel selection is superior compared to the Ohana Hotel's limited channel selection. I had no complaints with this hotel, but only one suggestion to the owners of the hotel: please trim or remove one or two of the palm trees by the pool to allow in a bit more sunshine. There was a couple of times I didn't feel like walking to the beach, so I reclined at poolside (along with a large rum & coke, LOL). Due to the shade from the palms (and from the east tower of the Hyatt), you don't get alot of direct sunlight for extended hours at poolside. For first-timers going to Waikiki, I'd recommend this hotel, and if you are trying to save a few dollars, then consider staying at the Aqua Bamboo's neighboring hotel a block away (but definitely at this end of Waikiki due to the close proximity to the beach and amenities) and to avoid north east Waikiki due to it's distance to everything, unless you like walking. The rooms are cheaper in north west Waikiki, but I personally won't walk blocks to go to the beach anymore.

We stayed here 3 nights. The location is great, only a couple of blocks from the ocean and all the activity of Waikiki, without the high prices. Our room was clean & in good shape except for the AC units. We had a suite (a free upgrade they gave us) with a master bedroom & twin beds in the main area. The AC unit in the master bedroom made a loud squeeking noise, so we slept in the main room, where its unit was just loud. Our room was on the street, so you heard a lot of traffic all the time. Ask for a poolside room. We also have a full kitchen which meant we could make meals if we wanted.If you can live with the noise (remember you are in a city), I would recommend the hotel. The pool area is very lovely. They have beach chairs and mats availabe for guest use. Free coffee & tea in the lobby. The staff was very helpful. If you are on a budget & want to stay near the beach in Waikiki, this is a good option.

Bed was comfortable, however we could not use our balcony as they were working outside, rooms are average, very noisy (even with ac going). Pool area small, but nice. Wifi in lobby is terrible. Property is well located, just very dated.

I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo with my husband for several nights mid-January after reading all of the reviews... and seeing the price compared to other hotels. You are only a block away from all the big oceanfront hotels, so we would walk over there and have lunch or a cocktail, but were happy to retreat back to the Aqua Bamboo.I requested a courtyard-facing room (looking at pool) and this was honored. I had read many other reviews on Tripadvisor suggesting this and I am glad that I did. The view was great and it was pretty quiet. The renovation noise was pretty distant.Pros:Free coffee, tea, ice water and lemonade in lobbyFree newspaper & applesBeach chairs and beach towels availableCharming pool areaView of ocean from lanaiWifi at poolCons:The property feels a bit worn and aged despite inside renovationsWish there was WiFi in the rooms rather than needing a USB cord, but cords are provided free of charge so that's a good thing.For the price and location, I certainly recommend this room.Nearby dining suggestion: If you want to the right about half a block there is a great local restaurant called "Ruffage." Excellent smoothies, acai sorbet bowl, and chicken teriyaki bowl all at extremely reasonable prices. Definitely recommend this for some cheap local food!I also highly recommend going to Roy's if you want to spend more and have a more upscale experience -- best food I have ever had.Overall, I would recommend Aqua Bamboo for the price, pool and location.

When we checked into the hotel, we were informed that since we were only staying one night, they upgraded us to a suite at no extra charge! And the suite was REALLY nice. There were two private lanais and a small kitchen. The beds (there were two) were very soft. I particularly liked the bathroom: all the towels had orchid flowers tucked in the folds, and the floor of the shower was black river-rock type stuff. We really stayed a short time, so I can't talk about the location of the hotel. Parking was just next door in another hotel's garage, but was an extra charge - $20 for 24 hours, though you could enter and exit as much as you wanted. The ambiance was as beautiful and relaxing as I had hoped, and the staff were very nice. I would definitely return.

I had booked the Bamboo after reading a review of it in the book "Oahu Revealed" by Andrew Doughty. He called it a "Gem" and so do I. It was my first trip to Oahu and I was a bit overwelmed by the size of Wakikii. Hotels everywhere! Aqua Bamboo is not one of those huge hotels. It has a gorgeous private pool area, lovely rooms and it's close to everything. We were lucky and got the Penthouse Suite. We travelled with family and we each had our own private room and bathroom. Loved the Lanai! Perfect place to be for the New Year's fireworks. We were front and center! Our bed was so comfortable. There was a Sauna in the master bath! Chairs,mats or floats for the ocean? They have an area to borrow theirs for NO charge! We were a bit disappointed that the spa was closed, we were going to get mani-pedis, but, there was a great place for that right next door. Maybe they can turn the building for the spa that is next to the pool into a tiki bar. Now that would be awesome!

My wife and I booked a room with self catering facilities for 3 nights. While we wanted pool side room (after reading other reviews about traffic noise) none was available. So we ended up with an 11th floor suite for no extra cost. Fantastic! In our stay there was only minimal renovation noise and always between 9am and 5pm when you should be out and about anyway. Little road noise to be heard up so high as well. Staff were very helpful. Free wifi a plus too. No bar by the pool only a minor complaint. Great location close to beach and the action of Waikiki. We would stay again.

We stayed at the hotel the first week of January, 2012. This hotel has great customer service. If you need something, just ask! We stayed in a studio suite, which had a refrigerator, microwave, and a stove. Seems like the rooms were updated recently with a more modern style of furniture and it had a flat panel TV. This location in Kuhio Street is good. Lots of things within walking distance! I do recommend you get a room facing the pool, because I can imagine the ones facing Kuhio can be noisy due to the traffic and people walking by. There was a little noise in our room but nothing major. Parking is very tight and limited down in the basement, but at least it is available in case you need it. Internet was provided in our room for free (ethernet connection) and there was free wireless internet in the lobby. The speeds were not blazing fast, but acceptable to check emails and see a few YouTube videos.

Our view wasn't the best, but a very good hotel. If we looked out the window we would see an apartment with clothes hanging out. The pool wasn't very big, but pretty warm. It did have a very tropical and nice hot tub. The Aqua Bamboo was right across the street from a $7.95 buffet for breakfast. It was a very nice place. You can see tropical birds here and there. Waikiki beach is within walking distance. As well as the International market. You definitely do not need a car or taxi. The rooms were kind of humid, but very clean and the AC works really well. We actually got cold. You don't need a car for much more than airport transportation or going to Pearl Harbor. The staff was incredibly helpful, and very polite!

We recently stayed at the Aqua Bamboo and had 3 seperate rooms as we had 6 people. We were on higher floors 8 & 9 which were great. We had purchased moderate rooms with no kitchenettes and were upgraded. It was perfect! clean room & a kitchen we could cook in. The hotel is in the perfect location on Kuhio and only 2 blocks from the waikiki beach, although that beach is super crowded , so go early or rent a car and go to the north shore. The staff at Bamboo was all pretty amazing especially Fe & Anthony. Our housekeeper was the sweetest Philipino lady ! There was one girl who was not great. She usually worked the night shift and she was rude to almost every customer. She also chatted on the phone to her friends or whoever almost every time we saw her. She also freaked out because we asked for earplugs one night and couldn't figure out if the hotel had them or not , when we had read that the hotel was giving them out due to the constuction. I wish i could remember her name but she has tan skin and brown hair and very unpleasant. Nobody else was like her at all. Everyone was soooooooooooo friendly and valued the true aloha spirit. We didn't hear the construction at all on the top floors and we didn't see a lot of workers. The free drinks in the lobby are a great added touch! the rooms we had all had balconys and were great. The hotel isn't totally soundproof , but if you come to Waikiki you obviously aren't coming to a place for piece & quiet. STay out of the city if you don't like noise. The pool area was awesome! cold pool , but no pools are heated in Hawaii. There are cabanas and also a grill where we grilled two nights. Yes the hotel is an older hotel , but it is well taken care of and you never hear anyone who is around you , just the traffic or the a/c unit. Perfect ! we also got to have a peek at a suite on floor nine which was BEAUTIFUL! full wrap around deck , private grill , huge soaker tub and a great view of Waikiki. This hotel is small which is exactly what we love! Great place for families or just couples. Stay at the bamboo , it's a great location and a great value.

My husband and I stayed here 2 nights recently before leaving on cruise, and we liked the Bamboo very much - would recommend it to all. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the lobby is cozy and serene with scented candles burning. Our room was somewhat small, but this is Waikiki! Fresh orchids every day and a comfortable bed. Some of the furniture was a bit chipped and there is construction now on one side of the exterior. We were put on the opposite side - so did not matter. The pool area is also very nice, and it is only 2 blocks to the beach. For the price of this lovely hotel, I felt like we found a real jewel right in Waikiki. I would definitely come back and would recommend it to all.

This is not the ritz, but rather a smallish hotel that is in a very convenient location and is very good value for money. We have been back for the last two years and have enjoyed our stays a great deal. Yes there are a few things that could be improved but this is a nice honest place to stay and we have found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.

I travelled to the Aqua Bamboo in March of 2011 This was my first time travelling to Hawaii & i can not recommend this hotel enough !We walked past a lot of the more expensive hotels & through their pool areas, they were lovely, but we were much happier at the Aqua Bamboo So, the pro's...As a young Australian couple we are definitely happy go lucky, but would not stay in a backpackers or anywhere icky. The patio area at the Aqua Bamboo was very very tranquil, the pool was never full, the deckchairs and cabana's were so comfy & the complimentary iced tea was an added extra. On one of the nights we were there they had a welcome party, it was a lovely added extra The staff were beautiful, always holding the door open for us, the maids left purple orchids every time they cleaned the room & they were more than happy to organise tours for us / call us cabs The location is ideal ! We walked pretty much everywhere, the buses to Ala Moana stopped right outside the Aqua Bamboo, Tour shuttles to Paradise Cove Luau's ect, were on the next block & the International Market Place / Beach / Kalakaua Ave were like a 3 minute walk away a few cons...The exterior of the building was looking a little shabby, but this has since been renovated There was a bit of noise if you stayed on the Kuhio St side of the Hotel, not enough to keep you awake & the view of the hills for the Kuhio St side was amazing :D I have since become a travel agent & would be more than happy to sell this hotel to my client Great work Aqua Bamboo !!

For the price in Waikiki, this was a wonderful hotel. Located just one block off the main strip, it's a perfect location. Even though it has 10 rooms on each of 12 floors, it felt like an intimate hotel. The lobby and pool were never crowded. You never waited to speak to the front desk. And the way the floors are laid out, it almost felt like each floor had only a couple of rooms. Staff was really nice. We felt very safe here. This is not a very kid-friendly hotel, so it's rather quiet and the clientele is very mature (no loud partying). We had a king bed with a kitchenette. There was plenty of room to move around (if you've been to Waikiki you know that many rooms can barely accommodate two people walking around the bed). If people are complaining and expect more, then they should go up one block to Kalakaua Avenue and pay $400/night. There are a few drawbacks: 1) The spa has closed indefinitely. Unfortunately some websites still call this the Aqua Bamboo and Spa. 2) Parking is extremely tight in the underground garage. If you rent a car, try to get a compact and make sure your parking skills are sharp. 3) The exterior of one side of the hotel is under renovation. They are jackhammering the balconeys. Our balconey was off limits the entire time we were there. Wish they'd thought to tell us this before our arrival or even when we checked in. 4) If you make any changes to your reservations, be sure to read the change confirmation emails thoroughly. They mistakenly changed our name and address after we requested a date change. It took us several calls/emails to get it corrected. And still, just days before our arrival, they sent us a confirmation email with the wrong arrival date. Despite all this, we really enjoyed our stay and recommend this to anyone.

I really enjoyed my 4 nights here, I was traveling solo so having a kitchenette made it even better so i didn't have to eat out every night if i didn't want to. The hotel was being renovated when i was there, only during the day so i didn't even hear much noise at all if i was in the room during 9-5. It didn't impact at all, no matter where you were in the hotel.They had laundry facilities which was good, and the pool was nice. You have the beach so the pool is big enough for the few who want to relax there. The room was modern, really nice actually just like the pictures so I was impressed. I have seen a few people have written that it was noisy, but what do you expect? If you stay in Waikiki its going to be a little noisy. My room was on the side so I still got a little street noise, I could hear buses etc driving and stopping but I still had a good nights sleep and was up early enough anyway that it didn't interrupt my sleep really. If you want something quieter stay further out of Waikiki. The room was comfortable, I relaxed some nights for a few hours and had enough food and drinks to keep me happy which i liked about having a microwave, stove and fridge so if I was hungry or thirsty i didn't have to go anywhere to get it. There was a supermarket a few blocks down which were reasonable so I stocked up on breakfast foods and lunch snacks and some dinners so I had something each day and wasn't going back and forth. Overall, I would come back here, it was cheap for the location, it had a kitchenette which was handy and was so close to the beach, like 2 blocks, bus stops and the main shopping street of Waikiki without having to go all the way to the mall. Staying here made my trip relaxing and nice and I am really glad I stayed here! Would stay here again!

We had a room on the 4th floor towards kuhio avenue. The traffic noise was so bad that we had to leave the ancient and moldy airconditioner stay on all the time. We checked out early since we could not relax. The hotel is old. As a budget hotel, it is OK. We called it bamboo hell.

I travelled to this hotel based on the reviews read here, and since the price was affordable and the pictures on the website looked okay. Don't be fooled. Even though this is not a horrible hotel, they do not give any extra for that extra buck you're spending here, compared to other Aqua Hotels in Waikiki. The rooms are very small. There was not almost any place to put our suitcases, and they were just medium sized. The facade was being painted, so we could not open our veranda at all (it was locked). The personnel at the front door is just fine, but won't give you any special treatment. Besides that it charges USD 20 for the parking- the price is okay to Waikiki standards, but since the garage is for public use, doesn't matter if you're in the hotel or not, you pay the same as any other person who wants to park there, so you have no advantage on that matter. I think that for the treatment and the amenities I received I could have picked another hotel around USD 40 less in the same neighborhood.

As two young women travelling alone, we could not have felt safer or more at home during our stay at Aqua Bamboo. The staff were friendly and accommodating, willing to go the extra mile and did not hesitate to accommodate our early arrival after an overnight flight from Australia, or provide restaurant and transport recommendations when asked. Our room faced the unfortunate apartment block, but this didn't matter to us - the point of going to Hawaii is to see Hawaii, not to spend your time in the hotel! The short walk to the beach, shopping, restaurants and amenities and value for money made Aqua Bamboo a winner in our eyes. The pool area is lovely, though it was crowded during the day - no matter as we practically lived on the beach. We experienced some noise from the street, but it is to be expected when staying on Kuhio Ave. The decor is a little dated but very comfortable and has been modernised as best it could, but once again, we were not there to spend all our time in the hotel. The ipod dock was a plus, the room was very clean and the kitchen facilities (though largely unused) were great! It was lovely to walk into the lobby from a long day in the sun and help ourselves to the iced tea and lemon water, and the manager's reception with Nicole was thoroughly enjoyable. Would definitely recommend if you don't mind being a couple of blocks back from the beach and are looking to save a little!

Pros: Well located, close to beach and amenities. Thursday afternoon complimentary drinks and food by the pool. The staff honoured our request for a courtyard facing room. Not too pricey. Lemonade and coffee provided in the foyer. Extra hour given free for late checkout.Cons: The rooms we stayed in seemed a little shabby. Perhaps quite a few are being renovated. Customer service wasn't consistent. No kettle in the room. Noisy at night.

The aqua bamboo is one of the best hotels I've been to. We've stayed here twice in the past two years for 2 weeks a time, with no problems at all. About 2 blocks from the beach- it is in a very convenient place. We were very impressed by the rooms, which were themed beautifully and were absolutely spotless, the staff was very friendly and had great advice about the local area, and the thursday 'bamboozle' is not to be missed - see you next year aquabamboo!

Because of its excellent reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book reservations at the Aqua Bamboo for my wife and I for our aniversary. I was aware that hotel is on the busy street, Kuhio Ave, so months ahead of time I requested a Courtyard facing room on a high floor (9th or higher) letting the hotel know that I am a light sleeper. We were successfully upgraded to a Courtyard room and my request for a high-up room was noted in the system. Upon arrival, we were placed in room 410, a Courtyard away from the street with a nice view of the pool; however, our side balcony opened directly to the neighboring run-down apartment complex approximately 10 feet away and saw a guy half-naked laying in his bed watching TV. I kept the shades closed and figured it would not be a problem.After returning to our room around 7:30pm, I noticed that it was extremely loud with the apartments right next door...literally. People were smoking on their balconies, that guys was still in his bed now blaring a movie, and another person was blaring music. I tried closing the bathroom window to see if that would help but we couldn't take the constant noise so we called the front desk. The front desk lady was unsympathetic telling my wife she could do nothing about the noise and if she called over anyways they wouldn't turn down their music. My wife asked if there was anything else she could do and she said no. We asked if we could be moved to another room on a different floor and she said no, they don't have any. We asked if we could get the upgrade fee we paid for the Courtyard room and she said no, she is not authorized to do so. She said all she can do is move us to a room facing the street on the same floor. We figured it would be better than this and quieter so we agreed. We were both our pajamas so we asked if somebody could bring up the new key to us and she said no; there is nobody at the hotel that can do that...we would have to come down to the lobby and get it. So I changed, went down to the lobby and let her know I was from room 410. All she said was "oh, here you go and said nothing else." She acted as if she could care less about us as patrons of their business.We were moved to room 407 and upon moving our items over, I noticed that is was a 1-room suite. We were confused and not sure if we were going to get charged extra or not for being upgraded to a suite so my wife called back asking. The front desk lady condescendingly told my wife of course she is not going to charge us and that we should be happy because she was upgrading us to a room 2x better than our last room. Sadly, the room ended up being much louder because buses stop right below it and the sliding glass doors are very old and do not eliminate much, if any sound. Moreover, there is a scooter / motorcycle company right next door that blares music non-stop. I used to live in an apartment right next to a busy street and the owner put in sound-proofing windows; the Aqua Bamboo needs to do so on their lower level floors to eliminate this issue. The next morning, we spoke to the supervisor and told her of our issue. She said she could move us to a 9th floor room but after two moves we decided against it...we were tired of packing and unpacking, it is just too much of a hassle. She also waived our upgrade fee and appologized, but by then our experience of this hotel was ruined. Additionally, the pillows are flat. The comforters are non-existent, the telephones and smoke alarms appeared to be 20 years old, and the rooms are not that clean. While the day staff are nice and charming, the night staff is not. Moreover, if you are unlucky to get a room on the lower floors, you will either have a nice view of run-down apartments or hear buses your entire stay. If you are a deep sleeper or hard of hearing, this is not an issue...but being a very light sleeper, it was for me. So beware of the lower floors.On the plus side, the hotel is close to the beach, stores, and restuarants; however, I would recommend paying a bit extra and getting a hotel on or right across the streeet from the beach...it is worth it, especially with all of the new development.

We stayed at the Aqua bamboo Nov 23-26th and again after our cruise Dec 3-7th. Our experience was wonderful. This Hotel is older but has been nicely renovated. We stayed in room 301 that overlooked the pool and hot tub. The staff goes the extra mile to make your vacation stress free. We new we'd be coming back to the hotel after our cruise and would need an early check-in and they did thier best to accommodate us. We asked if we could have our same room and we got that. Our flight home was at 9:30pm so we asked if we could keep our room until 6pm so we could enjoy our last day on the beach and shower before our flight home again they accommodated us. We missed the managers cocktail party and thier famous bamboozal cocktail and Nicole the manager, had a pitcher sent up to our room. Yummy...Nicole if your reading this I'd love the receipe. The staff was friendly and helpful. Thank-you Nicole, Jasmine, Revarie, Raymond and the many others that made our stay wonderful
This hotel was lovely. We had three balconies, service was terrific, and great pool area. Good bargain.

We wanted a condo type hotel room and were very pleased with our 11th floor corner suite at the Aqua Bamboo. The unit included a spacious bedroom, living room, large bath,kitchen, and balcony. The hotel was 2 blocks from the beach and close to grocery stores, restaurants, shops, and public transportation. The front desk receptionists were very knowledgeable in helping us navigate by bus and car around town and the island.

I booked this budget hotel in Waikiki because I was traveling alone over a very expensive weekend (Thanksgiving) and didn't want to break the bank. I knew also knew that Aqua has been buying up various properties at various price points, branding them, remodeling, and calling them Aqua. Which is fine, because that means the chain has contracts with suppliers for all their little commodities, like shampoo and robes.One thing re-branding cannot change, however, is location. This hotel is on Ala Moana, the main thoroughfare, smack dab in the middle of everything. So my room the first two nights was so unbelievably loud. I stayed last year in a hotel on the 405 in LA where they were doing on ramp construction at the exit and it wasn't this loud. Plus, My room, which was quite large and comfortable, had a lanai (balcony) that overlooked the seedy apartment building next door, where the residents' cigarette smoke wafted into my room each night and made me keep the windows closed. So the first day I requested a room change and I had to spend two nights in that room (boom! scream!) and then was sent ($15 more a night - worth it!) to a full on suite (full kitchen) with a lovely view of the pool (small) and palm trees. Like a different place. Had an excellent massage at the hotel spa, (I get massages regularly -very professional and competent therapist at Bamboo.) So, my advice is, if you say there, insist on a room overlooking the pool. And bring your own coffee. and swim at the beach.

We stayed here late November 2011 and over all had a great stay. We received an upgrade which is always fun. The only downside is that work was going on to the exterior of the hotel whilst we were there. Which would be ok normally as we were expecting that; however, we didn't expect it to be being done to the balcony of our room! Not the best start to a day to have a few workmen on your balcony drilling a couple of feet from you. The only other downside for me were the floors; for some reason they have unfinished (on purpose) rocks and cement as the floor inside the hotel rooms. Other than it making us very nervous that our 1 year old would totter over and have a hard fall, it wasn't very nice underfoot for me + due to the exposed cement the soles of my feet were frequently dirty. Also our patio windows/doors were all stuck.The plus points are good though... huge and v comfortable bed, we also had a huge bathroom with a nice touch of some flowers in there too. The room was very stylish, going gun ho on the bamboo furniture and the room was a good size. Staff were all very accommodating and it has a nice secluded pool and relaxation area - I imagine once the construction is finished and if they put some nice rugs in the room this would be an awesome hotel - oh and location's great, if a tad noisy.

After searching Tripadviser (the Traveller's best friend) for a hotel that would best suit our needs we chose to stay at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa from the 7th - 11th November in a room with a Kitchen. Great choice!Our room was on the 5th floor at the rear. We chose the 2 double bed option and it meant we had a really good sized room. (obviously you don't have to use both beds!). The Kitchen was separate and was very well fitted out and had stainless steel oven and fridge. Tea and Coffee supplies are included free. Everything was beautifully clean and well presented. We also received a bottle of champagne and chocolates on arrival. A lovely touch.The Bedroom Balcony overlooked the gorgeous pool area. An Oasis in a busy area and very relaxing & inviting,The Bathroom had a shower over the bath, toilet and vanity and was a good size. The room also had a safe which meant we could leave valuables at the hotel.The whole hotel had a comfortable, friendly feel to it and we will definitely go back there next year when we again pass through Hawaii. We've already recommended it to heaps of people.Staff are proffessional (not overwhelming you with wanting to be your best buddy at a moments aquaintance) and extrememly knowledgeable about local attractions and transport.Some previous reviewers have mentioned bugs. We didn't see a single one but that may be because we were not on the lower floors. People can forget that Hawaii is a tropical place and that there are bound to be insects of the tropical kind wherever there are people, restraurants and the like in the area. We strongly recommend you upgrade to a room on the upper floors in any hotel.What did we like best about the Hotel? Definitely the feeling of being in a tropical oasis in the middle of a big city. With regards practicalities, the Hotel location is exceptional if you want access to the Beach (it's 2 blocks from the statue of the 'Duke' on Waikiki beach). A few minutes walk to the International Market, Waikiki Market, the Food Pantry and several ABC Shops. You can also walk along the beach to a number of attractions and a closer look at Diamond Head.Ala Moana Market is a bus ride away. Take the # 8,19,20,23,24 or 42, but the bus stop is just across the road from the hotel.'The Bus' is a great way to travel. A 4 day pass costs $25 and will get you pretty much everywhere including Pearl Harbour (# 20 or 42)and a Circle trip of the Island (Go to the Ala Moana Transfer station then transfer to the #52 or 55).This Hotel is 3 1/2 star but we loved everything about it. We've stayed in dozens of 5 star hotels, but if you want to experience the real Hawaii and it's people then this is the hotel for you. Be independent and catch the bus round the island and jump on and off with your 4 day pass. It's an experience you'll never forget.

Stayed in corner room 1006 from 15th Nov until 24th (missed thanksgiving). The bedroom was spacious and overlooked the pool, but dressing table and luggage rack were on the wobbly side. Kitchenette and bathroom were on the small side but perfectly adequate for our needs.Only time we used the pool area was the day we arrived early (8.30am) and couldn't get into our room as it was still occupied (next time we know to book a room for the night/day we arrive), so after wandering around Waikiki for a bit (only a 3-5 minute walk) we had a relax on the day bed. Definitely made use of the free beach equipment though.Found the hotel very central to the beach, restaurants, food panty and bus stops.All staff were friendly but Puma deserves a special mention.

We had checked this hotel out on line, On arrival we were upgraded ( yeah I know ,,doesnt happen to everyone). Regardless..this hotel has great staff, great rooms, cosy pool and BBQ which we used most nights.Lazy 7 minute stroll to beach...likewise to main shops and restaurants ( dont really need them with a hotel kitchen and poolside bbq).Have recommended this place to my friends and both of them ( yes I have more than 1 friend) loved it.,

The beds are huge! Stayed here for several days while relaxing on the beach. Not too noisy, excellent service. Enjoyed the different free snacks in the lobby each day. Perfect distance from the busy beachfront. Great spa too - had a lovely massage!
Fantastic Staff, fantastic place, perfect location, i cant wait to go back there, Mahalo.
Excellent customer service, great location and it's a beautiful place

Very clean hotel with pillow top mattresses. All rooms have a kitchenette. Complimentary coffee, tea, lemon water on ice and lemonade or ice tea daily in lobby as well as apples!Free for your use on the beach: towels, boogie boards, folding chairs, bamboo matts, air mattresses.BBQ for your use on the pool deck. Pool and hot tub.Everyone was very nice and accommodating. Close to all amenities.Great hotel.
Great locaation and value!! Clean rooms, elevators, lobby, pool, etc. Very comfortable and secure facility. I would highly recommend the Aqua Bamboo Waikiki.

Not sure what else I can add here that others have not already said. Overall, this is a great place to stay in Waikiki, Honolulu--though we would recommend requesting a room that doesn't face the street (which can be very noisy!). Otherwise, it was centrally located and a very nice hotel for the price.

What a fantastic time we had staying at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa for nine days in October. Had a room on the fifth floor two double beds, kitchenette and lots of room.The staff here were fantastic very friendly and had a great rapport with their guests. It's a small boutique hotel with a beautiful pool area and daybeds to hang out in the shade on a hot summer afternoon.Enjoyed the manager's happy hour on thursday's yummy snack food and bamboozle cocktails. Went to the day spa and had a lomi lomi massage.Beach was only five min walk which made this hotel very central to the action of waikiki.Met some lovely people staying at this hotel and lots of aussies who like myself were having a fantastic time.I will definately return sooner rather than later. Mahalo to Nicole& staff for helping us make our holiday to waikiki magical.
What a wonderful stay!Puna was a wonderful help on more then one occasion and gave us great restaurant reviews! Be sure to visit the pool area!

I Keep looking at the reviews as my husband to be and I are arriving at this hotel for our honeymoon on 13 November. I am finding the reviews useful so thank you for that. The travel agent we booked with did offer us the chance to change our reservation due to the works taking place at the hotel but we decided not to change and hope we made the right choice by keeping with the booking. See you in just over a week. Maggie Bird and Craig Pickup

We are two families consisting of 5 and we stayed 14 nights in 2 rooms (kitchenette studio), 5th floor, on the street side. This did not bother us at all, a bit of street noise but you got used to it. The rooms were quite spacious, beds were great (my daughter wanted to take her bed home). My only complaint was that if you didn't drink coffee there was no kettle in the room, we had to boil water on the stove in a saucepan.Location for us was excellant, close to the beach, food stores, restaurants and bus routes. We also had a great tour desk around the corner run by Jack and Bernadette which was recommended to us by Fe and Nicole.The pool area was a great place to unwind and relax, it got plenty of shade and it was quite a relaxing environment. The complimentary tea/coffee and cold drinks in the lobby foyer was a nice touch. You couln't wish for more pleasant and helpful staff from the front desk to housekeeping.I would like to thank the following staff who helped make our stay a great experience- Fe, Raymond, Puna, Revarie, Nicole, Vinata and Craig. A job well done guys.Would we recommend this hotel - YES we would, its not a 5 star hotel but it certainly delivered everything we wanted, from the location, rooms, pool and price. We had a great stay, thankyou to all at the Aqua Bamboo and Spa Hotel

I'd have to say that I feel mislead by the high rating on Trip Advisor. Stayed at the Aqua Palms the last time I was in Oahu, which is why I chose to stay this time with the Aqua Bamboo. We had the room with a kitchenette and 2 double beds. The furniture looks worn and frayed, room is very small. The bathroom needs renovating. The bathroom sink was fitted with a large tall faucet, it would be more appropriate for a kitchen sink. We were on the 7th flr facing the street, very noisy. Did like the fact that they had tea in the lobby. Was a very short walk to Waikiki beach. I would not stay here again.

During a recent October trip we stayed at the Bamboo for 2 nights. The staff were lovely upon check in and all very helpful. The room was alright, large and clean but was on the second floor, near the laundry and I would recommend any visitor to ask to stay on a higher floor because there was a smell in the hallways and my view overlooked some resident flats, which is alright for 2 nights but not great for a longer period of time. Overall we were hardly in the hotel and the construction outside was not intrusive at all. The pool area was quiet and away from the noise of the main strip. I would definitely go to O'ahu again but unlikely to Waikiki but if I did, I would stay here again.

During a recent October vacation my girlfriend and I had the pleasure of staying a week at the Bamboo. I really liked this place,but first things first. This isn't no mega, cookie cutter hotel on the main strip. This is a smaller, older, more personable hotel off the beaten path. And when I say older it is very tastefully renovated with it's own classy style. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite, which I fully appreciated! The room was clean, comfortable and very nice. I really loved the feel of this place, it had the feeling of another time and place (well at least for Waikiki). The staff at the front desk was great, zero complaints at all! I would stay again at this hotel without hesitation and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice affordable hotel off the beaten path. My only negative comment would be the noise on Kuhio Ave. I would recommend getting a room opposite the street. Kuhio Ave is a noisy street! I realize the hotel has no control over the traffic, sirens, the trash trucks or the drunks yelling in the street in the middle of the night but they're there...... Don't say I didn't warn you!
user_name:
BobAbooey505
Costa Mesa, California, United States

review_body: My sister and I stayed at this hotel Oct/11 for two weeks. We had upgraded from a moderate room with a kitchenett to a larger room with a full kitchen.The room had two double beds and three balconies. The room was very clean and they gave plenty of towel. Two of the balconies faced the pool. (as we were at the back of the hotel the construction being done on the hotel front did not bother us).The pool area is lovley. There is complimentary coffee, tea, lemon water and ice tea or lemmonaid in the lobby all day. The location of the Bamboo is about two block from Waikiki beach (about a 5 min. walk).There are plenty of store in the area, with a Foodpanty for groceries about a 5-7 in walk from the hotel. The staff at the Bamboo Hotel are wonderful. They are always friendly and helpful when we asked for either direction or suggesting on good resturants or what tour company to use.We had a wonderfull time in Hawaii and at the Aqua Bamboo hotel. We would stay at this hotel again when in Waikiki.

I stayed here with my partner during October 2011. I reserved a Moderate Hotel Room under 'Aqua's 10th Birthday Special'. On arrival we were relieved that we were able to check in extra early at 9:30 am after a 10 hour plane ride.Big Negatives: There is construction work on the entire front of the building (facing the street). The website says "***Beginning September 6, 2011 the hotel will be undergoing exterior improvements." this belies the true extent of this work. Every balcony facing the street is being worked on and the entire front of the hotel is clad in scaffolding. We could not use our two balconies at all (they were untiled and being resurfaced) and we had to keep the blinds shut from 8am to 5:30pm for our privacy as there were workers going up and down on a suspended scaffold / swing stage outside our window. While the workers were working on or near our balcony the smell of the smoke from their cigarettes filtered through the air con unit and ended up in our room. We could also hear their portable radio blasting out hits and commercials while we tried to have a siesta.The bathroom stank constantly. It could have been really bad mildew but it smelled more like sewage.The air conditioning units rattled very loudly and the noise from the street could be heard clearly coming from the small air conditioning units mounted in the walls.We were sitting in our room on the first day when a Japanese couple barged in with luggage and very confused looks. I guess front desk had rented the same room out twice.A few of the light globes were broken and needed to be replaced.Positives: The pool area is new and pleasant. The actual pool is quite small (impossible to swim laps in). There is also a hot tub, deck chairs and iced tea and lemonade available for free.Free in-room internet with acceptable speed, TV was 32inch Phillips LCD with 36 channels including local and some cable channels (including Discovery) all in 4:3 aspect ratio. Room included a kitchenette with small fridge, plates, bowls, microwave, oven.The location is great, bus stop is straight across the road and it is a short direct walk to Waikiki beach.If you are planning to stay here soon you must request a room overlooking the pool (which is at the rear of the hotel) or facing the sides of the building - there was no construction work going on there. I'd guess that at the rate the work appears to be going (read: slowly) the street facing balconies could be out of action until December.For the price it was acceptable but there should have been a better warning of the major construction work going on and its effect on guests.

Finishing up our trip to Hawaii. The service is excellent and friendly and responsible. They did a wonderful job keeping the room clean. There are very useful amenities including working high-speed internet (bring a LAN cable - Wifi is only available in the lobby), free water/tea service in the lobby, coin-operated washer/dryer on certain floors. Parking is limited and $20/night which is very reasonable in this area. The rooms are as described and clean. We saw no roaches during our stay. There is a kitchenette (hotplate) with sink and coffeemaker and plates/microwave.The location is very central, which makes for noisy nights from the local traffic. Bring earplugs unless you're the most sound of sleepers.

Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 16 nights in September. We absolutely loved it here! The pool area and reception were relaxing and you wouldn't have thought you were next to the busiest part of the area. Nice little touches like the bamboozle and free coffee/apples made it extra special. The staff were all helpful and friendly and gave us tips and printed maps for when we were visiting places nearby. The room was cleaned everyday, the only thing was the maid stopped leaving the coffee in the room towards the end but that was fine as there was coffe downstairs. They also give you shampoo conditioner and body lotion everyday so you dont even need to bring essentials. You also dont need to bring a towel as they supply you with one in return for a towel card.The only small gripe was the refurb work was very loud in the day and we weren't aware of this when we booked. Also next time I am not sure we would look to have a front facing room as it can be a little noisy due to the road outside but nothing unbearable!We will definitely be looking to stay here again and compared to the huge other hotels in the area this is a very cute boutique hotel which is a lot more personal. Thank you Bamboo for a lovely holiday!

Let's face it, Waikiki is fun, but it's also a sea of humanity. I for one don't want that sea to extend into my hotel. Walk into most Waikiki high-rise hotels and you will likely have to bob and weave your way past hordes of tourists just to get to the elevator. You may think you have to stay far away from the action to find peace and tranquility in your lodging, but there's a wonderful alternative just blocks from everything: The Aqua Bamboo.First, the location; situated on Kuhio Avenue, it is truly a three minute walk to the beach, a major grocery store and right across the street from public transportation. It is just far enough from the action to feel like you can breathe.This review pertains to the 1 bedroom suite with kitchenette. Keep in mind your room might be different. The Bamboo is only 12 floors which is smallish by Waikiki standards, but inside you will find a collection of standard rooms and suites. Our suite (1104) is advertised at 400 square feet and feels very spacious. There is a separate area for the kitchenette that is not even visible from the sitting area or bedroom. the kitchenette contained a two burner stove, a mini fridge, and a full-size built-in microwave. Sufficient pans, dishware and utensils were provided. A single serving coffee maker seems to be standard, but to our delight we found a 12 cup coffee maker under the counter. A sliding door off the kitchen opened to a railing with no lanai, but is one of three large sliders that can provide natural light and fresh air. A small table for two completes the space. Exit the kitchen and you find a generous closet that contains a safe and robes for your use while you are there. Enter the bathroom and you see a double sink, a 3x3 foot shower, and a full-size soak tub. Gold fixtures accent the black countertop. Two people can easily move about the bathroom at the same time. Back inside the suite, you are now in the sitting room with a writing desk where there is a wired Ethernet connection. I checked it to be 1MB/s download and .33MB/s upload speeds. It is complementary during your stay. If you bring a 10 foot cable, you can surf from your bed, too. At the other end of the sitting room is a futon, which doubles as a sofa where you can sit and watch the secondary TV nestled in a nook with another mini-fridge. In our room, this nook also contained a DVD player and IPod enabled stereo system. Adjacent to the nook is sliding door number two. Impressed yet?After you get over the amenities and spacious room, you notice the floor is all done tastefully in stone. Bamboo is not just in the name, as walls and furnishings are mostly finished in real bamboo and wood.
