Speaking of wood, separating the sitting room from the bedroom is a gorgeous and substantial louvered folding door, which when closed provides privacy and light filtering for those afternoon naps.Moving into the bedroom, our suite had a massive four-poster king size bed supported by very realistic bamboo stalks at each corner. The entire wall behind the bed was mirrored. Two end tables surround the bed with bamboo wood lamps on each. At the end of the bed was a six-drawer dresser, large enough for longer stays. Above the dresser is your main TV, a large Visio LCD set housed in a tasteful black surround. A sitting bench gives you a place to put on your shoes or set a smaller open suitcase. I found the pillow top mattress comfortable, but the sheets didn't want to stay in place for some reason. By morning, I was untangling myself from them.About the TVs... 30 channels of basic cable are on tap, and are not in HD. You can't plug anything into the main set due to it's mounting, but the secondary TV's inputs are exposed and sport HDMI and composite inputs for your camcorder or media player. Unlike many hotels, the Bamboo has no annoying pay-per-view interface that cripples the sets own remotes. Both TVs use the same Visio remotes so you can pass them back and forth.Speaking of remotes, how about two, count em’, two identical high-tech Mitsubishi air conditioners with remotes? Too cold in bed? Raise the temp without getting up. Fan too high? Want to turn on the motorized vent deflector? All done via the remote. The one in the bedroom sits above the TV. The one in the sitting room is in the entertainment nook and cools the rest of the suite. Some rooms in the hotel may have older AC units, but these were powerful and quiet.Now it's out to your lanai. Only average in size, ours was provided with two sturdy wooden chairs and a small table for your coffee or mai-tais. Our view was to the west. The city views were stunning and fun to watch. Some miscellaneous comments...During our entire stay, I never saw one bug, only one little tiny Gecko (and I mean tiny!) out in the hall. We did see ladies of the night, but not in front of the hotel. They are all over Waikiki and are no reflection on the Bamboo or it's location, which felt nice and safe to us. After 10pm you must use your card key to enter.The two smallish elevators were fast and prompt. We never waited more than about one minute for them to arrive.The pool area is a true Mecca, and if you are not happy lounging in your room or on the beach with the free towel service, you can go out there and rest in peace and quiet on padded chairs and lounges.We loved the staff who were attentive when you needed them and unobtrusive when you didn't.Conclusion: for the price of a standard room in a big name hotel one or two blocks closer to the beach, you can have a private oasis in the middle of the frenzy that is Waikiki. It must be the Zen.

My trip was the last week of April and the first week of May. Aqua Bamboo is a very nice place. The front desk personnel were all very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Great with restaurant information, although we (my daughter and I) had breakfast at Denny's every morning (ask for Tina or Mona, they were great). The property is on a busy street, however, every street in Honolulu is busy. We stayed on the fifth floor, facing Kuhio. We were about a block and a half from the ocean. Two to three blocks from Kapiolani Park, where the Zoo and the Aquarium are located. The parking area is very small. Only room for about 8 cars, so make reservation for a space early if you want to park there. I did and I'm glad I did. However there is a garage about a block away if you can't get a space. One incident that I found great. During our stay we had a power failure across Waikiki. I was washing my clothes at the time. The backup generator kicked in while the washer was running and the washer kept on running. In fact the only way I knew that out power was out was when I mentioned to the front desk that our cable wasn't working. Believe me I appreciate that generator.The back yard pool is a beautiful sight. Very nice landscaping. There is massage spa there also. We didn't use this service. In the lobby are two drink stations. One with iced tea and one with lemonade. A very nice thing to return to especially since the trade winds failed us for about three day. A morning newspaper is available by the lobby elevator as an internet connection. In all honesty, I would have preferred to stay at a place on the ocean front, but when I go back, I will most likely stay at this location again. I really have no complaints but, lots of praise. I highly recommend this property.

Wish I can write a better review but no. Cockroaches in a 3* hotel is unacceptable. We did some reseach and read great reviews about this hotel so we were very disappointed to get a medium-warm welcome at the check-in desk and have thumb-size running cockroaches in the room and the bathroom. We booked through the hotel's website and didn't get the supposedly included breakfast. Only + of this hotel: Location is great & rooms have good soundproofing.

Stayed 5 nights. Location fantastic. In all directions 5 mins from anywhere you need to be. Day staff very good. Had problems with air conditioner noise for 2 nights and it was handled by reception immediately and with the upmost understanding. Staff even moved our luggage for us to new upgraded room. There are alterations being done and the noise is sometimes quite bad. But as we were out most days is didn't effect us greatly. Do feel sorry for the staff though, they have to work with this noise Monday to Friday. All in all would recommend this hotel to anyone who dos'nt expect a 5 star hotel. You ware not paying 5 star but you are certainly getting near to that grade for much less. The pool area is great and the free cold and hit drinks available 24/7 is appreciated.

A very nice place to stay. Right in the actionzone! The rooms are not big, but spacious enough for a couple. Beds are comfy. It's also very clean, relatively quiet and the staff was friendly. However, we didn't like the fact that the supposedly included breakfast (we booked with expedia) did no longer excist. In fact, they had quit serving breakfast 9 month earlier. That was kind of a bummer because we were counting on it!The pool area was pretty sweet! Urban yet tropical, we loved it! On tuesday they arranged a managers reception, with their 'Bamboozle' cocktail and Hawaiian style snackes! All free of charge, very welcoming!In the lobby they have internet access and free icetea/lemonwater/coffee&tea!Would definitely recommend..

I read so many reviews of Waikiki hotels before booking this one. And I've got to say, I wasn't disappointed. Some people on here have complained that the hotel isn't 5 star quality - well, that's because it's not a 5 star hotel! But it's a seriously outstanding hotel for its star rating and price. It's very clean with nice decor. Before we arrived I emailed the staff, hoping to secure a room on the quieter side of the hotel. Not only did they give us the room, but they waived the additional fee it would have cost us for the upgrade because it was our anniversary! We arrived at the hotel early in the morning, and our room wasn't available yet, but the staff were more than happy to hold our luggage while we went exploring. When we came back, our bags were already in our room, the air conditioner was on and champagne and chocolates awaited us! It's the little things about this hotel that make it great - from the free beach towel service to the cold drinks and fruit in the foyer. The staff were friendly and helpful, happy to make phone calls to secure or confirm bookings for us, and the housekeeping staff is wonderful! Not only did they make our bed and give us clean towels, they also tidied our shoes and restocked our toiletries! We had such a wonderful time, it was very difficult to leave, but we hope to come back in a few years time, maybe with kids in tow!

Aqua Bamboo is having one of the most friendly staff in Hotels of Waikiki. I am dare to say that is due to I also experienced service from Hotel Kalaha, Hilton Hawaiian Village, Royal Hawaiian, Halekunali Hotel and hotel renew (there are 40 of us had holiday in Hawaii at the same time). The staff actually went out of their way to help my stay there comfortable.Apart from that, the hotel is old and the full renovation is too loud to call it improvement. I do noticed the web site said "Beginning September 6, 2011 the hotel will be undergoing exterior improvements.Please note that the pool and outer sanctuary will remain open for the duration of the project. The hotel will take special care to minimize disruption to guests during your stay. All work will be limited to weekdays from 9:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m."It is not improvement, as soon as 9am hit, the work on the wall was simple too loud for anyone to sleep in. I am on holiday, and sometime prefer a little bit of sleep in but it is simple too loud for it.The room is a bit too old to said it is newly renovated. The design of the room is still old and the pipes in the bathroom are still having rust over it.However, the room is clean and comfortable..I am only provide the hotel with three stars is due to the exterior renovation is simple way too loud to call it improvement. And I am feeling the hotel does not take special care to minimize the noise level.

Stayed 7 nights at the Aqua Bamboo for our two year anniversary. We were greeted with a bottle of champagne and macadamia chocolates for indicating a special occasion when we made the reservation. We were also upgraded to the Studio Kitchenette for sharing our stay on facebook/twitter for advertising purposes (based upon availability).Very old hotel, but renovated rooms. We were close to booking at the Aqua Aloha Surf and are sooo glad we didn't! Aqua Bamboo rooms are roomy enough and clean for the excellent price! Cute little oasis/pool/spa in the back and about 2 blocks from the beach! Customer service was outstanding--front desk staff was always super friendly and greeted us each time we came in and out of the hotel. Everyone (especially Puna) made the effort to reach out and genuinely seemed interested in what we were up to each day of our vacation!Next time we travel to Hawaii, we would like to stay at a hotel right on the beach, but for our first college-students-on-a-budget trip together, this was a perfect choice.
Had a great time here, stayed on three different occasions. Very reasonable, and walking distance to waikii beach, shopping, plenty of resturants. Internet service in Lobby, Pool area great.
Even tho there was annoying drilling going on which was unpreventable , the staff was very accomodating.2 blocks from the beach.

We stayed the first three nights of our ten day holiday in Hawaii at the Aqua Bamboo and it fitted our requirements. We hadn't visited Oahu for 20 years, and it was a good place to get re-acquainted with the area. The first impression when we arrived at night was that it was a bit tired and dingy, but after a good nights sleep (we turned the noisy air-conditioner off), we had a look around the place and were happy with what we found. Our room was fine - had a microwave and refrigerator. It was clean and tidy and the bed was comfortable. There was an ipod station and flat screen tv. Internet was free. The pool area made it for me. We spent quite a few hours there - just sitting in the shade winding down. They had free apples, a free newspaper and iced water or iced tea and a coffee machine in the foyer - nice touch. They don't mind you taking food to the pool area and I saw some people having a beer there, so obviously that is fine too. This place is not a luxourious, high end hotel, but it's clean, tidy, well positioned and well priced. Our room overlooked an apartment building and I would say that pool view would be nicer and quieter too as they are away from Kuhio Ave which is busy and noisy.

We ended up enjoying our stay very much. Fe and Raymond looked out for us with our room request, local travel ideas and ensuring that we had the best the hotel had to offer. The housekeeping lead was also above and beyond, but I didn't get her name. We were so impressed by their genuine care, we felt compelled to leave thank you tokens for them. The room we ended up in, 11th floor - was very lovely, luxurious and felt like a 'vacation' room - pretty bathroom fixtures, small ocean view, king bed - really lovely. The value for the price was great. I would look into staying there again, but have to say, it was because of the day crew's hospitality. There was a noticeable difference in the care/concern of the afteroon staff. I heard them talking about hotel guests, rolling their eyes when we had to get our luggage twice and just lacking the genuine smile and interest that the day team expressed. Were it not for the service of the day staff, we would not have stayed. My advice? Ask a lot of questions. If you are not happy, tell someone. If you get less than great service (we got GREAT service) - tell someone so those that are invested and care about their hotel can help you. Would stay here again if I got the service of those who went above and beyond. They even sent me some pink flowers for my birthday, along with a bottle of champagne and some chocolates. PEOPLE make all the difference.

We had a 6 night stay at this hotel which was personally recommended to us by our wonderful travel agent Linda at Charter Travel. We initially liked the look of the Best Western Coconut, but we decided to put our trust in Linda and take the leap of faith in believing her! We were not disappointed! Thank you Linda!! We arrived after a very long flight via SFO to be dealt with a lovely lovely member of staff called Fe, she advised us that we were been offered a free upgrade to the Penthouse Suite!! She let us have a good look around to make sure it suited our party of 3 and we snapped her hand off!! The PH was lovely, it was clean, well equipped, well presented and beautiful surrounding views around Waikiki. I cannot say we encountered any rude or unhelpful staff members, they all welcomed you with an Hello or Goodbye and a smile. This hotel has quite a nice cosy feeling to it, rather than some of the rather taller and more imposing hotels nearby. I would imagine that the likes of the Hyatt, Sheraton and Aston are also double or treble the price that the Aqua Bamboo! The location is great, you are literally 2 or so blocks away from the main front of Waikiki Beach, all it's shops and restaurants. All in all this hotel is good value for money for location and cleanliness, the staff are helpful and polite. The only gripe which is something all guest have to live with is the noise level! Sirens are constantly going day and night, and general traffic noise is very loud. But it's a small price to pay to live in paradise for a week or so!! I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and go back tomorrow!

My husband and I stayed in September on our first visit to Hawaii. Our room was nice and clean with a fridge and microwave. The location was very good, just a couple of blocks to the beach and close to restaurants and shops. Nice pool area as well. Parking was a challenge - very steep entry-way and tight parking spaces!

My husband and I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo August 27-31 while island hopping. Our room was updated and nice and clean. The location was very good, just a short walk to the beach and very convenient to plenty of restaurants and shops. Also, we really appreciated the beach chairs and boogie boards that are available for use for free. Our only complaint at all is that front desk staff was never friendly. We actually felt uncomfortable having to ask them for anything. No one working there made us feel welcome in any way...Oh well, the room was nice and overall our stay was pleasant.

Stayed in August and September 2011 and found staff friendly. Some decor is dated but the painters were in and new sign going up. There's also a view of the sea from there if you are on higher floors. Complimentary tea ,coffee, beach chairs and towels. Close to Waikiki. Lovely courtyard albeit with cracked pavers but nice spa and pool with waterfall and palms. Basic and comfortable. No breakfast but great breakfast at neaby cafe called Keoni.

This hotel has a lot of features that much more expensive hotels have. Service was fantastic; when we couldn't use the wine opener, they sent up a seemingly brand new one that they purchased from the store. Really good value. Room was nice and big with two "terraces."

This was my first trip to Hawaii and this place was recommended by a friend who had stayed previously and was returning with me The staff are amazingly helpful and always pleasant. The hotel is located in a great spot - close to the International Marketplace, a short walk from Macy's, close to lots of good eating places and bars. Quick local bus ride to Ala Moana or shuttles can also be arranged. The reception has some very comfortable chairs and couches and what was really impressive was what else was offered in reception. There is always iced tea, cold lemon water, fresh fruit and the daily newspaper available free of charge. The pool is clean and a lovely oasis from the heat with lots of shade available. Our room was lovely and cleaned daily. The only slightly troubling issue was a clunky and quite noisy room air conditioner, however this was the only concern which wasn't enough to affect our stay. I can't recommend this place highly enough, and hope to return again soon.

You know you're somewhere average when you have to take your own luggage to your room. The staff in the loby rarely looked up and acknowledged us as we came and went(except for one friendly and helpful young man). The room (with kitchenette) was tidy, clean and roomy but you could easily forget you were in beautiful Hawaii as it was furnished and decorated in various tones of brown. These negatives can be overlooked but the noise is very difficult to overcome. Firstly there is no central airconditioning and the wall units are incredibly noisy and rattled. Then there's the street noise from the traffic and passers by. We requested a room change but there were none available. We worked out the best way to get some sleep was to have the constant air-con noise drown out the outside noise and we wore ear plugs to drown out the air-con noise! Not very romantic considering we were there for our wedding anniversary. The only feature that was remotely close to a 3 star hotel were the complimentary robes but overall this is a very well located two star hotel.....simple, clean and uninspired.

We booked this hotel through our travel agent, but only stayed one night before transferring to a different Aqua hotel. Reasons we chose Aqua Bamboo: 1. Images on the website looked very nice. 2. There were many good reviews. 3. The Oahu Revealed travel book lists it as a "real gem". http://www.wizardpub.com/oahu/oraquabamboo.html4. Excellent location for Waikiki Beaches. 5. We got a good rate. Reasons we left: 1. We saw a roach on the wall as soon as we walked in and had to kill about 10 of them in one nights stay. 2. Our balcony had no furniture and the view was directly into the neighboring apartments window. (We saw some people in their underwear!) 3. It is a little outdated In Summary: If you see recent reviews of a roach problem before you book your stay then I wouldn't recommend staying here. Although there was the roach problem on the first day, I can say that they seemed to handle it very well and we didn't see any additional insects before we packed up and left. We transferred from this Aqua (Bamboo) to Aqua Palms because we had stayed there about a year ago and had a pleasant experience. Aqua Bamboo made the transfer seamless and there was no hassle or questions asked. We basically packed up our stuff and moved, while they handled all the leg work as far as billing/booking/etc.

We are frequent return customers of the Aqua Bamboo (5th visit with them) and will return soon we hope. The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki on Kuhio Avenue, a 1 minute walk to Waikiki beach and great restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff are lovely: friendly, hard working, accomodating, no request denied. Upon entering the lobby, you feel like you are in a spa with the scented aromatherapy, fresh apples, hot facial towels upon arrival. The hotel rooms are newly renovated, very stylish, nicely decorated and comfortable. The beds are very comfortable. There is laundry machines and driers available on four floors. We have never had any complaints here at all and feel like it is a "home away from home". Nicole, the manager is a lovely lady who does her very best to welcome guests and accomodate special requests. There is free Wi-fi in the lobby and free internet in the hotel rooms. They loan free beach chairs, boogie boards and beach inner tubes. We recommend this to anyone who wants to stay at a gorgeous boutique hotel but at budget prices!!

This is an economy hotel with minimum amenities. It's location is convenient - close to Yikiki Beach, stores including supermarket, and (tour) bus stops. The staff was friendly. Nothing extremely positive jumped at me - neither too clean nor too dirty. And the sleep quality here wasn't exactly satisfactory. Due to its location (on major thoroughfare), it was noisy at night. Worse still, I found bugs (swarms of them) running away when I turned on the light at night. The staff was sympathetic, but they said, it's inevitable because of tropical climate and these bugs don't bite. Unfortunately I got bitten during my last night. For a budget hotel, it's not very cheap, but I guess that's expected because of its location.

Great hotel with a beautiful Spa and "grotto" courtyard with pool, jaccuzi, etc. Right on Kuhio in the middle of Waikiki and a 5 minute walk to the beach, restuarants, etc. Some rooms have fantasic ocean views and it is one of the few hotels downtown that has rooms with Kitchenettes. We stayed 4 nights while waiting to move into our new apartment a short distance away. (It's also on the military TLA-authorized list, btw, and they will send the bill staright to the Army for you, vioce charging you.) Some of the rooms are small, but still very comfortable. High floors are better as there are always cars in Waikiki. There is limited guest parking in the garage downstairs from the hotel, but a reasonably priced (for Waikiki) public garage only 100m away. (Military on TLA get a spot downstairs for free!)The courtyard area is really special and we spent several hours there. Would stay again and recommend to visitors!

We recently stayed at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa for 4 nights and loved it! I did expect the location to be a bit noisy, being only 2 short blocks from Waikiki Beach, but it was surprisingly quiet and I slept like a log in their comfy beds. We arrived very early (after an overnight flight) to be greeted at reception by a cold glass of juice, a refreshing cool damp flannel and a seamless checkin. Our rooms were not ready yet (we expected this), so we left our bags and went off exploring. As it happens we did not make it back to the Bamboo until 12 hours later - to find that our bags had already been moved to our rooms for us - much appreciated Bamboo! On arriving at our rooms, we were delighted by lovely orchids placed on our beds and in the bathroom and spotlessly clean rooms. One of my friend's was celebrating a special birthday while we were there and the Bamboo team surprised her with a cake, some chocolates and a bottle of bubbly - she was thrilled and felt very special. The facilities at the Bamboo, along with the lovely pool area and colocation with the Spa (which we unfortunately did not use) make me definitely want to stay here again! The lobby area is also beautifully decorated and makes for a relaxing spot to hang out while awaiting your next Oahu adventure. The hotel is a very short walk to everywhere you will want to go in Waikiki and close to the trolley stops.

I thoroughly enjoyed staying at the aqua bamboo and spa, the highlights! refreshments in the foyer of home made lemonade, ice tea and lemon water :), the staff were very friendly, the pool is gorgeous and its location for me was perfect, the room was clean and very comfortable.

Stayed here for one night during a long layover in Honolulu. The staff was very nice but the room was just small, old & felt unsafe. I had a 2nd floor room on the side so I had a nice view of other people's apartments and their drying laundry. The tub didn't drain, there's no Wi-Fi in the rooms and it just felt a little dirty overall. The location is decent but has no ocean view whatsoever. One good thing is that it is very near the bus stop but really, just stay someplace else (and remember to use your AAA card as a lot of hotels give discounts for it).

We stayed at Aqua Bamboo for 5 days in April 2011. Let's get the facts out right away - this is not a resort, it is a hotel. Not a fantastic hotel, but definitely not bad either. It's located a few minutes walk from the 'heart' of downtown Waikiki, and about a 10 or so minute walk from the beaches. The lobby staff is friendly and helpful, and you can have a key to get in if you plan on coming back to the room after about 9pm or so. The rooms are pretty good - nothing special, but clean and comfortable, and all of them (I think) have their own lanai. Of course, the view from your lanai is the lanais of an apartment complex across the street, with people hanging out their laundry, etc :) But this hotel is pretty reasonably priced if you're looking to stay on a budget, and it's within a few minutes walk of anywhere you might want to go in town or on the beach. One more thing - the spa is actually pretty nice, and has great massage therapists. A definite recommend, even if you don't stay here.

The Aqua Bamboo and Spa is an older hotel.The ceilings are low, no soaring atrium here. The building itself tapers upward. Consequencly the rooms get smaller as you go to rooms on the upper floors. We were on the top floor and the room could accomodate only a regular size bed. The building is showing its age. There is a washer and dryer on the top floor balcony but you must be able to stand at the railing and not have a fear of heights. PHEW!The staff was quite good and it is in a good location; we had to walk only two blocks to the pick-up point for the tour busses.

I needed time away and took a solo vacation to Waikiki - simple, inexpensive and easy. This hotel kept coming up on Hawaiian Airlines Vacations and I was drawn to it by it's simplicity and price. However, from the initial check in to the moment I left the hotel 6 nights later, I felt like I was with old friends. The staff- everyone included, was exceptionally and most importantly to me, genuinely, nice. I may not have been with old friends, but I definitely left with new friends. I will not stay anywhere else from now on. I've stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Mandarin Oriental and felt nowhere near this comfortable. My housekeeper was truly amazing. I don't know how she did it, but she anticipated the things I liked from the smallest clues and then cleaned my room to my standards every day. (Her name was Josie, by the way.) Ray, the daytime Bellman, was extremely helpful and had the most positive approach to life that I've experienced in a very long time. Nicole, the guest services manager had the same warmth and genuineness that the rest of the staff had. She was very informative about all the hotels offerings, including the Spa. Fe, at the front desk, always had a smile on her face- and could handle any amount of guests with ease. I can't remember everyones name- but I can tell you that this was an experience that I've never had at any hotel before. I truly think that everyone was honestly happy at their jobs- which is what made the experience so good. Oh, the night staff was awesome too! I was up at all hours of the night and day, and the night staff was really nice, professional and yet relaxed at the same time. I used to travel for work and would be in hotels in Seattle, Salt Lake City, Boise, Las Vegas and various cities in California 6 days out of every week. I honestly can say out of all the dozens of hotels I've stayed at- maybe more than 50 different hotels over the years, I have not experienced this rare combination of great people and wonderful service, cleanliness, safety and fun at any hotel- ever.

It was our 2nd trip back to Honolulu/Waikiki staying at the Aqua Bamboo once again. We checked-in late at night with no problems. Like last year, we stayed at the very same floor but in a different room. We also received a very kind "welcome back" box of chocolates from the Aqua Bamboo staff. Daily housekeeping made sure our rooms were clean and tidy. Every staff member was very friendly on our return making us very important people.The were some negatives parts such as some night traffic noise from Kuhio Ave, but it was mainly quiet from our 10th floor room. Also they discontinued the continental breakfast that had pastries, pineapple juice, fresh kona coffee, and fruit. That didn't bother us too much though.Again the Aqua Bamboo was close by to Waikiki Beach, Kalakaua and Kuhio Ave, restaurants, International Market Place, and the Royal Hawaiian Shopping center.I still miss Honolulu to this very day, but I won't forget our memorable stay at the Aqua Bamboo hoping one day I'll be back.BC

The hotel staff were very helpful. We were upgraded to a ocean view room, which had a kitchenette (very handy!) when they found out we had just become engaged. We would come back to stay here any day, and have already recommended it to our friends and family.
Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Gift shop had some nice items including clothing reasonably priced. Room was clean, comfortable and appealing.

My daughter and I stayed in room 702 from 7/31 through 8/6 at the Bamboo. Nicole, Puna & Fe provided excellent service as well as others who's names I didn't catch. Loved the pool, the reception on Thursday night, and the recommended Tours4Less guidance. We loved this calm, peaceful Hotel. Many thanks for providing a great environment. Kim & Sarah LaForce

My husband and I stayed here for 1 night on the last night of our honeymoon. (We had only 1 night in Honolulu.) From the website photos and Trip Advisor info, we were expecting a cute, little, modern boutique hotel, and that's not really the case.The lobby is an assault on the senses - so much decoration, knick-knacks, and scents! There was an overpowering peppermint smell that had us flying through the lobby any time we had to pass through there. It wasn't necessarily a bad smell, but it was so strong, you felt like you were living inside a York Peppermint Patty. Strange. The pool was also not super appealing. We walked out there to check it out, and the hot tub was tiny, cold, and did not look like water we would want to get in.Our room was run down, and it felt like we were staying in someone's apartment. The furniture is mismatched and not in great shape - The decor looks like a bachelor's apartment who is just out of college and has been collecting friend's furniture (we even had a futon covered in a sheet in the living room.) It was just a little odd. However, it was CLEAN which is critical (except for the random Solo cup under the sink cabinet - again, reminiscent of a young guy's bachelor pad!) The window unit AC does rattle, as I read in another review.It appeared that people individually own the rooms and perhaps the hotel rents them out nightly? Like a condotel? This may be the reason for the rooms not looking nearly as good as the website. Perhaps each room looks somewhat different because of different owners?That said, the good things were: friendly staff, very affordable, clean, and very good location (walking distance to lots of great stuff.)All in all, it was just an odd little place. Not quirky fun odd, just plain odd. We would not return. We'd rather pay a little extra for an overall better experience.

We have spent many hours reviewing various hotels in Honolulu for our honeymoon in Hawaii. After reading the feedback on this hotel, booking here was an obvious choice. We want our honeymoon to be perfect and are sure we will have a fantastic experience at the Aqua Bamboo and Spa when we stay from October 4 to October 15. Thank you to everyone who has reviewed this hotel - your feedback will help ensure our honeymoon will be amazing!Looking forward to meeting all of the wonderful staff at Aqua and enjoying all of the amenities!Alyshia Higgins & Mike Van Veen

I am not sure I want to make this comment,as I do not want to give away one of the best kept secrets in Waikiki, but I will anyway. The Aqua Bamboo is the Zen place to stay while visiting Waikik whether traveling for business or pleasure. It is a beautiful, intimate place with freindly helpful staff. Off the main drag and around the corner from the beach, it is easily acccessable to anywhere you want to go. I had a full kitchen and 3 lanais from my spacious room. It felt like home and I could easily "live" there.Mahalo to the Aqua Bamboo for such a great experience.
Great location, really nice room, good facilities if you want to cook for yourself, wonderful bed!!, and the pool area was just fabulous.

We were two couples travelling together and our flight was late so they gave us the penthouse instead of separate rooms. The penthouse which took up the full 13th floor. The price was much cheaper than individual rooms and included a full two bedroom suite with two bathrooms, large fully equiped kitchen, a large dining room and livingroom. There were big screen TVs in each bedroom and the living room. The master bathroom also included a large sauna and whirlpool bath. The balcony extended all around the building so we had panoramic view of Waikiki. Although an older hotel the suite was clean and very comfortable, the staff was helpful and very courteous. Free WiFi in the lobby and free high speed cable in the suite. There is a nice pool and a separate garden area. The only down side is the elevator does not go to the top and you are required to walk up one flight. We are all ever 60 years old and we had no problem with this.We really enjoyed our stay there and will try to book it next time we return to Waikiki.

My wife and I recently spent 10 nights at the Aqua bamboo & Spa. We were part of a 20 person ukulele orchestra from Australia, and had been invited to perform in the annual International Ukulele Festival in Waikiki on July 17, 2011. Another couple from our group also stayed at the Aqua Bamboo. We absolutely loved our stay at the hotel - the reception staff were exceptionally friendly, courteous, and helpful in every way; and were only too happy for people from our group (who were staying at other venues) to come to the Aqua Bamboo for a few rehearsals around the beautiful pool area; and the house staff likewise were always helpful and friendly. The rooms and amenities are the "older style" in design, but very clean and comfortable. The lobby area is also extremely welcoming (iced tea and lemon water always available), and very comfortable and relaxing. Paula and I would most certainly stay at the Aqua Bamboo again, and have no hesitaion at all in recommending it to other visitors and travellors. Aloha and mahalo.Dennis & Paula BrowneNewcastle, NSW, Australia

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in May 2011. We chose this hotel due to the location, price and ratings on TA. The hotel does not include parking like many other hotels in Honolulu. We chose to park our rental in the lot next door because it was cheaper ($15 vs $20 at the hotel). The location is very central for going to the beach and also for the downtown area. You are never more than a 3 minute walk to anything. There are stores on the street, transit etc. Our experience with Aqua began a little bit bumpy due to one staff member who was very rude. We checked prices and availability before arriving and the staff member that was working the night we arrived was actually quite rude. After dealing with this young lady we decided that we would only stay the one night. We had called before hand and were told about gov't rates and CAA rates etc. and the price was good, but when we talked to the staff member in person she was being very difficult and would not give us that rate. She had told us that she has one room available for government rate (which by the way was not government rate!!). We get to our room and it is facing the traffic and is on level 2, right above the lobby. Nothing can drown out the sound. We decided that we were done with the hotel but called down to the lobby and just wanted to see if we could possibly change rooms and get the government rate. We spoke with Fe and she was amazing.We got moved to a temporary room due to a mix up and ended up with a pool view suite for 2 nights at the cheap rate. We then got moved after our room became available. The hotel itself is actually a little run down, but has all the basic things that are needed in a hotel. Washing machines, pool, coffee and juices all day for free in the lobby. They also had a pool party that was free. It included finger foods and alcoholic beverages, there was also food for purchase and the money was donated to charity. The pool was small but nice and clean, the lobby had free Wi-fi and couches all over, it also had some computer stations that you could pay to use. Parking was not free, $15(24 hrs) for next door above ground parking or in the Bamboo itself for $20 per night. Price was good, I would not pay the full-price for the pool view suite as its not amazing but it is nice if you need a full kitchen. Hotel is a little older, staff are alright if you find the nice ones. Good location about 5 min walk from beach. I will probably stay here again if the prices are the same or cheaper. I would not pay more than $110 per a night though. Avoid rooms facing Kuhio or ask for a room higher up to get away from the noise.

We have stayed here twice. Great little hotel in a top location. Nice pool area, friendly staff and very close to the beach and shops. Very clean and the kitchenette is good for having a light breakfast/meal for a family. The only negative is that outlook from some of the rooms is a bit ordinary (looking over apartments next door for example) but then it is not a five star hotel. Will be back.

We really enjoyed the Aqua Bamboo in Waikiki. Fe at check in was very nice. The lobby smelled really good and was clean. The room was clean, but small. It was average, nothing fancy. It was fine for us though. It is in a great location central to everything and easy walking distance for food, beach and shopping. Would stay here again! Ceiling fan in room didn't work, so that was a bummer. Be sure to try the Bamboozle on Thurs, it is really good!

My husband and I stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in July and had a nice stay. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from the beach (right behind the Hyatt) and was within easy walking distance of restaurants, shops and the beach. Our room had a very nice view of the pool area, although some of the rooms have a city view, which was not that nice (we had a city view on our second stay later in the trip). The rooms were clean, as was the lobby. We did have difficulty signing onto the free WIFI in the lobby and the workers were unable to help. They were very kind and tried their best. All in all, the Aqua Bamboo is a good value for the price.

I apologise for my tardiness in writing this review. I want to start by saying that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this establishment and would highly recommend it to friends and family. The staff was courteous and helpful and made me feel at home during my stay. The staff exceeded my expectations and made my stay that much more enjoyable.With respect to location, I couldn’t have asked for a better location within my price range. In addition, I felt safe as the beach and restaurants were within close proximity. I stayed at the hotel for two weeks in mid-December and used transit daily, which was right across the street. I also took the bus to Hanauma Bay a couple of times and the transit stop was a block away.I was very pleased upon arrival to be upgraded to a lovely poolside room with all the amenities that were perfect for my stay. Since I was travelling solo, I could not afford to spend too much on a room, but was looking for a hotel that was clean and in a great location and this hotel fulfilled that requirement. I was hoping that my two-week stay would entitle me to a reduced rate, but was happy to receive an upgrade at no additional cost. The Management Reception along with entertainment was excellent. Nicole even demonstrated her talent with Hawaiian dance for all the guests to enjoy. Nicole was extremely helpful during my stay with great advice and directions.The only complaint I would have is that a couple of the families did not ask their children to remove the floating devices from the pool, which in my opinion, is very discourteous to the other guests and staff. I saw a staff member in the morning removing all the toys prior to cleaning the pool and felt sorry for him. He didn’t complain at all, but I was disappointed that the parents/children felt that is was someone else’s responsibility to pick up after them.If and when I go back to Waikiki, I would stay at this hotel again. Thank you very much for my lovely stay and I hope that you continue keep up the gold standard for service and cleanliness.Kim D.

We stayed at Aqua Bamboo for a week in July; I was carefully checking the reviews on this website prior to booking as I knew it was an older hotel and wasn't sure what to expect. Most of the reviews were positive so we booked. The hotel was just as expected, small, older hotel in decent condition, with a nice relaxing pool area and friendly and helpful staff. The management welcomed us with a small bottle of champaigne and a box of chocolates which was very much appreciated. The room was nicely equipped, had everything one may need during a stay, although some areas could still use a bit of sprucing up, such as the rusty bath tub drain, dusty window screens and air conditioner. We specifically requested a non-kitchenette room as we were not planning to eat in, but it was nice that the room had a small fridge and a microwave. We made great use of the lanai (balcony) each evening, sipping our drinks and people watching from above. We did not partake in the Thursday night activities that the managment organizes for the guests as we were out most evenings, but we did appreciate the free daily newspaper and free internet in the room.The location was excellent, a short walk to the beach, stores, bus stop, etc. We had a wonderful trip which we will fondly remember for years to come, and enjoyed our stay very much, however, we probably would not stay here again as we just found that we tend to enjoy a little more 'luxury' when we travel. I would though recommend it to those looking for a clean, budget friendly stay in Waikiki.

Came here for a week as the price was amazing and the room was fine--the only problem was the bathroom--it was just so small. Other than that the room has everything that you would ever need, mini fridge, microwave. The location is great because you can walk to the beach and check out Waikiki. There was this grocery store right behind the hotel which was nice for any snacks and cravings late at night! The rooms were clean and nothing fancy! Just cheap and fun!

I recently stayed at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa on a trip I took with my son. I read all the reviews on tripadvisor, which definitely helped me make my decision to stay here. I arrived kind of late in the evening and had trouble finding parking. I learned that there was a parking garage right next door for $15/night, which isn't too bad for Honolulu. We stayed on the 2nd floor next to the road, so our room was VERY NOISY. The cars, buses and people outside our lanai kept us up late some nights. That's not to mention the loud air conditioning unit, which was so loud that it would wake me up in the middle of the night. Other than those problems, the hotel and room was very nice. I stayed in a kitchenette that had a good selection of dishes/utensils. The bathroom was small but doable. I enjoyed the Managers Reception and the bamboozle drink that was served was yummy! My son loved the pool and I didn't mind laying out while he was swimming. The pool area is very quiet and laid back. The location is great, only 2 blocks away from Waikiki.The people were very hospitable, for the most part. Overall, worth the money paid & I'll definitely stay here again (if I can be in a room facing the pool =)

We stayed at Aqua Bamboo for two nights prior to our crusie on the Pride of America. I prefer smaller hotels and this one was perfect. We had requested a room with a view and were pleasanlty surprised to find out our room had 3 balconys. Two had a view of the pool which Aqua has made into a relaxing oasis in the center of the city. The other balcony faced an apartment building but we just avoided going out onto that one. We enjoyed the Thursday "happy hour" by the pool. It was very friendly, a woman and her daughter got up and danced a hula and even the staff clapped when it was over. It was a quick 2 block walk to the beach and the hotel provided towels, chairs, and floats to make your beach experience more comfortable. It was very quick and easy to walk to places to eat and the bus stop and the staff was very helpful in directing you there. This hotel provides you with value for your money.

We stayed in room 701 in the Bamboo Spa. What a beautiful place. Half is hotel and half is privare condos. We were in a private studio and when checking in was told we have the best unit in the complex and I would have to agree. Everything and I mean everything was new. Beautiful black marble kitchenette. Glass bowl sink in the bathroom, only unit with a king bed, flat screen T.V and wifi. We loved the view overlooking the pool and out towards the ocean. Easy walking distance to everything. The staff are really nice. Free lemonade and iced tea in the lobby everyday. Had dinner at Moose Mcgilicuddy's, cheesecake factory, Dukes Barefoot bar (Of Course) and LaCucuracha's, all were amazing and large serves. Get Tony from Airport Blue line transport (737 4445) to pick you up from the airport. He is a very, very nice man. This is our fourth visit to Hawaii and he looks after us every time. He will take you wherever you want to go at reasonable rates. The aloha markets, pearl harbour, anywhere. Loved every minute of our stay.

A half-dozen of my friends and I were in Honolulu for a masters swim meet, and the swim meet organizers had negotiated some room blocks at a few of the Aqua hotels there. According to various internet sites, this was a 3 star hotel; the others were 2. We booked a studio kitchenette which turned out to be rather small. One of the others in our group booked the same room type and got a room that was easily twice the size of ours, but for the same price... We didn't spend much time in the room as we spent most of our mornings at the swimming pool and most of the afternoons on the beach, so the size wasn't too constraining. The rooms were decently appointed but were nothing fancy. The three worst things about the room were: 1) the showerhead had probably not been de-limed in a while, so the stream was neither strong nor uniform; 2) there were pockets of black mould on the bathroom ceiling and in the air conditioning unit (which was a bit gross); and 3) the in-wall air conditioning unit was incredibly loud, so much so that when the condenser switched on, it caused a vibration you could feel throughout the entire room. This made it rather challenging to maintain a continuous run of sleep during the night, particularly during the first couple of nights when we were still trying to fight the 6 hour time zone change. On the upside, the place was cheap at $129 per night; the swim meet organizers had managed to get a good deal for those of us flying in from around the world for this swim meet. Unlike some others, I didn't find the area "seedy" and my friends and I were not approached by prostitutes at all. My final thoughts... The staff are nice, the rooms are small, there's not a lot of attention to detail as far as cleaning goes and don't expect a good night sleep if you are a light sleeper.

I arrived at the hotel pretty late, due to a delayed flight. When my partner and I got close to the hotel, we called to inquire about where we could park. The staff member who answered the phone kept asking for our name to check our reservation and said she couldn't find my name. That was annoying because I needed to know where to park, and I thought it made more sense to talk about reservations when I actually parked and came in. She then told us that parking was full that night and we would need go to another hotel to park. Whatever, we found street parking and it worked out anyway. When we came in the hotel, she found the reservation under my partner's name and we checked in. She didn't tell us about any features or services that the hotel offers (I guess she assumed we were already fully aware), but just had us sign the necessary paperwork and handed us the key. OK... Her service wasn't bad, but it was good either, hence the title! The location was pretty good and we could walk to shops, restaurants, and the beach. The parking situation was a little stressful, but I assume that most Waikiki hotels have that issue. The room was pretty nice and comfortable. It was clean and I had no complaints on the functionality of anything in that room. We did ask for a King instead of two doubles, and they weren't able to accommodate that request, but that didn't ruin everything. The housekeeping did a good job while we were gone. I didn't really like the internet situation as I was bound to the dresser to use my laptop. I was pretty satisfied with my experience at this hotel, for the money I paid.

We stayed here for the last 4 days of our honeymoon. We had a busy month touring Maui and Big Island so we were looking forward to relaxing in Honolulu. We had a great stay at Aqua Bamboo, from our greeting with fresh cold towels and juice, to our free room upgrade because we were on our honeymoon, we couldn't of asked for more. Robes to wear during your stay, pool/beach towels, a welcome bottle of champagne with chocolates... it was all perfect!This is a great small resort to stay at-- not busy and crowed like to ones on the beach.Its just a 1-2 mins walk to all the restaurants, shopping and of course the famous Waikiki beach!We will def stay here again if when return to Hawaii, Honolulu.

I loved the Aqua Bamboo & Spa. I loved the location, the fact that it wasn't a huge highrise hote, the charm, the decor. I will definitely be staying there again - am looking foward to next year. This hotel was the highlight of my trip on Oahua.

This place was very welcoming. The staff was terrifc and friendly since day till we left. The rooms were very nice and well cleaned. The lanai could be better though. Overall, I would definetly recommend this place to anyone visiting the islands. I would definetly be back again!

My husband and I stayed here the week before our wedding. We were looking for an affordable, centrally located option-the Aqua hotel was perfect. Just a few blocks from the beach, marketplace, and little boutiques, and restaurants along the way!The staff was so kind! Manny helped to bring all our stuff (we had 4 suitcases, and 2 big boxes, and my wedding dress) to our room and gave us a quick tour of the amenities and helped organize our items!Every aspect felt personalized from the folded towels, gently placed orchids, to the warm welcome when you step in the door! I loved the Aqua and we can't wait to return and enjoy all they have to offer!

Just returned from an awesome stay at this great hotel! 1 Block from the world famous Waikiki Beach and shopping. Not only is the location suburb with shops and wonderful neighborhood restaurants in abundance, but the employees and management go wayyyy beyond to make your stay memorable! Our arrival from Texas was grueling. We found our room to be very inviting and comfortable. Thank you to Fe, she upgraded our room apon request and made sure all of our items were moved including our food! We settled into room 801 overlooking the beautiful court yard with swaying palm trees. King bed with a full kitchen was very nice and comfortable! Each day the room was freshened with orchids and a sweet note from housekeeping! Don't get caught up in the big highrise hotels on the beach in tourist mania when you can experience the real essence of Hawaii with local flavor surrounded with the peacefulness of Aqua Bamboo! We will be back~~~ Mahalo~~~

I can't say enough about the experience my wife and I encountered at this hotel. We read all of the tripadvisor reports and I usually read the poor ones first. Big mistake! This boutique hotel was very clean and much like an oasis in the big city. The lobby and pool were beautiful and the rooms were surprisingly nice. I've worked in the hotel business for over 10 years and currently work for an elite name known worldwide for it's standards and butler service. My wife will tell you that I commonly pick things apart when we stay somewhere. In reviewing several rooms, I could not find anything to pick on!Nicole (Guest Service manager) was amazing! My wife being partially handicapped required some special needs at times. Nicole not only accomodated her but literally went offsite to purchase items if they didn't have them. I had some very good experiences with Puna and Hans (Bell men) as well. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Simple but very elegant hotel. Great value for the price. Had the flight and accommodation deal. Very handy location .Restaurant, stores , the beach and the bus are just out front.Staff were excellent and the pool-out door patio was just like being in the Tropics! BeautifulPalm trees, waterfall and Cabanas. Peaceful to relax even though close to the street.Would go back anytime as is more personal and quieter environment compared to the larger, pricier hotels closeby.

Had a great first trip to Hawaii. The Bamboo is in the perfect location right in the heart of Waikiki. Service was excellent and the staff was friendly. Clean room with comfortable pillows and mattresses. If I ever do come back I will stay here again. You really can't go wrong staying here.

My fiancee and I stayed here for 2 nights. We actually transferred from another Aqua hotel because the other one was very dirty. the first thing I liked about Aqua Bamboo is the friendly staff. They really seemed to go out of their way to make sure we have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. They would always greet us as we walked out of the elevator and made sure were comfortable. The hotel offers free coffee and tea all day which is a plus from me because I didnt have to leave the hotel to get drinks. The lobby looks great, new furniture, nice fixtures. The pool looked clean, but the jacuzzi was a bit small ( Its still my favorite spot). There is laundry facility on premises so if you are planning to stay for a while, it is very convenient to do laundry there. Pros--Friendly staff, clean rooms, seems to be recently renovated, short distance to all the hot spots and a short walk to Waikiki beach.Cons--$20 for parking for hotel guests per day (too pricey), charge for wifiOverall Aqua Bamboo was well worth the money!

location, rooms, and serivce all top notch at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa....why fight with the masses in the other HUGE hotels in the area.one block from the beach, right in the middle of waikiki on Kuhio.Ive stayed at several properties, on oahu, this is my fave hands down...

My partner and I sayed in the Aqua Bamboo for 3 nights in May 2011. This little hotel outshone all of the major chain hotels we stayed in including Sheraton and Hilton hotels in the same city. Aqua Bamboo is well located within 200m of the beach and from our rooms two balconies we had a choice of beach views or mountain views. We could no believe how generous the room was with two double beds in one room adjoining a comfortable sitting room. The room also had a well equiped kitchenette with microwave and plates. cutlery etc. The bathroom was huge with two showers, a bath and double sinks. Service was also faultless. Staff were very happy to assist with any questions or difficulties that we had and were always courteous and greeted us with a smile whenever we came in from sightseeing.

I booked this hotel (distinctive smaller property with kitchenettes!) as an alternative to the large Waikiki hotel nearby where I attended a four-day business meeting, with follow up family time, and found it idea for both purposesl The staff are friendly and accomodating; though I needed politely to persistent, to get an initial problem--a room with airconditioning on the fritz-- resolved. The 1-bedroom unit with kitchenette was just right for a couple and a 14-year-old, especially because the solution to the airconditioning problem had led to my being upgraded to one of the units with a beautiful terrace with table, grill, and "tiki hut" where we ate breakfast during several early morning rains! We saved considerable vacation expense by cooking simple meals (kitchenette well supplied) after judicious food shopping at a local ABC store and (to save even more) at the Foodland in the Ala Moana Center where some buses between downtown Honolulu and Waikiki stop. We felt very relaxed "at home" that way, after busy days out and about. The inner courtyard and spa faciliities are also special--we even treated our teenage athlete to her first professional massage, which she loved-- and the hotel lends out boogie boards and beach chairs and has lemonade and ice water and even apples on offer in the beautiful, calm lobby. Other reports speak of the noise of buses on Kuhio Avenue, but we successfully muted that by requesting a unit on the upper floors and by using the airconditioning (rather than the tradewinds, which otherwise were quite cooling) when streets got noiser in the evening. Having the buses right in front of the hotel was otherwise a great advantage--a number pass frequently that go most places, and we got by fine without a car except the couple of days we explored the island. Then we parked in the public garage at the Pacific Monarch hotel immediately next door (at $15./day the parking there is cheaper than in the too-small lot under the Aqua Bamboo --just follow the instructions and park on as low a level as possible, as there's no access to an elevator or inner staircase at that parking garage for those not staying at the Pacific Monarch).The more basic units may be rather small for more than one person but I had from the beginning also for the days by myself decided that for a week-long stay it was worthwhile to find a deal on a one bedroom suite with kitchenette. Altogether what we saw and experienced was even BETTER than the beautiful pictures you can see on the website--not frequently our experience. We'd definitely stay there again on a return trip to Honolulu!

The Aqua Bamboo is a cozy and comfy place to stay. It was just around the corner from the beach. There are so many restaurants near by. The pool area was small but just what I needed to lay in the sun, away from the crowds at the beach, to tan and take a dip to cool off.Our room was not too big and not too small. It had a microwave and mini fridge for our lelf overs from all the great restaurants.I loved the decor of the hotel, all about the bamboo. It's was chill and zen. Our room was on the 9th floor and we could see the ocean from our room just a couple blocks away.I admit we did have some cockroches in our room but when I called down to the front desk and said "hey I know I'm in a tropical destination but is it normal to have cockroaches in my room?" they were quick to suggest they move us and deal with the problem. We travel a lot, so we know bugs, they need a home too but not in our room.It was just nice to see how quick they were to find and offer a solution.Distance wise, anywhere you stay in waikiki is close to everything including the beach, it's just a very small community. To give you perspective on the distance, my husband and I were at the Hilton Hawaiian Village (the hotel with the rainbow on the side of it) and we walked from there to Diamond Head, up Diamond Head and back again. People said take the bus it's so far. Uh yeh, it's not. Plus, we got to see a lot of great spots on the way and back again.We also walked from the Bamboo to the Ala Moana shopping mall. Good long walk but again, totally do-able!Take the bus back if you have many shopping bags :)Other tips, I've stayed at a few hotels in Waikiki and admit there are some real dives. Be careful.The Aqua Bamboo is GREAT!! If I do ever come back this is where we shall rest!
I can really recommend this hotel, 2 minutes walk to the beach.

We wanted to be able to stay as close to Waikiki beach as possible without breaking the bank. We were very please with Aqua bamboo and spa. We ended up with a room with a view of the ocean and city. There were multiple small balconies which was great. Although we didn't have a chance to use the pool, the area was well maintained and was a nice lush area in the middle of a bustling city. The location is perfect. We walked to the beach in 5 minutes. There are plenty of dinner spots within walking distance. Be sure to call and reserve a parking space in the garage below the hotel. It is tiny and there aren't many spaces. The hotel was very nice to have chocolates and champagne in our room when we arrived since my husband and I were celebrating our anniversary. Free coffee in main lobby but no breakfast. One thing to be careful about is that if you sign up to be offered upgrades upon arrival you may be upgraded without even knowing it. Even though I had confirmed with the hotel that I would not be automatically upgraded upon arrival (costs money) and instead would be asked it we wanted to pay more for the upgrade, we were never asked. Oh well, we had a great room and we still feel like we got a good deal compared to other nearby hotel prices. Thanks Aqua Bamboo and Spa for a great stay!
This place was very close to the beach and major roads in Waikiki for eating, shopping and sightseeing. Everyone was pretty much friendly and the rooms were very convenient with the kitchenette.

Myself and 8 freinds had a wonderful stay at the Bamboo!The staff were friendly and helpful and made our stay all the more pleasant!We loved the pool area, spending most nights there until closing time! We even had a couple of BBQ's for dinner, which the staff helped us arrange!The free wifi in the lobby and pool side were great- I could even pick it up from the 4th floor service balcony! lol!The rooms were lovely and well equipped. My room attendant looked after me very well.The hotel is central to the beach, restaurants and the supermarket which was great for a week long stay!I will see you again if we ever make it back!

This was our first trip to Hawaii and it was grrreatttt...We spent two weeks at this hotel and loved having this as our base to explore.The staff was friendly and egar to please. They truly made us feel at home featuring the daily newspaper, lemonaid, coffee and a fresh bowl of apples daily in the lobby. The hotel is located a short walk to Waikiki Beach. There are plenty of places to dine and abundant entertainment any time of the day or night. We especially liked the doors being locked later in the evening as it made us feel safe in this busy city. The Bamboozle on Thursday afternoon at pool side is a must. It was enjoyed by all the guests and the staff appear to enjoy entertaining also! We will definately stay again and recommend it to fellow Canadians who visit Hawaii!

We returned home yesturday from our week long stay at Aqua Bamboo. I spent a lot of time looking for accomodation for our first trip to Oahu and discovered the Aqua Bamboo, we were not disapointed.On arrival we were greeted by the friendly Fe at reception. We were very impressed at our room on the top floor with a great view of the beach. The room was clean and tidy and enough room for the two of us. The room was serviced daily and it was good to come back after a busy day to fresh clean towles and a made up clean room! Thank you to the room service people!It was good having the fridge in the room as we would buy some drinks and sit on our balcany before dinner watching the surf roll in - the beach was only a block or so away. There was a bit of noise from the traffic, but that was because we slept with the door open as we prefer fresh air instead of the air con, however we did not have a problem waking up or being unable to get to sleep because of any noise. The location was great! we walked everywhere. The beach was just a block away, the main part of Waikki only a 2min walk, bus stop next to the hotel. We were very happy about the location. Obviously if you want beach front hotels (that cost a lot more) then choose another hotel, but we wern't disapointed with the location and even walking back to our hotel after a night out we felt safe. We didn't use the pool or spa so I can't comment, but it looked clean enough. The iced water and iced tea in recpetion were a nice touch after a big day out in the sun and reception always smelt refreshing when we could walk back in.The towel system you have is also a good idea!We plan on comming back to Waikki and if we do we will look at staying at the Bamboo because of the friendly staff, great location and tidy rooms. Mahalo for making our stay wonderful!

We stayed for 8 nights at the Aqua Bamboo and Spa for our first trip to Hawaii. We were on the 12th floor and pleasantly surprised to be able to see the beach. Although it wasn't a priority for us, or we would have stayed elsewhere, it was lovely to be able to sit on our balcony and enjoy a few drinks, while watching the not-too-distant surf.The location was fantastic. It was so close to everything that we walked to just about anywhere. Very convenient to many food places from a variety of cuisines. For anything further away, there was a bus stop right out the front and the buses are very easy to use.My only grizzle would be that the mattress on our bed was absolutely awful. It was in desperate need of replacing but in defence of the hotel, we did not mention it to staff as we were happy with everything else. I'm sure if we had they would probably have moved us to another room but we loved our room so much, we didn't want to. So we put up with it. If hotel management are reading this, it's room 1206.Other than that though, we would happily stay here again. It's pleasant, convenient and great value for money.
Great place to stay and it's well located to great restaurant and shopping. And it's a great walk from the hotel to the zoo. I would gladly recommend this place to my friends and co workers!

I wrote a review prior too staying at the “Aqua bamboo and spa” about how I was totally impressed with the reviews and how the representative responded back and was still impressed that they responded back to my pre-review comments. Well I just returned from our stay at the Aqua bamboo and spa and also our first Visit to Oahu and Hawaii. The first Hour on Oahu we were not too impressed, after over 6 hours in Flight 5 hour earlier time zone than what my biological time clock is used too. From the Airport to the Hotel stuck in crawling bumper to bumper traffic in our rental car to the Hotel. Is not much difference of any larger metropolitan area and could not tell at first we started our vacation on the beautiful island of Oahu. We were drained physically by the time we reached the Hotel and I recommend to any one staying in Hawaii add an extra two days to your stay for travel to and from to rest a recuperate . We pulled up in front of the Hotel and I know this is not your valet bellhop resort I did not expect someone to grab my luggage and park my car for us. We wanted a smaller low key Boutique hotel but from the reviews I did expect some type of greeting and directions. My wife stayed in the car I jump out and ran into the hotel to figure out what to do next. No Aloha or welcome to “Aqua bamboo and spa” but I had to do all the inquiry I almost felt like I was ignorant for not knowing what to do that is was expected for me to know the process. Found all the parking area was sold out for the length of my stay had to park next door , Never was offered to park out front while I unloaded our luggage and check in. We ended up having to go next door to figure out the parking actually paid a day to much. My wife and I carried our entire luggage down from the 4th level of the parking garage we were tired and worn out and at this point a little concerned about our stay. Nobody greeted us or open the door when we brought our luggage in. We are used to the Hilton chain “Garden In and suites” Homewood wood suites” on the mainland. Not you’re higher end Hilton Chain but a greeting and caring attitude we did not feel the same extended welcome impression when first arriving at this Hotel.  With all that said once we check-in and made it too our room and figured out the parking. I am thinking they upgraded our room to include a kitchenette. Our accommodations were nice and clean and the fresh flowers strategically placed throughout the room, a box of Chocolate and a bottle Champagne to help celebrate our 30 year anniversary. Although we don’t drink we appreciated the thought and effort that went with the gift of Champagne. The location of the room was good overlooking the Pool area with the tropical setting and I have to say the pool area is beautiful and kept clean and maintained daily. The bed was comfortable and room was quite except for some noise reaching us from the pool area and outside utility area side of the Hotel but nothing not expected for a Tourist Hotel area. All in all in a review I was not totally impressed but satisfied as they always say the first impression is the lasting impression. If the first moments of arrival were better with the staff presentation and help with understanding the process would have made a big impact. Living up to the expectation of the room saved the day and the location of the Hotel like the other reviews was near shopping and restaurants.  Would I recommend this hotel to others that depends on the individuals my wife I was not totally impressed we probably will not. I know this Hotel has several good reviews but if it is your first time to the Island and you do not know Honolulu area and Waikiki I would maybe plan to stay North Shore somewhere away from Honolulu and Waikiki. With the Hotel staff except for a few but it did not live up to our expectations with all the reviews. I could not even tell you any of their names like some of the other reviews did. They never ask as how our stay was going or if we needed anything or even when we left. One night I was even having problem figuring out the coffee machine “Pretty simple process just hit the button” but a staff walked right by us and never stop to ask if everything was ok’ I making it pretty vocal my frustration. Sincerely,Mr. and Mrs. Watts

Overall, we were pleasantly surprised with our room at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa. We stayed in room number 604 for our anniversary in May 2011. The room had two single beds and a double bed in a separate room, plus a kitchenette. The rooms were the perfect temperature, internet worked well, was clean, and a good value for the money. I LOVED the fresh orchids they placed in our room and bathroom. When asking a question about attractions, suggestions, etc., the staff were friendly and helpful.Things to note: It is on a very busy street and often not as quiet as we'd hoped. However, we did our research on trip advisor before our stay and knew this. We brought ear plugs for nighttime and slept well. The bathroom window is open constantly... as in.... there is no way to close it, there are privacy blinds on the outside of the window, but most of the noise, humidity, and musky odor comes from the window being open. The parking costs $20.00 a night in their garage, if you park at the Price Edward next door, it is only $15.00 a night. There is no room service. It is located within walking distance of Waikiki beach... pretty much near everything Waikiki.

Stayed here with my 13 yr old son for one week. First night, we had cockroaches in the bathroom and kitchenette and upon notifying the front desk, we were moved to the other side of the building, but same floor. Next day, we had roaches again in the bathroom (I found a roach bait under the bathroom vanity so they obviously knew this was a problem). The front desk said it was because housekeeping was located on the 2nd floor so we were moved to the 4th floor. Didn't see anymore roaches until the last night when found two in the bathroom. The first night the room was tiny and very run down. 2nd room was somewhat bigger and in better condition. 3rd room was two bedroom and had a full kitchen. All the rooms looked tired and what appeared to be bad DIY remodelling - missing baseboards/trim, paint drips, holes sloppily cut in the cabinetry, the furniture was gouged up, etc. which would not have seemed so significant if there had not been the cockroach infestation. We had to keep our luggage zipped at all times and off the floor. We stored all food/beverages in the fridge and decided it best not to use the kitchenette at all. Housekeeping could be a little more thorough - you could see where they had not vacuumed under the beds and the shower curtain needed to be laundered.The hotel is located 2 blocks up from Kuhio Beach which was great but there was a lot of riff raff going on outside day or night, including MANY prostitutes and drug dealing at the bus stop on the corner. There were sirens every night and it was pretty hard to get any decent sleep. If I was travelling on my own this would not have been a big deal at all but I was having to herd my 13 yr old around this stuff every time we went out the lobby doors.All that being said, the staff was excellent! Everyone from the front desk to the bellman to the housekeeping was super friendly and extremely nice. The pool area was spacious and nicely decorated. The location was great in that it wasn't right in the middle of the tourist heavy spots and we were able to walk everywhere. If our destination was too far to walk, the bus stop was literally right outside. There were also many very affordable places to eat within a few minutes walking distance.All the negatives combined did not ruin our trip in the slightest bit but the cockroaches are a deal breaker and unfortunately, I would not stay at this Aqua hotel again. I had previously enjoyed staying at the Aqua Palms and had fairly high expectations about the Aqua Bamboo.

I was in Waikiki for business with clients and wanted to host a cocktail hour on the lanai. Kaheaha, Bamboo's new hotel manager hooked us up with room 903 which has a 600 sqaure foot lanai. This lanai was just remodled and includes all new teak furniture, barbeque, tiki torches and an incredible Tiki Hut perfect for entertaining, even if it's raining. My clients loved it and the rate was very reasonable. Frankly, I have never seen anything like this in Waikiki and want to bring my whole family back this summer.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo in Waikiki for 3 days.we really enjoyed our short stay.Thought the hotel is not new it is very clean well located for everything.the pool area is very nice and clean and we found it very cozy.We don not like huge resorts so this was perfect for us.We would definitely recommend this hotel.Thank you to all the staff for the special attention you did for for our 50th wedding anniversary.

One of the main reasons I chose this hotel was the high rating it received on this site. However, after staying at this hotel for over 10 days, I don't really understand why it is rated so high. It is not a terrible hotel, but there was a bunch of little things that were bothersome which added up to me being less than satisfied. First of all, my boyfriend and I were initially given a room with two double beds and a balcony that looked over a parking lot. We asked if we could have a room with a queen size bed since we are obviously a couple. They told us it would be $15 per night and we took it. The room we received looked out onto the pool area which is much nicer. However, the sheets and towels looked dingy, the shower was not renovated, and we found two small cockroaches in our kitchenette. As far as the pool goes, it is way too cold and so no one ever goes in it. The hot tub is hilariously small. Only two or three people can fit comfortably in it. Also, they charge $20 a day to park in their garage, which is way too much considering that it is so tight. Every time we entered or left, one of us would have to get out of the car to direct the other so that we wouldn't hit the posts or other cars. Very frustrating.This hotel is okay if you want to save money. But in my opinion, I would rather spend more and have an awesome experience without the little annoyances. Last year we stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and it was amazing. Next year I will definitely stay at a newer, beachfront hotel because I think the extra money is well worth it.

This hotel was great, no complaints. Nothing overly fancy but the rooms were nice and clean, hotel staff was awesome. We booked a studio with kitchenette that overlooked the pool. Couldn't have been better. Pool area is very nice, comfy chairs and nice a quiet, never know you were in the middle of Waikiki. Cannot wait to return!

We only had three days in Honolulu and wanted to be close enough to Waikiki to walk to the beach, shopping, and restaurants. This was the perfect choice for us. Two blocks from the beach. Older building, but clean and nice inside. Based on this site, we upgraded to room facing courtyard and it was well worth it to be away from the traffic noise. Friendly staff, comfortable clean room, good price. Beautiful courtyard and nice landscaping make a trip to the pool relaxing and a great way to be out of the busy city.

This isn't a premium,on the beach, high end TOURIST hotel; it's a "travellers hotel". A great location to start any day trip,hike or shopping excursion.It's like an Oasis from the main strip,where after a day about, you can come back, relax, and cool off around the small but well appointed pool area.Coffee,tea,lemonade,iced tea are free all day.No food is available,except on Thursday ,when they have a managers appreciation happy hour.
