The Staff are friendly and will help with almost everything from directions,to eating,to finding hidden locations away from the strip or the best beach,golfing and getaway.The rooms are more than adequate,clean and well appointed.The kitchenette is great for those that can cook with minimal gear.Don't expect to make roast beef dinners,but healthy eating is easy.All in all,the Aqua Bamboo is an excellent choice for those that don't hang around the hotel pool all day;it's for those that like to get out on their own,away from the tour bus groups and travel about at will.

This hotel is certainly living up to it's reviews and reputation. A great little hotel, just a block behind the main road of Waikiki, tucked away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to the shops and beach. There's also some great little eating spots within a few minutes walk, so the location is perfect.We chose this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews and it's everything that it says here, so I won't go into details. We had a great stay and would definitely stay here again. My only grizzle would be regarding our room - we were upgraded from a studio to a room with kitchenette (great) but we had two queen sized beds, with one right beside the ranch slider making it impossible to get out onto the deck. But other than that, the room was excellent.

I have to reflect on a phone call we just received from one of our clients, an extended family of 6 (80's through 20's) just returning from a NCL Hawaii cruise. As travel agents it is our responsibility to make intellegent property suggestions to our clients. We sugested the Aqua Bamboo for both our client's pre and post cruise stays based on positive past client experiences, reflections and the resort's great price point. Our client's couldn't have been more glowing about both their stays. They raved about the beautiful property and how perfect it was, were humbled by the fantastic servce staff provided, and that they were all upgraded to balcony suites on their return stay. They felt the location was ideal for their needs and a great value for their dollars spent. They all stated that they "will always stay at the Aqua Bamboo when in Waikiki."I need to qualify this review by stating that our company has no connection or relationship with the Aqua Bamboo, but felt after receiving a call from a client that was so positive and glowing that I owed it to the Aqua Bamboo for taking such great care of our clients. I say THANK YOU Aqua Bamboo you made our selection look great. You will see lots more of our clients in the future.

Why do I return year after year (last 9 years) to the Hawaiian Oasis aka Aqua Bamboo and Spa? From the time you enter 'the Oasis' and met by Zenie, Fe, Anthony or Puna, or the management Customer Relations Nicole to the gracious and delightful new General Manager Ms Kahealani Doss, you receive the Maholo AQua experience.The little things like the weekly Bamboozle meet and greet by management, the huge bowl of the juciest apples, complimentary 24hrs coffee and tea, to the soothing pool and surrounds, just a perfert Oasis.Yes, I say, WHY NOT. Same time next year.Terry . Sydney Aust.

Good price & conveniently located. Would recommend to adventurers not looking to spend the majority of time in their hotel. Was relatively quiet on the south side for being off such a busy road. Be sure to tip the housekeeping--no matter how well the job was done--or don't expect your room to be put back in order.

This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in!!!!Me, my now husband, and 2 friends stayed in this hotel for our wedding in Hawaii. The service that we received is absolutely excellent (especially Anthony and Fe!). Everything we asked them was never too much effort, and they were all willing to help with anything. When they found out we were getting married whilst staying with them, they were delighted, and dressed our room with flowers, champagne and chocolates for the day. We are very appreciated and touched they did this for us.The location of the hotel is brillant about a five minute walk from the beach, close to all the shops, bars and restaurants.The outside area is fantastic - free wifi, pool and spa, and spa facilities. The pool is on the small side but the right size for the amount of people that use it. We had one of the massages and they were fantastic.Although this hotel does not have a bar or restaurant, they allow you to bring in your own food (and cook on their barbeque if you want), and liquor/alcohol, this meant that we were able to save some money from expensive bar bills!!For the wedding day we stayed at another hotel as the Aqua Bamboo does not have a restaurant, and were disspointed with the service of the staff. If only the staff at the Aqua Bamboo worked at the other hotel as well!The room we stayed in was the one bedroom suite which is absolutely fantastic, my mouth fell open when I saw it for the first time. If your budget allows you, you should definitely pick this room, you will not be disspointed.This hotel is absolutely 100% fantastic, I can not find a bad work to say against them. When me and my husband come back to Hawaii we will definitely be staying at this hotel again, and will not even consider the other hotels around the area.Thank you so much for a fantastic holiday Aqua Bamboo Staff!!!

Booked this hotel after spending many hours on the internet to find our ideal hotel in the right location at the right price, and boy did I make the right choice. The hotel is small so you got to know other guests very quickly, another way that helped to meet the other guests was the cocktail party on a Thursday evening from 4.30 till 5.30pm. The cocktail party that the hotel put on every Thursday was also a good way to meet other guests. Overall this hotel is a dream, friendly and professional staff especially Anthony, Puna, and Nicole who made us feel so welcome. Lovely light and airy room with kitchen which was a godsend as you could relax in the morning over breakfast reading the complimentary newspaper, and not have to rush out to find a place to eat.By far my favourite part of the hotel was the pool area. You could relax in the comfortable loungers and swim in the pool area to cool down. Lovely little waterfall beside the pool which was surrounded by palm trees. As you go out to the pool area complimentary cool refreshments were available to take out. Well done Bamboo for all the nice little extras that you supply - when we return to Hawaii will have no hesitation in booking at the Bamboo yet again.

The Aqua Bamboo is centrally located. It's only a short walk to beach, shops, transit and great restaurants. Bamboo staff are always pleasant and professional. We keep returning to the Aqua Bamboo. We've stayed at other hotels but find that after eight years the Bamboo still has everything we need for our annual late winter thaw.

Just returned from a trip to the Aqua Bamboo and Spa, 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. This is a small, boutique hotel that is an excellent value and is a nice respite from the noise and constant energy of the Waikiki scene. The intimate garden courtyard, with pool, waterfall, and spa, also has free WiFi, All rooms have at a minimum a fridge and microwave, and many have full kitchenettes. Staff are smiling and go out of their way to be helpful. The location is an easy walk to the beach, Kuhio Beach Park, and the bus stop is right across the street. In fact, everything seems to be within walking distance from this hotel! In addition, the Oahu bus system is amazing; you can go anywhere on the island for $2.50, the buses are clean, drivers are helpful, and patrons are respectful of each other. Granted, this is not the Hyatt, but if you book your hotel room through the Aqua hotel website, they are currently offering a free upgrade, and my sense is they will upgrade you anyway, if they can ( I always book through the hotel if possible because I believe they take a more personal interest in you). I highly recommend this hotel, and would return in a heart beat. Mahalo!

Throughout 2010 I stayed at Aqua Bamboo for 1 or 2 weeks each month for work. I highly recommend Bamboo for those who enjoy resort quality rooms, welcoming and friendly service, spa-like atmosphere, great coffee and total relaxation. Ahhhhhhh, a heavenly stay awaits you.

We stayed at the Bamboo twice, at the start and end of our trip for a couple of nights each time prior to flying out. It was good value for the area and is a few mins walk from the shops and beach etc. The rooms are very nicely decorated, in a minimalist style and look recently done. Staff were very helpful and friendly, room was big with a large comfortable bed (they upgraded us to one of the suites which was nice!). The bathroom was lovely and there was a small kitchenette for cooking. Note that there is no restuarant at the 'hotel' (it's more of a motel) and they no longer do the breakfast in rooms. This isn't a problem though as there are loads of places around there to go. The rooms are fairly noisy but Waikiki is a noisy place so this is to be expected. All in all a good place to stay - met all expectations and was a very good price compared to others in the area.
Great hotel at only a 5 minutes walk from Waikiki beach, restaurants, shops, etc... The room was clean. The staff was very helpful (especially Anthony & Puna). Very good value for money.

You can fill in the blank with anything about the hotel and you've got an accurate statement. The location was great, a four minute walk to Wikiki Beach and all the action there, yet you weren't in the middle of it back at your hotel. They offer free boogie boards, chairs, and other floaties to borrow and take down to the beach with you. The pool area was nice, decent size pool/ hot tub with comfy loungers surrounding. In the main lobby there was always free refreshments (like lemonade/ice tea and water) which was nice when coming out of the pool. The staff at the Bamboo helped make our stay that much more pleasant... Just go book your stay!

My family had a great time at the Bamboo & Spa. We felt very "at home". Anthony ,Puna, Nicole, as well as the rest of the staff were very helpfull and accomodating. While not new and fancy the suite was pleasant and the house keeping staff effecient. The pool area and courtyard were keep clean and was very nice spot to unwind. The only minor items I noticed were the BBQ needs attention,the carpet in our unit was getting a little scruffy around the edges and I would have preferred a real coffee maker in the room. The property is older as are alot of hotels in Waikiki , but kept up well the location is 2 blocks to the beach and hotel has chairs,towels,boogie boards available no charge. Overall The "Bamboo" was a nice place to stay and good value for Waikiki.

I was pleased to have a clean well-appointed room on a higher floor. I especially appreciated the convenience of the kitchen. I liked watching the sun rise from bed and reading the complimentary newspaper from my sunny lanai, which included a partial view of the ocean. The air conditioner was loud, so I tended to turn it on only when I left the room. The trade-off of the great location with excellent bus service anywhere on the island and only one block from the beach, was the traffic noise from Kuhio Avenue. After a day it didn't bother me. The staff were very friendly and responsive to my needs. I'd definitely recommend this hotel, and next time I'll try to get a quieter room on the pool side.

My wife and I spent our anniversary/belated honeymoon in Waikiki, and I can't say enough good things about the Aqua Bamboo. Upon mention of the honeymoon aspect of our trip, we were quickly upgraded to a full suite. No, it didn't look or feel like a 5-star hotel but for the price this is an amazing place to stay. The room was very clean and modern, the kitchen was fantastic, and the staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, to the point of one of the staff members lending us their personal lunch cooler for a day trip. The pool/lounge area is gorgeous. Lots of mature trees and landscaping so it doesn't sound or feel like you're in the city at all. Of course, why sit around the pool when the beach is two short blocks away? We were some of the last people to get dropped off when we took the shuttle from the airport so we stopped at several other (more expensive) hotels on the way, and I have to say that we had the best location of all of them as far as proximity to the beach. There are lots of grocery stores and everything else you might need very nearby, and a bus stop right in front if you need to go further.And for Canadians like us, there was a small but significant added bonus - free SWEETENED iced tea in the lobby! All in all, I would have no problem staying here again.

We were invited to a wedding in Honolulu and need a place to stay. I read through the reviews and was not sure how the property would serve our needs but I was pleasantly surprised and felt the need to add to the stellar reviews for this property. The location, staff and convenience made our stay extremely enjoyable. Reading the reviews from others about the noise level was helpful in selecting the right room location. Yes, it is slightly dated but cleanliness, convenience and value were paramount in providing a very pleasant experience.

What a great hotel, great value, great location! I could not have been more pleased with our stay. We love Hawaii and this hotel just added to the "Aloha Spirit"! First, I would like to say that I booked this hotel based on these trip advisor reviews, so I know how important these reviews are, not only to travelers, but businesses as well. In advance, based on comments here, I emailed the hotel and asked for a room above the 7th floor, overlooking the pool. They accommodated our request well! We were very, very pleasantly surprised when we opened our curtains on the 11th floor, room 1101 to be exact, and saw views of the Pacific Ocean and Waikiki Beach and also views of the lovely pool area from our lanai. Our room was quiet, our bed was comfortable and we were greeted with chocolates and champagne with beautiful orchids in the bathroom and with our welcome gift. It was our anniversary trip. Our first impression was awesome!The pool area is immaculate and relaxing. We sat in the pool area and used the jacuzzi in the evening after walking a lot during the day. The plants, flowers and trees are so lush and well taken care of. The walk to the beach is short and perfect for a morning or evening stroll. There are several ABC stores nearby and I felt safe walking by myself for several trips to get water or other items. Everything is within close walking distance! We went to Subway most mornings for a cheapie breakfast and there are two that we know of nearby. Our favorite value dinner was actually the other way, towards the Ali Wai canal at a place called Waikiki Sand Villa, which is a hotel. It was a bar and grill below the hotel that not a whole lot of people are aware of, but their fish and chips and Mahi Mahi over rice was absolutely delicious!! It was away from the hustle and bustle just a couple blocks over in the busy downtown area, which was nice. We were greeted upon every return to the hotel with an open door and an "Aloha" which just added to the feel of the hotel. This is a smaller hotel too, so the elevator was never a long wait, there was a current newspaper located right at the elevator doors every day, and the iced tea and lemon water by the pool area was fantastic and refreshing! The free internet wifi service was a major bonus as well. We were able to do a video chat with our kids back home in MN every evening before they went to bed, which we weren't able to do the last time we were in Hawaii. It made being away from the kids much easier to deal with, so we could enjoy ourselves and relax even more. The maid service was great every day as well. It's always so nice to come back to a made bed and fresh towels. Even the lotion and shampoo/conditioner was great! It smelled so nice.Some other items that we did not use but might be important to others is that they have surf boards and a few other pool/beach items that you can check out in their pool area. They also have a sauna that we did not use, and spa services in the pool area as well. We will be back to stay at this hotel. We wouldn't stay anywhere else! We don't need the fancy four and five star hotels on Waikiki Beach when we know about this hotel. It's close enough to everything and in my book it's five stars anyway! Mahalo, Aqua Bamboo! We can't wait to return!

This is a small boutique hotel with a lovely garden, pool, hot tub and spa (massage parlor) in back. The rooms are spacious, well decorated and extremely well kept. The staff is very attentive and friendly. They responded immediately to my needs. This isn't on the beach but it's a short walk there--the front street, Kuhio, is a main bus line and you can reach just about any place in Honolulu by catching a bus in front of the hotel. Other amenities nearby are a grocery store, a Starbucks and a gym. Great value--I recommend it without reservation!

I come to Honolulu often and I usually stay @ The Aqua Palms & Spa. Being that they were full I decided to go to Bamboo. I enjoyed my stay very much. The staff was very polite and helpful. The Guest services manager Nicole Valentino was also a great help in making sure my stay was very comfortable. The rooms were very clean and neat and it is right in the middle of all the action in waikiki, The Bamboo had a unexpected problem with a power outtage while I was there and they handled it great. They gave all the guest a free bar B que by the pool. Burgers and Hot dogs,chips,soda, etc. They made sure we were comfortable and fed during the outtage which lasted for at least 6 hrs. The rates are affordable and the rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. Just a short walk to the beach and plenty of shopping. What more can you ask for??

This is a somewhat dated property on a busy street. Get a room on a higher floor that is not facing the street to help reduce street noise. We loved the location, only 2 blocks to a fantastic section of the beach, easy walking distance to everything in Waikiki. Our room was on the 10th floor, on the side of the building toward the rear. The wall mounted air conditioner makes noise but did its job cooling; we simply shut it off at night and left the patio door open (the outside air was quite comfortable at night). Our room was clean throughout, the mattress was newer, firm & comfortable. Staff is responsive but not pampering. Overall I thought I received good "value" for my money; there are many fancier places to stay in Waikiki if you want to pay much much higher prices!

The rooms are nicely appointed with rudimentary kitchen faciilities. The staff is uniformly friendly, helpful and fair. The lobby is calming and a nice refuge from Waikiki, which can get to be a bit much at times. But the piece de resistance is the pool and its surroundings. A great place to stay cool during the afternoons and to get away from the hustle bustle. Were I going back to Waikiki, I would book the Bamboo in a minute.

You are in the heart of it all with walking distance to everything that your heart may desire and want. The rooms are clean and attractive with constant up keeping and a great outlook, out of your window to beach front dreams. I would recommend this hotel as one of the best that we have stayed at for services, location and a pleasant atmosphere to relax in.

This is a kind of a different review we are planning on staying at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa in May of 2011 for 30th wedding anniversary. First time to the state of Hawaii I chose Oahu because 30th anniversary is the year of the pearl and this is known for Pearl Harbor and where Pearl City is located . My wife and I have never been the resort type of people we like the smaller more touchable atmosphere. I chose this Hotel from these reviews and trust me I did the Homework. I noticed good or even the "few" negative reviews the General Manager responded to each of these reviews and addressed the comments. I hope my gut feeling is right because I want this to special for us as we celebrate a milestone in Life. Look forward to meeting the staff they sound great. Look forward to our visit in May. Sincerely,David and Valorie Watts

Spending 3 nights in this conveniently located hotel was the perfect end to a 3 week + vacation. We were amazed and delighted to be upgraded to one of the 2 deluxe suites on the 9th floor. The lanai was as big as the indoor area, and equipped with living, dining, and lounge furniture and a barbecue the size of a small car. Well equipped kitchen- equipment and dishes. Grocery store is just down the street, and is on the city bus route. Beach is a very short walk. Ocean was visible from the other lanai off the bedroom. Pool area was a quiet, secure oasis, with soft music and waterfall. Free wi-fi in room worked all the time. Beautifully decorated with bamboo theme. Comfy beds. Staff was helpful and cheerful. We definitely would stay there again.

I like the fact that this hotel is small and you don't get lost in the crowd of many guests. The staff is nice and embody the Aloha Spirit! I would definitly return time and time again to this hotel since I now found this quiet small hotel in the middle of Waikiki.

My sister and I stayed here for a week in early February. Nice, friendly and helpful staff and the room was better than we expected. Great location too.Will definitely come back to this hotel again, if I ever return to Waikiki.

From the time we arrived we felt welcome! Anthony and the other young staffers at the front desk greeted us OUTSIDE the door and helped us get to the desk with our luggage after a long flight. I was apprehensive because the price was lower than most properties in the heart of Honolulu, but my husband and I were delighted with every detail of this small hotel. The garden patio area behind the hotel by the pool is intimate and comfortable. The room had a nice "bamboo" theme right down to the water faucets, furnishings, and linens! We had a room with a small kitchen area that saved us a ton of money on breakfast & lunch. It's within easy walking distance of shops, food (try the seafood buffet at the Pacific Beach for a splurge), and the beach. I will DEFINITELY stay there again!!!

Overall a very nice hotel. The staff were pleasant and helpful and the hotel is located fairly close to the main areas of Waikiki.Be sure to ask for a back room or a high floor, the noise from the main road is painful and will leave you sleep deprived. Beware of some of the people that hang around the smoke shop just down from it.Reasonably priced and spacious rooms. Kitchenette wasn't very big, if you are planning to cook in your room, go for the full kitchen.Wifi was a bit dodgey and constantly dropping out. Front desk staff were more then happy to book tours and provide advice.

This place was a steal! We got some kind of deal where it was $100/night plus parking. When we arrived there was champagne and chocolates in our room. I thought this was for our honeymoon but I think they do that for all the guests. One night they had complimentary Hawaiian music and cocktails and apps by the pool. Just a lot of aloha, lot of little touches. The room was a little small, but it's Waikiki... so be realistic! The place is truly renovated, flat screen TVs, new furniture, all that. The pool area is like a secluded little garden. Check out the pics on the website, it pretty much is like exactly that. The beach is so close that we just literally grabbed our hotel key and walked over in our suits. Which is important cause I wouldn't want to leave a beach bag out on Waikiki beach so we loved that!

My husband & I just got back from Oahu. We had read all the reviews possible & stayed "on the fence" about whether or not to give this place a shot. But, we did & do not regret it. We stayed at Aqua Bamboo & Spa for almost a week. We were married in Oahu while we were there. So here's the bottom line-overall Aqua Bamboo & Spa is awesome. No, it's not a 5 star hotel but if you are on a budget & weren't raised with a silver spoon in your mouth it's great. Here are some tips to make sure your stay is nice as well: Ask for a room facing the pool & above the 7th floor. We stayed on the 9th floor in 906 facing the pool & it was a little noisy still but with the a/c on at night & the bathroom door shut (window is thinner in there & noise comes thru) we were able to sleep well. The room did honestly have a bit of a musty smell (that part is true in other reviews) but it's not unbearable. If its unbearable to you, just buy a cheap air freshener from 1 of the tons of ABC stores that are in the area & you won't even notice it. Our room had 3 balconies with tile floors, 1 off the kitchenette, 1 off the bedroom & 1 off the side & the rest of our room was carpeted-bathroom was tile too. Our room was in the corner of the hotel away from the elevators so I think that helped too for noise reduction. Note-they no longer offer the free continental breakfast but they have alot of free beverages in the lobby,(the lemonade is so good!) If you are on a budget ask for a room with a kitchenette. The kitchenettes really are fully equipped with plates, silverware & cooking utensils, coffee, coffee maker & cups, glasses, pots & pans, a pitcher, a toaster, microwave, 4 burner stove top, etc. There is an in-room safe big enough to accommodate a laptap & purse, etc. (It's about 12 inches high). We didn't take our laptop so we used their internet. You swipe your credit card and it is around 20cents a minute& counts down the minutes for you so you know how much time you have used. I can honestly say those on here that have said the hotel does not look like the pictures are wrong. It does to a tee, the only thing we noticed was some of the furniture outside was a little faded. Everything else was like we were looking at the website. A must do tip- when you first arrive be sure to meet Fe. She is the front desk manager & is awesome! She goes above & beyond to make sure your stay is great. (Especially if you are a couple getting married on Oahu or a honeymooning couple ask for Fe before you leave & let her know!) My husband called before we went & mentioned we were getting married in Oahu & she is the 1 he spoke to. She had champagne, flowers & chocolates in the room upon our arrival. On our actual wedding day she tooks pics of us before we left the hotel, made a flower for my hair & when we returned our bed was decorated with beautiful flowers in the shape of a heart & there were flowers strewn all over the floor! The bouquets with our wedding coordinators package were a little pricey so we had planned on getting 1 at a florist when we arrived. We asked Fe where the nearest florist was & she told us she would make me 1! She made me a gorgeous bouquet out of white roses & pearls & gave it to me as a gift! Some of the reviews state the staff was young & acted not interested in general. Yes, they are young but we noticed that they feed off the attitudes of the guests. We had to wait in the lobby for awhile for our limo & watched several interactions with people checking in/out. Smile upon your arrival, say hi each time you walk by to leave/come back to your room & you will get the same treatment. Other tips about the area: The ABC stores are not just liquor stores, they are more like a small store that sells everything including food, clothing, etc. The food is a little high- take the city bus ($2.50 roundtrip) to Walmart. Food in Hawaii at Walmart is around $4.50 for a gallon of milk, around $3 for a dozen of eggs, about $2.50 for a loaf of bread. We asked for a kitchenette & saved a ton of money by cooking some of our own meals. The fresh fish Hawaii has it's a shame not to. There are washers&dryers for $1.50 per load@ on a few of the floors. Make sure you buy a book called "Oahu Revealed" by Andrew Doughty. It has honest opinions about everything from dining to hotels, etc. By the way-in the book Aqua Bamboo & Spa was called a "real gem". Do everything I recommended & you won't be disppointed. We did eat out a few meals (try Puka Dog & Duke's Canoe Club!) The city bus is called "The Bus" & is well worth the fare. The bus drivers are friendly & will tell you which bus to take. The bus literally goes almost anywhere. We even took it all the way around the island. We wanted to see how hawaiians really lived & not just what they want you to see in the tourist trap areas. It took awhile (3 or 4 hours)to go from Waikiki up the Windward side to the North Shore, then it goes down thru central Oahu right past Dole Plantation. The bus ride was alot of fun & cheaper than renting a car,(gas is around $3.80 & parking is expensive, small spaces & very limited).

We stayed here for one week during our time on Oahu. We had a room on the 10th floor with a kitchenette and were informed we had been upgraded upon check-in. The room was spacious and clean. The service we experienced was decent and our garbage disposal was promptly cleaned out when we requested it. The room did face Kuhio Ave. which can be a little noisy at night but we do like to sleep with our windows open. There are plenty of ABC stores nearby and restaurants. The location was great for its proximity to the beach, only 2 blocks. The only negative thing was the shuttle service that the hotel uses to get to the airport was late and the operator was a little rude so you might want to make your own shuttle arrangements. I wished the front desk had followed up more as it became apparent we were running late. Overall a good stay.

We stayed at Aqua Bamboo for 9 nights in January 2011. Booked the room for around $140 per night for two adults and one child, including taxes. This is an excellent rate for a hotel in Waikiki which, unlike most of the States, is quite expensive. We had booked a room with two double beds, but were upgraded to a two room suite.... queen bed in one room and twin beds in the other, a kitchenette and bathroom with shower over bath. We later discovered that this was not such a bonus, as these larger suites all front the main road and some evenings the traffic was horrendous. I would definitely stay here again, the pool and jacuzzi area is lovely if not huge, the rooms are clean and every requirement was met. No cafe/restaurant attached, but they're on every corner in Waikiki so this was no bother. It's situated directly on the major bus route, so each day we'd just walk directly across the road to catch a bus wherever we wanted to go. When staying there again I will ask for either a two room suite on one of the higher levels, or go for a smaller room overlooking the pool which we were advised was much quieter. A great value small hotel which I'd happily recommend!

I found it to be just another hotel in Waikiki. It was pretty, with nice decor but nothing outstanding. It was clean and the service was pleasant. The room was pretty small, but that's pretty common in Hawaii (unless you step up to a luxurious hotel) and not like it really matters, we used it for sleeping, not hanging around at. They only had two queens for us instead of a king, but again, it wasn't as big of a deal. The room was clean and the bathroom was pretty decent too. The view was nonexistent, the balcony overlooked an apartment building. One of the highlights was the kitchenette, it had pots, pans, fridge,etc. Useful to make a quick meal on the go.The staff was courteous, the manager inquired if we were enjoying our stay. The only problem we had with the staff was the front desk people were not very knowledgeable about local attractions and gave us wrong directions which resulted in us getting lost.The location is great, the Waikiki beach is within short walking distance. You have to valet your car in an underground parking (standard in Honolulu), what adds somewhat to the price of the hotel every day.Overall, it was pleasant, although next time I'll opt for someplace a little less crowded than Waikiki.

Room was tiny. AC was noisy but they fixed it the next morning. View was not so great but we were hardly in room, so it does not matter. 10-min drive to Diamond Head Hike and trip to Waikiki beach was walkable. Lemonade available in the lobby in the mornings was refreshing. Pool area was shady and cozy. Parking price can be cheaper - it is very tiny and difficult to get out the first few times. Rent the car from the airport for cheaper deals compared to the tour provider available closeby who was quite rude when we said we need a few mins to decide.Someone reported earlier about graffitti in elevator. Seems they read that coz when we arrived, noticed 2 staff members hard at work cleaning it! :) A helpful staff directed us to a nice Japanese restaurant down a block from the hotel - awesome food.Lots of ABC stores and restaurants closeby, almost 1 ABC store in each block. Rent a car to go around rest of Oahu at your pace and comfort. Don't forget to check out thye ABC show "Off the Map" shooting location in Waimaha. Avoid the Pineapple Express in Dole Plantation - quite a disappointment..no pineapples to see!
user_name:
Pragyan
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: it's just ok! it reminds me of a motel, they even had a neon vacany sign. It should tell you something if they lock the front door by 10pm. It's old and needs to be updated, it even has an old smell. The pool and the lobby furniture needs to be cleaned (if you can really call that a lobby). It looks NOTHING like it's pictures on line. The staff was outstanding and my room was clean is the best I can say. Do yourself a favor, pay $30 a night more and go to a decent hotel. Oh yea, you think they would offer free internet to make it for some of the bad things, NOPE you can't even check in or print your boarding pass without a fee.

Hotel needs a facelift, particularly the lobby and the elevators (Doesn't anyone who works there see or care about the strange graffiti scratched into the surface of the elevator doors?). The hotel is outside of a major bus stop in Waikiki. Windows should be triple paned.

Stayed at the Aqua Bamboo and Spa over New Years. Purchased the room on their website and got a great rate with their 60 day advanced purchase pre-pay. After you purchase on their website, they give you an option to upgrade to a higher floor for only $4 more/night if a room is available, which I chose. When we checked in we were told that the upgrade was accepted, and were given a room on the 8th floor that had a view (obstructed) of the ocean. It was a great room, with 2 balconies. Not spacious, but better than expected! The floor has a coin operated laundry, which was nice. Did not use the pool, as it was very small. But did sit out in the courtyard which is nice. The location is excellent - only one block to the beach. The location is a bit noisy, with traffic, construction and early morning garbage trucks, though I suspect that is a common problem for Waikiki. Other reviews have commented on the continental breakfast, but we were told that breakfast was discontinued as of January 1. I did experience one problem that is worth noting: we rented a car for the last 2 days and paid $20 per night to park in the hotel's garage. On our last day in Waikiki we were planning on a leisurely morning as our plane did not leave until 3 PM. We were planing on breakfast, a walk on the beach and doing some laundry, then checking out at noon (check out time). But the night before the hotel put up a sign in the elevator stating that the parking lot would close at 9:00 AM to put up a new gate - no one would be allowed in or out from 9 to 5. Since we were not planning on leaving until noon, I talked to the desk staff about an alternative place to park for 2-3 hours in the morning. The desk staff had no idea where we could park and stated that they would have to talk to the manager, who wasn't present at the time. By 9 AM the next morning the manager was still not present and I had no choice but to check out and get my car out of the parking lot. We barely got our car out, as the crew to put up the gate was already at work! This was inconvenient, as it meant that instead of a leisurely morning at the hotel, we had to rush out of the room and ended up spending the 3 extra hours waiting at the airport for our flight. I was very disappointed that the hotel had not pre-arranged alternative parking for guests (especially after paying $20 per night for parking) since installing the new gate was previously planned work! However, on a more positive note, a week after our stay the Aqua hotels e-mailed me a survey of our stay and I mentioned this problem on the survey. The immediately responded with an apology and refunded me the $40 we paid for parking for 2 nights. So I have to give them credit for trying to fix the problem, albeit after the fact. All in all, I would stay here again!

We had a great time at this hotel. It was clean and friendly. The staff is very accommodating. IN addition they have a weekly free cocktail hour by the pool. We visited other hotels and the pools tend not to stay open past 7, but at Bamboo they are open till 10. For those looking for simplicity, low maintained at a very reasonable cost, Bamboo is a gem.

+ good location. not on the beach but close. - rooms. urgently need refurbishing. furniture, sheets, towels, air conditioning, everything looks 40 years old. like in an old motel. but the worst was breakfast. the worst I've ever had, anywhere in the world. a rotten banana, 3 days old buns and awful coffee. pool is small and almost always in the shade cause of the high-raise buildings around. especially deceiving cause their website is really cool. so far from reality though. prepare to spend a bit more and get a decent place! the idea of saving money in hawaii is ridiculous anyway.

We have stayed at the Aqua Bamboo three times over three years and are pleasantly suprised and satisfied with each visit. We will be repeat customers again in the years to come. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Rooms that end in 03 and 04 have stone tile floors which we especially appreciate for the cool on our feet and cleanliness. Most typical hotel rooms in other hotels have grungy, old, sandy carpets. Not the case in some of the rooms at the Aqua Bamboo.The staff are friendly and are very accomodating. Facing Kuhio Ave can be a bit noisey at night. I found that we had to close our balconey doors to fall asleep but all hotels on Kuhio Ave face similar issues. The rooms are beautifully decorated and have a boutique hotel feel on a budget price. We fully recommend the Aqua Bamboo!

This is a three star hotel - nothing more, nothing less. Staff is very young. Facilities out-dated. Sheets had holes in them from wear and towels fraying. A/C sounded like a freight train. Chose to sleep with it off. On the positive side, beautiful pool out back, fab kitchenette in room, free wi-fi in lobby. Very slick website for a very mediocre hotel (notice there are no lobby pictures).
get a suite in the upper floors there is view of the beach and backyard with pool and take in the free thursday bamboozler party in there lobby we enjoyed a free mini massage and yukulele musician

Lovely boutique hotel -- My "standard" room had three balconies! Room was very clean and comfortable. Plenty spacious, comfy bed, serene and quiet at night -- even though it's in the heart of everything. Friendly, professional staff. I could not have had a better stay. Perfectly priced below the overpriced chains. Two blocks from beach.

This hotel provided the perfect combination of being in the midst of activity in Waikiki, yet making you feel like you were in an isolated tropical hideaway. The staff was wonderful, friendly and efficient at all times. The rooms were spotless and cleaned quickly and efficiently. They were also roomy enough for a family with teenagers to have plenty of room to manuever in. The pool area was relaxing and tranquil. We especially loved the big grill there and being able to fix our own meal once in a while. The spa was a luxurious experience.

After a long flight we arrived tired, to find they did not have the room I reserved, months in advance and had confirmation for, they had given it to someone else. It was supposed to have been on the quiet side of the property and they gave us a room on the noisey street side, where people slept on a park bench overnight. It made me nervous and our room door did not lock properly which also made me nervous. The pool was small and crowded. Internet was not free as advertised (the catch is that it was free if you happen to have a laptop computer along with you). I had done a lot of research before deciding on this hotel, but was very disappointed and would not want to go back. It was not a good introduction to our long awaited visit to Hawaii. This hotel seemed unprofessional unreliable, and disorganized. We were much happier with the hotel we stayed at later in our trip.

We stayed at the Aqua Bamboo and Spa for 2 nights in early November. First, I must say that the location is great! It is within easy walking distance to all of the Waikiki hot spots. The pool and hot tub are beautiful and almost a sanctuary that doesn't seem to fit with the rest of the hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The reason that I give the hotel only 3 stars is for the quality of the rooms. I didn't realize when booking that the rooms are individually owned and decorated. Our room was average, in definite need of some updating. We faced the front of the hotel and as many people mention on here, the noise from the buses is very noticeable. It wasn't something that kept me up at night, but it does take you out of that "paradise" mindset at times. One evening, we sat on our balcony overlooking the busy street and felt as though it might collapse at any time. I think it is time for the hotel to do a major upgrade on their rooms. The lobby and pool area are great, but are noticeably nicer than the rest of the hotel. That being said, I would consider staying at this hotel again, due to the location and affordability. I am glad that we only stayed here for 2 nights, I honestly don't think anyone needs to stay in Waikiki longer than that. Get out and see the true beauty of Hawaii!!!

We booked online and mentioned we were a honeymooning couple. We were given a dual aspect room with views to the sea and 2 balconies which was very nice. The towels were all laid our with fresh flowers. After about 5 mins a maid came in to deliver champagne and glasses for our honeymoon treat, which was a lovely gesture. We were only staying one night before moving on to the North Shore so packed in as much as we could as soon as we arrived which involved shopping and trip to the beach before coming back to freshen up and go out again. The location of the hotel was perfect for us as it's just behind the shopping area and spitting distance to the beach so we didn't need to use our car again until we moved on. As we were up and out early the following morning we didn't take breakfast at the hotel; it looked like a basic continental and we were after something more exciting - there's plenty of choice but we ended up at the Shore Bird on the beach which had a huge buffet breakfast and did us just fine (and more!)Our room overlooked the lovely pool, jacuzzi and spa area and although we didn't use it as we wanted to get out and see the sights, there were plenty of people in there, eventhough it was raining!All in all a very pleasant stay, albeit brief but I would definitely recommend this hotel on value and location.

The Aqua Bamboo and Spa has been recently renovated and is convenient to everything. The room we stayed in was 310. It faces the courtyard, so it is very quiet. We asked for a room with two double beds and a kitchenette, as we were two single ladies traveling together and on a budget. The room was HUGE! The main area had 2 double beds, a desk and chair, a large flat panel TV, a dresser and enough open area to fit another double bed with room to spare! The "kitchenette" in this room is actually a full kitchen - a separate room with a full size frig, full size stove, and a table and 2 chairs! It's stocked with dishes, glasses, silverware, pots and pans, dish soap and a towel. There is a small hallway between the bedroom area and the bathroom that has a closet on one end (with an in-room safe, ironing board and iron to use). The bathroom is small, but clean and updated. There is a curved rod for the shower curtain, so there is lots of room inside and the shower head has several settings. The only negative about the bathroom is that the new vanity is a little large for the space, and it crowds the toilet a bit. It was OK for us, but if you are a large person, it doesn't give you much room when you are seated! One surprise we found when we arrived was that this room has THREE balconies! Only the balcony off of the main room has furniture on it, but there is also a balcony off the kitchen, and one off the hallway by the bathroom. The beds are extremely comfortable, and there is an alarm clock to use. There is internet in the room if you bring your computer...if not, the computers in the lobby cost to use them, so bring your laptop. The staff is very helpful and friendly. You may get towels at the front desk to take to the beach and use. In the courtyard there is a rack with beach chairs, boogie boards, beach mats, umbrellas, and even some water noodles to take to the beach. There is no charge for this service, and they also have free amenities if you forgot your razor, toothbrush, toothpaste, etc. There is a continental breakfast served in the courtyard each morning, which is a couple small pastries, juice, coffee, and fruit. There is a weekly manager's cocktail get-together in the courtyard on Thursdays...they had a musician playing guitar, free appetizers and drinks, free 5-minute chair massages, and even a sketch artist! (Although I didn't use the spa during our visit, the chair massage was excellent, so I assume the spa is, too) The Bamboo is on Kuhio Avenue, one block from the main section of Waikiki Beach...directly back from the police station and the Hyatt Regency, so it is very centrally located. Traveling there all the way from Alaska, it was difficult to narrow down the hotel choices. We went to lots of online sites and spent weeks trying to decide, but we actually ended up booking through Hector at Discount Hotels Hawaii. I found his website through a review I read on trip advisor! (http://www.discounthotelshawaii.com/) He got us a great deal on the room at only $105/night. He was so nice to work with and can get the best rates at any hotel you want. He regularly visits and knows the hotels...which ones have problems, which ones are best for whatever you want to do and where you want to be. He also has the absolute BEST map of Waikiki hotels and restaurants, and there's even a map of parking in Waikiki. We didn't have a car, but the Bamboo does not have lots of parking, so that was not an issue for us. There is a bus stop right across the street from the hotel that can take you to Ala Moana shopping center or to any place on the island. There really is no need for a car. The Aqua Bamboo is a very nice, clean, friendly boutique hotel that has lots of features and won't charge you for every little thing like many places do. (Beware of the "resort fee" that many larger hotels charge on top of the room rate!) Our flight was late in the evening, and they stored our luggage for us so we could still spend the day at the beach and not pay for an extra night! I will definitely go back to this hotel!
Great service and rooms had a great view of the ocean. Location to beach was great and everything you need is in walking distance.

We had a great stay at the Aqua Bamboo & Spa.The location is very convenient - bus stop is just down the road, and shuttle stops for the Waikele Outlets shuttle and the Ala Moana trolley are less than 5 min walk away. A few minutes to the beach. Shops all within walking distance.We stayed 3 nights in a studio kitchenette - it was small but comfortable and clean. All staff were very helpful - checking in and out was a breeze. We'd booked online and had a few questions via email, which were all responded to very very promptly by staff! Very impressed with their service.As some other reviewers have noted, the hotel could be described as being slightly older and dated, but honestly we have no complaints - it's clean and comfortable, and very good value (they are pretty competitively priced anyway, but we managed to score a great online deal directly on the Aqua Bamboo & Spa website). There's lots to see and do - we weren't really in our room all that much, it was perfectly fine to freshen up and relax at the end of a long day of shopping and sightseeing.Would definitely recommend to others, and we would stay here again when we return to Honolulu.

This was are first time in Hawaii and the front desk people(Fe & Anthony) are very informative and has great knowledge of the island. We needed a vehicle the next day to go to the North Shore early morning. We tried different tour guides with no results. Anthony, the front desk person, suggested Tours 4 less. We tried the Tours 4 less and got a vehicle early morning. We did not miss are morning activity. Thank you Anthony. A great stay with a great crew.

Location is a short walk to the beach, with towels & chairs available from the staff. Restaurants and ABC markets are available in all directions. THE BUS runs infront of the hotel, making sightseeing easy and reasonable for seniors. A one or two day car rental helps fill the need to go to Leonard's and the north shore.

Seems unlikely to find the combination of location, amenities, price and pleasant staff. But that is what my husband and I found at this pretty hotel on Kuhio Avenue in bustling Waikiki Beach. If forced to find something negative to say about the Aqua Bamboo, all we can come up with is that the pool is not very large. It is beautiful, though, surrounded by palms and bougainvillea, and there is a lovely spa at poolside where we enjoyed chatting while soaking with a newlywed couple from Australia. The hotel’s entrance is marked by a recirculating glassed-in waterfall with bamboo growing behind it. The pretty lobby welcomes the weary traveler with friendly desk clerks, fresh apples every day, and complimentary iced tea and lemon water in large urns next to the door leading out to the pool. Anthony and the other staff answered our concerns graciously and promptly. They seemed to care about our Oahu experience, and wanted us to have an enjoyable stay. Not to be missed is the Thursday evening manager’s party, where the infamous Bamboozle cocktail is served to hotel guests. When we were there, the snacks included slices of fresh banana dipped under a cascading chocolate fountain. Ono! The lobby was decorated for Christmas, and the party included live music, chair massages, and caricature sketches by a local artist. The building is older (popcorn ceilings) but well cared for, and beautifully located within easy walking distance of the beach, the International Marketplace, restaurants, Kapiolani Park and the Waikiki Aquarium. There really are too many positives to mention in a brief review. Suffice it to say that we hope to stay at the Aqua Bamboo again on our next trip to Honolulu, which hopefully will be very soon.

Reviewers seem to really like this hotel but we found it to be somewhat less modern than expected. While there are many nice touches to give the property and rooms a quaint feel it was hard to ignore the overall condition.They do give complementary champagne and chocolates upon arrival and have free lemonade and iced tea in the lobby. The pool area is also nicely appointed and a relaxing area to hang out. There is a spa on site but no other amenities such as fitness room or bar/restaurant.Our room was fine with a fairly comfortable bed - and very spacious as we actually had a separate room with a desk, a kitchen and three outdoor patios. The bathroom was very small and cramped however. The tv was somewhat older and we had pretty spotty reception while watching football in the morning.Overall not a bad place, but it isn't that cheap and I would pay up next time to stay at a more modern hotel with more amenities.

The Aqua Bamboo & Spa is a great hotel. I stayed there with friends for 5 days and we enjoyed ourselves. The rooms are well sized and very clean. The staff are very friendly and happy to accommodate you in any way. The front desk also has great suggestions for things to do and places to see. The hotel is on a bit of busy street, so you do get a bit of street noise. But nothing that keeps you up at night. The hotel is located within walking distance to Waikiki beach, restaurants, bars, the international market place, etc... It also has a really nice and peaceful pool area. You definitely won't be disappointed if you stay here :)
We have stayed here many times, and as always had a great experience. The rooms are very nice and comfortable, the staff is always helpful and nice, great location, GREAT price, great pool.
Stayed in a suite with kitchenette, lovely spacious room in great location. Modern, clean , two TV's, two mini fridges, well appointed bathroom, sep shower, plus bath with shower. And no bed bugs!!

I LOVE this hotel. I am a solo business traveler who has been to other Aqua properties, but this is the one that I consider home. The value is outstanding and it's just 2 blocks in from the beach which keeps it a little less insane in terms of pedestrian traffic. The staff is AWESOME - love me some Anthony with his snarky wit and Zenie, Fe and Renier are all great along with the rest of the staff. Something that I think is overlooked at this property is that it is a SECURE property. Meaning you have to key card in after 10:00P to get in the lobby. The rest of the hotels do not have this level of security. As a single, female traveler I can really appreciate not being able to be followed by any stranger up to my room. I don't ever underestimate my personal safety this property makes me feel secure admist many hotels that seem like this might not be something to be taken seriously... I can't say enough good things about this property...

The hotel is old but very clean. The front desk services were outstanding. The rooms are very clean. The hotel is a few minutes walk to the beach.. The hotel provides plenty of towels for the beach and has chairs and boogie boards you can use at the beach. There is free internet available. The only thing I did not like was the noise in the room from the road on the front side of the building. not enough to make me change rooms, althought I could have changed. I would stay there again. The hotel was not overpriced and convenient to resturant.
friendly staff, clean rooms great location cant think of anything wrong. anyone wanting info about this hotel i would be glad to answer any emails glgeddes@rfnow.com
